headline: North Korean Leader Hails Nuclear Arsenal as ‘Powerful Deterrent’
teaser: Kim Jong-un struck a defiant tone after President Trump said diplomacy had failed to end the crisis. And South Korean officials were worried that the North would conduct a major test Tuesday.

headline: Erik Prince, Blackwater Founder, Weighs Primary Challenge to Wyoming Republican
teaser: If Mr. Prince runs, he would be a high-profile contender in a fledgling drive to oust establishment lawmakers with insurgents in the mold of President Trump.

headline: At Queens Museum, the Director Is as Political as the Art
teaser: Laura Raicovich is particularly outspoken on immigration, an issue that hits close to home: Five percent of the museum’s staff members are DACA recipients.

headline: Trump Goes After Senator Bob Corker, Who Bites Back
teaser: Senator Corker, who decided not to run for re-election, tweeted that the White House had become “an adult day care center,” and said, “Someone obviously missed their shift this morning.”

headline: Pence Leaves Colts Game After Visiting 49ers Kneel During Anthem
teaser: Following President Trump’s lead, the vice president said he would “not dignify any event that disrespects our soldiers, our Flag, or our National Anthem.”

headline: For Deal on ‘Dreamers,’ White House Will Demand Crackdown on Child Border Crossers
teaser: President Trump will demand curbs on children from Central America and a boost in border security before he agrees to a “Dreamers” deal for legal status.

headline: Stephen Miller, the Powerful Survivor on the President’s Right Flank
teaser: Mr. Miller, who was a conservative trapped in a liberal California high school, has rocketed to the upper reaches of White House influence, especially on immigration.

headline: Sidebar: Facing the Death Penalty With a Disloyal Lawyer
teaser: The Supreme Court has agreed to decide whether a lawyer may concede his client’s guilt in a death penalty case over the client’s objection.

headline: E.P.A. Announces Repeal of Major Obama-Era Carbon Emissions Rule
teaser: The rollback of the Clean Power Plan, which limits greenhouse gas emissions from power plants, sets up a bitter fight over United States climate policy.

headline: News Analysis: Corker’s Blast at Trump Has Other Republicans Nodding in Agreement
teaser: Other Republicans share the senator’s view of the president but fear retaliation if they express it out loud. Still, it could spell trouble for Trump.

headline: Listen to Our Exclusive Interview with Senator Bob Corker
teaser: In audio excerpts from an interview with Jonathan Martin, a New York Times reporter, Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, spoke about President Trump's tweets and what Mr. Trump’s twitter feed means for diplomacy.

headline: Trump’s Cuts to Health Law Enrollment Efforts Are Hitting Hard
teaser: The Trump administration promised its deepest cuts for groups that have performed poorly in signing people up for Obamacare insurance. It hasn’t worked that way.

headline: ‘Trump White House’ Reality Show Recap: An Ex-Wife Claims First Lady Title
teaser: Melania Trump’s East Wing lashed out at President Trump’s first wife, Ivana, on Monday for jokingly referring to herself as first lady.

headline: After White House Issues Demands, Hopes for an Immigration Deal Dim
teaser: President Trump’s list of hard-line immigration measures revealed an unspoken truth: Optimism for a bipartisan deal to protect “Dreamers” was likely misplaced.

headline: Trump’s Immigration Rhetoric Echoes a Bitter Fight in the 90s
teaser: Border fences, deportations, and putting “America First.” It all happened in the 1990s, and it started in California.

headline: Stephen Miller, the Young Man With Trump’s Ear
teaser: President Trump’s 32-year-old senior adviser has gained attention for his hard-line stances in support of the president. Glenn Thrush takes a look at Mr. Miller, from his days as a young conservative to his current role in the White House.

headline: Retro Report: Trump’s Argument Against Immigrants: We’ve Heard It Before
teaser: President Trump wants to sharply limit immigrants and refugees. His efforts, and the resulting backlash, echo the debate over a 1994 California referendum.

headline: Right and Left React to Senator Bob Corker’s Rebuke of Trump
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the war of words between the president and the retiring senator from Tennessee.

headline: Read Excepts From Senator Bob Corker’s Interview With The Times
teaser: The Tennessee Republican discussed his relationship with President Trump and his outlook on the administration in a phone interview on Sunday with The Times.

headline: How Russia Harvested American Rage to Reshape U.S. Politics
teaser: A Times examination of Russian-linked Facebook pages used in the 2016 election found that much of the content was taken directly from videos and posts from Americans.

headline: The New Health Care: Doubtful Science Behind Arguments to Restrict Birth Control Access
teaser: A Trump administration effort to weaken rules on health care coverage of contraception has raised legal questions. It should also raise medical ones.

headline: Trump Threatens N.F.L. and Attacks Jemele Hill
teaser: In early Twitter posts, the president said Congress should eliminate a law allowing the N.F.L.’s central office to avoid paying taxes and said ESPN ratings have “tanked.”

headline: Trump Mocks Bob Corker’s Height, Escalating Feud with a Key Republican
teaser: The president said that “Liddle Bob Corker” was “made to sound a fool” when the senator criticized Mr. Trump in an interview over the weekend.

headline: What Is the Clean Power Plan, and How Can Trump Repeal It?
teaser: President Trump wants to scrap the Obama-era initiative. What will happen next, and how does this relate to the Paris climate agreement?

headline: Kansas Tried a Tax Plan Similar to Trump’s. It Failed.
teaser: The state’s experiment with tax cuts on so-called pass-through entities did not heat up its economy — but did help some very rich people.

headline: Ethics Chief ‘Deeply Concerned’ About Actions by Top Federal Officials
teaser: The acting head of Office of Government Ethics sent an unusual memo urging federal workers to remember to act honorably.

headline: In New Test for Obamacare, Iowa Seeks to Abandon Marketplace
teaser: Its plan would give premium subsidies to well-off people but increase out-of-pocket costs for many with modest incomes. Other states could potentially follow.

headline: E.P.A. Says It Will Write a New Carbon Rule, but No One Can Say When
teaser: Industry leaders and environmentalists both doubt the agency will move quickly to replace former President Obama’s Clean Power Plan with something new.

headline: At Benghazi Trial, C.I.A. Officers Recount Bloody Attack on Their Base
teaser: Wearing disguises in the courtroom, the C.I.A. officers described how their rescue team tried desperately to find the American ambassador and later came under mortar attack.

headline: Niger Attack Lays Bare U.S. Troops’ Long Wait for Medical Help in Africa
teaser: The time frame for moving injured troops is much longer in Africa, where four were killed in an ambush last week, than in Iraq or Afghanistan, military officials said.

headline: How Israel Caught Russian Hackers Scouring the World for U.S. Secrets
teaser: Exploiting the popular Kaspersky antivirus software, Russian hackers searched millions of computers for American intelligence keywords. Israeli intelligence tipped off American officials.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Misleadingly Blames Bob Corker for Iran Deal
teaser: President Trump said Senator Bob Corker “gave us” the Iran nuclear deal. Actually, Mr. Corker opposed it — and has the votes to prove it.

headline: Melania Trump Says She Aims to ‘Give a Voice’ to the Victims of Opioids
teaser: The first lady’s visit to a clinic in West Virginia is a signal that her interests — so far stated broadly as helping children and combating cyberbullying — have narrowed.

headline: Disney, Hillary Clinton and the Obamas Condemn Weinstein
teaser: Disney once owned Miramax, which Harvey Weinstein co-founded. Mr. Weinstein is also a longtime Democratic donor with ties to the Clintons and the Obamas.

headline: Supreme Court Dismisses Appeal of Case on Expired Travel Ban
teaser: New limits on nine countries led the justices to remove the earlier case from their docket. Another case still being considered will probably also be dismissed.

headline: MacArthur Foundation Names 2017 ‘Genius’ Grant Winners
teaser: The MacArthur fellowship this year honors 24 artists, scholars, activists and others chosen for exceptional “originality, insight and potential.”

headline: On Washington: For Republicans, ‘Failure Is Not an Option’ on Tax Cuts
teaser: After their health care debacle, Republicans acknowledge that an inability to deliver on taxes would be disastrous and set them up for a fierce backlash.

headline: What Is It Like to Cover the Trump White House? Submit Your Questions
teaser: White House correspondents Maggie Haberman and Peter Baker will talk with Dean Baquet, our executive editor, on Thursday about covering the Trump administration.

headline: Military Is Waiting Longer Before Force-Feeding Hunger Strikers, Detainees Say
teaser: The military appears to be letting protesters deteriorate past a point that once prompted medical attention. One lawyer called it a new strategy to stop the hunger strikes.

headline: Eminem Lashes Out at Trump With Freestyle Rap Video
teaser: The rapper accused President Trump of racism, hypocrisy, disrespect of military veterans and more in a video played at the BET Hip Hop Awards.

headline: On the Runway: Melania Trump Wears First Lady Cred on Her Sleeve
teaser: On her trip to West Virginia, she wore a dress from Cefinn, the brand created by Samantha Cameron, wife of the former British prime minister.

headline: U.S. Helicopter Crashes on Okinawa, Adding to Safety Concerns
teaser: Residents of the area have been protesting the placement of landing pads near civilians.

headline: I.M.F. Cautions Against Tax Cuts for Wealthy as Republicans Consider Them
teaser: The International Monetary Fund said global leaders need to address income inequality or risk undermining economic growth.

headline: Pledge to Impeach Trump, a Key Donor Demands of Democrats
teaser: Tom Steyer, a prominent liberal backer, called on Democratic lawmakers to remove Mr. Trump from office if they take control of Congress in 2018.

headline: Ehud Barak, Israeli Hawk and No Friend of Iran, Urges Trump to Keep Nuclear Deal
teaser: Mr. Barak, Israel’s former leader and defense chief, does not want Mr. Trump to decertify the deal — a step the president is expected to take.

headline: Tom Hanks: Confirm or Deny
teaser: The actor is convinced that typewriters are making a comeback.

headline: With...Tom Hanks: Hollywood’s Most Decent Fella on Harvey, Trump and History
teaser: As accusations rain on a kingpin of his industry, the actor known for his American hero roles begins a tour for his wide-eyed book of short stories.

headline: The Shift: We Asked Facebook 12 Questions About the Election, and Got 5 Answers
teaser: Facebook responded to some questions about its role in the 2016 presidential election, and its plans to safeguard its platform in the future.

headline: Trump’s Tough Talk on Nafta Raising Fears of Pact’s Demise
teaser: The president has long talked about scrapping Nafta. Even skeptics are starting to believe him.

headline: Trump Threatens NBC Over Nuclear Weapons Report
teaser: The president said he might use the power of the federal government to retaliate by challenging broadcast licenses.

headline: Fed Still Puzzled by Inflation, but Rate Increase Is on Track
teaser: Slow inflation was the main topic at the Federal Reserve’s last policy meeting, but most officials leaned toward another interest rate move this year.

headline: White House Aide Is Selected to Run Homeland Security Department
teaser: President Trump’s choice, Kirstjen Nielsen, is at top aide to his chief of staff, John F. Kelly. Some White House aides had chafed at her regimented style.

headline: California Winds Are Fueling Fires. It May Be Getting Worse.
teaser: Some scientists think global warming may be making California’s autumn winds even drier, a “key parameter for fire risk.”

headline: Conservatives Want to Make Mitch McConnell the Symbol of a Toxic Washington
teaser: Republicans, who made Nancy Pelosi into a successful boogeyman for their base, are now trying the same tactic with one of their own: Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader.

headline: Foiled in Congress, Trump Moves on His Own to Undermine Obamacare
teaser: President Trump is expected to issue an order on Thursday to allow the sale of health insurance plans that are exempt from some Affordable Care Act rules.

headline: Growing Chorus Confronts Trump Against Leaving Nuclear Deal
teaser: Even those in Congress who did not support the 2015 accord to limit Tehran’s nuclear program warn against spooking allies by leaving it now.

headline: In Pennsylvania, Trump Hunts for Democratic Support for Tax Plan
teaser: The president said his plan will benefit the middle class, but Pennsylvania’s senior senator, a Democrat, called it a giveaway to wealthy Americans.

headline: House Democrats Can’t Impeach Trump, but They’re Willing to Try
teaser: Articles of impeachment against President Trump reached the House floor on Wednesday. They weren’t the first and will not be the last.

headline: Trump Warns Puerto Rico Weeks After Storms: Federal Help Cannot Stay ‘Forever’
teaser: The president says the island bears some of the blame for its current crisis and that “we cannot keep” federal troops and recovery workers there “forever.”

headline: Militants Free American Woman and Family Held for 5 Years in Afghanistan
teaser: An American woman, her Canadian husband and three children were held for five years in Afghanistan by a Taliban faction, the Haqqani network.

headline: U.S. Will Withdraw From Unesco, Citing Its ‘Anti-Israel Bias’
teaser: The Trump administration said the withdrawal, which is effective at the end of 2018, is also over a “need for fundamental reform” at the cultural organization.

headline: Foiled in Congress, Trump Signs Order to Undermine Obamacare
teaser: President Trump issued an order on Thursday to allow the sale of health insurance plans that are exempt from some Affordable Care Act coverage rules.

headline: N.F.L. Players May Have an Ally in Their Protests: Labor Law
teaser: In a debate over how far workers can go in banding together without retribution by their employers, many experts say showing solidarity is a legal right.

headline: Kim Davis, Once Jailed in America, Campaigns Against Gay Marriage in Romania
teaser: Her trip was organized by Liberty Counsel, a conservative research group that represented her when she was held in 2015 for contempt of court.

headline: In Speech to Truckers, Trump Hinted at Hostage Release
teaser: The night before their release was announced, President Trump teased the pending freedom of an American woman and her family who were held hostage for five years.

headline: House Approves $36.5 Billion Hurricane and Wildfire Aid Package
teaser: The relief package is the second installment of aid passed by lawmakers to respond to this year’s hurricanes, and much more money will still be needed.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Makes Puzzling Claim That Rising Stock Market Erases Debt
teaser: The president’s comments, which do not reflect reality, come as Republicans are pushing a tax plan that experts say could add more to the debt.

headline: Tech Giants, Once Seen as Saviors, Are Now Viewed as Threats
teaser: American tech companies positioned themselves as entities that brought positive change by connecting people and spreading information. Perceptions are shifting.

headline: Trump’s Attacks on the Press: Telling Escalation From Empty Threats
teaser: Old hands like Bob Schieffer and Russell Baker take the president’s words with a grain of salt. Others are not so sure.

headline: Watch Live: Times Journalists on Covering the Trump White House
teaser: Dean Baquet, the executive editor of The New York Times, joins the White House correspondents Maggie Haberman and Peter Baker in a TimesTalk about covering President Trump. The Times’s media columnist, Jim Rutenberg, will moderate.

headline: What Would Happen if the U.S. Withdrew From Nafta
teaser: President Trump says the United States may withdraw from the North American Free Trade Agreement. That would bring big changes for the economy and consumers.

headline: Public Health: What Did Trump’s Health Care Executive Order Do?
teaser: Nothing yet. But it could matter for people who buy their own insurance or get it from work in the long-term.

headline: House Ethics Office Says New York Congressman May Have Violated Rules
teaser: An inquiry centered on actions by a New York Congressman who is a majority stockholder in a biotech company.

headline: White House Memo: Trump’s Chief of Staff, Speaking With Press, Walks a Verbal Tightrope
teaser: The chief of staff, John F. Kelly, tried to show calm and order inside the White House while not appearing critical of the president’s lack of those qualities.

headline: Right and Left React to Reports of Harvey Weinstein’s Abusive Behavior
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum take on the fallout from accusations of sexual misconduct by the Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.

headline: Trump Won’t Certify Iran Nuclear Deal, but He Also Won’t Unravel It
teaser: President Trump will declare on Friday his intention not to certify Iran’s compliance with the 2015 accord, an act that kicks to Congress a decision about whether to reimpose sanctions on the country.

headline: U.S. Corporate Tax Shake-Up Could Fuel Tension With Allies
teaser: Other countries have their eyes on the money that lawmakers want to put on American tax rolls. But a European crackdown could work in Washington’s favor.

headline: Drilling in the Arctic Wildlife Refuge: How the G.O.P. Could Finally Break the Impasse
teaser: The prospects for opening the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to oil and gas exploration are better than they have been in years.

headline: How a Seed Bank, Almost Lost in Syria’s War, Could Help Feed a Warming Planet
teaser: A plant conservationist from Syria and his colleagues are safeguarding seeds that might be crucial when more parts of the world become as hot and arid as the Middle East.

headline: This Is Not Arthur Laffer’s Famous Napkin
teaser: The Smithsonian says that it has the most famous napkin in economic history. The available evidence suggests that’s probably not true.

headline: Reversing Course, Trump Seeks to Reassure Puerto Rico
teaser: A day after warning that he “cannot keep” troops and emergency workers in the hurricane-ravaged island “forever,” the president signals solidarity.

headline: Public Health: Trump Is Telling Obamacare Insurers He Doesn’t Support the Market
teaser: Most plans can probably survive without the subsidies he vowed to cut off on Thursday. But he has signaled that he will use policy levers to make their business hard.

headline: Europe Scrambles to Save Iran Nuclear Deal
teaser: Leaders across the continent voiced alarm at the prospect of President Trump undermining the 2015 deal, which Tehran negotiated with the U.S. and five other countries.

headline: Trump Names Former Texas Regulator as White House Environmental Adviser
teaser: Kathleen Hartnett White, who has called global warming a “dogma” and clean energy “parasitic” was nominated to lead the Council on Environmental Quality.

headline: Seven Takeaways From the Times Journalists Who Cover Trump
teaser: Dean Baquet, our executive editor, discussed with the White House correspondents Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman The Times’s approach to covering President Trump.

headline: Zinke Vows to End ‘Virus’ of Harassment in Park Service
teaser: Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke outlined new initiatives to deal with harassment in the National Park Service after the release of an internal survey.

headline: Why Trump Hates the Iran Nuclear Deal
teaser: President Trump has called the Iran nuclear deal the “worst deal ever.” David E. Sanger, the national security correspondent for the Times, explains why the president is against the deal, and what that means for its future.

headline: Guantánamo Defendant Is Sentenced, in Rare Success for Military Commission
teaser: A Guantánamo military commission sentenced a Saudi detainee to 13 years in prison for terrorism offenses, even as defense lawyers quit another case before the tribunal.

headline: Mnuchin, Contradicting Trump, Says Estate Tax Repeal Will Help ‘Rich People’
teaser: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said repealing the estate tax will help the rich. Those comments stand in contrast to President Trump’s claim that the tax hurts the working class.

headline: Russian Banker Denies Role in Planned Trump Building in Moscow
teaser: Andrey L. Kostin, the head of Russia’s second-largest bank, dismissed as “fake news” a claim by an associate of President Trump’s that Mr. Kostin had agreed to finance a deal.

headline: Ex-White House Chief of Staff Is Interviewed by Special Counsel
teaser: Reince Priebus, who was fired in July, was the first senior administration official known to have been questioned by Robert Mueller’s investigators.

headline: Fact Check: Assessing Trump’s Criticisms of Iran and the Nuclear Deal
teaser: In his rebuke of the Islamic republic, President Trump omitted or distorted facts about history, the Iran deal and an alleged violation of the agreement.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Adopts Obama Approach While Seeking to Undo a Legacy
teaser: Like his predecessor, President Trump has grown frustrated with Congress and as a result has turned to executive power to advance a stalled agenda.

headline: End to Health Care Subsidies Puts Congress in a Tight Spot
teaser: Some lawmakers want to fund the payments to insurers that President Trump is cutting off, while the president says Democrats should negotiate with him.

headline: Iowa’s Swing to Republicans Is a Matter of (Lacking a) Degree
teaser: Iowa’s status as a swing state in presidential elections may be in doubt. One key reason: its economy cannot support enough college graduates. That’s bad news for Democrats.

headline: Canadian Held Hostage in Afghanistan Says Militants Killed His Child
teaser: Joshua Boyle, who with his family was freed by Pakistani troops, also said his wife had been raped during their five-year captivity by the Haqqani network.

headline: Back Home, a Unanimous Verdict on Corker vs. Trump: That’s Just Bob
teaser: The nation has seen Mr. Corker, a reliable Republican senator from a deep-red state, stunningly undermining his president. Chattanooga has seen it coming, for better or worse.

headline: Wary of Hackers, States Move to Upgrade Voting Systems
teaser: New equipment and security protocols are part of the response to Russian meddling in 2016. But lack of money is an obstacle.

headline: Black Lawmakers Hold a Particular Grievance With Facebook: Racial Exploitation
teaser: Sheryl Sandberg’s meeting on Thursday with the Congressional Black Caucus afforded lawmakers a chance to vent over Russia’s exploitation of racial division.

headline: News Analysis: Promise the Moon? Easy for Trump. But Now Comes the Reckoning.
teaser: On issues like health care and Iran, President Trump’s language has not been matched by action, raising questions about whether his base will be satisfied by partial steps.

headline: 4 Ways Trump Has Moved to Undo His Predecessors’ Legacies
teaser: President Trump has promised sweeping changes to health care, immigration, the Iran deal and trade. Here’s a look at where things stand now.

headline: Documenting U.S. Role in Democracy’s Fall and Dictator’s Rise in Chile
teaser: An exhibition at the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago displays once-secret documents that describe covert operations and intelligence gathering on the Pinochet dictatorship.

headline: Trump Tweets Approval After Health Care Stocks ‘Plunged’
teaser: President Trump cut off subsidies to cover insurance costs for low-income people, and some health care stocks fell. He cheered.

headline: The New Washington: ‘The New Washington’: Breitbart in the White House
teaser: In this week’s episode, Charlie Spiering, a White House correspondent for Breitbart News, spoke to The Times about how he does his job, what he makes of the controversy surrounding his employer and more.

headline: Fed’s Janet Yellen Says the Economy Remains in Good Health
teaser: Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, gave an upbeat assessment but said inflation was likely to rise as the domestic economy continued to grow.

headline: National Anthem Controversies, From Helsinki to Kuwait
teaser: Most anthem-related controversies are not quite as dramatic as the confrontation between N.F.L. players and the Trump administration. But they are often funnier.

headline: Amazon Turns on the Charm Amid Criticism From Right and Left
teaser: After years of relying on a no-frills lobbying operation, Amazon is spreading its message far and wide in the nation’s capital.

headline: Aiding Transgender Case, Sessions Defies His Image on Civil Rights
teaser: In an unusual move, the attorney general has sent a federal hate crimes lawyer to Iowa to help prosecute a man charged with murdering a transgender high school student.

headline: Jeff Flake’s Lesson for Republicans: Cross Trump at Your Own Risk
teaser: The Arizona senator is in political peril as the 2018 election approaches, but he says he has no regrets in taking on President Trump.

headline: Jimmy Kimmel on Health Care, National Tragedies and Twitter Feuds
teaser: Mr. Kimmel, the star of ABC’s “Jimmy Kimmel Live!,” discusses the attention he has received for some politically pointed monologues.

headline: A Bot That Makes Trump’s Tweets Presidential
teaser: Twitter bots are winning fans by formatting President Trump’s posts to look like official statements, or tracking the accounts he and his inner circle follow.

headline: Not on the Ballot, but Dominating the Virginia Governor’s Race: Trump
teaser: The Republican and Democratic candidates in the closely watched contest are struggling to deal with President Trump’s outsize influence.

headline: On Washington: Trump Closes a Health Dispute, but Leaves Open a Power Struggle
teaser: An administration maneuver to cut off health insurance subsidies, effectively a capitulation in a long-running legal battle, could give Congress the upper hand over the executive branch.

headline: Trump Campaign Spending on Legal Fees Surges as Russia Inquiries Widen
teaser: The campaign spent more than $1.1 million on legal fees in the last quarter, underscoring the extent to which the investigations have consumed the president’s team.

headline: Boston Fed’s President Makes Case for Interest Rate Hikes
teaser: Eric Rosengren argues that continuing to raise interest rates at a measured pace could prolong the economic expansion.

headline: Trump’s Top Economist Says Corporate Tax Cuts Will Lift Workers’ Wages
teaser: The typical household’s income would climb by thousands of dollars, says a report that hints at a primary argument the administration will make in selling its tax plan.

headline: A Nafta Battleground on the Shores of Canada
teaser: A fight over a scuttled quarry project exemplifies one of the key disputes that has endangered a trade pact between the United States, Mexico and Canada.

headline: Charlottesville Counterprotester Who Ignited Spray Can Is Charged
teaser: Charged with assault and battery, Corey A. Long, who wielded an improvised flamethrower in opposition to a white nationalist rally in August, turned himself in on Friday.

headline: Trump Blames Democrats and ‘Some Republicans’ for Stalled Agenda
teaser: Trump said that some Republicans “should be ashamed at themselves” for failing to support the president’s agenda, including repeal of the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: For Their Portraits, Obamas Shine Light on African-American Art
teaser: The Obamas have chosen Kehinde Wiley and Amy Sherald: one established artist, one on her way.

headline: Trump Blames Cuba for Attacks That Sickened U.S. Diplomats
teaser: The statement broke with the State Department, whose officials have said repeatedly that they did not know the cause of the illness.

headline: Mississippi Senator’s Health Woes Narrow Republican Majority
teaser: Senator Thad Cochran was expected back in Washington on Monday after an extended illness. His failure to appear has increased speculation about his health.

headline: Trump and McConnell Strive for Comity Amid Rising Tensions
teaser: President Trump and Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, put on a public display of bonhomie, waving aside reports of a disintegrating relationship.

headline: Trump Says He’ll Consider Pulling Drug Czar Nomination
teaser: As a congressman, Tom Marino, the president’s choice to lead the drug policy office, championed legislation to undercut enforcement efforts against the drug industry.

headline: Trump Falsely Claims Obama Didn’t Contact Families of Fallen Soldiers
teaser: President Trump’s assertion belied a long record of meetings his predecessor, Barack Obama, held with the families of killed soldiers, as well as calls and letters.

headline: Right and Left React to Bannon’s Harsh Words for McConnell
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the continuing rifts inside the Republican Party.

headline: Hillary Clinton, the N.F.L., Roy Moore and Other Asides From the President
teaser: President Trump, during a news conference, touched on topics as wide-ranging as disaster relief, the special counsel and assault allegations.

headline: Trump and McConnell Hold Joint News Conference
teaser: At a news conference projecting Republican unity, President Trump spoke about four Green Berets killed in Niger, and made false claims that his predecessors did not call the families of fallen soldiers.

headline: Bombardier Turns to Airbus to Salvage Imperiled Airliner
teaser: Airbus made no financial commitment to the joint venture to make and sell Bombardier’s CSeries airliner, which could be assembled in the United States, avoiding import duties.

headline: First Words: Why Is ‘Politicization’ So Partisan?
teaser: Accusations of “politicizing” may seem like mudslinging but reflect deeper assumptions about what is objective truth.

headline: Fed’s Williams Says Economy Is Stronger Than It Looks
teaser: John Williams, the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, says some indicators are understating the strength of the American economy.

headline: On Washington: Trump and McConnell See a Way to Make Conservatives Happy
teaser: Under pressure to deliver legislatively, the president and the Senate majority leader are seeking to aggressively to install conservative jurists at the appeals and district court level.

headline: Trump Says Drug Czar Nominee Tom Marino Withdraws From Consideration
teaser: Representative Tom Marino had championed a law that undermined the Drug Enforcement Administration’s efforts to combat the opioid crisis.

headline: Why Hasn’t Sexual Harassment Disappeared?
teaser: The evolution of battling sexual harassment in the workplace has developed from naming the problem in the 1970s, to bringing it out of the shadows in the 1990s, to a growing sense of accountability today.

headline: Delta Passenger Says She Was Stopped From Singing National Anthem for Fallen Soldier
teaser: The airline said it was looking into what happened on the flight carrying the body to Atlanta, after a widely circulated Facebook video.

headline: Obama’s Visit to New Jersey Caps Tour of Democrats Supporting Murphy
teaser: The former president will campaign for Philip D. Murphy, the Democratic candidate for New Jersey governor, as the party looks to statehouses to protect policies.

headline: Senators Reach Deal to Fund Subsidies to Health Insurers
teaser: The plan by the two senators, Lamar Alexander of Tennessee and Patty Murray of Washington, would fund the subsidies that President Trump said he would cut off.

headline: Google Serves Fake News Ads in an Unlikely Place: Fact-Checking Sites
teaser: Google is placing ads linking to blatantly false stories on Snopes and PolitiFact, fact-checking sites created precisely to dispel such falsehoods.

headline: Navy SEALs Were Ready if Pakistan Failed to Free Family Held as Hostages
teaser: American officials asked Pakistan to rescue an American woman, her Canadian husband and their children. With new intelligence on their whereabouts, officials had limited time to act.

headline: Fact Check: Can Trump Claim Credit for a Waning Islamic State?
teaser: President Trump claims that he has “done more against ISIS” than President Obama. But he hasn’t ventured far from the path his predecessor set.

headline: White House Push to Help Workers Through Corporate Tax Cut Draws Skepticism
teaser: The administration is pushing a version of “trickle-down economics,” where corporate tax cuts deliver big pay raises for workers

headline: Nafta Negotiators Extend Talks, Delaying Its Potential Demise
teaser: The extension of the trade talks leaves a narrow and challenging path to rewriting the pact.

headline: Bipartisan Group Plans to Urge Trump to Adjust Policing Policies
teaser: Some of the nation’s most prominent prosecutors, police chiefs and criminal justice overhaul advocates are expected to urge President Trump to change his policies on policing and criminality.

headline: Lawsuit Claims Three U.S. Companies Funded Terror in Iraq
teaser: The lawsuit, filed in federal court in Washington, cited as evidence contracts between the companies and the Iraqi government, leaked diplomatic cables, and the testimony of informants.

headline: Top General’s Grief Becomes Political Talking Point for Trump
teaser: President Trump is testing the reluctance of his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, to discuss the death of his son Second Lt. Robert Kelly, who died in combat in 2010.

headline: Live Briefing: Sessions Is Likely to Face Questions That He Has Refused to Answer

headline: Op-Ed Columnist: Are We Headed Toward a New Korean War?
teaser: We have a failed strategy with a hopeless goal.

headline: News Analysis: Washington Eyes a Cold War Strategy Against North Korea

teaser: The brief interview focused on a meeting attended by a Russian ambassador and the incoming national security adviser, Michael Flynn, according to a person briefed on the investigation.

headline: Op-Ed Columnist: Oh Lord, Now the Gun Thing’s Back

headline: Fact Check: Trump Sells Tax Plan With False Claims

headline: Live Briefing: Republican Tax Overhaul Heads to the Senate Floor for Debate

headline: Op-Ed Columnist: Time to Talk Impeachment
teaser: Trump’s reckless behavior this week is another sign of crisis.

headline: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: The Self-Destruction of American Democracy

headline: Editorial: The Senate Is Rushing to Pass Its Tax Bill Because It Stinks
teaser: This is no way to handle a complex piece of legislation, and the Republicans must know it.

headline: Op-Ed Columnist: Trump, Proxy of Racism

teaser: Bad faith touches every aspect of the G.O.P.’s sales pitch to ram a bill through.

headline: What Happened When Lauer Interviewed Both Trump and Clinton?
teaser: When Matt Lauer interviewed Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump in September 2016, he was widely criticized for being soft on Mr. Trump and for hammering Mrs. Clinton.

headline: Replacing Tillerson With Pompeo Would Supplant a Moderate With a Hawk

teaser: The party, which criticized the growth of the federal debt under President Barack Obama, has rallied behind a tax cut that would send it to new heights.

teaser: Ms. Brown, a former representative from Florida, was convicted of fraud after using over $300,000 from the charity for personal expenses, including tickets to a Beyoncé concert.

teaser: The country’s longest-serving congressman plans to announce his decision Tuesday, said his great-nephew, who plans to run for the seat.

teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the tax legislation making its way through Congress.

headline: As Harassment Accusations Multiply, a Question: Who Stays and Who Goes?

teaser: By denying deductions for state and local taxes, the Republicans seek to force high-tax states run by Democrats to capitulate.

teaser: Stephen K. Bannon, the president’s former strategist, has another medium to take on the Republican establishment.

headline: U.S. to Recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s Capital, Trump Says, Alarming Middle East Leaders

headline: Trump Administration Touts Border Arrests as Proof of Crackdown on Illegal Immigration
teaser: A decrease in arrests at the border shows that the administration’s deterrence efforts are effective, Homeland Security officials said.

headline: Special Counsel Investigation Has Cost at Least $6.7 million
teaser: Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel investigating the Trump campaign’s ties to Russia, spent almost $7 million in its first four and a half months, he said.

headline: The CHIP Program Is Beloved. Why Is Its Funding in Danger?

headline: Fed, Perplexed by Low Inflation, Is Still Ready to Raise Rates

headline: Fed’s Kaplan Says Technology Is Holding Down Inflation
teaser: Robert S. Kaplan, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, says increased competition is making it harder for companies to raise prices.

headline: Kirstjen Nielsen, White House Aide, Is Confirmed as Homeland Security Secretary
teaser: Ms. Nielsen, an aide to John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, has defended herself against charges that she is too inexperienced to lead the department.

headline: Tax Plan Crowns a Big Winner: Trump’s Industry
teaser: Commercial real estate gets lower rates and new breaks in the Republican bills, and trusts that have been key financing sources do especially well.

headline: Republicans Consider More Generous State and Local Tax Break
teaser: The discussions being held among Republican lawmakers come one day before the Senate is expected to vote to begin the process of aligning its bill with the House-passed legislation.

headline: Trump’s Endorsement of Roy Moore Points Up a G.O.P. Problem: Chaos

teaser: The former White House strategist delivered a plea to elect Mr. Moore on Tuesday at a rally in southern Alabama.

headline: Conservative Groups Seeking Support for Tax Cuts Find It a Hard Sell
teaser: Groups like the Koch-funded Americans for Prosperity are trying to convince ordinary Americans that this is good for them too.

headline: Trump Plans to Formally Recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s Capital

headline: Trump Pick to Head Consumer Safety Board Is Seen as Too Close to Industries
teaser: Ann Marie Buerkle, a commissioner poised to run the federal agency, has rarely voted for a mandatory recall, a maximum fine, or a tougher safety standard.

headline: House Votes to Sharply Expand Concealed-Carry Gun Rights
teaser: The House easily passed legislation requiring each state to recognize another state’s concealed-carry gun permit. But the bill faces doubt in the Senate.

headline: John Conyers III Was Arrested in February, Accused of Stabbing His Girlfriend
teaser: John Conyers III, whose father endorsed him for a House seat election as the lawmaker resigned amid sexual harassment allegations, was arrested in February after his girlfriend suffered knife cuts during an argument.

headline: Tax Bill Is Likely to Undo Health Insurance Mandate, Republicans Say
teaser: House Republicans are embracing the Senate’s repeal of the health law’s mandate that most people have insurance, but they are not buying a side deal to stabilize insurance markets.

headline: Republicans Move to Resolve Tax Bill Differences as Cost Concerns Loom
teaser: The Senate voted to begin the formal process of reconciling its tax bill with the House version as lawmakers continued to discuss changes to the legislation.

headline: For Trump, an Embassy in Jerusalem Is a Political Decision, Not a Diplomatic One
teaser: The president seemed to relish playing a familiar role: the political insurgent, defying foreign policy orthodoxy on behalf of the people who elected him.

headline: Sheldon Adelson’s Influence on Trump’s Israel Policy
teaser: When President Trump formally recognized Jerusalem as Israel’s capital, one man who was probably smiling was the Republican mega-donor Sheldon Adelson. Here’s a look at how he became influential within the Trump administration.

headline: Nikki Haley Calls U.S Presence at South Korea Olympics an ‘Open Question’
teaser: The American envoy to the United Nations expressed concerns about whether tensions on the Korean Peninsula could pose a threat to athletes.

headline: Al Franken: From ‘Saturday Night Live’ to Congress
teaser: Mr. Franken was a star on the sketch comedy show and then a talk-radio host before running for political office.

headline: Senator Al Franken to Speak From Senate Floor Amid Sexual Harassment Allegations
teaser: The Democratic senator of Minnesota is scheduled to speak at 11:45 a.m., a day after dozens of his colleagues called for him to step down.

headline: Full Video: Senator Al Franken Announces That He Will Resign
teaser: Nearly all of the Senate’s Democratic women — and most Democratic men — called for Mr. Franken to resign after multiple allegations of sexual harassment or misconduct.

headline: Al Franken’s Rise and Fall
teaser: Once a star of “Saturday Night Live,” Al Franken took his liberal politics to Washington in 2008 when he narrowly won a Minnesota Senate seat. He said he would resign over allegations of sexual misconduct.

headline: Full Video and Transcript: Al Franken Announces Resignation from Senate
teaser: The senator of Minnesota said he will resign after several of his colleagues called for him to step down over allegations of sexual misconduct.

headline: Tillerson Says the U.S. Will Never Accept Crimea Annexation
teaser: The American secretary of state and the Russian foreign minister traded barbs at a security conference in Vienna.

headline: The Male Animal: What’s the Deal With That Guy’s Fluffy Hair?
teaser: From Bernie Sanders to Graydon Carter, men of a certain age embrace an unruly hairstyle that suggests mad genius or regal slob.

headline: F.B.I. Director Denies Political Bias Is Tainting Investigations
teaser: The F.B.I. director, Christopher A. Wray, defended his employees during a politically charged appearance on Capitol Hill.

headline: Full Video: Senator Al Franken Announces That He Will Resign
teaser: Nearly all of the Senate’s Democratic women — and most Democratic men — called for Mr. Franken to resign after multiple allegations of sexual harassment or misconduct.

headline: House Passes Two-Week Stopgap Bill to Keep Government Funded
teaser: Faced with a Friday deadline to pass a government funding measure, the House passed on Thursday a two-week fix to buy more time for negotiations.

headline: Inside the Opposition to a Net Neutrality Repeal
teaser: Fight for the Future, a scrappy 10-person nonprofit, has helped lead the uproar against changes to internet rules, including hundreds of protests on Thursday.

headline: Fact Check: How Trump Has Flip-Flopped on Intelligence Agencies
teaser: President Trump has offered lavish praise when the intelligence community or law enforcement investigates his opponents but rebuked them when their actions do not align with his interests.

headline: Renewable Energy Is Surging. The G.O.P. Tax Bill Could Curtail That.
teaser: The tax bills moving through Congress could hobble the United States’ renewable energy industry because of provisions that scale back incentives for wind and solar power.

headline: House Republican Trent Franks Plans to Resign
teaser: Mr. Franks, who made his name with strident social conservatism and adamant opposition to abortion in all forms, would be the third lawmaker to step down from office this week.

headline: Hillary Clinton and Lena Dunham, Her Main Millennial, Hit the Weinstein Wall
teaser: Ms. Dunham, longtime Clinton enthusiast, says she warned the campaign against associating with Harvey Weinstein.

headline: Ex-Governor’s Run Gives Democrats a Bit More Hope of Retaking the Senate
teaser: Former Gov. Phil Bredesen will run for the seat being vacated by Senator Bob Corker, giving Democrats a mathematical but narrow path to the majority.

headline: James O’Keefe, Practitioner of the Sting, Has an Ally in Trump
teaser: James O’Keefe has long struggled for respect from the media and acceptance from the conservative movement. But now he has an ally in the Oval Office.

headline: On Washington: Al Franken’s Improbable Political Rise and Sudden Fall
teaser: Mr. Franken came to the Senate as an instant star, but he was brought down by accusations of inappropriate behavior and a Democratic need to clean house.

headline: Congressional Democrats Left Out of White House Hanukkah Party
teaser: The White House pared down its invite list for the annual Hanukkah celebration. Democrats and Jewish groups critical of the president were not included.

headline: Devin Nunes Cleared of Misconduct Over Disclosing Monitoring of Trump Aides
teaser: The House Committee on Ethics found that Mr. Nunes, the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, had not improperly disclosed classified information.

headline: News Analysis: Did Trump Kill Off a Two-State Solution? He Says No, Palestinians Say Yes
teaser: The chief Palestinian negotiator said Mr. Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital means a radical P.L.O. shift — to a push for a single state, with equal civil rights.

headline: Right and Left React to Al Franken’s Decision to Resign
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on Senator Al Franken’s decision to step down amid accusations of sexual misconduct.

headline: Trump Says Wells Fargo Fines Will Not Be Reduced
teaser: The president appeared to be pushing back against a report about his administration reviewing whether the bank should pay hefty fines for abusive mortgage lending practices.

headline: Trump Speaks Tonight in Florida, but Alabama Voters Will be Listening
teaser: President Trump is holding a campaign-style rally in the Florida Panhandle Friday night. But his real audience is likely to be in neighboring Alabama.

headline: Dina Powell, Influential Foreign Policy Adviser, Is Set to Leave White House
teaser: Dina Powell, a deputy national security adviser to President Trump, has been a key player on a variety of issues and a top ally of Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner.

headline: Justice Dept. Investigating Fetal Tissue Transfers by Planned Parenthood and Others
teaser: In a letter to the Senate Judiciary Committee, the Justice Department requested documents indicating it is picking up the fetal tissue issue that Congress started last year.

headline: Your Money: Under New Tax Plan, the Cost of Aging Could Rise
teaser: If the tax bill removes medical expense deductions, many people could lose over $10,000 annually.

headline: In Syria’s Skies, Close Calls With Russian Warplanes
teaser: American air commanders complain that the Russians are flouting their agreements aimed at avoiding midair collisions.

headline: F.B.I. Warned Hope Hicks About Emails From Russian Operatives
teaser: Top counterintelligence agents met with Ms. Hicks, one of President Trump’s closest advisers, to urge caution about Russian outreach efforts.

headline: Hope Hicks: Seen, but Not Heard
teaser: Members of the Trump administration haven't always followed a traditional path. Hope Hicks fits right in, a communications director that hardly communicates publicly.

headline: Justices to Hear Second Partisan Gerrymandering Case
teaser: The Supreme Court, which heard arguments in October on Wisconsin’s voting maps, agreed to consider a similar challenge from Maryland.

headline: CNN Corrects a Trump Story, Fueling Claims of ‘Fake News’
teaser: The erroneous report involving Donald Trump Jr. and WikiLeaks came at a time when the media faces public skepticism and frequent criticism from the White House.

headline: Justices, Divided 5-4, Let Trump Shield DACA Documents
teaser: The Trump administration may withhold documents concerning its decision to end a program protecting young, undocumented immigrants known as Dreamers.

headline: Liberal Activists to Democrats: Protect Young Immigrants or Shut Down Government
teaser: Democrats want a deal to shield young undocumented immigrants from deportation, but liberal activists question their party’s willingness to provoke a shutdown.

headline: Trent Franks, Accused of Offering $5 Million to Impregnate an Aide, Abruptly Resigns
teaser: Mr. Franks, Republican of Arizona, resigned earlier than expected after two women said he wanted to use sex as a means to impregnate them.

headline: Janet Yellen Didn’t Set Out to Be a Feminist Hero
teaser: The Federal Reserve chair (don’t call her “chairwoman”) quietly achieved rock-star status. Now that she’s leaving, her many fans are sad to see her go.

headline: Reza Zarrab Reveals a Plot to Kill Him, and Is Accused of Rape
teaser: The star witness in the trial over a billion-dollar scheme to violate United States sanctions on Iran said an inmate tried to kill him. Another inmate sued him on rape charges.

headline: Inside Trump’s Hour-by-Hour Battle for Self-Preservation
teaser: With Twitter as his Excalibur, the president takes on his doubters, powered by long spells of cable news and a dozen Diet Cokes. But if Mr. Trump has yet to bend the presidency to his will, he is at least wrestling it to a draw.

headline: U.S. Put 92 Somalis on a Deportation Flight, Then Brought Them Back
teaser: The Somalis boarded a flight to the war-torn country on Thursday, but the plane only made it as far as Senegal. Immigration officials cited logistical issues.

headline: Fact Check: Moore’s Rebuke of His Accuser and Other Distortions in Alabama’s Senate Race
teaser: Roy Moore has offered misleading defenses after allegations of sexual misconduct. Doug Jones has exaggerated attacks on his opponent.

headline: Street Outside Russian Embassy in Washington May Be Renamed for a Dissident
teaser: Local officials are debating whether to name a stretch of road after Boris Y. Nemtsov, a democratic activist gunned down near the Kremlin.

headline: On Washington: How Arctic Drilling, Stymied for Decades, Made Surprise Return in Tax Bill
teaser: Advocates of oil exploration in an Alaska wildlife refuge are taking advantage of the special rules of the tax debate to charge toward victory.

headline: Macron Steps Into Middle East Role as U.S. Retreats
teaser: The French president is carving out an ambitious and assertive global role, as many see the United States under President Trump abandoning leadership.

headline: Even in Unruly Alabama Politics, ‘Never Seen Anything Like This’
teaser: The wild and ugly campaign for Senate, fraught with incendiary comments and molestation accusations, has left even veterans of the state’s politics searching for parallels.

headline: Trump, Rejecting Calls to Stay Away, Speaks at Civil Rights Museum
teaser: In Jackson, Miss., the president hailed heroes of the civil rights movement even as activists and politicians said his presence insulted the effort to confront the state’s history.

headline: Protests in Lebanon Near U.S. Embassy After Trump’s Jerusalem Decision
teaser: Lebanese Army forces fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse thousands of protesters outside the embassy near Beirut.

headline: Under Trump, E.P.A. Has Slowed Down Actions Against Polluters, and Curbed Enforcement
teaser: An analysis of enforcement data at the E.P.A. shows a substantial drop in activity against polluters when compared to the Obama and Bush administrations.

headline: How The Times Compared E.P.A. Enforcement Across Three Administrations
teaser: Using information from a public database, the analysis covered activity during the first 266 days of E.P.A. leaders in the Trump, Obama and Bush administrations.

headline: Pentagon Foresees at Least Two More Years of Combat in Somalia
teaser: In a proposal, the Defense Department is also seeking looser oversight of its operations in Somalia, where it doubled the number of airstrikes it carried out this year.

headline: Trump Wants Washington Post Reporter Fired Over Misleading Tweet
teaser: The president said the reporter, Dave Weigel, should be fired for a photo he posted on Twitter of a sparsely filled arena before a rally for the president in Florida.

headline: Vote in 2 Days, Alabama Senator Says Party Can ‘Do Better’ Than Roy Moore
teaser: Senator Richard C. Shelby, a fixture of Republican politics in Alabama for a generation, sent a clear message to his state’s voters with an appearance on national television.

headline: Nikki Haley Says Women Who Accuse Trump of Misconduct ‘Should Be Heard’
teaser: The comments by Ms. Haley, the United Nations ambassador, were a break from the administration’s assertions that the allegations have no merit and should be dismissed.

headline: A Fed Rate Increase Is Expected. But What Comes Next?
teaser: The Federal Reserve has signaled its move this week. Investors, though, want to know whether the central bank will continue with its patient approach to rates.

headline: North Korean Submarine Missile Threat Prompts U.S.-Led Military Drills
teaser: The joint exercises are in response to growing concerns that North Korea is making progress developing hard-to-detect submarine-launched missiles.

headline: Trump Says New York Times Is ‘Wrong!’ on His Television Habits
teaser: President Trump responded to a Times article published over the weekend that offered an inside look into a typical day.

headline: Hunting Taliban and Islamic State Fighters, From 20,000 Feet
teaser: B-52s have once again been called into action in Afghanistan. A New York Times correspondent flew on one.

headline: Supreme Court Won’t Hear Case on Bias Against Gay Workers
teaser: Federal appeals courts are divided over whether a federal law’s prohibition of discrimination in the workplace based on sex also applies to sexual orientation.

headline: To Test for Climate Disasters: Build Stuff, Then Blow It Apart
teaser: A team of researchers is destroying things — with wind, water and fire — to help insurers manage the increasing risks of extreme weather.

headline: Meet Me at the Fair
teaser: The Iowa State Fair is a must-attend event for many of the 2008 presidential candidates.

headline: Transgender People Will Be Allowed to Enlist in Military as Court Case Advances
teaser: President Trump had announced on Twitter in July that he was barring transgender people from serving in the military, though a ban was never fully implemented.

headline: Treasury Defends Tax Plan in One-Page Analysis
teaser: A long-awaited document says the $1.5 trillion plan will pay for itself, assuming robust economic growth from a host of policies yet to be enacted.

headline: An Obamacare Surprise in the Mail: New Insurers and New Costs
teaser: Through “automatic re-enrollment,” some Obamacare consumers are being assigned new insurance policies at higher costs — for doing nothing during open enrollment.

headline: Several Women Repeat Accusations of Sexual Misconduct by Trump
teaser: The women said they hoped to be taken more seriously after a torrent of allegations that have toppled the careers of men in the news media, business and politics.

headline: White House Memo: A Campaign Memoir That Shows Trump, at Least Partly, as He Is
teaser: For the first time, some former Trump aides put their name to describing the president’s habits.

headline: Texas Congressman Runs What Aides Call a Hostile Workplace
teaser: Representative Blake Farenthold, the subject of an ethics investigation, set the tone for off-color jokes and inappropriate banter, legal documents and interviews with former aides suggest.

headline: Trump Announces That the Moon Is Astronauts’ Next Destination
teaser: The presidential directive called for partnership with other nations and commercial companies but did not offer details about schedule or cost.

headline: Right and Left React to the Alabama Senate Candidacy of Roy Moore
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the contentious Senate race in Alabama.

headline: Alabama Senate Race: Four Things to Watch
teaser: Alabama voters go to the polls to choose between Roy S. Moore and Doug Jones in a special election with huge stakes for both parties and President Trump.

headline: Fingerprints of Russian Disinformation: From AIDS to Fake News
teaser: In the 1980s, the Soviets peddled “bum dope about AIDS” around the world. Moscow’s tactics haven’t changed much in the years since.

headline: New Higher Education Bill Rolls Back Obama-Era Safeguards
teaser: A House rewrite of the law governing higher education would dismantle several regulations imposed by the Obama administration to control for-profit colleges.

headline: Economic Scene: Tax Plan’s Biggest Cuts Could Be in Living Standards
teaser: Cutting taxes is mostly an exercise in slicing the economic pie a different way, not making it bigger, with gains for a few offset by losses for many.

headline: Why No One Knows What Will Happen in Alabama
teaser: Today’s special election is forcing pollsters to confront just about every major challenge in survey research.

headline: Talk of Trump Visit Tests U.K.’s ‘Special Relationship’
teaser: The American ambassador in London said he hoped a planned trip by President Trump would go ahead despite vocal opposition.

headline: Trump Blames Democrats for ‘False Accusations’ From Women
teaser: “Unable to show any collusion with Russia,” the president says, and accuses Democrats of fabricating stories of sexual misconduct.

headline: Republicans Nearing Agreement on Final Tax Bill
teaser: Senator John Cornyn said a deal to reconcile the House and Senate tax bills could be reached on Tuesday.

headline: Many G.O.P. Blunders Put Seat at Risk, Even Before Scandal
teaser: Republicans made a lengthy list of errors, giving Democrats an opening well before Roy Moore was accused of sexual misbehavior.

headline: Tillerson Says Embassy in Jerusalem Is at Least Three Years Away
teaser: On Tuesday, Rex W. Tillerson discussed the future of the embassy in a speech at the State Department and then took questions from department employees.

headline: Once a Long Shot, Democrat Doug Jones Wins Alabama Senate Race
teaser: Doug Jones, a former prosecutor, defeated scandal-scarred Roy S. Moore for the Senate seat once held by Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

headline: Full Transcript: Doug Jones Speaks After Winning Alabama Senate Race
teaser: Doug Jones addressed the crowd in Birmingham, Ala., after beating Roy S. Moore in a special election for the seat vacated by Jeff Sessions.

headline: Video and Full Transcript: Roy Moore, Refusing to Concede, Addresses Supporters on Election Night
teaser: Roy S. Moore, the Republican candidate in the Senate race in Alabama, addressed his supporters on Tuesday night after the election was called for his opponent, Doug Jones.

headline: Roy Moore Addresses Supporters and Doesn’t Concede
teaser: Mr. Moore, the scandal-plagued Republican candidate, lost to Doug Jones in Alabama's special Senate election on Tuesday. But he didn't concede a race that he said was still too close to call.

headline: Doug Jones Tops Roy Moore in Alabama Senate Race
teaser: Doug Jones addressed supporters Tuesday night after a major upset over Roy S. Moore, the scandal-plagued former judge, in Alabama’s heated Senate race.

headline: Key Takeaways From Doug Jones’s Alabama Victory
teaser: The defeat of Roy S. Moore, the Republican, in Alabama’s Senate election contains some worrying signs for the party as it heads into the 2018 midterms.

headline: Text Messages in Hand, Republicans Plan to Accuse Justice Department of Bias
teaser: A chorus of Republicans, including some party mainstays, are questioning the impartiality of the Justice Department and F.B.I. to discredit the Trump investigation.

headline: The Fed and Interest Rates: What to Watch For Today
teaser: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise its benchmark interest rate by a quarter point, and to issue a new economic forecast.

headline: Trump: ‘I Said Roy Moore Will Not Be Able to Win’ in Alabama
teaser: President Trump, never one to accept blame, may look for a scapegoat for his failure to lift Mr. Moore to victory in Alabama.

headline: Republicans’ Tax Bill Nearing the Finish Line
teaser: A public hearing of the conference committee on Wednesday will be largely a show given that Republican lawmakers are close to a final deal on the $1.5 trillion tax bill.

headline: You Don’t Need to Take an Oath on a Bible, or Any Religious Text
teaser: A spokesman for Roy Moore, explaining why his candidate believed Muslims should not serve in Congress, said politicians must be sworn in on a Bible. He was wrong.

headline: Omarosa Manigault Newman to Leave White House Job Next Month
teaser: Omarosa Manigault Newman resigned “to pursue other opportunities,” the White House press secretary said.

headline: Democrats: McConnell Must ‘Hit the Pause Button’ on Tax Vote
teaser: Buoyed by their upset victory in the Alabama Senate Race, Democrats are calling for a delay on the tax vote until Senator-Elect Doug Jones is sworn in.

headline: Right and Left React to Roy Moore’s Defeat in Alabama
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the victory of Doug Jones and the defeat of Roy Moore in the Alabama Senate race.

headline: The Year in Stuff
teaser: What a long, strange year it has been. Here are the pieces that defined it: what we wore, we carried, wanted, feared and waited for.

headline: Republicans Say They Have a Deal on Tax Bill
teaser: House and Senate negotiators reach agreement, appear on track to send bill to President Trump by Christmas

headline: Schumer Files Police Report After Fraudulent Document Emerges
teaser: A document that looks like a court filing suggests Senator Chuck Schumer harassed a staff member, but the staff member said any such claims are false.

headline: Why Turnout Shifts in Alabama Bode Well for Democrats
teaser: Black voters surged, and Trump’s less educated version of the Republican coalition has eroded the G.O.P.’s traditional turnout edge.

headline: White House Corrects Tillerson on Whether U.S. Will Talk to North Korea
teaser: It was only the latest example of a public rift between the president and his chief diplomat over North Korea.

headline: Doug Jones: From Prosecuting K.K.K. Members to the Senate
teaser: Senator-Elect Doug Jones of Alabama made a name for himself prosecuting two Ku Klux Klan members for a church bombing that killed four black girls in 1963. Now, he will become a member of the U.S. Senate.

headline: Vera Katz, Mayor Who Oversaw Portland’s Flowering, Dies at 84
teaser: A feminist force and lawmaker in Oregon, she served three terms in Portland as it grew into a liberal bastion of visionary urban planning.

headline: Strong Demand for Health Insurance as Deadline Looms
teaser: Nearly 4.7 million people have signed up for health insurance despite cutbacks in federal efforts to promote enrollment under the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Joe Biden Comforts Meghan McCain in Heartfelt Exchange on ‘The View’
teaser: “One of the things that gave Beau courage, my word, was John,” Mr. Biden told a tearful Ms. McCain. Her father, John McCain, has the same form of cancer that killed his son Beau.

headline: Fact Check: Trump’s Revisionist History of His Role in Alabama Race
teaser: President Trump said he had always predicted Roy Moore’s loss in Alabama — despite campaigning for him and claiming “he’s going to do very well.”

headline: Voices From Alabama: Black Women Who Voted for Doug Jones
teaser: Exit polling shows 98 percent of female African-American voters supported Doug Jones in the Senate election in Alabama. We spoke to some of them to learn what was so important to them in this election.

headline: Trump’s E.P.A. Chemical Safety Nominee Withdraws
teaser: The nominee, Michael L. Dourson, had faced criticism on several fronts for his ties to the chemical industry.

headline: Last-Ditch Effort to Sway Senator on Tax Bill Involves Personal Pleas
teaser: Progressive activists met with Senator Susan Collins, Republican of Maine, in a bid to persuade her to vote against the $1.5 trillion tax bill.

headline: His Plans Gone Awry, Rupert Murdoch Divides His Spoils
teaser: As he prepares to sell off much of 21st Century Fox, the 86-year-old magnate is having his King Lear moment.

headline: Thousands of Interior Dept. Employees Report Harassment and Intimidation at Work
teaser: About 30,000 employees took an Interior Department survey, and 35 percent said they were mistreated, the agency said in results released Thursday.

headline: Blake Farenthold, Texas Congressman Accused of Sexual Harassment, Will Not Run Again
teaser: Representative Blake Farenthold, who settled a sexual harassment claim for $84,000, is the subject of an Ethics Committee investigation and will not run again.

headline: Republicans Prepare for Final Rollout of Tax Bill
teaser: As Republicans prepared to roll out their final $1.5 trillion tax plan questions continued to loom about how the last-minute changes would be paid for.

headline: ‘Are You Normal?’ Putin Asks U.S. Congress in Annual News Gathering
teaser: As much circus as news conference, the event provided the Russian president with a platform to bolster his campaign and to attack the United States.

headline: Trump Says His Regulatory Rollback Already Is the ‘Most Far-Reaching’
teaser: President Trump, showcasing his accomplishments near the end of his first year, said that for every new regulation, his administration has killed 22.

headline: Once Unthinkable, Senate Looks Like a Tossup in 2018
teaser: Alabama’s surprising result gives Democrats a plausible path to take control.

headline: On Washington: With New Focus on Sexual Misconduct, Democrats Take Aim at Trump
teaser: After purging some from their ranks, Democrats intensify a push to investigate the president over accusations of harassment and abuse.

headline: Labor Board Reverses Ruling That Helped Unions Fight Chains
teaser: Newly under Republican control, the National Labor Relations Board changed the standard for holding a company responsible for a franchisee’s practices.

headline: Bulletin Board: NYT Needle Returns to the Spotlight. The Internet Notices.
teaser: New York Times editors explain how our election needle came to be and why we’re all fixated on it.

headline: Skepticism as U.S. Accuses Iran of U.N. Arms Violation
teaser: American officials showcased weapons thought to be used by Iran-backed rebels in Yemen but failed to show how they proved Iran violated an international agreement.

headline: With Billions at Stake in Tax Debate, Lobbyists Played Hardball
teaser: The rapid pace of the tax bill moving through Congress left lobbyists with little time and few lawmakers to press for changes in the $1.5 trillion overhaul.

headline: President Trump Escalates Criticism of F.B.I. Role in Russia Inquiry
teaser: President Trump stepped up his criticism of some F.B.I. agents helping to investigate possible Russian involvement in his campaign, calling it a “very sad thing to watch.”

headline: DeVos Delays Rule on Racial Disparities in Special Education
teaser: The Education Department delayed an Obama-era regulation pressing school districts to address the disproportionate number of minorities in special education.

headline: Trump’s Judicial Nominee Stumbles When Asked About Law
teaser: Matthew S. Petersen, a U.S. District Court judge nominee, failed to answer several questions about the law when asked by Senator John Kennedy at a hearing.

headline: With Concession to Rubio on Child Credit, G.O.P. Is Set to Release Compromise Tax Plan
teaser: Republican lawmakers have agreed to expand the child care tax credit so that it benefits more low-income Americans, a move intended to win back the support of Senator Marco Rubio of Florida.

headline: G.O.P. Establishment Declares Open Season on a Weakened Bannon
teaser: Roy S. Moore’s loss in Alabama has stirred up fresh worry that Republicans are again descending again into Tea Party-type spasms of self-defeating rage.

headline: Trump Administration Adds Restrictions for Visa-Waiver Countries
teaser: Countries whose citizens can visit the United States without a visa must step up their information sharing and put in effect other security measurements, American officials said.

headline: House Intelligence Panel Is Rushing to Complete Russia Probe
teaser: With key interviews shoehorned into next week before the holiday break, the House Intelligence Committee appears to be rushing its Russia probe to an end.

headline: Trump Judicial Nominee Attracts Scorn After Flopping in Hearing
teaser: The nominee, Matthew S. Petersen, was unable to answer basic legal questions during a hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee.

headline: Right and Left React to the F.C.C.’s Vote on Net Neutrality Rules
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the vote Thursday by the Federal Communications Commission to dismantle Obama-era rules on net neutrality.

headline: Accused of Sexual Harassment, Andrea Ramsey Ends Kansas Congressional Run
teaser: Ms. Ramsey, a newcomer to politics, was running to unseat a Republican. She denies that she harassed a male subordinate, as alleged in a 2005 lawsuit.

headline: Court Temporarily Blocks Trump Order Against Contraceptive Coverage
teaser: A federal judge in Philadelphia allowed an Obama-era rule, generally requiring employers and insurers to pay for contraceptive costs, to continue.

headline: Governors Look to Save Nafta Amid Washington’s Tough Talk
teaser: More state officials are warning about the dangers of upsetting the North American Free Trade Agreement, but the White House so far appears unmoved.

headline: A Last Push for Obamacare Sign-ups — and Worries About Who Got Hurt
teaser: Blacks and Hispanics saw the biggest gains under the Affordable Care Act. They’re also likely to be most affected by cuts to this year’s enrollment period, which ended Friday.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Embellishes the Truth in a Speech to the Thin Blue Line
teaser: Among other claims, President Trump inaccurately said the Obama administration “refused” to equip police with military gear with little reason.

headline: Omarosa’s White House Show Is Canceled
teaser: Love her or hate her, the former reality show star turned White House aide has never shied away from controversy.

headline: Many Questions, Few Answers on U.S. Claims of Iran Violations
teaser: Nikki R. Haley, the American ambassador to the United Nations, presented what she said was evidence that Iran was violating one of its international agreements. John Ismay, a Times reporter, said the evidence fell short of proving her claims.

headline: A Middle-Class Tax Cut? Americans Aren’t Buying It
teaser: A poll finds that Americans don’t expect their own taxes to decline next year and doubt that the Republican plan will raise wages or economic growth.

headline: Executive at Consultancy Hired by E.P.A. Scrutinized Agency Employees Critical of Trump
teaser: A top executive has submitted at least 40 Freedom of Information Act requests targeting employees known to be questioning management at the E.P.A.

headline: As a Must-Pass Republican Tax Bill Headed for the Finish Line, Rubio Saw an Opening
teaser: On Thursday, Marco Rubio took a stand: He threatened to vote no unless House and Senate negotiators expanded the child tax credit.

headline: Omarosa Manigault Newman, Leaving the White House, Suggests the Show Will Go On
teaser: As the spectacle surrounding Ms. Newman’s departure promises to carry over into the Trump administration’s second year, her telegenic antics have not been entertaining to several West Wing aides.

headline: A.C.L.U. Goes to Court for 2 Undocumented Teenagers Seeking Abortions
teaser: The organization is fighting what it says is a Trump administration policy of blocking undocumented minors’ access to abortion.

headline: What Has Bannon Blamed for Moore’s Problems?
teaser: In the aftermath of Roy Moore’s defeat in Alabama, a look back at all the people and institutions Stephen K. Bannon blamed for Moore’s failures on the campaign trail.

headline: What’s in the Tax Bill, and How It Will Affect You
teaser: Several expected changes made the final cut, including a big increase in the standard deduction and a reduction in state and local income tax breaks.

headline: Are High Heels Headed for a Tumble?
teaser: With sexual harassment revelations rife and public spaces threatened, some women are wondering just why they wear these things.

headline: Homeowners Have Had It Good. Too Good, Says the Tax Bill.
teaser: The tax code has long offered rewards for buying rather than renting, an equation that has troubled some economists — and that the Republican bill upends.

headline: Glowing Auras and ‘Black Money’: The Pentagon’s Mysterious U.F.O. Program
teaser: The shadowy program began in 2007 and was largely funded at the request of Harry Reid, the former Senate majority leader, who has had a longtime interest in space phenomena.

headline: 2 Navy Airmen and an Object That ‘Accelerated Like Nothing I’ve Ever Seen’
teaser: What began as a training mission took a bizarre turn in 2004, an encounter that caught the attention of a Pentagon program investigating U.F.O.s.

headline: Kirsten Gillibrand, Long a Champion of Women, Finds the Nation Joining Her
teaser: Ms. Gillibrand, a senator from New York, has seen her rising star lifted higher by her run-ins with President Trump over his treatment of women.

headline: Tax Bill Largely Preserves Incentives for Wind and Solar Power
teaser: The final text of the legislation reverses language in earlier versions that could have slowed the growth of renewable energy.

headline: News Analysis: File Your Taxes on a Postcard? A G.O.P. Promise Marked Undeliverable
teaser: The tax bill on the cusp of being passed by Congress is not the grand simplification of the code that Republicans promised when they set out to eliminate tax breaks and cut the number of tax brackets.

headline: Nevada Democrat Facing Harassment Accusations Will Not Seek Re-Election
teaser: Representative Ruben Kihuen denied the accusations, but said they would be a distraction in a re-election campaign. He is the fifth member of Congress to step aside in two weeks.

headline: Uproar Over Purported Ban at C.D.C. of Words Like ‘Fetus’
teaser: The Department of Health and Human Services played down a report that officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention were told not to use several words in budget documents.

headline: Tax Bill Would Curb Breaks for Sexual Abuse Settlements
teaser: Companies will have to pay more in taxes if they use nondisclosure agreements, but experts say it isn’t likely to deter businesses from seeking confidentiality.

headline: Trump Lawyer Says Mueller Illegally Obtained Transition Emails
teaser: The move was the latest in the mounting attacks by the president and his surrogates on the investigation by the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III.

headline: News Analysis: Champion of the ‘Little Guy’? Trump’s Actions Tell Another Story
teaser: Instead of tearing down the establishment, President Trump’s critics say, he has helped prop it up through the tax bill, the “net neutrality” reversal and other steps.

headline: John McCain, Fighting Brain Cancer, Likely to Miss Vote on Tax Overhaul
teaser: President Trump, who indicated that Mr. McCain was returning home to Arizona after being hospitalized, said the senator would come back if his vote was needed.

headline: E.P.A. Employees Spoke Out. Then Came Scrutiny of Their Email.
teaser: A Republican research group has requested the emails of E.P.A. employees critical of the agency. Now the E.P.A. has hired an affiliated company.

headline: A Tillerson Slip Offers a Peek Into Secret Planning on North Korea
teaser: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson offered tantalizing details about how the United States would race inside North Korea to seize its nuclear weapons in the event of a collapse.

headline: Rebelling Republican Suburbs Offer Democrats Path to House Control
teaser: From Houston to Seattle, suburban districts once locked down by Republicans are looking to Democratic candidates to oppose President Trump.

headline: Have You Ever Felt Sorry for the I.R.S.? Now Might Be the Time
teaser: Already struggling with its workload, the agency must start adapting systems to the new tax code while processing returns under the old one.

headline: Sidebar: Across the Atlantic, Another Supreme Court Case on Cake and Gay Rights
teaser: This spring, Britain’s Supreme Court will consider whether a bakery could refuse to create a cake celebrating same-sex marriage.

headline: Trump National Security Strategy Sees U.S. Confronting China and Russia
teaser: The strategy the president plans to outline Monday is at odds with his often-warm relations with the leaders of China and Russia.

headline: Federal Judge Alex Kozinski Retires Abruptly After Sexual Harassment Allegations
teaser: Mr. Kozinski, an appeals court judge in California for 32 years, had been accused of misconduct by multiple women.

headline: Republicans Have Tax Bill Victory in Sight as Democrats Try to Chip Away at Support
teaser: The bill’s expected passage along party lines had Democrats scrambling to pressure a late supporter, Senator Bob Corker of Tennessee, to vote against the bill.

headline: Fact Check: The Tax Plan
teaser: President Trump and the Republicans aim to pass their tax overhaul before Christmas. Does it deliver on their promises?

headline: In Fight for Judiciary Slot, Democrats Broach the ‘I’ Word: Impeachment
teaser: House Democrats will choose between Representatives Jerrold Nadler and Zoe Lofgren to lead the Judiciary Committee. They have impeachment on their minds.

headline: Our Journalists Share Their Most Memorable Interviews of 2017
teaser: Times reporters reflect on the conversations that stuck with them long after their assignments ended.

headline: Boeing and Bombardier Trade Clash Poses More Risks for Nafta
teaser: The case between two rival jet makers has bigger implications for the trade relationship between the United States and Canada, and the trade pact that governs it.

headline: Trump’s Strategy: ‘Wealth and Power at Home’
teaser: President Trump said his national security strategy will advance four vital United States interests, in an address in Washington on Monday.

headline: President Trump, the Animatronic Version, Comes to Disney World
teaser: Mr. Trump joined the Hall of Presidents in the Magic Kingdom on Monday. The exhibit was closed before his inauguration, prompting some people to theorize that Disney was trying to silence him.

headline: Democrats in New York Can Already Hear Iowa’s Siren Song
teaser: The region is home to a glut of nationally ambitious politicians and a confluence of egos that promise friction heading into 2020.
