headline: Pence Postpones Trip to Middle East, Citing Vote on Tax Bill This Week
teaser: The decision also came amid mounting tension in the region over President Trump’s decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital.

headline: Republican Tax Cuts Would Lift Some Industries More Than Others
teaser: Financial firms would see a larger tax cut than manufacturers, a University of Pennsylvania study concluded.

headline: Without the Insurance Mandate, Health Care’s Future Is Anyone’s Guess
teaser: The tax bill headed for passage eliminates the Affordable Care Act’s mandate that most people have insurance. No one is sure what that will do to health care.

headline: Trump Nominee Withdraws in Latest Judicial Setback for White House
teaser: The nominee, Matthew Petersen, was the third in recent days to remove himself from consideration, another embarrassment for the White House selection process.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Inaccurately Claims ‘Firsts’ in Defense Speech
teaser: President Trump sold his first national security strategy with inaccurate claims about military spending, NATO and border security.

headline: U.S. Accuses North Korea of Mounting WannaCry Cyberattack
teaser: The Trump administration suggested the U.S. would act against North Korea beyond the sanctions now being imposed for its rapid expansion of its nuclear weapons program.

headline: Right and Left: Partisan Writing You Shouldn’t Miss on the Robert Mueller Investigation
teaser: Read about how the other side thinks about the special counsel’s investigation, reports of Peter Strzok’s comments about Trump and the response of White House allies.

headline: Graduate Students Escaped Tax Increases, but They Still Feel a Target on Their Backs
teaser: House Republicans took aim at graduate students with provisions to tax their benefits. Those were dropped from the tax deal but they could return in a separate bill.

headline: Trump Takes Mantle of First Bull as the Stock Market Rises
teaser: President Trump has been an unabashed cheerleader of the rising stock market, saying that his policies have emboldened Wall Street and individual investors.

headline: Decoding Trump’s Plan to Rein In China
teaser: Beijing poses a threat on the business and technology fronts as well as militarily, the White House argues in a new national security blueprint.

headline: Republican Tax Bill Heads to a Vote
teaser: The House begins debate on the tax bill and plans to vote Tuesday afternoon. The Senate could vote soon after, handing Republicans a major first legislative victory.

headline: As Trump Tightens Legal Immigration, Canada Woos Tech Firms
teaser: In an industry relying heavily on workers from overseas, the administration’s efforts to limit visas have companies looking to relocate north.

headline: House Secretly Paid $115,000 to Settle Harassment Claims Over Four Years
teaser: The new cases bring to $199,000 the amount paid in sexual harassment claims since 2008. There is no public information about the claims, and names were not released.

headline: Senate Panel Rejects Trump’s Nominee to Lead Ex-Im Bank
teaser: With two Republican defections, the Senate Banking Committee voted down the nomination of Scott Garrett, a former Republican congressman from New Jersey.

headline: Senate Investigators Scrutinize Another Presidential Candidate: Jill Stein
teaser: The Senate Intelligence Committee is examining links between Green Party candidate Jill Stein and Russia’s efforts to interfere with the 2016 election.

headline: Ta-Nehisi Coates Deletes Twitter Account After Sparring With Cornel West
teaser: Mr. West, a fierce critic of President Obama from the left, called Mr. Coates “the neoliberal face of the black freedom struggle.” Twitter wasn’t happy.

headline: Ask Us Your Questions About the Republican Tax Bill
teaser: Two New York Times reporters will answer reader questions on Facebook Live about the sweeping $1.5 trillion tax overhaul.

headline: The House Votes on Tax Bill
teaser: The House mustered enough support to move forward with a sweeping G.O.P. tax plan on Tuesday. However, the House will have to vote again Wednesday after the Senate parliamentarian rejected three provisions in the Senate bill.

headline: As G.O.P. Celebrates House Vote, New York and New Jersey Lawmakers Say No
teaser: In almost every case, the reason for that opposition came down to the assertion that the two states were basically being used to pay for tax cuts in the other 48.

headline: E.P.A. Delays Bans on Uses of Hazardous Chemicals
teaser: Despite earlier warnings about the dangers, the agency will indefinitely postpone bans on three chemicals used in paint strippers, and in dry-cleaning and degreasing agents.

headline: Heritage Foundation Names New President After Turmoil Under DeMint
teaser: The selection of Kay Coles James suggested that Heritage was trying to regroup after struggling to find footing in President Trump’s Washington.

headline: With Children’s Health Program Running Dry, Parents Beg Congress: ‘Do the Right Thing’
teaser: Congress is looking to leave Washington for the year, but the Children’s Health Insurance Program is out of money, and parents are pleading for help.

headline: How Republicans Rallied Together to Deliver a Tax Cut
teaser: The rushed timeline of the bill resulted from the failure of health care legislation over the summer — and a collective decision to block out bad news.

headline: G.O.P. Nears Triumph on Taxes as House Passes Bill
teaser: After the House approved the tax rewrite, the first significant legislative achievement of the Trump presidency was within reach for Republicans.

headline: In Protests of Net Neutrality Repeal, Teenage Voices Stood Out
teaser: Young people who have grown up knowing only an open internet organized rallies, streamed the F.C.C. vote in class — and say they plan to keep fighting.

headline: G.O.P. Finally Notches 2017 Victory While Bracing for 2018 Verdict
teaser: After a year when legislative victories eluded them, Republicans secured a big one at the end. But at what cost?

headline: House to Move Quickly to Finish Tax Vote
teaser: The Senate revisions that the House will vote on are minor, so there is no suspense about the outcome when the House holds its final vote.

headline: State of the Art: What the Tax Bill Fails to Address: Technology’s Tsunami
teaser: Technology is changing everything about how Americans work, but the industry is left largely unscathed by the Republican tax bill that Congress took up this week.

headline: A New Russian Ploy: Competing Extradition Requests
teaser: Moscow is seeking to block U.S. trials of cybercriminals by trying to extradite them to Russia for crimes allegedly committed years before.

headline: With Tax Overhaul, Trump Fulfills a Campaign Promise and Flexes Republican Muscle
teaser: President Trump will enter his second year in office with a major legislative achievement, which Republicans will try to sell to voters in midterm elections.

headline: Trump Threatens to End American Aid: ‘We’re Watching Those Votes’ at the U.N.
teaser: The General Assembly is scheduled to vote on Thursday on a resolution that would condemn President Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital.

headline: House Passes Tax Overhaul in Re-Vote
teaser: The House, forced to vote a second time on the $1.5 trillion tax bill, passed the final version on Wednesday. It was the most sweeping tax overhaul in 31 years.

headline: U.S. Punishes Chechen Leader in New Sanctions Against Russians
teaser: Sanctions could be a sign the Trump administration is heightening pressure on some Russians despite a more accommodating tone with President Vladimir V. Putin.

headline: Trump and G.O.P. Celebrate Tax Bill
teaser: The passage of the tax overhaul bill is the biggest legislative achievement for Republicans since they gained full control of Congress and the White House.

headline: Glenn Thrush, Suspended Times Reporter, to Resume Work but Won’t Cover White House
teaser: Mr. Thrush, who was accused of inappropriate sexual behavior, will no longer cover the White House when he returns from his suspension in late January, The Times said.

headline: Democrats Are Pulling Away in the Generic Ballot. What Does That Mean?
teaser: The party’s advantage has ballooned over the last few months, improving its outlook for retaking the House.

headline: Drilling in Arctic Refuge Gets a Green Light. What’s Next?
teaser: The tax bill headed to President Trump for signature lifts a ban on oil drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. But it might take years for drilling to begin, if it ever does.

headline: Republican Economic Policies Put Business First
teaser: President Trump’s approach to economic policy is to help business as a way to help workers, a theory that will be put to the test with the passage of the $1.5 trillion tax plan.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Falsely Claims to Have ‘Repealed Obamacare’
teaser: The repeal of the individual mandate in the tax bill, despite President Trump’s claim, does not amount to a repeal of the entire health care law.

headline: How a Tuition-Free College Turned Into a Casualty of the Tax Wars
teaser: In a push to embarrass Republicans and slow their tax bill, Senator Bernie Sanders stripped out a pet provision of Senator Mitch McConnell’s — and punished a college for the poor.

headline: Officials Weigh Sending American Detainee to Saudi Arabia
teaser: Security officials are exploring whether to transfer a detained U.S. citizen suspected of being an Islamic State fighter to Saudi Arabia, where he grew up.

headline: Bill de Blasio Wants to Be Heard. Is Anyone Listening?
teaser: New York City’s mayor went to Iowa to lay out his vision for the future of the Democratic Party, and to present himself as proof that progressivism sells.

headline: In Tax Overhaul, Trump Tries to Defy the Economic Odds
teaser: Few independent analyses project anywhere near the rosy forecasts offered by the president’s top economic advisers.

headline: Justices Return Dispute Over DACA Documents to Lower Courts
teaser: The Supreme Court indicated that federal courts in California had moved too fast in ordering the Trump administration to disclose documents concerning its decision to end the program.

headline: Fearful of a Shutdown, Congress Inches Toward Stopgap Spending Bill
teaser: An end-of-the-year showdown over issues like immigration, health care and surveillance appeared to fizzle on Wednesday.

headline: Confederate Statues in Memphis to Be Removed After City Council Vote
teaser: The City Council voted Wednesday to sell two public parks to a private entity, allowing the city to skirt a state law barring the removal of the memorials.

headline: Facial Scans at U.S. Airports Violate Americans’ Privacy, Report Says
teaser: The Homeland Security Department is grappling with trying to catch foreigners who are illegally in the United States without trampling privacy rights.

headline: Governor Cuomo Proposes More Disclosure for Online Political Ads in New York
teaser: The New York legislation, which closely hews to a federal bill, would require internet companies to reveal who is paying and to show where content comes from.

headline: Tax Cuts Buoy Republicans, but They’re Swimming Against an Undertow
teaser: Passage of President Trump’s “beautiful” tax cuts will give Republicans a victory to talk about, but they still have to contend with an unpopular president.

headline: With a Friday Deadline, G.O.P. Lawmakers Rush to Avoid a Government Shutdown
teaser: House Republican leaders released a plan that would extend funding through Jan. 19 while punting fights over immigration and surveillance into next year.

headline: Brushing Aside Trump’s Threats, U.N. General Assembly Condemns U.S. Decree on Jerusalem
teaser: The vote amounted to a collective act of defiance toward the Trump administration at the United Nations, the world’s biggest diplomatic stage.

headline: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on 52 People and Entities for Abuse and Corruption
teaser: The Trump administration announced the imposition of sanctions on 52 individuals and entities under a law to punish human rights abusers.

headline: Mortgage Giants Cut Deal With Treasury to Cover Expected Losses
teaser: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will be allowed to keep $3 billion as capital cushion to prevent against losses activated by the Republican tax bill.

headline: Despite Internal Review, Justice Department Officials Say Congress Needs to Act on Bump Stocks
teaser: The Justice Department is continuing to work on the issue of bump stocks, despite public and private misgivings of its own officials.

headline: Obamacare Sign-ups at High Levels Despite Trump Saying It’s ‘Imploding’
teaser: Sign-ups at Healthcare.gov reached 8.8 million, just shy of last year’s levels, despite an open enrollment period that was half as long and far less advertised.

headline: Judge Dismisses Suit Against Trump Over Business Dealings
teaser: The complaint accused President Trump of violating the Constitution by continuing to own and profit from his business empire.

headline: Edward Rowny, Outspoken Treaty Negotiator, Dies at 100
teaser: General Rowny advised presidents from Richard Nixon to George H.W. Bush during talks with the Soviet Union about nuclear arms. He could be blunt.

headline: For Students Swindled by Predatory Colleges, Relief May Only Be Partial
teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos said her department would start granting loan forgiveness for students bilked by for-profit colleges.

headline: Justice Dept. Revokes 25 Legal Guidance Documents Dating to 1975
teaser: The Justice Department rescinded 25 guidance documents dating back decades after Attorney General Jeff Sessions said that such documents circumvented the regulatory rule-making process.

headline: Dispute Over Midterm Game Plan Erupts Inside the White House
teaser: A meeting involving President Trump and his top advisers devolved into a heated exchange between his former campaign adviser and the White House political director.

headline: Right and Left React to the Passage of the G.O.P. Tax Cut
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the Republican tax cut plan that passed the House and Senate and is awaiting President Trump’s signature.

headline: E.P.A. Officials, Disheartened by Agency’s Direction, Are Leaving in Droves
teaser: Among the departures are nearly 200 biologists, chemists and toxicologists, draining the agency of scientific expertise needed to address pollution threats.

headline: Trump Signs Sweeping Tax Bill, a Major Legislative Victory for the President
teaser: The bill was the most significant overhaul of America’s tax system in decades.

headline: Trump Watches News. Rushes to Sign Tax Bill.
teaser: President Trump pushed aside a formal signing in January to sign the tax legislation because television news networks questioned whether he would keep his promise to sign the legislation before Christmas.

headline: Prosecutors Said to Seek Kushner Records From Deutsche Bank
teaser: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn subpoenaed records about entities associated with the family company of President Trump’s son-in-law, people briefed on the matter said.

headline: U.S. Government Went Through These People’s Phones at the Border. Read Their Stories.
teaser: Here are additional excerpts from complaints filed by people whose electronic devices were searched at the border, supplementing a companion article.

headline: Privacy Complaints Mount Over Phone Searches at U.S. Border Since 2011
teaser: Complaints filed by people whose electronics were searched at the border without warrants highlight a growing debate over privacy, security and technology.

headline: A Teenager Said She Had Been Raped in Her Home Country. The U.S. Opposed Her Abortion.
teaser: An official who temporarily blocked an undocumented teenager’s abortion said that although the girl had been raped, it was not possible to “cure violence with further violence.”

headline: F.B.I. Director Wants to Move Forward, but the President Is Making His Job Harder
teaser: Five months since Christopher Wray started the job, President Trump’s verbal assaults have put Mr. Wray and his team in a difficult position.

headline: U.S. Tax Bill May Inspire Cuts Globally, While Fueling Trade Tensions
teaser: Other countries may need to cut corporate taxes to stay competitive. But companies outside the United States also worry the bill discriminates against them.

headline: McConnell Wryly Calls Bannon a ‘Genius’
teaser: Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, took a shot at President Trump’s former chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, saying Mr. Bannon had cost Republicans a Senate seat in Alabama.

headline: Jeanine Pirro of Fox News Helps an Old Friend: President Trump
teaser: After a White House visit, the Fox News host has called for the firing of Robert Mueller and said F.B.I. agents should be “taken out in cuffs.”

headline: VIDEO FEATURE: What Happens When You Report Sexual Harassment?
teaser: For many women, it’s a complicated maze that can cost them their careers and leave them with long-term emotional scars. Here are some of their stories.

headline: Rupert Murdoch and President Trump: A Friendship of Convenience
teaser: After decades of mutual wariness, the two titans now have a close relationship — just in time for Disney’s proposed acquisition of 21st Century Fox.

headline: Trump's Tough Immigration Talk Meets Reality
teaser: As ICE arrests have gone up, deportations have gone down. Why? It’s partly because of the complex realities of tough policy in practice.

headline: Trump’s Way: Stoking Fears, Trump Defied Bureaucracy to Advance Immigration Agenda
teaser: The changes have had far-reaching consequences, both for the immigrants who have sought to make a new home in this country and for America’s image in the world.

headline: The DeVos ‘Nice List’
teaser: It pays to be a cause that Education Secretary Betsy DeVos cares about. She has a lot of money and gives a lot of it away.

headline: Andrew McCabe, F.B.I.’s Embattled Deputy, Is Expected to Retire
teaser: Mr. McCabe’s plans to leave early next year should take some of the pressure off the new director, who has been criticized by President Trump for not replacing top leadership fast enough.

headline: Joan Walsh’s Contract at MSNBC Is Not Renewed
teaser: The network said the longtime contributor “will still be invited on our shows” but won’t be paid. Katie Couric is among those calling on MSNBC to keep her.

headline: The Hunt for ISIS Pivots to Remaining Pockets in Syria
teaser: The last phase of the American campaign against the caliphate is relying heavily on warplanes that are focused on an area half the size of Manhattan.

headline: American ISIS Suspect Held in Iraq Has Right to Lawyer, Judge Rules
teaser: An American citizen who has been imprisoned in military custody as an “enemy combatant” for months must be allowed to talk with an A.C.L.U. lawyer.

headline: Judge Partially Lifts Trump Administration Ban on Refugees
teaser: Two groups argued that the policy prevented people from some mostly Muslim countries from reuniting with family living legally in the United States.

headline: After a Chaotic Start, Congress Has Made a Conservative Mark
teaser: The 115th Congress, under Republican control, has left a conservative imprint on the courts, taxation, regulation and the environment. Next up: poverty programs.

headline: Mediator: Spielberg’s ‘The Post’ Provides Fitting End to Turbulent Year for the Media
teaser: A movie offers a reminder that leaking to the press can be a patriotic act comes at a time when the president delights in attacking journalists.

headline: Box of Horse Manure Is Left for Steve Mnuchin Near His Home, Police Say
teaser: The gift-wrapped package was addressed to Mr. Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, and left at his neighbor’s home in an upscale part of Los Angeles.

headline: New York’s Attorney General in Battle With Trump
teaser: Eric Schneiderman’s office recently took its 100th legal or administrative action against “the biggest threat” to New Yorkers: the federal government.

headline: Economic Scene: Incomes Grew After Past Tax Cuts, but Guess Whose
teaser: While the well-to-do did even better than before, average income for Americans on the bottom half of the scale actually shrank under Presidents Ronald Reagan and George W. Bush.

headline: The Daily: Meeting a Town’s Beloved Resident, Months After Telling His Immigration Story
teaser: When federal immigration agents took Juan Carlos Hernandez Pacheco away from his Illinois home, a reporter first turned to neighbors and town officials.

headline: Kimmel, Covfefe, ‘Wonder Woman’: Washington’s Views on Pop Culture in 2017
teaser: Two Times reporters shared their analysis of how pop culture looks from inside the White House.

headline: Orrin Hatch Says He’s ‘Grateful’ for Biting Editorial That Suggested He Resign
teaser: The senator’s response to being named “Utahn of the Year” by The Salt Lake Tribune led to ridicule. A spokesman said the comment had been tongue-in-cheek.

headline: Years of Attack Leave Obamacare a More Government-Focused Health Law
teaser: Efforts by Republicans to chip away at the Affordable Care Act, culminating in the repeal of the individual mandate, have left behind a more government-focused health program.

headline: Mike Huckabee Says Trump Is Like Churchill. Historians Disagree.
teaser: The former Arkansas governor’s tweets after seeing “The Darkest Hour,” a film about Winston Churchill, stirred up Twitter.

headline: Best of Late Night: Late-Night TV in 2017: Trump, Russia, Weinstein and More
teaser: The first year of President Trump’s administration provided considerable fodder for hosts.

headline: Barack Obama’s BBC Interview With Prince Harry
teaser: The former president said he was adjusting to life outside the White House, and expressed concern, without naming names, about the possible corrosive effects of social media.

headline: The Library of Congress No Longer Wants All the Tweets
teaser: Having archived all public tweets over 12 years, the institution says it has enough and intends to be more selective.

headline: In a Complex Tax Bill, Let the Hunt for Loopholes Begin
teaser: A 2004 change by Congress, meant to foster domestic manufacturing, may provide a cautionary tale: You can mine a lot of tax breaks from just one word.

headline: F.D.A. Leaves Tainted Foods on Shelves Too Long, Report Finds
teaser: The agency has the authority to force recalls of contaminated foods but is not adequately ensuring timely compliance, an inspector general’s report concludes.

headline: Singer Files Police Report Claiming Corey Lewandowski Slapped Her on the Buttocks
teaser: The singer, Joy Villa, and the former Trump campaign manager met at a party celebrating the president. She said Mr. Lewandowski slapped her twice on the buttocks.

headline: Appeals Court Orders E.P.A. to Update Lead Paint Rules, Quickly
teaser: A federal panel told the agency to revise its standard for dangerous levels of lead in paint within a year.

headline: Roy Moore Asks Alabama Court to Block Election’s Certification
teaser: Less than 24 hours before Alabama officials were expected to certify the results of a Senate election, Roy S. Moore went to court claiming voter fraud.

headline: China Offers Tax Incentives to Persuade U.S. Companies to Stay
teaser: Following a tax overhaul in the United States, Beijing has announced a temporary exemption for foreign firms investing in certain sectors.

headline: Trump’s Way: Trump, the Insurgent, Breaks With 70 Years of American Foreign Policy
teaser: President Trump has transformed the world’s view of the United States from an anchor of the international order into something more inward-looking and unpredictable.

headline: Anatomy of a Trump Tweet:Vanity Fair Edition
teaser: President Trump’s broadside aimed at Vanity Fair mastered a tricky title and made much of a 14-word statement.

headline: Trump Says Russia Inquiry Makes U.S. ‘Look Very Bad’
teaser: The president said in an interview on Thursday that the special counsel will treat him fairly, contradicting a campaign by some Republicans to discredit the investigation.

headline: It’s Cold Outside. Get Ready for the Trump Global Warming Tweet.
teaser: With frigid temperatures in the East, President Trump cast doubt on the reality of climate change. But weather is not the same as climate.

headline: Trump’s Foreign Policy: Mixing the Brash and the Blunt
teaser: A closer look at how President Trump’s unpredictable approach to foreign policy plays out on the global stage.

headline: Excerpts From Trump’s Interview With The Times
teaser: President Trump discussed a range of issues with The New York Times, including the Russia inquiry, the tax overhaul and China, at his golf club in West Palm Beach, Fla.

headline: U.S. to Roll Back Safety Rules Created After Deepwater Horizon Spill
teaser: The Interior Department said reversing the Obama-era regulations would reduce “unnecessary burdens” on the energy industry.

headline: Washington Memo: The Year the News Accelerated to Trump Speed
teaser: The president’s news-making in the age of the tweet and the push alert has produced something of a sensory overload that shortens the life span of even the most dominant stories.

headline: How Climate Change Deniers Rise to the Top in Google Searches
teaser: Groups that reject established climate science can use the search engine’s advertising business to their advantage, gaming the system to find a mass platform for false or misleading claims.

headline: Out There: U.F.O.s: Is This All There Is?
teaser: Astronomers have their noses pressed against the windows of the unknown, wanting to believe in life elsewhere just like many outer space enthusiasts.

headline: Frustrated U.S. Might Withhold $255 Million in Aid From Pakistan
teaser: American officials are frustrated over Pakistan’s lack of cooperation on counterterrorism, including its refusal to hand over a militant who helped hold Americans hostage.

headline: Carnage, Comey and Covevfe: 2017: Our Reporters Reflect on Covering Washington and Politics
teaser: News from Washington dominated headlines and captured the world’s attention this year. Here’s a look at a handful of those stories, with reflections from the reporters who covered them.

headline: Fact Check: 10 Falsehoods From Trump’s Interview With The Times
teaser: The inaccurate statements covered the Russia investigation, health care, immigration and the president’s following on social media.

headline: Our Reporter Mike Schmidt on His Golf Club Interview With President Trump
teaser: I knew this was not going to go over well with the White House press office, which hates being blindsided by the president making news.

headline: How the Russia Inquiry Began: A Campaign Aide, Drinks and Talk of Political Dirt
teaser: George Papadopoulos, a Trump foreign policy adviser, was the improbable match that set off a blaze that has consumed the first year of the Trump administration.

headline: Republican Attacks on Mueller and F.B.I. Open New Rift in G.O.P.
teaser: A campaign to discredit the F.B.I. and the special counsel investigating President Trump is growing more heated, splitting the Republican Party.

headline: Trump Ends Terms of Remaining Members of H.I.V. and AIDS Council
teaser: The council’s executive director said the dismissals were common when a new administration takes office. Six members resigned in June in protest of President Trump.

headline: The U.S. Has Pummeled Al Qaeda in Yemen. But the Threat Is Barely Dented.
teaser: Despite tripling airstrikes this year, American officials concede an attack emanating from the chaotic, ungoverned spaces of Yemen remains among their top terrorism fears.

headline: On Washington: Republicans’ 2018 Resolution: Bipartisanship. Will It Last?
teaser: With their Senate majority narrowed even further and a midterm election approaching, Republicans are seeking some consensus with Democrats after a year of intense division.

headline: Trump’s Way: For Trump, a Year of Reinventing the Presidency
teaser: In ways that were once unimaginable, President Trump has discarded the conventions and norms established by his predecessors. Will that change the institution permanently?

headline: Tax Law Offers a Carrot to Gig Workers. But It May Have Costs.
teaser: A 20 percent tax deduction for setting oneself up as a business could reward severing formal employment relationships but erode benefits and security.

headline: From Trump to #MeToo: A Dizzying Year in TV News
teaser: Two Times media reporters analyze why 2017, despite powerful foes like Netflix and the fallout of harassment scandals, was the year TV roared back.

headline: Partisans, Wielding Money, Begin Seeking to Exploit Harassment Claims
teaser: The earthquake of sexual misconduct allegations has taken down powerful men without regard to politics, but as it shakes Washington, accusations are taking on a partisan tint.

headline: Courts Must Better Police Themselves on Harassment, Chief Justice Says
teaser: In his year-end report on the state of the federal judiciary, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. addressed reports of sexual misconduct by an appeals court judge.

headline: Sidebar: Pulled Over in a Rental Car, With Heroin in the Trunk
teaser: The Supreme Court will hear arguments next week about whether drivers not listed in rental car agreements give up their privacy rights.

headline: Korean War, a ‘Forgotten’ Conflict That Shaped the Modern World
teaser: The three-year conflict set the stage for decades of tension on the Korean Peninsula, but today many Americans know little about it.

headline: With Disney Deal Looming, Murdoch’s Empire Is Fractured
teaser: Rupert Murdoch’s decision to sell most of 21st Century Fox has many wondering what the future holds for him and the two sons who seemed on the cusp of taking over his vast empire.

headline: On Washington: Republicans’ 2018 Resolution: Bipartisanship. Will It Last?
teaser: With their Senate majority narrowed even further and a midterm election approaching, Republicans are seeking some consensus with Democrats after a year of intense division.

headline: Mayor de Blasio Begins Second Term in Frigid Ceremony
teaser: On a bitterly cold day, Bill de Blasio was sworn by Senator Bernie Sanders and pledged “a new progressive era in this city’s history.”

headline: The Trump Effect: Business, Anticipating Less Regulation, Loosens Purse Strings
teaser: The administration’s campaign to reduce regulation has improved the mood of business executives. They may be spending more money as a result.

headline: At de Blasio Inaugural, Speeches by Two Who Might Replace Him
teaser: Addresses by the comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, and public advocate, Leticia James, marked a kind of unofficial start to the 2021 mayoral campaign.

headline: Mind: ‘Fake News’: Wide Reach but Little Impact, Study Suggests
teaser: Before the 2016 election, those most likely to read “fake news” online were older and conservative, a new study finds. But even they relied most often on mainstream media.

headline: Trump Accuses Former Clinton Aide of Failing to Follow Security Protocols
teaser: About 3,000 of Huma Abedin’s emails were released by the State Department on Friday. The president also accused his Justice Department of being a “deep state.”

headline: Orrin Hatch to Retire from Senate, Opening Path for Mitt Romney
teaser: Orrin G. Hatch, the longest-serving Senate Republican, will announce that he will retire at the end of the year, clearing a path for Mitt Romney to run.

headline: Trump Reiterates Support for Iranian Protesters, but Also Criticizes Obama
teaser: Unlike President Barack Obama, who was faulted for his response to the protests that became known as the Green Movement, President Trump has come down on the side of the demonstrators

headline: U.S. Service Member Is Killed in Afghan Province
teaser: Four service members were wounded after a skirmish on Monday in Nangarhar Province in eastern Afghanistan.

headline: Fact Check: Trump’s Aviation Boast Fails to Get in the Air
teaser: President Trump claimed undue credit for the “safest year on record” in commercial aviation, despite having done little on the issue.

headline: ‘I Too Have a Nuclear Button, but It Is a Much Bigger & More Powerful One’: Trump Taunts Kim Jong-un
teaser: In a tweet, the president of the United States says his nuclear button is bigger and more powerful than Kim Jong-un’s.

headline: Senate Returns to a Plate Full of Democratic Demands
teaser: Democrats are pushing for funding for children’s health care and protection for young undocumented immigrants, among other priorities.

headline: Trump Accuses Former Clinton Aide of Failing to Follow Security Protocols
teaser: About 3,000 of Huma Abedin’s emails were released by the State Department on Friday. The president also accused his Justice Department of being a “deep state.”

headline: Showtime’s ‘The Circus’ Will Go On Without Mark Halperin
teaser: The journalist will not return in the wake of claims of sexual assault. Alex Wagner of CBS News will replace him, joining John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon.

headline: Social Media Shudders After Trump Mocks North Korea’s ‘Button’
teaser: The president’s tweet that he has a “much bigger” arsenal of nuclear weapons was met with dread and humor, of both the gallows and locker-room varieties.

headline: Ex-Homeland Security Officials Urge Faster Action on DACA
teaser: The window for legislative action to protect undocumented immigrants brought to the country as children will close by the middle of January, three former officials said in a letter.

headline: The ‘Nuclear Button’ Explained: For Starters, There’s No Button
teaser: The image of a leader being able to launch missiles with the push of one finger has, for decades, instilled fear.

headline: Trump’s First Big Twitter Day of 2018: Analyzing Nuclear Buttons and the ‘Corrupt Media’
teaser: The president’s 17 posts on Tuesday can be read as an outline of his agenda but also a glimpse at the challenges he faces this year.

headline: Trump Says Bannon Has ‘Lost His Mind’ After Bannon Insults Donald Trump Jr.
teaser: “Steve Bannon has nothing to do with me or my Presidency,” President Trump said in a statement. “When he was fired, he not only lost his job, he lost his mind.”

headline: Two Democrats Sworn in to Senate, Cutting G.O.P. Margin to One
teaser: Doug Jones of Alabama and Tina Smith of Minnesota were sworn in as senators on Wednesday, leaving Republicans with a 51-49 majority and the Senate with a record 22 women.

headline: Read Trump’s Reaction to Steve Bannon’s Comments
teaser: President Trump hit back at the former White House chief strategist through a statement saying that Mr. Bannon had nothing to do with his “historic victory.”

headline: Fed Sees Rate Increases in 2018 but Lacks Consensus on Frequency
teaser: Federal Reserve officials agreed that additional rate hikes are coming but disagreed about the frequency of such increases, according to minutes of the December meeting.

headline: Would Twitter Ever Suspend Trump’s Account?
teaser: Critics have wondered whether the president’s more violent tweets — including those directed at North Korea — could merit a suspension or ban. Here’s what Twitter says.

headline: Paul Manafort Sues Mueller and Asks a Judge to Narrow the Russia Investigation
teaser: The highly unusual lawsuit says the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, was given an overly broad mandate and needs to be reined in.

headline: Trump’s Threat to Cut Palestinian Aid Worries Many in Israel
teaser: Far from encouraging a return to peace talks, a pair of blunt tweets from the American president appeared to distance the Palestinians and confuse the Israelis.

headline: Ex-N.S.A. Worker Accused of Stealing Trove of Secrets Offers to Plead Guilty
teaser: Harold T. Martin III, who stored classified documents in his shed and car, gambles on a plea to one charge, with no guarantee that 19 more will be dropped.

headline: Trump Disbands Commission on Voter Fraud
teaser: The president signed an order to end the White House commission even though he said there was “substantial evidence of voter fraud,” which experts say is rare.

headline: Companies Are Handing Out Bonuses Thanks to the Tax Law. Is It a Publicity Stunt?
teaser: Following the big tax cut, companies have announced bonuses or wage hikes for employees. Will they make a difference? Or are they publicity stunts?

headline: Will 2018 Be the Year of Protectionism? Trump Alone Will Decide
teaser: The president has said he wants tariffs. He’ll have chances to impose them.

headline: Trump Watches From the Sidelines as the Koreas Begin to Talk
teaser: The Trump administration doesn’t oppose diplomatic talks on the Korean Peninsula but worries the North will try to drive a wedge between the United States and South Korea.

headline: Trump Administration to Move to Weaken Marijuana Legalization Movement
teaser: Federal prosecutors will be given discretion to more aggressively enforce marijuana laws, threatening to undermine the legalization movement at the state level.

headline: Trump Demands That Publisher Halt Release of Critical Book
teaser: A lawyer for the president threatens possible legal action to block publication of “Fire and Fury,” by Michael Wolff.

headline: Trump Proposes New Health Plan Options for Small Businesses
teaser: The Trump administration proposed new rules that could expand access to lower-cost insurance exempt from some requirements of the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Companies Warn of Hits From Tax Cuts. Don’t Be Fooled.
teaser: Companies are expected to report billions of dollars in short-term losses stemming from the new tax law. But they are a prelude to much larger profits.

headline: Global Warming’s Toll on Coral Reefs: As if They’re ‘Ravaged by War’
teaser: New research has found that mass bleaching of coral reefs, once virtually unknown, now happens every 6 years on average. That means the reefs don’t have time to recover.

headline: Trump Moves to Open Nearly All Offshore Waters to Drilling
teaser: The energy industry would have broad access to most of the outer continental shelf, reversing part of Barack Obama’s environmental legacy.

headline: Iran Lashes Out at Its Enemies, at Home and Abroad, Amid Protests
teaser: The chief prosecutor blamed “the United States, Israel and Saudi Arabia” for instigating the protests, while hard-liners and reformists traded accusations.

headline: U.S. Will Withhold Security Aid From Pakistan
teaser: The United States has provided billions of dollars in aid to Pakistan but the Trump administration says it is not doing enough to confront terrorist networks operating there.

headline: Right and Left React to the Clash Between Trump and Bannon
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the comments made by Stephen K. Bannon about President Trump and the president’s response.

headline: Led by the Mercers, Bannon’s Allies Abandon Him
teaser: Stephen K. Bannon’s provocative remarks about President Trump and his family, and Mr. Trump’s angry response, further alienated some of Mr. Bannon’s most important backers.

headline: Senators and Trump Inch Toward DACA Deal, but a Wall Divides Them
teaser: Democrats and Republicans remain divided over the shape and scope of a package that would restore protections for young unauthorized immigrants and bolster border security.

headline: Michael Wolff, From Local Media Scourge to National Newsmaker
teaser: A journalist who loved to needle the Manhattan elite enrages the president with his insider account of the year he spend reporting from the West Wing.

headline: Obstruction Inquiry Shows Trump’s Struggle to Keep Grip on Russia Investigation
teaser: The special counsel’s investigation has uncovered several incidents involving the president that raise questions about whether he obstructed justice.

headline: Will Nearly 200,000 Salvadorans Lose Their Immigration Status?
teaser: Jose Salinas has Temporary Protected Status, which is granted to immigrants who came to the United States from countries crippled by natural disasters or war. The Trump administration may end the program this month.

headline: U.S. to Start Korean Trade Talks Amid Rising Tensions
teaser: The renegotiation of the agreement between the United States and South Korea comes at a critical time, as North Korea seeks to drive a wedge between the allies.

headline: On Washington: New Pot Policy by Trump Administration Draws Bipartisan Fire
teaser: Lawmakers from both parties see it as a state decision and vow to force the attorney general, Jeff Sessions, to back down.

headline: Cellphone and Computer Searches at U.S. Border Rise Under Trump
teaser: Border agents say the electronic searches have stopped terrorism suspects and criminals, but privacy advocates call them an invasive violation of the Constitution.

headline: White House Memo: For Trump, Book Raises Familiar Questions of Loyalty and Candor
teaser: Every president is confronted by unflattering portrayals by former aides who leave and tell their stories, but usually not so early in an administration.

headline: Trump and Republicans to Meet at Camp David With Urgent Matters Looming
teaser: President Trump and Republican leaders in Congress are to meet Friday at Camp David, the presidential retreat in Maryland, to discuss a range of urgent domestic matters.

headline: American Detained by U.S. Military Says He Wants to Sue
teaser: An American citizen being held as an enemy combatant has told the A.C.L.U. he wants the group to represent him in challenging his indefinite wartime detention.

headline: Chris Christie Interview Excerpts: The Governor on Trump, the Transition and His Record
teaser: Weeks before the end of his second term, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey gave a two-hour interview on a wide range of subjects, including President Trump.

headline: Christie on His Relationship With Trump (Great) and His Regrets (Few) as New Jersey’s Governor
teaser: “I feel like I’ve done the job as well or better than anybody who’s ever had it,” Gov. Chris Christie said.

headline: Republican Senators Raise Possible Charges Against Author of Trump Dossier
teaser: The first congressional criminal referral in connection with Russian meddling targeted a former British spy, not anyone accused of conspiracy.

headline: Expect Environmental Battles to Be ‘Even More Significant’ in 2018
teaser: The Trump administration offered grand pronouncements about environmental deregulation in 2017. But this is the year to hammer out the details.

headline: Amid Calls from Trump, F.B.I. Renews Questions Over Clinton Foundation
teaser: Career prosecutors shut down the case in 2016 over lack of evidence. The new interest comes as Mr. Trump has taken the highly unusual step of calling for investigations into political rivals.

headline: Nuclear War Would Be ‘Devastating,’ So the C.D.C. Wants to Get People Prepared
teaser: The nation’s public health agency says a workshop was scheduled months ago, before President Trump’s recent tweets about nuclear buttons and North Korea.

headline: Band of the Insulted: The Nicknames of Trump’s Adversaries
teaser: President Trump has inducted one of his own into the bleak fraternity: “Sloppy Steve” Bannon, his strategist-in-exile, has a new Twitter nickname.

headline: Trump and Bannon: From Bromance to Breakup
teaser: The two anti-establishment Republicans bonded during the campaign. Now they are in the throes of a bad breakup after Steve Bannon made critical statements about President Trump.

headline: As Trump Targets the Press, His White House Is Screening a Journalism Tribute
teaser: While President Trump ramps up his attacks on the news media, the White House is set to screen two movies. One is about journalism. The other is about P.T. Barnum.

headline: Without Naming Trump, Twitter Says It Won’t Block World Leaders
teaser: Twitter said on Friday that prohibiting a world leader from posting on the platform “would hide important information people should be able to see and debate.”

headline: From Mexico to the U.S., a Nafta Tale of Two Truckers
teaser: Restricted from operating in the United States, most Mexican drivers must hand off their cargo. The Trump administration wants even tighter controls.

headline: Trump Defends His Mental Capacity, Calling Himself a ‘Genius’
teaser: Mr. Trump, seeming to respond to revelations in a new book, issued an extraordinary defense of his fitness for office.

headline: Medical Research? Congress Cheers. Medical Care? Congress Brawls.
teaser: Lawmakers are pushing for billions in new funding for biomedical research, but sparring over health insurance and almost everything else related to the Affordable Care Act.

headline: ‘Everything I’ve Done Is 100 Percent Proper,’ Trump Says of Russia Inquiry
teaser: Mr. Trump again insisted that he was not under investigation by the special counsel, adding that “there’s been no collusion, there’s been no crime.”

headline: Let’s Talk About the Gorilla Channel for One More Day
teaser: A joking tweet claimed that President Trump had demanded a TV channel devoted to primates. Most got the gag, some didn’t, and it quickly became fodder for political and social commentary.

headline: How U.S. Intelligence Agencies Underestimated North Korea
teaser: For decades, they warned the North was making progress on a missile that could reach the United States. But the last breakthroughs happened faster than they expected.

headline: Top Trump Adviser Continues Assault on Bannon in Heated TV Interview
teaser: The president’s senior policy adviser, Stephen Miller, said comments by Stephen K. Bannon in a new book were “out of touch with reality,” “vindictive” and “grotesque.”

headline: Bannon Issues Apology for Attack on Trump’s Son
teaser: Stephen K. Bannon, who is quoted in a new book calling Donald Trump Jr.’s meeting with Russians in 2016 “treasonous,” said that Mr. Trump was “both a patriot and a good man.”

headline: Steve Bannon’s Statement on Donald Trump Jr.
teaser: Mr. Bannon, the president’s former chief strategist, expressed regret after being quoted as saying that a meeting involving Donald Trump Jr. and Russians was “treasonous.”

headline: Major Donor Reconsiders Support for Democrats Who Urged Al Franken to Quit
teaser: The donor, Susie Tompkins Buell, who has spent millions on liberal causes, said Mr. Franken’s fellow senators “moved too fast” in calling on him to resign.

headline: Bannon Needs Breitbart. Does Breitbart Need Bannon?
teaser: After he was quoted speaking critically of Donald Trump Jr., the former White House strategist appears to be trying to stay at the right-wing news site.

headline: As Trump Appeals to Farmers, Some of His Policies Don’t
teaser: The president will cast himself as a friend to farmers in a speech on Monday, but his position on trade and some parts of the new tax law threaten to undercut their interests.

headline: Strong Economies Lift Presidents. Trump Seems an Exception.
teaser: His approval ratings reflect political weakness despite good news on several fronts.

headline: Death Penalty Case Heard by Racist Juror Is Reopened by Supreme Court
teaser: In a 6-3 decision, the Supreme Court ruled that a juror’s racist statements required an appeals court to reconsider a death row inmate’s case.

headline: Sold as Boon to Jobs in U.S., Tax Bill May Lead Firms to Open Plants Abroad
teaser: Supporters say the recently approved tax law will help American multinationals compete more aggressively overseas. Others see incentives to put factories overseas.

headline: Billionaire to Spend $30 Million on 2018 Elections. His Aim: Impeach Trump
teaser: The billionaire environmentalist Tom Steyer said he will spend $30 million on the 2018 midterms to elect Democrats, with a goal of removing the president.

headline: What Politicians Could Learn from Oprah Winfrey
teaser: Sneer at celebrity all you want, but elections are contests of stories, and Ms. Winfrey showed that she can tell one.

headline: Right and Left React to Questions About Trump’s Mental State
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum discuss questions about the president’s mental capacity.

headline: Rick Perry’s Plan to Rescue Struggling Coal and Nuclear Plants Is Rejected
teaser: In a blow to the Trump administration, a federal panel turned down a proposal by Energy Secretary Rick Perry to subsidize struggling plants.

headline: The Trump Team’s Best Defense? Offense
teaser: Stephen Miller's recent defense of his boss is symbolic of how the Trump administration deals with criticism — with verbal uppercuts. Defending your boss is nothing new. But the way they do it is.

headline: Q&A: Publisher Defied Trump to ‘Defend the Principles of the First Amendment’
teaser: John Sargent, the executive behind Michael Wolff’s “Fire and Fury,” discusses his decision to fight the president’s attempt to quash the book.

headline: Oprah 2020? Democrats Swing From Giddy to Skeptical at the Prospect
teaser: In the imagination of some Democrats, Oprah Winfrey seemed an answer to the party’s problems. Others questioned whether the country would be willing to accept another TV star.

headline: Mueller Is Said to Likely Seek to Interview Trump
teaser: White House officials viewed it as a sign the special counsel’s inquiry was nearly over. But it touched off discussions about the perils of the president sitting for an interview.

headline: Trump Takes Field at College Football Championship Game
teaser: The president’s appearance seemed intended to emphasize his furious critique of athletes for using football games as a place for protests.

headline: Fusion GPS Founder Hauled From the Shadows for the Russia Election Investigation
teaser: Glenn R. Simpson’s firm quietly compiled the notorious dossier of possible links between President Trump and Russia. Then it became public.

headline: Trump Overstates Size of Tax Cuts in Speech to Farmers
teaser: At a speech to farmers in Nashville on Monday, Mr. Trump claimed he had cut taxes by $5.5 trillion instead of the actual $1.5 trillion amount.

headline: To Pay for Wall, Trump Would Cut Proven Border Security Measures
teaser: Experts say some measures targeted are more effective than a wall, resulting in an approach a Republican congressman called “a third-century solution to a 21st-century problem.”

headline: As Economy Strengthens, Fed Ponders New Approach
teaser: The Federal Reserve is welcoming a debate among economists about proposed changes that might improve its response to future economic downturns.

headline: Trump Plans to Attend the World Economic Forum in Davos
teaser: The forum in Switzerland is synonymous with wealth and elite prestige, drawing leaders of nations, corporations, and some of the world’s richest individuals.

headline: Democratic Senator Releases Transcript of Interview with Dossier Firm
teaser: Senator Dianne Feinstein, the senior Democrat on the Judiciary Committee, released the transcript of the committee’s interview with Glenn Simpson, co-founder of Fusion GPS.

headline: On Washington: Advocates of Puerto Rico Statehood Plan to Demand Representation
teaser: The island’s political leaders say the aftermath of Hurricane Maria and poor treatment in the new tax law make clear that residents need added political clout.

headline: Secret Satellite Launched by SpaceX May Have Failed. What Happened?
teaser: Rumors are that an expensive, classified mission code-named “Zuma” failed to deploy in orbit and is now lost. Will we ever find out what actually happened?

headline: John Dickerson to Replace Charlie Rose on ‘CBS This Morning’
teaser: A Washingtonian through and through, Mr. Dickerson will move to New York and leave his role as host of “Face the Nation” to engage in morning banter.

headline: Republican Retirements Raise Talk of Democratic Wave in November
teaser: Republicans in Congress, dragged down by President Trump’s low approval ratings, are retiring in large numbers rather than seek re-election, a sign of trouble.

headline: Trump Appears to Endorse Path to Citizenship for Millions of Immigrants
teaser: President Trump said he would be willing to “take the heat” politically for a sweeping immigration deal, which could alienate some of his supporters.

headline: Fast-Food Workers Claim Victory in a New York Labor Effort
teaser: A nonunion group, invoking a new city law, says it has enlisted enough members to force restaurants to deduct the workers’ dues and forward the money.

headline: Trump Seeks a ‘Bill of Love’ With Immigration Deal
teaser: President Trump said legislation around an immigration overhaul should come from love, while also pushing for stronger security measures.

headline: Justices Seem Ready to Back Driver of Rental Car in Privacy Case
teaser: The Supreme Court considered a clash between a rental car contract’s boilerplate and the Fourth Amendment’s privacy protections.

headline: Steve Bannon Steps Down From Breitbart Post
teaser: No one has been more closely associated with the right-wing news site in recent years, but Mr. Bannon has lost support among conservative backers as President Trump has denounced him.

headline: Administration Delays Prosecuting Qaeda Suspect Once Seen as Candidate for Guantánamo
teaser: The delay is the latest example of how, in Mr. Trump’s first year in office, his campaign pledges have met the complicated realities of fighting terrorism.

headline: Trump Likes Drug Price Negotiations; His Nominee for Health Secretary Doesn’t
teaser: Alex M. Azar II, President Trump’s nominee for health secretary, told senators that he was wary of proposals for Medicare to negotiate drug prices.

headline: El Salvador Again Feels the Hand of Washington Shaping Its Fate
teaser: It has suffered from a civil war and gang violence, and is now bracing for the return of nearly 200,000 Salvadorans who have been living in the United States.

headline: Trump Administration Drops Florida From Offshore Drilling Plan
teaser: The state’s Republican governor, Rick Scott, had opposed the proposal to allow new offshore oil and gas drilling in nearly all United States waters.

headline: U.S. to Open Formal Inquiry on Americans Sickened in Cuba
teaser: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson is opening an investigation into what the government has described as mysterious attacks that sickened or injured 24 Americans in Havana in 2016.

headline: How a Coal Baron’s Wish List Became President Trump’s To-Do List
teaser: Robert E. Murray, the chief executive of Murray Energy, wrote a lengthy “action plan” last year for President Trump. There’s not much left undone.

headline: Trump’s First Full Physical Is Approaching. What He Discloses Is Up to Him.
teaser: With questions swirling around Mr. Trump’s mental health, his coming physical may yield few clues about whether he is, as his former doctor claimed during his candidacy, the “healthiest individual” to hold the office.

headline: Power Companies Got a Tax Cut. Will Your Bill Reflect It?
teaser: Some utilities say they will pass savings from the tax law to ratepayers. Attorneys general in several states are calling for federal action as well.

headline: A Brief Anatomy of Trump’s Immigration Meeting With Lawmakers
teaser: The West Wing met The Apprentice when President Trump presided over a meeting, later broadcast on television, of lawmakers from both parties debating immigration policy in the cabinet room.

headline: Trump’s Longtime Lawyer Sues BuzzFeed and the Firm Behind Russia Dossier
teaser: Saying “enough is enough,” Michael D. Cohen filed the defamation suit after denying for the past year that he played any part in a conspiracy to help elect President Trump.

headline: News Analysis: Trump’s Negotiation on Immigration, Unfolding on Camera
teaser: President Trump and a delegation of lawmakers from both parties engaged in a vigorous discussion of immigration, in effect negotiating legislation in front of the nation.

headline: South Korea’s Leader Credits Trump for North Korea Talks
teaser: President Moon Jae-in warned North Korea about sanctions if it resumed weapons tests, while crediting President Trump with forcing it to the table.

headline: How Much Has ‘Climate Change’ Been Scrubbed From Federal Websites? A Lot.
teaser: A new study found that the Trump administration has systematically removed, altered or played down references to climate change on federal websites.

headline: Russia’s Election Meddling Fits a Global Pattern, Senate Report Says
teaser: The report tracks Russian efforts in 19 countries, chronicling misinformation campaigns and the funding of far-right political causes long before the presidential election.

headline: ‘Outrageous,’ White House Says of Judge’s DACA Ruling
teaser: Republicans and Democrats are in the middle of a legislative battle over the program created by President Barack Obama, called the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA.

headline: I.R.S. Paid $20 Million to Collect $6.7 Million in Tax Debts
teaser: An agency watchdog says a congressionally mandated program using private debt collectors has been poorly administered and failed to respect taxpayers’ rights.

headline: Unbuttoned: Fake News Jeans: Travesty or Sign of Our Era?
teaser: Topshop, the British retailer, has made the issue into a slogan on a pair of pants. Cue controversy.

headline: Supreme Court Weighs Purge of Ohio Voting Rolls
teaser: The justices considered whether states may cull their voting lists based on the failure to vote.

headline: Darrell Issa, a California Republican, Will Not Seek Re-election to House
teaser: Mr. Issa becomes one of the most prominent in a long list of Republican retirements, adding to talk of a Democratic wave in the midterm elections.

headline: Darrell Issa, a California Republican, Will Not Seek Re-election to House
teaser: Mr. Issa becomes one of the most prominent in a long list of Republican retirements, adding to talk of a Democratic wave in the midterm elections.

headline: The Fed Delivered $80.2 Billion in Profits to the Treasury in 2017
teaser: Though last year’s contribution — made from revenue on its portfolio of bond holdings — declined from 2016, it was well above the average in years before the financial crisis.

headline: Measure to Ban Discredited ‘Conversion Therapy’ Fails in New Hampshire
teaser: The practice has been widely condemned, prompting at least nine states to ban its use on minors, but opponents of New Hampshire’s proposed law criticized its language.

headline: What if CHIP Funds Run Out? Here’s What 6 Families Would Do
teaser: With Congress yet to agree on a long-term plan to pay for the popular children’s health insurance program, parents start thinking about contingency plans.

headline: Surveillance and Privacy Debate Reaches Pivotal Moment in Congress
teaser: A yearslong debate over warrantless surveillance and Americans’ privacy rights faces a crucial test on Thursday in the House of Representatives.

headline: Florida Is Exempted From Coastal Drilling. Other States Ask, ‘Why Not Us?’
teaser: A surprise decision to exclude Florida, but not other states, from a plan to open up most of the nation’s coastline to offshore drilling raised questions about the plan’s legality.

headline: Wielding Data, Women Force a Reckoning Over Bias in the Economics Field
teaser: Longstanding complaints about the barriers women face in the economics profession are beginning to resonate within the male-dominated field.

headline: Canada Attacks U.S. Tariffs by Taking Case to World Trade Organization
teaser: A sweeping challenge to the Trump administration’s “America First” policies could add to tensions already frayed by Nafta negotiations.

headline: Trump Officials, After Rejecting Obama Medicare Model, Adopt One Like It
teaser: The Trump administration has unveiled a Medicare program that closely resembles the Obama-era efforts to change the way doctors and hospitals are paid.

headline: To Grease Wheels of Congress, Trump Suggests Bringing Back Pork
teaser: President Trump’s suggestion that Congress revive the old practice of salting spending bills with lawmaker pet projects has revived a simmering debate.

headline: House Republicans’ Hard-line Immigration Stand Clashes with Trump Overture
teaser: A new proposal from House Republicans underscored how deep the divisions are between and within the two parties on immigration — just days before a deadline for a deal.

headline: North Korea Praises ‘Fire and Fury’ Book on Trump Administration
teaser: The popularity of the book, which chronicles dysfunction in the White House, “foretells President Trump’s political demise,” North Korean state media said.

headline: Trump Administration Says States May Impose Work Requirements for Medicaid
teaser: Federal officials said they would support state efforts to require able-bodied adults to work as a condition of eligibility for Medicaid.

headline: Trump Tweets Support for Limiting Surveillance Law, Then Reverses Himself
teaser: President Trump muddles his administration’s position on restrictions to a surveillance law just as the House debates whether to approve it.

headline: Health Insurer Centene Is Sued Over Lack of Medical Coverage
teaser: A star of the Affordable Care Act is accused of offering plans that make it hard to find a doctor who accepts its insurance.

headline: Investigate an Accused Ally? New York Senate’s Republican Leader Says No
teaser: An accusation against Jeffrey D. Klein, a powerful senator, marks Albany’s biggest sexual harassment scandal in years. But despite anger, there are few options to investigate.

headline: Can Requiring People to Work Make Them Healthier?
teaser: The Trump administration wants to make a major change to Medicaid, but there’s not a lot of evidence for one of its key assertions.

headline: Treasury Inspector General Finds No Political Meddling in Tax Analysis
teaser: The Treasury Department’s failure to provide an economic analysis of its $1.5 trillion tax plan had prompted an inquiry into whether political meddling played a part.

headline: Melania Trump Hires Policy Director Amid Scrutiny From New Book
teaser: For months, Mrs. Trump’s East Wing had undergone a search for a policy director who could advance an agenda that has been broadly defined as helping children.

headline: Pressed on False Claims About Muslims, U.S. Ambassador Goes Silent
teaser: In an exchange with Dutch journalists, Peter Hoekstra declined to clarify his prior remarks. “This is the Netherlands, you have to answer questions,” one reporter said.

headline: Republicans’ ‘Tough Cycle’ Now Spreads to Senate
teaser: Republicans are facing challenges in recruiting Senate candidates, even in states that President Trump won easily in 2016.

headline: Trump Contradicts His Team. Then He Doesn’t.
teaser: President Trump tweeted in support of an amendment to the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, or FISA, on Thursday. It was the latest example of him contradicting his administration, his party and even himself.

headline: Right and Left React to the Extension of Warrantless Surveillance
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum discuss Congress’s vote to extend the N.S.A. spying program.

headline: Trump Alarms Lawmakers With Disparaging Words for Haiti and Africa
teaser: President Trump demanded to know at a White House meeting why he should accept immigrants from Haiti and African countries rather than people from places like Norway.

headline: To Lift Paychecks, Treasury Urges Companies to Act Quickly on New Tax Law
teaser: The Treasury Department took the first steps toward carrying out the $1.5 trillion Republican tax overhaul with the release of new tax withholding tables.

headline: Trump Boasts of ‘Very Good Relationship’ With North Korean Leader
teaser: The president’s rosy description of his relationship with Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, was a jarring reversal in tone after months of the two leaders trading taunts.

headline: Fact Check: These Claims About ‘Chain Migration’ Are Not Accurate
teaser: President Trump claimed “22 to 24 people came in” the United States on immigration visas sponsored by the Manhattan truck attacker, but this is implausible.

headline: Trump Floats a Return to the Era of Earmarks
teaser: Earmarks were banned by Congress in 2011. But some in Washington — including President Trump — say it might be time to reintroduce the practice.

headline: Trump Hates the Iran Deal but Won’t Kill It. Why?
teaser: Despite tough talk on Iran, President Trump announced that he would waive certain sanctions that keep the nuclear deal in place.

headline: Trump Is Expected to Stop Short of Reimposing Strict Sanctions on Iran
teaser: It will be the third time President Trump has given a reprieve to the nuclear agreement brokered by President Barack Obama, despite having labeled it “the worst deal ever.”

headline: From Norway to Haiti, Trump’s Comments Stir Fresh Outrage
teaser: In a meeting with lawmakers, President Trump said the United States needed more immigrants from places like Norway and fewer from Haiti and African countries.

headline: Black Colleges Swept Up in For-Profit Crackdown Find Relief From DeVos
teaser: The United Negro College Fund has been among the most vocal critics of Obama-era student borrower protections, saying they threaten the viability of its 37 member institutions.

headline: Trump Won’t Visit London for Embassy Opening, Citing Location
teaser: After President Trump said he disapproved of the new location, British critics jeered, saying he was afraid of the reception he would have gotten.

headline: Trump Appears to Deny Using Racially Charged Language About Immigrants
teaser: President Trump also criticized a bipartisan immigration proposal that prompted him to make racially charged remarks during a private meeting on Thursday.

headline: Trump Administration Wants More Control Over U.S. Lands for Border Wall
teaser: “This should set off all kinds of red flags,” said one advocate, fearing the land grab will violate civil liberties. Others say it will harm the environment.

headline: Durbin: Trump Said Vile Things Repeatedly
teaser: After President Trump vaguely denied using objectionable language to describe African and Caribbean nations, Senator Richard J. Durbin, Democrat of Illinois, relayed his account of the events.

headline: Racist or Not? How TV News Reacted to Trump’s Comment
teaser: After President Trump used vulgar language about immigrants, TV news grappled with a question: Were his comments racist?

headline: Trump Stops Short of Reimposing Iran Sanctions but Sets Deadline to Overhaul Deal
teaser: President Trump approved sanctions against the head of Iran’s judiciary, a powerful figure the administration holds culpable for the violent crackdown on anti-government protests.

headline: News Analysis: A President Who Fans, Rather Than Douses, the Nation’s Racial Fires
teaser: After his latest incendiary comments, the president’s critics say there is no doubt he is a racist. The White House calls such suggestions “insulting.”

headline: Justices to Hear Cases on Voting Rights and Internet Taxes
teaser: The Supreme Court will decide whether voting districts in Texas were the product of race discrimination and whether online merchants must collect sales taxes.

headline: Porn Star Who Claimed Sexual Encounter With Trump Received Hush Money, Wall Street Journal Reports
teaser: The $130,000 payment was reportedly made a month before the election. Mr. Trump “vehemently denies” the encounter happened, his lawyer told The Journal.

headline: Global Elite? At Davos? That’s News to Mnuchin
teaser: President Trump’s trip to the World Economic Forum is raising eyebrows in Washington given the event’s reputation as a retreat for the “globalists” he disdains.

headline: To Get Medicaid in Kentucky, Many Will Have to Work. Advocates for the Poor Are Horrified.
teaser: Led by the state’s Republican governor, the plan calls for many Medicaid recipients ages 19-64 to work at least 20 hours a week, beginning in July.

headline: Thomas Luken, Veteran Ohio Democrat, Is Dead at 92
teaser: Known for his confrontational style, Mr. Luken was a major force in Cincinnati for more than 30 years, as a prosecutor, the mayor and a member of Congress.

headline: Trump Is in ‘Excellent Health,’ Doctor Says After Exam
teaser: Dr. Ronny L. Jackson, a rear admiral in the Navy and the White House physician provided no details, including Mr. Trump’s weight or blood pressure.

headline: C.D.C. Postpones Session Preparing Us for Nuclear War
teaser: After the agency’s workshop attracted considerable media attention, especially given President Trump’s recent words with North Korea, the session has been postponed.

headline: John V. Tunney, Boxer’s Son Who Lasted One Term in the Senate, Dies at 83
teaser: Mr. Tunney seemed to be a rising star in the Democratic Party until a Senate re-election loss sent him into early political exile because of turbulent times.

headline: Uranium Miners Pushed Hard for a Comeback. They Got Their Wish.
teaser: Hundreds of mining claims fall neatly outside the new boundaries of Bears Ears National Monument, and a Navajo town scarred by uranium is bracing for new woes.

headline: A Romney Who Is Unfailingly Loyal to Trump
teaser: Ronna McDaniel, a niece of Mitt Romney who is the chairwoman of the Republican National Committee, faces a challenge both personal and political as her party faces a hostile election environment.

headline: In Trump’s Immigration Remarks, Echoes of a Century-Old Racial Ranking
teaser: The president’s vulgar comments about certain countries harken back to complaints about “undesirable nationals” that led to severe restrictions in 1924.

headline: Alert About Missile Bound for Hawaii Was Sent in Error, Officials Say
teaser: The alert appeared on cellphones warning people to “seek immediate shelter,” and said, “This is not a drill.” The authorities said it was a false alarm.

headline: Chelsea Manning Files for Senate Run in Maryland
teaser: Ms. Manning, a former Army private convicted of disclosing classified information, would face Senator Benjamin L. Cardin, the top Democrat on the Foreign Relations Committee, in the primary race.

headline: Causes of False Missile Alerts: The Sun, the Moon and a 46-Cent Chip
teaser: Every decade since the dawn of the nuclear age has seen its share of erroneous alarms, experts said. We revisit a few of them.

headline: DACA Participants Can Again Apply for Renewal, Immigration Agency Says
teaser: The government said it would comply with an order to resume accepting requests from immigrants brought illegally to the United States as children who were already in the program.

headline: ‘I’m Running,’ Romney Says Privately, but as a Trump Friend or Foe?
teaser: Mitt Romney’s expected return to politics as the next senator from Utah has set off a debate over whether he should actively counter President Trump.

headline: Trump Escalates a Dispute With The Wall Street Journal Over a Quotation
teaser: The president said he did not say “I probably have a very good relationship” with the North Korean leader, claiming he said “I’d.” It was difficult to tell from audio clips whether the complaint had merit.

headline: A DACA Question: Should Judges Use Local Cases to Halt National Orders?
teaser: When a federal judge in California ordered a stop to a key plank of President Trump’s immigration agenda, he revived a debate over the impartiality of the judiciary.

headline: G.O.P. Senator Says Trump Didn’t Use Vulgarity for Haiti and African Nations
teaser: Senator David Perdue, who attended the White House meeting, said Senator Dick Durbin’s account of President Trump’s language was a “gross misrepresentation.”

headline: He Studied Accounting. Now He Hunts the Taliban.
teaser: Lt. William Conway, who leads a team that identifies Taliban and Islamic State threats in Afghanistan, is not your typical military intelligence analyst.

headline: Graydon Carter, Ex-Editor of Vanity Fair, Invests in an App
teaser: The music producer Quincy Jones and the mogul Ron Meyer join Mr. Carter, who is now on ‘garden leave,’ in investing in an Instagram-style app called Zig.

headline: Military Quietly Prepares for a Last Resort: War With North Korea
teaser: It’s normal for American commanders to draw up combat plans. But recent exercises signal that the military wants to be ready for options on the Korean Peninsula.

headline: Individual Mandate Now Gone, G.O.P. Targets the One for Employers
teaser: Congressional Republicans will try once again to undo a requirement in the Affordable Care Act for employers to offer coverage to their employees.

headline: ‘I’m Not a Racist,’ Trump Says in Denying Vulgar Comment
teaser: “I’m not a racist. I’m the least racist person you will ever interview, that I can tell you,” President Trump said in Florida.

headline: Sidebar: A Case for Math, Not ‘Gobbledygook,’ in Judging Partisan Voting Maps
teaser: If courts are to combat voting districts warped by politics, a judge wrote, they must take account of advances in social science.

headline: ‘I’m Not a Racist’
teaser: After uproar around the world over his vulgar remarks on immigration, President Trump declared on Sunday that he is “not a racist,” and blamed Democrats for the legislative failure to protect young undocumented immigrants.

headline: On Washington: Sharper State Divide in Congress Seen as ‘New Civil War’
teaser: The prospect of more states with less bipartisan representation is likely to increase the intense polarization in Congress.

headline: As Shutdown Talk Rises, Trump’s Immigration Words Pose Risks for Both Parties
teaser: The fight over President Trump’s vulgar comment is exposing divisions in both parties, raising the risk of a government shutdown with unknown political consequences.

headline: Workplace Raids Signal Shifting Tactics in Immigration Fight
teaser: The Trump administration says its actions show the price of employing workers illegally, a message being felt keenly among the workers themselves.

headline: Turkey’s President Assails U.S.-Trained Kurdish Border Force
teaser: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey criticized a proposed American-trained force that could put thousands of Kurdish militia on the Turkish border.

headline: Democrats Add Momentum to G.O.P. Push to Loosen Banking Rules
teaser: The Senate is poised to approve significant changes to the post-crisis financial law. Some moderate Democrats are supporting the effort, even as their progressive colleagues warn that it’s too risky.

headline: Banks are Big Winners from Tax Cut
teaser: Financial firms are benefiting from the $1.5 trillion tax cut and make up the majority of companies so far handing out raises and bonuses as a result of the bill.

headline: Bannon Is Subpoenaed in Mueller’s Russia Investigation
teaser: The move marks the first time the special counsel is known to have used a grand jury subpoena to seek information from a member of President Trump’s inner circle.

headline: Economic Scene: Making Medicaid a Tool for Moral Education May Let Some Die
teaser: There is a precedent for letting states impose work requirements on the poor for medical coverage. It bodes ill for public health.

headline: White House Fuels Immigration Debate with Terrorism Statistics
teaser: A Trump administration report concludes that the vast majority of convicted terrorists are immigrants. But it relies on confusing and misleading data.

headline: Trump’s Harsh Words, Not His Plan for Wall, Dominate Hearing
teaser: The secretary of homeland security was quizzed repeatedly about the vulgar word, or words, said to have been uttered by the president describing African countries.

headline: Justice Dept., Fighting to Kill DACA, Asks for Supreme Court Review
teaser: The request by the Trump administration for immediate review is an unusual step after a judge ordered the administration to restart the program.

headline: Doctor Declares Trump’s Health Excellent, With Perfect Score on Cognitive Test
teaser: President Trump could benefit from more exercise and losing a few pounds, the presidential physician said after Mr. Trump’s annual physical.

headline: G.M. Chief Cautions Trump Administration on Upending Nafta
teaser: Mary Barra said that the United States should not scrap the trade pact and that any changes should account for the interests of American automakers and workers.

headline: Pentagon Suggests Countering Devastating Cyberattacks With Nuclear Arms
teaser: President Trump has not yet approved a draft strategy that would expand “extreme circumstances” for nuclear retaliation to include a crippling cyberattack.

headline: U.S. Withholds $65 Million From U.N. Relief Agency for Palestinians
teaser: The Trump administration cut by more than half the funding it provides to the U.N. Relief and Works Agency, which funds schools and clinics for Palestinians.

headline: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Suspected of Compromising Chinese Informants Is Arrested
teaser: The arrest of the former agent, Jerry Chun Shing Lee, 53, capped an intense F.B.I. investigation that began around 2012 after the C.I.A. began losing its agents in China.

headline: G.O.P. Weighs Children’s Health Insurance as Lure for Averting Shutdown
teaser: With no immigration deal in sight, Republicans are eyeing a stopgap bill to keep the government open past Friday, sweetening it with an extension of the child health program.

headline: Poll Finds Upturn in Sentiment on Tax Overhaul and Economy
teaser: The finding could be good news for Republicans looking to the midterm elections, but less comfort for President Trump, who was given little credit.

headline: Senate, Rebuffing Privacy Concerns, Clears Path to Extend Surveillance Law
teaser: The outcome of a procedural vote signals that the bill has sufficient support to pass in the Senate.

headline: Heated Exchanges About Trump’s Words
teaser: A Senate hearing meant to be about border walls devolved into a back-and-forth on whether the president used an obscenity to describe African and Caribbean countries.

headline: Right and Left React to President Trump’s Comments on Immigration
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the president’s immigration preferences and what role ethnicity should play in policymaking.

headline: White House Memo: Debate Continues Over What Trump Said. But Does the Exact Word Matter?
teaser: If the argument seems to amount to a distinction without a difference, neither the White House nor its allies have acknowledged it.

headline: Navy Seeks to Prosecute Top Officers for Crashes
teaser: The commanding officers of two Naval destroyers that collided with commercial vessels in the western Pacific last year will face court-martial charges, the Navy said.

headline: Citing ‘Inexcusable’ Treatment, Advisers Quit National Parks Panel
teaser: The majority of members of the National Parks System Advisory Board have jointly resigned in protest of Trump administration policies.

headline: The Next Hurdle for a Healthy Trump? Getting Some Exercise.
teaser: Washington often holds the mantle of the fittest city in the United States. It is now home to a president who has no interest in exercise.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Falsely Claims His Approval Among Black Americans Has Doubled
