teaser: According to the polling company that President Trump cited, his approval among black Americans has actually declined.

headline: He Leaked a Photo of Rick Perry Hugging a Coal Executive. Then He Lost His Job.
teaser: An Energy Department photographer says he was fired for exposing the coal industry’s influence with the Energy secretary.

headline: Arizona’s G.O.P. Senators Assail Trump for His Attacks on the Press
teaser: Senator Jeff Flake called President Trump a “figure of suspicion” for his attacks on the press as John McCain called on Congress to protect journalists.

headline: Bannon Agrees to Cooperate With Mueller Inquiry
teaser: Stephen K. Bannon, the president’s former chief strategist, will be interviewed by investigators for the special counsel rather than go in front of a grand jury.

headline: Supreme Court Skeptical of Lawyer’s Conduct in Death Penalty Case
teaser: Justices weighed the case of Robert McCoy, who told his lawyer he was innocent of a triple murder. His lawyer told the jury he was guilty in a bid to avoid the death penalty.

headline: Trump’s Physical Revealed Serious Heart Concerns, Outside Experts Say
teaser: The White House physician had said President Trump was in “excellent” cardiac health despite having an LDL cholesterol level of 143, well above the desired number.

headline: Tillerson Says U.S. Troops to Stay in Syria Beyond Battle With ISIS
teaser: In a speech, the secretary of state said American forces must stay engaged to prevent the extremists’ return and to keep President Bashar al-Assad in check.

headline: Fake News Awards? Don’t Roll Out the Red Carpet Just Yet
teaser: Journalists wait to see if President Trump makes good on his promise to honor the media’s “most corrupt & biased.”

headline: White House Chief of Staff Calls Trump’s Campaign Wall Promises ‘Uninformed’
teaser: White House Chief of Staff John F. Kelly told Hispanic members of Congress on Wednesday that President Trump’s campaign promises have “evolved” on immigration.

headline: Presidential Hopefuls in the Senate Are Pushing Democrats to the Left
teaser: The 2020 race for the White House is already unfolding in the Capitol, with no fewer than six Democratic senators angling for their party’s nomination.

headline: With Trump’s Visit to Pennsylvania, G.O.P. Scrambles to Save a House Seat
teaser: President Trump will fly in to the southwestern Pennsylvania district vacated by a scandal-tarred Republican, hoping to bolster the flagging campaign of his handpicked successor.

headline: More Details Emerge About Trump’s Relationship With Porn Star
teaser: In Touch published excerpts from its 2011 interview with Stephanie Clifford, in which she details her first encounter with Donald Trump.

headline: Olympic Détente Upends U.S. Strategy on North Korea
teaser: For the White House, the budding détente scrambles its strategy of pressuring the North, with sanctions and threats of military action, to give up its nuclear arsenal.

headline: Hunting a C.I.A. Mole, Agents Gambled and Let a Suspect Return to China
teaser: Officials hoped it would help solve the mystery of the deaths of C.I.A. informants. Five years later, an arrest has been made but the mystery remains.

headline: \: When States Make It Harder to Enroll, Even Eligible People Drop Medicaid
teaser: Kentucky’s new Medicaid waiver will ask low-income people to jump over hurdles to keep their coverage. Evidence suggests that many will fail.

headline: Souring World Views of Trump Open Doors for China and Russia
teaser: A Gallup survey of people in 134 countries found that just 30 percent approved of American leadership under President Trump, a drop of nearly 20 points.

headline: Trump Denies Changing His Position on Border Wall

headline: Democrats Question Justice Dept. Power to Charge Sanctuary City Leaders
teaser: California’s senators asked Jeff Sessions why the Justice Department is exploring criminal charges against local politicians.

headline: Trump Upsets Republican Strategy to Avoid Shutdown
teaser: With a government shutdown looming, the House planned to vote Thursday on a spending bill that would avert a crisis. But President Trump upended the G.O.P. strategy.

headline: Newsbook: On the Presidency’s Fraught Relationship With the Press
teaser: These books explores how administrations like Richard Nixon’s and Theodore Roosevelt’s worked with or fought against the news media.

headline: Health Workers Who Oppose Abortion Get New Protections
teaser: The Trump administration announced a new “conscience and religious freedom” office to protect health workers who oppose abortion, sex-changes and some contraception.

headline: An Advocate for Israel Draws Fire as He Nears Confirmation to Civil Rights Post
teaser: Kenneth Marcus’s potential return to the Education Department has drawn criticism from civil rights groups that see his narrow focus on Israel as blinding him to other matters of bias.

headline: Congress Approves Six-Year Extension of Surveillance Law
teaser: The Senate sent a bill to President Trump extending the N.S.A. warrantless surveillance program, rebuffing proposals for greater privacy safeguards.

headline: The Shindigger: ‘Fire and Fury’ Is Feted by the Media Elite Trump Excoriates
teaser: Yukking it up with Ann Coulter and Janice Min in the affluent heart of Manhattan for Michael Wolff.

headline: Arrested Former C.I.A. Officer Had Ties to Chinese Spies, Ex-Colleague Says
teaser: Jerry Lee, the former officer, had repeated contacts with Chinese intelligence both at the agency and afterward, the former colleague said.

headline: Two Federal Reserve Openings Provide One Chance to Counter Trump
teaser: The Fed is likely to get a new chairman next month, but there are still two job openings just below that post. President Trump controls one. Opponents see the other as an opportunity.

headline: Supreme Court Temporarily Blocks North Carolina Gerrymandering Ruling
teaser: The decision makes it likely the 2018 elections will be held using districts favorable to Republicans. But more decisions on gerrymandering are coming.

headline: Paul Booth, Antiwar Organizer and Union Stalwart, Dies at 74
teaser: A chief architect of the 1965 march on Washington against the Vietnam War, he later became a key adviser to the nation’s largest public employee union.

headline: U.S. Presses to Relocate Embassy to Jerusalem by 2019
teaser: The plans suggest the administration no longer cares about cushioning the blow of its new policy, which has cast President Trump’s peacemaking ambitions into doubt.

headline: Trump’s Evolving Words on the Wall
teaser: A review of President Trump's statements on Twitter, in campaign speeches and during interviews shows that the president’s views on the border wall have shifted repeatedly.

headline: The Chaos President vs. His Iron-Fisted Chief of Staff
teaser: President Trump’s public airing of grievances with John Kelly was perhaps an inevitable clash between two temperamentally similar but philosophically different alpha males.

headline: Tax Overhaul Is a Blow to Affordable Housing Efforts
teaser: By lowering rates, the law reduces the value of tax credits that have been crucial to rental projects nationwide, with the effect being felt already.

headline: House Passes Short-Term Spending Bill, Setting Up Shutdown Battle in Senate
teaser: The successful vote in the House provided only a faint glimmer of hope that a crisis could be averted before much of the government exhausts its funds at midnight on Friday.

headline: Every Time They Fight Me, It Gets 10 Feet Taller'
teaser: President Trump delivers a speech in Abingdon, Va.

headline: Right and Left React to the Prospect of a Government Shutdown
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum denounced the impasse on Capitol Hill and the possibility of a shutdown.

headline: On Washington: Inside the Oval Office Immigration Meeting That Left a Senator Stunned
teaser: In an interview, Senator Richard J. Durbin says President Trump’s private immigration comments shed new light on his policy motivations.

headline: On New Indian Condos, the Name Is Trump, and the Lure Is Meeting One
teaser: The developers of the new Trump Towers outside New Delhi promise the first 100 buyers a meeting with Donald Trump Jr. They got 20 to sign on the first day.

headline: Why Asking About Citizenship Could Make the Census Less Accurate
teaser: Distrust of the government's intentions toward noncitizens may be hard to overcome, research suggests, and political developments have increased levels of distrust.

headline: Showdown Vote in Senate on Friday With Government Shutdown at Stake
teaser: Senate Democrats appear ready to block legislation to keep the government funded past midnight, gambling that President Trump will offer concessions in the face of a crisis.

headline: Live Briefing: Senate Democrats Appear Set to Block Bill to Avert Government Shutdown
teaser: The government will shut down at midnight Eastern Time if lawmakers fail to get an agreement on a spending bill.

headline: Trump Talks About the Wall During the Campaign
teaser: The border wall was one of President Trump's favorite topics on the campaign trail.

headline: Vows: For Love of Country, and Each Other
teaser: Captains Daniel Hall and Vincent Franchino, both active-duty Apache helicopter pilots, are married at West Point.

headline: How Washington Reached the Brink of a Shutdown
teaser: Here’s a look back at the events that lead to the bring of a government shutdown over DACA.

headline: Drilling Off Florida Is Still On the Table, Interior Official Says
teaser: A surprise statement on Friday undercut last week’s announcement that Florida had been granted an exemption from President Trump’s offshore-drilling plan.

headline: Supreme Court to Consider Challenge to Trump’s Latest Travel Ban
teaser: President Trump’s third attempt to impose restrictions on travel from predominantly Muslim nations will face a test in the Supreme Court this spring.

headline: Trump Envisions an A.T.F. Without the A or T
teaser: The proposal would move alcohol and tobacco enforcement to Treasury. It would require a new name for an agency that no longer focuses on its historical target, bootleggers.

headline: Travel Ban Caught Homeland Security by Surprise, Report Concludes
teaser: Agents were given little notice and conflicting guidance on how to enforce President Trump’s first travel ban last year, leading to chaos at airports.

headline: Military Shifts Focus to Threats by Russia and China, Not Terrorism
teaser: The Pentagon says the military is too stretched to both fight insurgents and prepare for war with great world powers.

headline: Trump Passed a Cognitive Exam. What Does That Really Mean?
teaser: The exam, called the Moca, is widely used in doctor’s offices, but it is not sophisticated enough to diagnose mental decline, experts say.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Overstates Government Shutdown’s Effect on the Military
teaser: President Trump has repeatedly said that a government shutdown would devastate the military. But many parts of the military would continue to operate.

headline: We’ve Heard It All Before. Shutdown Talk in 2013 Compared to Today.
teaser: It’s déjà vu. The sentiments lawmakers make about a government shutdown are the same, but the party that is saying them has changed.

headline: News Analysis: Shutdown? It Could Be Forgotten in a Trumpian Flash
teaser: As Democrats pushed the government toward a shutdown, they could take solace in the rapid-fire news cycles of the Trump era. A crisis now may be long forgotten by November.

headline: Republicans Claim Surveillance Power Abuses in Russia Inquiry
teaser: A report claims that a warrant to eavesdrop on Carter Page, a former Trump campaign aide, was improperly obtained.

headline: Trump Tells Anti-Abortion Marchers ‘We Are With You All the Way’ and Shows It
teaser: For someone who once described himself as “very pro-choice,” Mr. Trump’s transformation into a champion of the anti-abortion cause is a remarkable political evolution.

headline: As the Shutdown Loomed, Trump Reached Out to Schumer
teaser: But as happened in September — when a tentative deal fell apart after the president’s hard-line advisers and conservative supporters revolted — the meeting went nowhere.

headline: Neighbor to Plead Guilty to Federal Charge in Attack on Rand Paul, Lawyer Says
teaser: Rene A. Boucher of Bowling Green, Ky., is expected to plead guilty in federal court, where prosecutors will seek a sentence of up to 21 months, his lawyer said.

headline: What Happens When the Government Shuts Down?
teaser: The clock is ticking. Without a funding deal, the federal government will shut down on Jan. 20 at 12:01 a.m. But what does that mean and how does it happen?

headline: Senate Leaders Speak After Government Shuts Down
teaser: Shortly after midnight, Senators Mitch McConnell and Chuck Schumer made statements blaming the opposing party for failing to reach an agreement to fund the government.

headline: Approaching Shutdown:Scenes From the Capital
teaser: This week, only the tours went according to plan.

headline: The National Rifle Association’s Telegenic Warrior
teaser: How Dana Loesch, a onetime Democrat, became a Second Amendment spokeswoman too incendiary for some right-wingers to handle.

headline: Trump Accuses Democrats of Playing ‘Shutdown Politics’ on Anniversary
teaser: President Trump charged that the party had orchestrated the crisis to detract from the anniversary of his inauguration.

headline: Trading Blame for the Shutdown, Lawmakers Search for a Deal to End It
teaser: With the government shut down and the two parties faulting each other, senators from both parties were looking for an agreement to end the crisis.

headline: Patrick Meehan, Congressman Combating Harassment, Settled His Own Misconduct Case
teaser: Representative Patrick Meehan, a Republican member of the House Ethics Committee, used taxpayer money to pay a former aide who had seen him as a father figure before he made unwanted advances.

headline: Open, Closed or Something in Between: What a Shutdown Looks Like
teaser: The vast machinery of the federal government began grinding to a halt, but much of the bureaucracy will stay in motion for a while.

headline: The Longer It Lasts, the More a Shutdown Could Hurt the Economy
teaser: The early days of the federal government shutdown won’t slow the American economy much, but that could change if the impasse drags out.

headline: Patrick Meehan’s Response to The Times’s Article on His Settlement for Misconduct
teaser: Representative Patrick Meehan, Republican of Pennsylvania, released this statement in response to an article about a settlement using public funds for misconduct.

headline: Who’s to Blame For the Shutdown?
teaser: The House and Senate reconvened for a rare Saturday session, hoping to find a way to restart the flow of funds after much of the federal government shut down, while Republican and Democratic leaders blamed each other for the stalemate.

headline: Trump Appointee Resigns and Apologizes for Racist Comments
teaser: Carl Higbie stepped down from the Corporation for National and Community Service after CNN revealed his disparaging remarks about black people, Muslims and others.

headline: Hawaii Governor Learned Missile Alert Was False Within Two Minutes
teaser: The leader of the Hawaii National Guard disclosed the timetable at a hearing on Friday. Lawmakers want to know why the public was not told quicker.

headline: Now on Stage, Stormy Daniels: A Strip Club and a Presidency Meet After Dark
teaser: The music came on. The clothes came off. And an airport strip club claimed its piece of the American presidency.

headline: Shutdown Day 2: Congress Seems Far Apart on a Resolution
teaser: Lawmakers remained mired in partisan disputes as Senator Mitch McConnell said he would move ahead with a vote on a temporary spending bill by 1 a.m. Monday.

headline: The Interpreter: Trump’s Hard-Line Israel Position Exports U.S. Culture War Abroad
teaser: Picking sides in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has long been taboo in American policy. Domestic politics best explain the president’s break with this practice.

headline: Pence and Jordan’s King ‘Agree to Disagree’ on Jerusalem
teaser: Vice President Mike Pence met King Abdullah II amid rising tension between their two countries over President Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital.

headline: On Washington: Shutdown’s Crux: Democrats’ Deep-Rooted Distrust of G.O.P. on Immigration
teaser: After decades of fruitless efforts to overhaul immigration and under withering attack by President Trump and others, Democrats simply do believe Republicans will follow through on the issue.

headline: Here Are the Senators Trying to Find a Bipartisan Solution to the Government Shutdown
teaser: A group of bipartisan lawmakers emerged as the negotiators behind a potential deal to end the gridlock and reopen the government.

headline: A President Not Sure of What He Wants Complicates the Shutdown Impasse
teaser: Democrats struggle with a president who says he wants to compromise but then is reined in by his own staff, while Republican leaders are loath to guess at his intentions.

headline: Fox in the Globalist Henhouse? Davos Awaits Trump’s Arrival
teaser: How will President Trump’s protectionism go over at the elite World Economic Forum meeting in Davos, Switzerland, which draws leaders who believe in globalism and free trade?

headline: The New Health Care: Twist to Kentucky’s Medicaid Work Rule: Pass a Course Instead
teaser: Lots of people could do with a little more health and financial literacy, not just Medicaid recipients. But linking it to retaining medical eligibility may not make sense.

headline: Live Briefing: Government Shutdown Stretches into Third Day as Senators Look for a Deal
teaser: Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, promises a “free and open debate” on immigration if Democrats will vote to reopen the government.

headline: Supreme Court Considers a Raucous Party and an Endangered Frog
teaser: The Supreme Court ruled that the police were entitled to arrest partygoers in a vacant house and will hear the case of the dusky gopher frog.

headline: Wary, Weary or Both, Southern Lawmakers Tone Down Culture Wars
teaser: State bills on lightning-rod social issues are getting noticeably less impetus this year, as elections loom and state leaders try to attract business investment.

headline: There’s a Surprise in the Government Funding Bill: More Tax Cuts
teaser: The deal struck by Democrats and Republicans on Monday to end a brief government shutdown contains $31 billion in tax cuts

headline: News Analysis: Bonuses Aside, Tax Law’s Trickle-Down Impact Not Yet Clear
teaser: Companies are announcing bonuses as a result of the tax cuts but it remains to be seen how much of that money will filter through to workers in the years to come.

headline: How Big a Deal Is a New Congressional Map for Pennsylvania?
teaser: Although they will probably pick up a few additional seats in this year’s election, the development is less helpful for Democrats than it might at first appear.

headline: With Talking Stick in Hand, Moderate Senators Broke the Shutdown
teaser: Two dozen centrist senators from both parties banded together to push their leaders to a deal to reopen the government. Now comes the hard part.

headline: Whiplash for Federal Workers: Go Home! Wait! Come Back!
teaser: Federal workers across the country fumed at both political parties. And uncertainties remained.

headline: Heritage Foundation Says Trump Has Embraced Two-Thirds of Its Agenda
teaser: President Trump, who has never been one to dwell on the details of governing, has shown considerable deference to conservative groups like the Heritage Foundation.

headline: Senate Democrats’ Vote to End Shutdown Infuriates Some on the Left
teaser: Liberal and immigration activists said Democrats betrayed young undocumented immigrants by reopening the government after only three days of a shutdown.

headline: Right and Left React to the End of the Government Shutdown
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum examine the aftermath of the government shutdown.

headline: As Turkey Attacks Kurds in Syria, U.S. Is on the Sideline
teaser: Turkish forces continued their attack on the Kurds, America’s closest ally in the war on Islamic State, with the apparent blessing of Moscow.

headline: News Analysis: Democrats Blink in Shutdown Impasse, Hoping for a Bargain
teaser: Senate Democrats believe they are limiting damage from a political miscalculation by surrendering, but in doing so they are drawing a fierce backlash from the left.

headline: Government Shutdown Ends After 3 Days of Recriminations
teaser: With a promise that lawmakers would soon take up immigration, Congress approved a short-term spending bill to reopen the government after a brief but heated shutdown.

headline: Why the U.S. Is Taking 58 Refugees in a Deal Trump Called ‘Dumb’
teaser: The Obama administration agreed to settle the men, detained offshore by Australia, if Australia would take Central American asylum seekers in exchange.

headline: A Billionaire Keeps Pushing to Impeach Trump. Democrats Are Rattled.
teaser: Tom Steyer, a major Democratic donor, has become one of President Trump’s most visible antagonists, firing up angry Democrats and unnerving his own party with the ferocity of his efforts.

headline: U.S. Tariffs, Aimed at China and South Korea, to Hit Targets Worldwide
teaser: Broad levies taking direct aim at the two countries would most likely affect other trading partners of the United States, illustrating the complexity of global commerce.

headline: Economic Scene: Fighting Climate Change? We’re Not Even Landing a Punch
teaser: Decades of diplomatic efforts to stem global warming have proven ineffectual because too many strategies have been taken off the table.

headline: Sessions Is Interviewed in Mueller’s Russia Investigation
teaser: The attorney general was questioned for hours as part of the inquiry into Russia’s election interference and whether President Trump has obstructed justice.

headline: Vaping Can Be Addictive and May Lure Teenagers to Smoking, Science Panel Concludes
teaser: A report from the National Academy of Sciences said that e-cigarettes are safer than smoking, but not quite safe, and may cause teens to take up tobacco.

headline: Man Arrested Outside the White House With Gun and Ammunition
teaser: Secret Service agents arrested the man after receiving reports of a suspicious vehicle, the second time in six months they picked up someone with firearms near the White House.

headline: Fed Nominee Is Asked Why He Erred in Forecasting Inflation. He Didn’t Answer.
teaser: Senate Democrats asked President Trump’s nominee for the Federal Reserve board, Marvin Goodfriend, to explain his repeated warnings after the 2008 crisis that the Fed was unleashing inflation.

headline: Manchin Will Seek Re-election but Sends Democrats a Stern Warning
teaser: Senator Joe Manchin III, after flirting with retirement, told colleagues on Tuesday that he will seek re-election, but he warned them against left-wing intolerance.

headline: First a Shutdown. Then a DACA Promise.
teaser: Senator Mitch McConnell promised to bring a vote on immigration reform to the floor by Feb. 8. Democrats are selling that pledge as a win. But is it?

headline: Fact Check: One Year Later, a Look at Trump’s Pledges About the Presidency
teaser: On golf, vacations and draining the swamp: Here’s a progress report on Mr. Trump’s campaign promises about his approach to the presidency.

headline: Union Chief Says Trump, Having ‘Actively Hurt’ Workers, Is Losing Support
teaser: Richard Trumka, the president of the A.F.L.-C.I.O., delivered a searing critique of the president’s first year, saying his policies favored corporations over workers.

headline: Mick Mulvaney Calls for ‘Humility’ from Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
teaser: Mr. Mulvaney, acting director of the consumer bureau, fired off a mission statement instructing staff to not “push the envelope.”

headline: In Davos, a Club Trump Has Revered and Resented Finally Opens Its Doors
teaser: As a businessman, Donald J. Trump never felt respected by the elites who shunned him. Now as president, he commands attention, if not admiration.

headline: Trump’s Solar Tariffs Are Clouding the Industry’s Future
teaser: At a solar farm in North Carolina, workers are bracing for the effect of a new tariff on imported solar cells and modules.

headline: An Unexpectedly Smooth First Year for Trump’s C.I.A. Director
teaser: In a pair of public appearances this week, Mike Pompeo marked his first year as C.I.A. director — a span that has gone more smoothly than many would have guessed.

headline: Under Fire for Harassment, Congressman Says Aide ‘Invited’ Behavior
teaser: Representative Patrick Meehan denied any impropriety, and said that he was emotionally wounded when a former aide filed a complaint against him.

headline: Duckworth, Saying She’s Pregnant, Would Be First Sitting Senator to Give Birth
teaser: The Democratic senator from Illinois is already one of only 10 women who have given birth while serving in Congress.

headline: In Looking for Loyalty, Trump Asked F.B.I. Official How He Voted
teaser: The question came as Mr. Trump openly discussed the need for James B. Comey’s successor to be “loyal,” according to an adviser to the president.

headline: Senators Race to Protect Immigrants, and Restore Their Institution
teaser: Members of the bipartisan group that intervened to bring the shutdown to an end hope the push for an immigration bill can reignite opportunity for debate.

headline: Wall Is ‘Off the Table,’ Schumer Says, as Progress on Immigration Unravels
teaser: With emotions still hot over the government shutdown, Senate negotiators found themselves back at Square 1 in their efforts to strike an immigration deal.

headline: For Pope Francis, Fake News Goes Back to the Garden of Eden
teaser: In a major document, the pontiff offered his analysis of how fake news works and how it can be stopped, though he overlooked the misuse of the term.

headline: Military Ordered to Notify A.C.L.U. Before Transferring American ISIS Suspect
teaser: The man was captured in Syria as a suspected Islamic State fighter, and his case has raised novel issues about the rights of American citizens.

headline: The Truth About Trump in Davos: Follow the Money
teaser: Much of the moneyed elite are willing to overlook what they portray as rhetorical foibles in favor of focusing on the additional wealth the president has delivered.

headline: Trump Officials Ask Sanctuary Cities to Prove Compliance With Immigration Law
teaser: The Justice Department asked 23 cities and states for any documents showing they withheld information from federal immigration authorities.

headline: Senate Confirms Trump Nominee Alex Azar as Health Secretary
teaser: Mr. Azar, a former drug company executive, immediately confronts two huge challenges: how to rein in drug prices and how to administer the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Trump Administration Slaps New Sanctions on North Korea
teaser: The Treasury Department announced new sanctions on North Korea as the administration continues to crack down on the nuclear ambitions of Kim Jong Un.

headline: Coal’s Decline Seems Impervious to Trump’s Promises
teaser: Domestic demand continues to fall as coal is displaced by natural gas in power plants. The impact is being felt at a Pennsylvania mine about to close.

headline: Online Sales of Illegal Opioids from China Surge in U.S.
teaser: A Senate report concluded that $800 million worth of fentanyl pills were shipped to the United States by Chinese sellers through mail system loopholes.

headline: Defeated in Syria, ISIS Fighters Held in Camps Still Pose a Threat
teaser: American military officials fear the makeshift camps may repeat a security mistake of the Iraq war even as they have sought to avoid any major responsibility for addressing it.

headline: Europe Is Back. And Rejecting Trumpism.
teaser: Bolstered by newfound economic strength, European leaders, steered by the French president, Emmanuel Macron, are pledging to further integrate the continent.

headline: Trump Groups Raised Millions, Then Paid It Out to Loyalists and a Trump Hotel
teaser: New campaign filings show that two pro-Trump groups are raising millions, then channeling the money into the Trump Organization and to Trump loyalists.

headline: As U.S. Trumpets ‘America First,’ Rest of the World Is Moving On
teaser: As President Trump touts a more aggressive approach to trade, other countries are moving on with deals that do not include the United States.

headline: Tips for Interviewing Jerry Brown
teaser: For one, it’s not a good idea to use the word “legacy” in asking about the California governor’s, um, legacy.

headline: White House Memo: Trump’s Enthusiasm for Stock Market Collides With His Trade Plans
teaser: No president has taken more delight, or claimed more credit, for a roaring market. But his advisers are warning him that more protectionist trade policies could hurt it.

headline: Trump Sharply Warns Turkey Against Military Strikes in Syria
teaser: In a phone call, President Trump urged President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to limit attacks against Kurdish militias, including some backed by American forces.

headline: Trump Says He Is Open to a Path to Citizenship for ‘Dreamers’
teaser: President Trump once again seemed to undercut his administration’s message, saying that he would allow the young illegal immigrants to “morph into” citizens over a period of time.

headline: F.B.I. Texts and Dueling Memos Escalate Fight Over Russia Inquiry
teaser: The Justice Department rebuked an effort by House Republicans to undermine the Russia investigation by pushing to release a memo said to accuse the F.B.I. of abusing its power.

headline: Trump Says He Is Willing to Speak Under Oath to Mueller
teaser: President Trump said he was willing to speak under oath to the special counsel, appearing to conflate

headline: Most Americans Want Legal Status for ‘Dreamers.’ These Are Not Among Them.
teaser: A slice of the public bucks popular sentiment for young undocumented immigrants, underscoring the conflicted feelings over the issue that have stymied Congress for years.

headline: Trump, in Davos, Hopes to Sell the Story of U.S. Success
teaser: The plan is to soft-pedal on trade issues and convince the assembled titans that the U.S., having cut taxes and regulations, is the place to invest.

headline: The Stock Market Is Up. You’ve Probably Heard.
teaser: President Trump likes to take credit for the rise of the stock market. It surged after he was elected in 2016 and has reached record highs. He has mentioned its performance at least 25 times this month alone.

headline: Oprah Says She Is Not Running for President
teaser: “I don’t have the DNA for it,” the billionaire media magnate told InStyle magazine, dashing hopes that she would run in 2020.

headline: Review: ‘The Confidence Man’ Finds Trump’s Business Image Was Made for TV
teaser: This film, part of Netflix’s docu-series “Dirty Money,” argues that the success the president used as a campaign plank was largely set dressing.

headline: Davos Memo: For Mnuchin, a Lesson in How Comments Can Move Markets
teaser: Steven Mnuchin, whose statement on the dollar caused a tumble, joins many Treasury secretaries whose words have been given more meaning than intended.

headline: A Beginner’s Travel Guide to Haiti, El Salvador and Africa
teaser: With recent reported inflammatory comments, President Trump put the spotlight on places many Americans have never visited. Here are some travel recommendations on a few of those countries.

headline: Trump Immigration Plan Will Demand Tough Concessions From Democrats
teaser: If Democrats want relief for young unauthorized immigrants, they would have to accept a border wall and restrictions on low-skilled immigrants joining their families in America.

headline: F.D.A. Panel Rejects Philip Morris’ Claim That Tobacco Stick Is Safer Than Cigarettes
teaser: The committee expressed doubts about the company’s health claims that the device, called IQOS, would cause less tobacco-related disease.

headline: Davos Memo: Trump and Davos: Not Exactly Best Friends, but Not Enemies Either
teaser: Last year, the chieftains at Davos were panicked at the thought of Trump. This year, they welcomed him with somewhat open arms.

headline: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos Is Sued Over Sexual Assault Guidance
teaser: Three organizations filed a complaint outlining ways that new sexual assault guidelines had had a “chilling effect” on campus sexual assault investigations.

headline: Scientists Rebel Over a Trump Ally at the Natural History Museum
teaser: More than 200 scientists and other academics are asking the American Museum of Natural History to remove Rebekah Mercer from its board.

headline: Trump Appointee Is Trying to Squelch Us, Labor Board Staff Says
teaser: The civil servants who handle most labor-relations cases — a group seen by critics as anti-employer — have expressed alarm over a proposal to demote them.

headline: Lawsuit on Trump Emoluments Violations Gains Traction in Court
teaser: In a hearing on Thursday, the judge seemed unwilling to toss out a lawsuit alleging the president is violating the Constitution by continuing to own his businesses.

headline: Patrick Meehan Won’t Seek Re-election in Pennsylvania
teaser: Mr. Meehan, Republican of Pennsylvania, facing backlash after settling a sexual harassment complaint brought by a former aide, will not seek re-election this year.

headline: White House Memo: Trump’s Impromptu News Conference: An Unplanned Drop-By or a Deliberate Dig?
teaser: Some in the White House saw President Trump’s appearance at a background briefing as a message to his chief of staff, John F. Kelly.

headline: Trump Ordered Mueller Fired, but Backed Off When White House Counsel Threatened to Quit
teaser: The president ordered the firing last June as he first learned that the special counsel might be investigating whether he had obstructed justice.

headline: Will You Fire Mueller? How Trump Has Responded
teaser: In June President Trump ordered the firing of Robert Mueller, who has been leading the Russia investigation. For months, however, Mr. Trump dismissed the idea in his public statements.

headline: Live Briefing: At the World Economic Forum, an Unusual Visitor: The U.S. President
teaser: President Trump’s presence at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland is notable for several reasons — starting with his values, which are clearly at odds with the forum’s majority.

headline: G.D.P. Report on Friday: An Economic Scorecard
teaser: Many analysts expect the estimate of economic growth to hit 3 percent for the third-straight quarter, a post-recession milestone.

headline: The Facts Behind the Weaponized Phrase ‘Chain Migration’
teaser: What is “chain migration” and how did the phrase become a contentious part of the immigration debate?

headline: Trump Calls Mueller Report ‘Fake News’
teaser: When asked if he tried to fire the special counsel Robert Mueller, President Trump called it “fake news.” The New York Times reported that Mr. Trump ordered the firing of Mr. Mueller in June.

headline: Museum Told White House: No Van Gogh, but Here’s a Gold Toilet
teaser: Officials at the Guggenheim Museum are being tight-lipped about a report in the The Washington Post that describes a strange email sent by the museum’s chief curator.

headline: Cecile Richards on Her Life After Planned Parenthood
teaser: The president of the organization since 2006, she will now be promoting a memoir and campaigning for Democratic women in the midterm elections.

headline: A Sober Trump Reassures the Davos Elite
teaser: In a restrained speech, the president argued that his “America First” policies were consistent with the current global economic system.

headline: Did the President Order Mueller to Be Fired? ‘Fake news,’ Trump Says
teaser: President Trump on Friday denied that he had ordered the firing of Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel. The president called reports of the June incident “fake news.”

headline: Hillary Clinton Chose to Shield a Top Adviser Accused of Harassment in 2008
teaser: Mrs. Clinton’s campaign manager at the time recommended that she fire the adviser, Burns Strider. Instead, Mr. Strider was docked several weeks of pay and ordered to undergo counseling.

headline: That Time ‘Murphy Brown’ and Dan Quayle Topped the Front Page
teaser: The show is coming back, CBS announced this week, reminding some of a 1992 skirmish in the culture wars. We take a walk through The Times archives.

headline: Right and Left React to Trump’s Attempted Firing of Robert Mueller
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the president’s aborted effort to dismiss the special counsel.

headline: The Chef Tom Colicchio Quits a Food Policy Group He Started
teaser: He says Food Policy Action’s lobbying efforts aren’t working; he’ll work instead to help elect “better” lawmakers.

headline: Curators at Museum of Natural History Object to a Trustee
teaser: Several members of the museum’s staff have sent a letter protesting Rebekah Mercer’s position on the board.

headline: Review: A Mariachi Opera Addresses Roiling Issues of Immigration
teaser: A richly affecting, musically restrained and very timely mariachi work, “Cruzar la Cara de la Luna,” comes to the New York City Opera.

headline: Boeing Denied Bid for Tariffs on Canadian Jets
teaser: The decision ends a trade case filed by Boeing, which said its Canadian rival Bombardier unfairly subsidized and dumped its planes in the United States.

headline: Training Quick and Staffing Unfinished, Army Units Brace for Surging Taliban
teaser: A brigade of military advisers is being heralded as a key part of President Trump’s strategy to turn the tide in Afghanistan, but its commander has raised internal concerns about the challenges it faces.

headline: Fact Check: In Davos Speech, Trump Mixes Facts With Fiction
teaser: The president was wrong about his place in history and mostly right in his assessment of a strong economy.

headline: Coming U.S. List of Oligarchs Linked to Putin Alarms Russia’s Rich
teaser: Wealthy Russians are on an aggressive lobbying push in fear that they will be penalized by a Washington intent on punishing Moscow’s aggressions.

headline: Counsel Quietly Trying to Corral Trump While Pushing G.O.P.’s Agenda
teaser: As a series of firings and resignations roiled the first year of the Trump administration, Donald F. McGahn II maintained a low profile, but he has recently been thrust squarely into the public eye.

headline: News Analysis: Gridlock Deepens Under Trump. Is Our Democracy at Risk?
teaser: The gloom is bipartisan as Republicans warn of a dark plot to overthrow the Trump government and Democrats talk of a creeping authoritarianism unchecked by Congress.

headline: Newsbook: What Awaits Salvadoran Immigrants in Their Native Country?
teaser: The Trump administration has removed protections for 200,000 Salvadorans who have been allowed to live here legally since 2001.

headline: State of the Union Preview: Will Trump Stick to the Script?
teaser: President Trump plans an optimistic address promoting priorities like overhauls of infrastructure and immigration, but there are no guarantees when the president faces a television camera.

headline: Stephen Wynn Steps Down From R.N.C. Post After Sexual Misconduct Claims
teaser: Mr. Wynn, who had been selected for the committee finance position by President Trump, was facing growing calls to step aside.

headline: Air Force One Needs 2 New Refrigerators. Together, They Cost $24 Million.
teaser: After more than a quarter-century in use, two “chillers” in the president’s plane are no longer effective and must be replaced, the Air Force said.

headline: Rubio Fires Chief of Staff After Misconduct Allegations
teaser: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida said he and his general counsel had found evidence that an employee had “violated office policies regarding proper relations.”

headline: At Davos, the Real Star May Have Been China, Not Trump
teaser: While President Trump reassured business leaders that he wanted trade to continue, Beijing extended its economic reach to Latin America and the Arctic.

headline: Republicans Show Little Urgency on Legislation to Protect Mueller
teaser: Democrats have stepped up calls to protect the special counsel after revelations of the president’s attempt to fire him. But Republicans appeared to settle on warnings instead.

headline: Iran Grants Baquer Namazi, 81, Four-Day Release From Evin Prison
teaser: A lawyer for Mr. Namazi, the oldest American known to be imprisoned in Iran, said he had been released temporarily because of poor health.

headline: President Trump Bragged to Jay-Z About Black Employment. Is He Right?
teaser: The president made a familiar boast that is true as far as it goes. But there are underlying dynamics to consider as well.

headline: The Chef José Andrés Has a New Bone to Pick With the Trumps
teaser: Mr. Andrés said he was snubbed at a party at the behest of Ivanka Trump. She said that was not true. It was all an encapsulation of President Trump’s Washington: unreliable narratives and petty feuds.

headline: Secret Memo Hints at a New Republican Target: Rod Rosenstein
teaser: The memo, raising doubts about the Russia inquiry, includes an account of Mr. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, approving surveillance of a former Trump campaign aide.

headline: Hillary Clinton Makes Grammys Cameo
teaser: In a pre-recorded sketch at the 2018 Grammy Awards, Mrs. Clinton read a passage from Michael Wolff's "Fire and Fury."

headline: Hillary Clinton, Reading From Trump Book, Makes a Grammys Cameo
teaser: Mrs. Clinton read an excerpt from the tell-all book “Fire and Fury” as part of a sketch during the Grammy Awards broadcast.

headline: The Subway Is Next Door. Should New Yorkers Pay Extra for That?
teaser: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has made “value capture” a big part of his plan to salvage the subway by seeking more taxes from property owners near stations.

headline: Sidebar: When a T-Shirt Gets You in Trouble at the Voting Booth
teaser: The Supreme Court will hear arguments next month in a First Amendment case on a Minnesota law that bars political T-shirts, hats and buttons at the polls.

headline: Strava Fitness App Can Reveal Military Sites, Analysts Say
teaser: A global map published by the company shows users’ movements and is said to expose data about bases and personnel, including those of U.S. forces in Iraq and Syria.

headline: Billion-Dollar Storms: Is This the New Normal?
teaser: In 2017 the U.S. saw some of the strongest and most expensive storms in history. As global temperatures continue to rise, things will get worse and more costly.

headline: From Annapolis to Congress? These Three Women Know Tough Missions
teaser: The women, who were contemporaries at the Naval Academy, are part of a powerful wave of political activism in the era of President Trump.

headline: Nafta Talks Conclude in Montreal With Signs of Progress and Risk
teaser: As the sixth round of talks over the future of the North American Free Trade Agreement concluded on Monday, large gaps remained between Canada, Mexico and the United States.

headline: Mother of Long Island Gang Victim Invited to the State of the Union
teaser: Evelyn Rodriguez has been a fierce advocate for victims since her daughter, Kayla Cuevas, was killed by the transnational gang MS-13 in 2016.

headline: Rodney Frelinghuysen, Powerful House Republican, Announces He Will Not Seek Re-Election
teaser: The chairman of the appropriations committee is the latest congressional Republican to announce he will not seek re-election in the 2018 midterms.

headline: Andrew McCabe Steps Down at F.B.I. in Widely Expected Move
teaser: The F.B.I.’s deputy director has come under fire from Republicans and President Trump.

headline: Tucked Into the Tax Bill, a Plan to Help Distressed America
teaser: A little-noticed provision in the tax law seeks to drive investment to parts of the country that are still waiting for the economic recovery to arrive.

headline: Trump Says Climate Is Both ‘Cooling’ and ‘Heating.’ He’s Only Half Right.
teaser: President Trump's comments about climate change in an interview with Piers Morgan were rich in misinformation.

headline: In Age of Trump, Political Reporters Are in Demand and Under Attack
teaser: White House correspondents have plenty of material — and plenty of angst — as they cover what Stephen K. Bannon calls “the first McLuhanesque presidency.”

headline: Janet Yellen’s Fitting Finale: Fed Plans to Stand Still
teaser: The Federal Reserve is expected to leave interest rates unchanged at Janet L. Yellen’s final meeting as the Fed chairwoman. Harder choices lie ahead.

headline: Attacks Reveal What U.S. Won’t: Victory Remains Elusive in Afghanistan
teaser: In his State of the Union address, President Trump is expected to promote his strategy to win the war in Afghanistan. He’ll be the third president to do so.

headline: Melania Trump, Out of Sight Since Report of Husband’s Infidelity, to Attend State of the Union
teaser: The reports of a payoff to an adult actress blindsided the first lady, who was furious with her husband, according to two people close to the couple.

headline: New Jersey Embraces an Idea it Once Rejected: Make Utilities Pay to Emit Carbon
teaser: Democratic governors nationwide are taking steps to tax or price emissions within their own borders, even as Trump dismantles federal climate policy.

headline: Senate Rejects Measure to Ban Abortion After 20 Weeks of Pregnancy
teaser: In a vote that fell mostly along party lines, Republicans aimed to force vulnerable Democrats to take a stand ahead of the midterm elections.

headline: House Republicans Vote to Release Secret Memo on Russia Probe
teaser: Disregarding Justice Department warnings, the House Intelligence Committee will release a secret memo questioning the origins of the Russia investigation.

headline: A Flurry of Courts have Ruled on Election Maps. Here’s What They’ve Said.
teaser: How the disputes over electoral maps in Wisconsin, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Maryland shape up, and what the next steps are.

headline: Many Muslim Refugees Will Face Additional Scrutiny Under Trump Plan
teaser: The Trump administration has cited security concerns about 11 countries, most of them predominantly Muslim, so their refugees will undergo more vetting.

headline: Some Supporters Fear Trump Will Lose Hard Edge in State of Union Speech
teaser: Signals from the White House have hard-line supporters worried that he will sing the praises of bipartisanship instead of ideological purity.

headline: The Resistance Has Come to Celebrity Award Shows
teaser: Hillary Clinton’s cameo at the Grammys set off a debate about how far glitzy awards shows should go in needling Democrats’ favorite target.

headline: How FISA Wiretap Applications Work and Why It Matters in the Trump-Russia Fight
teaser: How investigators seek permission to eavesdrop on Americans has been a subject of renewed interest after Republicans wrote a memo said to portray the Justice Department as abusing surveillance powers.

headline: The State of the Union Is … Misspelled
teaser: Tickets issued to lawmakers’ spouses and guests for President Trump’s annual address to Congress contained a glaring typo: “State of the Uniom.”

headline: Russian Jet Buzzed American Spy Plane Over Black Sea, U.S. Says
teaser: The State Department said the planes came within five feet of each other in “the latest example of Russian military activities disregarding international norms and agreements.”

headline: Trump Administration Won’t Impose Sanctions on Buyers of Russian Arms
teaser: The administration granted exceptions to a new law requiring such sanctions, saying the mere existence of the law had already deterred billions in purchases.

headline: Democratic National Committee’s Chief Executive Quits
teaser: Senior Democratic officials indicated that Jess O’Connell, who had been in the job less than year, had clashed with the party’s elected chairman.

headline: Ronald Reagan Invited a Guest. Then Every Other President Followed.
teaser: Ronald Reagan invited Lenny Skutnik, who saved a woman from drowning after a plane crash, to the State of the Union in 1982. Since, presidents have kept the tradition of inviting guests.

headline: Here’s Who Will Sit With the First Lady at the State of the Union
teaser: President Trump and Melania Trump, the first lady, have released their joint guest list for the State of the Union address on Tuesday night.

headline: Fact Check: Reviewing a Year of Fact Checks Before Trump’s First State of the Union
teaser: Ahead of President Trump’s first State of the Union address, a look at the claims he has made recently — and their accuracy.

headline: Kremlin Says U.S. Turns Russian Elite Into a List of ‘Enemies’
teaser: The Trump administration released the list in adherence with a demand from Congress, but it was met in Russia with disbelief and derision.

headline: Economic Scene: After Globalization, a New Specter Could Feed Populist Politics
teaser: Job-killing imports from China gave rise to the dynamics that led to President Trump’s election. Artificial intelligence could provide the next wave.

headline: Live Briefing: A State of the Union Amid Remarkable Turmoil and Concern
teaser: President Trump will deliver his first State of the Union address at 9 p.m. with a burgeoning economy but growing concern over the administration’s conduct.

headline: Scott Pruitt, the E.P.A. Chief, Assailed Trump in a 2016 Interview
teaser: Speaking on a radio show in 2016, Mr. Pruitt said that Donald Trump, if elected, would act in a way that is “truly unconstitutional.”

headline: It’s Trump’s Speech, but Eyes Are on Melania
teaser: Following reports of a payment to an alleged mistress in 2016, Melania Trump has kept a low profile. Mrs. Trump is expected to re-emerge to attend the State of the Union address.

headline: Chicago Cubs Co-owner Ricketts Expected to Head G.O.P. Fund-raising

teaser: John F. Kelly was brought in to restore order to a chaotic West Wing. But recently the White House chief of staff has been finding himself at the center of controversy.

headline: Union Leaders Protesting DeVos Are Left Out in the Cold
teaser: The leaders were not allowed access to the Education Department building to deliver failing “report cards.”

headline: Republicans Learn to Love Deficit Spending They Once Loathed
teaser: After years of professing fiscal discipline, Republicans are embracing budget deficits as the nation’s debt swells.

headline: Unwelcome Attention for John Kelly, the Man Enlisted to Bring Calm
teaser: President Trump is calling the chief of staff he pushed out, Reince Priebus, to complain about John Kelly, the chief of staff who took Mr. Priebus’s place.

headline: Mike Pence Tangles With Olympian Adam Rippon Over Gay Rights Record
teaser: Mr. Pence denied a report that Mr. Rippon, a gay American figure skater competing in Pyeongchang, had refused to meet with him. But Mr. Rippon’s agent said it was true.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: On ‘Big Brother,’ America Gets the Reality-TV Politics It Deserves
teaser: Omarosa Manigault Newman struck at Donald Trump using what she learned from him on “The Apprentice.”

headline: Encounters: Playing the President and Protesting One, Too
teaser: Elizabeth Marvel returns as President Keane on Season 7 of the political thriller “Homeland.”

headline: The Era of Fiscal Austerity Is Over. Here’s What Big Deficits Mean for the Economy.
teaser: It depends on whether you look at the short, medium or long term.

headline: Yesterday In Styles: 2004: When Fake News Was Cool
teaser: Long before “fake news” became a cudgel for the Trumpites, it was the hippest form of protest for Jon Stewart types during the George W. Bush years.

headline: Arizona G.O.P. Tiptoes Between a Trump-Loving Base and a Leery Wider Electorate
teaser: With possibly two Senate seats open, and as many as three competitive House seats, Arizona could be ground zero this year, but both parties are torn by divisions in the electorate.

headline: Trump Praises Top Adviser Accused of Abusing Ex-Wives
teaser: “We wish him well,” the president said, as a nearly all-male top White House staff appears to have looked the other way about allegations against the disgraced adviser, Rob Porter.

headline: On Washington: For Republicans, the Tea Party Is Over
teaser: In embracing a costly new bipartisan budget bill, the party of fiscal restraint shows little restraint.

headline: PUblic Health: Another of Obamacare’s Unloved Provisions Is Gone
teaser: The Independent Payment Advisory Board was supposed to make it easier for Congress to control Medicare spending. But Congress never loved it. Now it's gone.

headline: In Her Words: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos Assesses a Year on the Job
teaser: In the last 12 months, there isn’t much Ms. DeVos has done that hasn’t been met with a barrage of backlash. But in a wide-ranging interview, she said her agenda had not been derailed.

headline: Unexpected Opposition Imperils Federal Reserve Nominee
teaser: Senator Rand Paul, a Republican, has joined Democrats in opposing the nomination of Marvin Goodfriend to the board of governors.

headline: How Rand Paul Exposed a Republican Reversal
teaser: It wasn’t long ago that fiscal responsibility was a mainstream Republican rallying cry. This was not lost on Senator Rand Paul who briefly shut the government down Friday morning over spending increases.

headline: No. 3 Official at the Justice Department Is Stepping Down
teaser: The official, Rachel Brand, was widely seen as the most likely successor to Rod J. Rosenstein, who oversees the inquiry into Russian influence in the 2016 election.

headline: Lower Drug Prices: New Proposals Carry Lots of Promises
teaser: The White House is considering a plan to lower out-of-pocket costs for people in Medicare drug plans, who often pay inflated prices for their drugs.

headline: In Charm Offensive, Qatar Pushes for a Comeback in Washington
teaser: After a disastrous 2017, Qatar is winning over fans in the Trump administration. But given the country’s ties to Iran, risks remain.

headline: With New Budget Deal, Trump Surrenders to the Administrative State
teaser: A year after planning a broad reorganization of the federal government, President Trump has signed a budget that expands every facet of the Washington swamp.

headline: Trump Trade Measures Set Off a Global Legal Pushback
teaser: Foreign countries are responding to tariffs imposed on solar panels and washing machines with challenges in American courts and at the World Trade Organization.

headline: U.S. Spies, Seeking to Retrieve Cyberweapons, Paid Russian Peddling Trump Secrets
teaser: After months of negotiations, the Russian insisted on including information about the president as part of a deal involving stolen hacking tools.

headline: The Trump Tax Cuts Hurt This Manufacturer. It Kept On Lobbying.
teaser: Hundreds of companies were hurt by the Trump tax cuts, which failed to extend dozens of expiring tax credits. Executives at Plug Power never lost hope.

headline: Trump Blocks Release of Memo Rebutting Republican Claims
teaser: President Trump blocked the release of a classified Democratic memo, setting up a potential showdown with Congress over the fate of its contents.

headline: News Analysis: Amid Turmoil From Washington to Wall Street, a Surprisingly Passive President
teaser: President Trump stayed largely on the sidelines as a volatile stock market plunged, Congress sealed a budget deal and a top aide was ousted over abuse charges.

headline: No Handshakes as Pence Avoids Kim Jong-un’s Sister at Olympics
teaser: The terms were set by President Trump: He was open to their meeting but only if Mr. Pence delivered a tough message and if they met away from TV cameras.

headline: Inquiry of Soldiers’ Deaths Urges Curtailing West Africa Missions
teaser: The Pentagon is poised to scale back patrols and commanders’ authorities as a result of the October ambush in Niger that killed four American soldiers.

headline: White House Speechwriter Resigns Amid Abuse Accusations
teaser: He is the second Trump administration aide to resign this week after being accused of physical and emotional abuse toward a former wife.

headline: White House Chief of Staff Is a Longtime Defender of the Accused

headline: As Other Aides Face Trump’s Ire Over Rob Porter’s Departure, Hope Hicks Is Praised
teaser: The president dismissed an idea circulated by some aides and allies that he’d been unhappy with Ms. Hope’s role in workshopping an initial forceful defense of Mr. Porter.

headline: Trump’s Infrastructure Plan May Ignore Climate Change. It Could Be Costly.
teaser: President Trump wants to spend $1.5 trillion on rebuilding roads and bridges, but failing to account for climate change could add to costs later.

headline: How Joy Reid of MSNBC Became a Heroine of the Resistance
teaser: The daughter of immigrants, she spars fiercely with supporters of President Trump, both on the air and in the Twitter ether.

headline: Trump Says Democrats’ Rebuttal Memo Was a Setup
teaser: President Trump said on Twitter that Democrats knew he would have to block the memo’s release on national security grounds, opening him to charges of a lack of transparency.

headline: News Analysis: Republicans Have an Election Message, but Trump Can’t Stick to It
teaser: Tax cuts and economic growth appear to be improving the party’s political position, but President Trump can’t seem to stop antagonizing voters, especially women.

headline: Kentucky Rushes to Remake Medicaid as Other States Prepare to Follow
teaser: The state will require many people to work, volunteer or train for a job to qualify for coverage — and to prove it with frequent documentation.

headline: Trump, Saying ‘Mere Allegation’ Ruins Lives, Appears to Doubt #MeToo Movement
teaser: After the resignations of two aides facing claims of domestic violence, President Trump said that the “falsely accused” had little chance of recovery.

headline: Administration Imposes Sweeping Limits on Federal Actions Against Companies
teaser: Consumer advocates say the policy change will crimp enforcement of crucial protections, but defense lawyers contend it gives them a powerful tool to fend off claims of wrongdoing against their clients.

headline: Fired Official Was Exploring Resolution to 9/11 Case Precluding Death Penalty
teaser: A tribunal official fired without explanation last week had been in talks that could have ended in plea deals and foreclosed any possibility of execution.

headline: ‘No Fire, No Fury?’ Trump Is on Board With a Jeanine Pirro Book to Rebut Michael Wolff
teaser: Ms. Pirro, the Fox News personality, met with President Trump on Wednesday in the White House, where he agreed to be interviewed for the book.

headline: Liberals Wanted Fiscal Stimulus. Conservatives Delivered It.
teaser: Left-leaning economists hate the timing and the composition. But the expansionary fiscal policy they sought is on the way.

headline: Nancy Pelosi Wants to Take Back the House. But She Faces a More Urgent Test.
teaser: At 77, Ms. Pelosi remains a dominant figure in Washington. How she bridges Democrats’ factions on immigration may help determine whether she can lead her party to a majority.

headline: Trump Rules: F.D.A. Chief Goes Against the Administration Stereotype
teaser: Dr. Scott Gottlieb isn’t rolling back his agency’s mission, although he is straddling the interests of the drug and health industries along with public health.

headline: NASA Budgets for a Trip to the Moon, but Not While Trump Is President
teaser: The administration sees a greater role for the private sector in returning to the moon and running the International Space Station, which it would stop financing in 2025.

headline: Pelosi Spoke for Eight Hours on Dreamers. We Checked Her Facts.
teaser: The House Democratic leader mostly told anecdotes and personal stories. But she included a few facts and falsehoods to sort through as well.

headline: Tillerson’s Mideast Trip Was Already Daunting. Then Israel and Iran Collided.
teaser: Israel’s strikes in Syrian territory give even greater urgency to a top priority: managing the aftermath of the expected final defeat of the Islamic State in Syria.

headline: Trump’s Infrastructure Plan: Modest Federal Incentives, Facing Long Odds
teaser: President Trump this week will call for a $1.5 trillion infrastructure initiative by matching up to $100 billion in funds that states and cities put toward infrastructure projects.

headline: As DeVos Approves Education Plans, She Finds Skeptics in G.O.P. Governors
teaser: Several governors, mostly Republicans, have declined to sign their own states’ plans for implementing a new federal education law intended to devolve control to the states.

headline: Abuse Case Exposes Fissures in a White House in Turmoil
teaser: Aides to President Trump said they remained confused and upset over the handling of the accusations against Rob Porter, the staff secretary who stepped down.

headline: Big Republican Advantages Are Eroding in the Race for House Control
teaser: Retirements and reversals in gerrymandering give Democrats a clearer path to a majority.

headline: As White House Releases Budget, Congress Sets Spending Priorities
teaser: The White House releases a proposed budget that is largely irrelevant, given Congress passed a spending bill last week that outlines priorities.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: Obama Portraits Blend Paint and Politics, and Fact and Fiction
teaser: This Barack Obama Is No Mr. Nice Guy. Kehinde Wiley’s portrait of the former president contradicts the impression he often made in office of being detached.

headline: Trump Taps Harry Harris, Known for Being Tough on China, as Australia Envoy
teaser: Adm. Harry B. Harris Jr., the commander of the United States Pacific Command, is a vocal critic of China’s military expansion in the region.

headline: What’s in the White House Budget Request?

headline: Here Are the Places That Struggle to Meet the Rules on Safe Drinking Water

headline: Trump Threatens New Trade Penalties, but It Could Be a Hard Bargain
teaser: The president said the United States would announce a “reciprocal tax” on unfair trading partners, but one White House adviser said nothing had been formalized.

headline: Right and Left React to the Soaring Budget Deficit
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the large deficits in the recently passed federal spending plan and on President Trump’s budget.

headline: Accusations Against Aide Renew Attention on White House Security Clearances

headline: Senate Begins ‘Wild’ Week of Debate on Immigration, Outcome Unknown
teaser: Lawmakers will try to assemble immigration legislation that can garner 60 votes as the Senate undertakes an exceedingly rare open-ended debate.

headline: Trump Administration Targets Obama-Era Effort to Limit Methane
teaser: The rule, dating from President Barack Obama’s final days in office, survived a Senate vote in 2017 but now faces formal repeal.

headline: A Whirlwind Envelops the White House, and the Revolving Door Spins
teaser: The White House turnover rate in the first year of Donald J. Trump’s presidency has been 34 percent. That’s a modern record.

headline: Washington Is Willing to Talk With North Korea, the South’s President Says

headline: Trump Pressures Democrats Over DACA and Infrastructure Plan
teaser: In two early tweets, Mr. Trump said a March deadline to protect young immigrants would be the “last chance,” and suggested that Democrats should come to a deal on his infrastructure proposal.

headline: Fake News and Bots May Be Worrisome, but Their Political Power Is Overblown
teaser: It’s very hard to change people’s minds, especially when so many are already committed partisans.

headline: Maggie Haberman on Her Hardest Interview and Predictions for 2018

headline: Julian Assange’s Arrest Warrant Is Again Upheld by U.K. Judge

headline: Senate Immigration Debate Gets Off to a Slow, Unhappy Start

headline: Corker Reconsiders Retirement, but He Must Win Over Trump to Do It

teaser: The F.B.I. chief upended the White House’s timeline of events, also saying the bureau delivered its first report on Mr. Porter months earlier than officials had said.

headline: The F.B.I., Domestic Abuse and the White House: A Timeline of the Rob Porter Scandal
teaser: The White House has shifted its story about how and when members of the administration learned about the domestic abuse allegations that forced a top aide to resign.

headline: Trump’s Longtime Lawyer Says He Paid Stormy Daniels Out of His Own Pocket
teaser: Michael D. Cohen, who worked as a counsel to the Trump Organization for more than a decade, said he was not reimbursed for the 2016 payment.

headline: A Citizenship Question on the Census May Be Bad for Your Health

teaser: Rob Porter, the White House staff secretary who was forced to resign after accusations of spousal abuse, amassed job titles in multiple Senate offices before joining President Trump’s staff.

headline: The Trump Administration Is Optimistic About Economic Growth. Be Skeptical.

teaser: A band known for noisy, tuneful, hyperkinetic guitar rock has changed course for its 11th studio album.

teaser: The admission by President Trump’s longtime personal lawyer that he sent $130,000 to a porn actress is raising new legal, ethical and factual questions.

teaser: Ms. Warren used an unannounced appearance on Wednesday to confront a political liability before a potential bid for president.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Gets What He Wants in Immigration Debate: Quiet on the Right
teaser: The activism and outrage from conservatives that has killed past immigration deals is less vitriolic this time, perhaps because they sense they are winning.

teaser: An investigation could lead to questions that the F.C.C. chairman, Ajit Pai, has so far tried to avoid answering in public.

headline: Trump’s Inaugural Committee Paid $26 Million to Firm of First Lady’s Adviser
teaser: The committee, which raised a record $107 million, detailed its finances in a tax filing, revealing that it donated less than expected to charity.

headline: News Analysis: The White House Flouts the First Rule of Crisis Communications: Get the Facts Out Fast
teaser: Its handling of Rob Porter’s resignation has become a case study in how shifting stories can make matters worse.

headline: Frustration Grows as Congress Shows Inability to Pass Even Modest Gun Measures

headline: Trump’s Latest Travel Ban Suffers Blow From a Second Appeals Court

teaser: Mr. Trump’s remarks came in the face of criticism that the White House had not done enough to reassure the public in the hours following one of the deadliest mass shootings in United States history.

headline: U.S. Bank Cited by Federal Authorities for Lapses in Money Laundering
teaser: The bank, which was accused of neglecting safeguards against illegal activity and of lying to a regulator, agreed to pay $613 million in fines and penalties to resolve the case.

headline: In Pursuit of Peace, Trump Generates Rare Friction With Netanyahu
teaser: The pushback on Israel suggests that the White House is recalibrating its approach to Israel and the Palestinians as it wrestles with when, and how, to put a peace proposal on the table.

headline: Senate Rejects Trump’s Immigration Plan
teaser: The measure would have severely limited chain migration, ended the visa lottery, funded the border wall and resolved the fate of the Dreamers.

headline: American ISIS Suspect Said He Wanted to Report From Syria, Filing Shows
teaser: The unnamed man has been in custody of the United States military for months as the Trump administration tries to figure out how to handle his case.

headline: Diplomats in Cuba Suffered Brain Injuries. Experts Still Don’t Know Why.
teaser: After examining 21 American diplomats said to have been victims of a mysterious “attack” in Havana, medical experts found concussion-like damage but no obvious causes.

teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the predictable debate over gun control in the wake of a mass shooting.

headline: Senate’s Renewed Push for Sentencing Overhaul Hits a Familiar Roadblock
teaser: The Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, sees a bipartisan effort to make sweeping changes to federal sentencing laws as a losing issue and is unlikely to bring it before the full Senate.

headline: New Health Secretary Faces First Test as Idaho Skirts Federal Law
teaser: Alex M. Azar II, the health secretary, told Congress he would scrutinize Idaho’s plan to allow sale of insurance that does not comply with the Affordable Care Act.

headline: U.S. Condemns Russia for Cyberattack, Showing Split in Stance on Putin
teaser: The attack was aimed at Ukraine but crippled computers around the world.

headline: YouTube Comment Seen as Early Warning in Shooting Left Little for F.B.I. to Investigate
teaser: A commenter who shared a name with the suspect in the Florida school vowed to become a “professional school shooter” in a disturbing post that the authorities examined last fall.

headline: Encounters: A Melania Trump Impersonator’s Downtime With Her Daughter
teaser: Laura Benanti, the cabaret performer and Broadway star, keeps a low profile in her Harlem neighborhood.

headline: Mitt Romney Announces Senate Run
teaser: Mr. Romney, a critic of the president, officially confirmed that he would run to fill the seat of Senator Orrin G. Hatch, who is retiring.

headline: Trump Administration Recommends Stiff Penalties on Steel and Aluminum Imports
teaser: The Commerce Department said foreign metals pose a threat to national security, setting the stage for President Trump to determine what trade action to take.

headline: Jennifer Lawrence as a Russian ‘Sparrow’: Four Takeaways
teaser: Jennifer Lawrence, her director and a C.I.A. master of disguise discuss Russia, spy craft and their new film “Red Sparrow” with The New York Times.
