teaser: Shane Scott, a New York Times reporter, speaks with Jennifer Lawrence; the director Francis Lawrence; and Jonna Hiestand Mendez, a former C.I.A. intelligence officer, about Russian espionage and the making of the new spy thriller “Red Sparrow.”

headline: 13 Russians Indicted in First Charges on 2016 Election Interference
teaser: The special counsel charged 13 foreigners associated with Russia and three Russian organizations with illegally using social media platforms to sow political discord.

headline: Meet Yevgeny Prigozhin, the Russian Oligarch Indicted in U.S. Election Interference
teaser: A secretive oligarch often called “Putin’s cook,” he is one of 13 Russians the special counsel charged on Friday for meddling in the 2016 U.S. election.

headline: News Analysis: A Hoax? Indictments Make Trump’s Claim Even Harder to Maintain
teaser: By laying out in excruciating detail the evidence of Russian meddling spanning the last four years, the special counsel instantly created a new political reality for President Trump.

headline: Russians Bought Bank Accounts from California Man, Mueller Says
teaser: A California man illegally provided hundreds of bank account numbers to a Russian social media operation, the special counsel revealed.

headline: Fact-Checking Claims About Gun Violence and Mental Illness
teaser: Paul Ryan, Bernie Sanders and others stated facts and falsehoods in the wake of the Parkland Shooting.

headline: As Kenya Political Stalemate Drags On, U.S. Becomes a Target
teaser: The opposition coalition is beginning to fray, but some of its supporters are doubling down — by burning American flags.

headline: Kelly Orders Overhaul to White House Security Clearance After Abuse Claims
teaser: The changes require F.B.I. officials to directly report to the White House counsel concerns that they uncover during the background investigation of the president’s top aides.

headline: Congress Struggles for Path Forward on Immigration
teaser: After legislative efforts collapsed Thursday in the Senate, lawmakers in the House and Senate struggled for a path forward to protect the “Dreamers.”

headline: Frustrated Military Tribunal Judge Indefinitely Halts Cole Bombing Case
teaser: The judge described himself as shaken by his experience in the case and portrayed a detainee’s former defense lawyers as pursuing a “revolution to the system” by defying judicial orders.

headline: Media Memo: A Familiar Editorial Split After Parkland Shooting, but Not Everywhere
teaser: A surprise editorial in favor of gun control from the Trump-friendly New York Post appears among a deluge of argument and erroneous reporting.

headline: Trump Visits Florida Hospital That Treated School Shooting Victims
teaser: “It’s very sad, something like that could happen,” a solemn Mr. Trump told reporters afterward.

headline: Inside a 3-Year Russian Campaign to Influence U.S. Voters
teaser: Using American bank accounts, drivers’ licenses and disposable phones, about 80 Russians worked to disparage Hillary Clinton, promote Donald Trump and sow political discord.

headline: How Does a Political Reporter Write a Memoir? First, Read Books. A Lot of Books.
teaser: A reporter who spent a decade covering Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaigns talks about her adjustment to book leave and finding the “foreign land where writers live.”

headline: Still Talking After All These Years
teaser: At the annual meeting of the American Psychoanalytic Association, the seminars covered the quantum hologram (huh?) and President Trump.

headline: The Troll Farm: What We Know About 13 Russians Indicted by the U.S.
teaser: Employees and associates of the Internet Research Agency, a shadowy company based in St. Petersburg, are accused of trying to interfere in the 2016 election.

headline: In Wake of Florida Massacre, Gun-Control Advocates Look to Connecticut
teaser: Connecticut, which passed a strict gun law after the 2012 shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School, has seen a sharp drop in the number of gun deaths.

headline: News Analysis: Trump’s Conspicuous Silence Leaves a Struggle Against Russia Without a Leader
teaser: President Trump depicted indictments charging Russians with interfering in America’s politics as a vindication for himself rather than a threat to the United States.

headline: Trump’s National Security Chief Calls Russian Interference ‘Incontrovertible’
teaser: Lt. General H.R. McMaster accused Moscow of engaging in “disinformation, subversion and espionage.” The comments highlighted a sharp division in the White House on how to talk about Russia’s actions.

headline: To Stir Discord in 2016, Russians Turned Most Often to Facebook
teaser: The special counsel’s indictment detailed how crucial Facebook and Instagram were to the Russian campaign to disrupt the presidential election.

headline: Trump Should Get Behind Romney’s Candidacy, McConnell Says
teaser: In an interview, Senator Mitch McConnell said that Mitt Romney’s Senate run was an illustration of Republicans’ improving fortunes entering a challenging midterm campaign.

headline: DeVos and Democrats Urge Congress to Hold Hearings on School Shootings
teaser: Asked whether she believed teachers should be allowed and trained to carry weapons, Betsy DeVos said only that it was “an important issue for all states to grapple with and to tackle.”

headline: When Calling An Uber Can Pay Off For Cities and States
teaser: New taxes and fees on ride-hailing services have raised millions of dollars for transportation, infrastructure, and even public schools.

headline: Trump Blames Obama and Democrats for Failing to Stop Russian Meddling
teaser: The president seemed to embrace the idea that sowing discord in American politics had been Russia’s aim, after previously saying little to acknowledge a threat.

headline: News Analysis: U.S. Revives Concerns About European Defense Plans, Rattling NATO Allies
teaser: After pressing European nations to spend more on their security, Americans now worry that their projects could weaken the Atlantic alliance and block U.S. defense contractors from deals.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Falsely Claims, ‘I Never Said Russia Did Not Meddle’
teaser: Here are eight times President Trump has rejected or otherwise doubted that Moscow had a role in interfering with the 2016 presidential election.

headline: Spending Bill Sets Path to Fix a Looming Pension Crisis
teaser: The sprawling agreement to boost government spending quietly included a step toward defusing what could be a financial time bomb for 1.5 million retirees.

headline: How Unwitting Americans Encountered Russian Operatives Online
teaser: With imperfect English and tireless posting on Facebook and Twitter, Russian trolls summoned Americans to rallies, praised Donald J. Trump and played on political divisions.

headline: Tools of Trump’s Fixer: Payouts, Intimidation and the Tabloids
teaser: Beyond facilitating a $130,000 payment to silence a porn star, Donald Trump’s lawyer spent years making aggressive behind-the-scenes efforts to protect him.

headline: Indictment Leaves No Doubt: Russia Backed Trump. But Was It the Difference?
teaser: The charges against 13 Russians have injected a new twist into a debate that has consumed the political universe since the final hours of election night: How did Trump do it?

headline: Fact-Checking a Facebook Executive’s Comments on Russian Interference
teaser: Rob Goldman, Facebook vice president for ads, tweeted about Russia’s disinformation effort. President Trump then cited him. We fact-checked Mr. Goldman.

headline: White House Memo: White House Seeks to Move On From Abuse Scandal. But What Did It Learn?
teaser: A better-not-to-know approach in the White House allowed the Rob Porter problem to fester and raises questions about whether officials are capable of creating a better system.

headline: Sidebar: Will Anthony Kennedy Retire? What Influences a Justice’s Decision
teaser: Among the factors justices have considered in deciding when to step down are party loyalty, judicial legacy and the next presidential election.

headline: Trump Adds Cautious Support to Changes to Background Checks for Gun Buyers
teaser: The White House press secretary said that Mr. Trump had spoken to Senator John Cornyn, Republican of Texas, about legislation he helped introduce to revamp background checks.

headline: Texas Democrat Writes Giant-Killer Narrative One Livestream at a Time
teaser: Representative Beto O’Rourke is making a long-shot bid to defeat Ted Cruz and become the first Democrat in Texas to win a statewide office since 1994.

headline: As Some Got Free Health Care, Gwen Got Squeezed: An Obamacare Dilemma
teaser: Trump’s efforts to undermine the health law have widened the gap between those who get government aid and those who don’t, deepening resentments.

headline: Tax Overhaul Gains Public Support, Buoying Republicans
teaser: The upturn follows an aggressive advertising campaign by the party and coincides with an eroding Democratic lead in polls gauging midterm election prospects.

headline: Trump Edges Toward a Conventional Republican Approach, at Least on Policy
teaser: For all the ways President Trump has flouted the norms of his office, on policy he comes closer to other modern Republican presidents.

headline: Rob Porter’s Charisma and Ambition Disguised Flare-ups of Anger
teaser: The White House aide who resigned in a domestic abuse scandal that engulfed the White House was known for his ambition at Harvard and on Capitol Hill.

headline: Trump Endorses Mitt Romney’s Run for Utah Senate Seat
teaser: Mr. Romney, who has publicly clashed with Mr. Trump in the past, has signaled he plans to serve as a check on the president if he is elected.

headline: Trump Tries to Shift Blame to Obama for Not Countering Russian Meddling
teaser: President Trump suggested that the Obama administration did not do enough to prevent the Kremlin’s influence campaign.

headline: Fox News Plans a Streaming Service for ‘Superfans’
teaser: Fox Nation will focus primarily on right-leaning commentary and charge viewers a subscription fee.

headline: Economic Scene: Come the Recession, Don’t Count on That Safety Net
teaser: Republicans seek a leaner welfare system tying government benefits to hard work. But such benefits are worthless when there is no work to be had.

headline: Lawyer Accused of Making False Statements in Russia Investigation
teaser: The attorney was interviewed by the special counsel about work he did in Ukraine with Rick Gates, who went on to serve on President Trump’s campaign.

headline: Trump Moves to Relax Rules on Cheaper Health Insurance
teaser: Under current rules, such “short-term, limited-duration insurance” cannot last for more than three months. Under the proposal, the limit would be 364 days.

headline: Justices Won’t Hear Case on Waiting Period for Gun Purchases
teaser: Justice Clarence Thomas dissented, saying the court had turned the Second Amendment into a “constitutional orphan.”

headline: Polk Awards Honor Articles on Russia Investigation and #MeToo Movement
teaser: Journalists from The Washington Post and The New York Times who uncovered ties between the Trump campaign and Russia were among the winners of the George Polk Awards.

headline: Why a Republican Plan for Paid Leave Has Stirred Concern About Social Security
teaser: A proposal would allow people to collect Social Security after a birth, but there’s a catch.

headline: U.S. Misses Deadline to Repatriate Detainee Who Pleaded Guilty
teaser: The lapsing of the deadline for the Guantánamo detainee was another blow to the military commissions system, although the Pentagon was still hoping to transfer him to Saudi Arabia.

headline: Trump Moves to Regulate ‘Bump Stock’ Devices
teaser: The president asked the Justice Department to propose regulations that would ban “bump stocks,” which can convert a semiautomatic gun into an automatic weapon.

headline: Right-Wing Media Uses Parkland Shooting as Conspiracy Fodder
teaser: Bill O’Reilly, Rush Limbaugh and Jack Kingston express suspicion toward the teenage survivors. The website Gateway Pundit claims they were coached.

headline: Kushner Resists Losing Access as Kelly Tackles Security Clearance Issues
teaser: Jared Kushner, frustrated about the issue and concerned that Mr. Kelly has targeted him personally with the directive, has told colleagues that he is reluctant to give up his high-level access.

headline: North Korea Dropped Out of Meeting With Pence at Last Minute, U.S. Says
teaser: Vice President Mike Pence had planned to secretly meet with North Korean officials at the Winter Olympics in South Korea, the State Department said.

headline: Trump’s Republican Critics Find a Sudden Need for His Support
teaser: Their hopes for a détente with Mr. Trump, who effectively staged a hostile takeover of a party he joined only in 2012, reflect the realization that rank-and-file Republicans have come to embrace the president.

headline: Under Trump, Border Patrol Steps Up Searches Far From the Border
teaser: The Border Patrol is aggressively using a ittle-known authority to set up checkpoints and search private property to crack down on illegal immigration.

headline: Trump Attacks Obama, and His Own Attorney General, Over Russia Inquiry
teaser: President Trump attacked his own attorney general on Wednesday, asking in a Twitter post why Jeff Sessions has not been investigating Democrats for Russian interference in the 2016 election.

headline: Trump to Discuss School Shootings With Survivors, Including Florida Students
teaser: The afternoon session in the State Dining Room will include those affected by school shootings in Parkland, Fla., Littleton, Colo., and Newtown, Conn.

headline: Supreme Court Rules on Terrorism, Whistle-Blowers and Prisoners
teaser: The justices issued four decisions, including one rejecting a bid to seize Iranian artifacts in a terrorism suit and another limiting whistle-blower protections.

headline: Fed Officials Say Economy Is Ready for Higher Rates
teaser: A strengthening economy is giving the Fed confidence that interest rates can rise, according to minutes of the most recent policymaking meeting.

headline: How a Court Outdid Even Democrats in Redrawing Pennsylvania’s Map
teaser: Democrats seemed not to believe that they would be allowed to strive for partisan balance in addressing Republican gerrymandering.

headline: Hotel Carrying New Trump Brand Secures $6 Million Tax Break
teaser: The first of the Trumps’ Scion hotels is being built in the Mississippi Delta. The local developers, saying it would draw tourists, sought state tax relief.

headline: 5 of the Most Dramatic Moments in a Day of Confrontation Over Guns
teaser: Students at the Florida high school where a gunman killed 17 people last week traveled to the White House and the Florida State Capitol and called for changes to gun laws.

headline: The Making of a No. 1 YouTube Conspiracy Video After the Parkland Tragedy
teaser: The user who posted the video, “mike m.,” stands by his baseless theory that a student at the school is really an actor. And he says he’s “not going to stop.”

headline: New Candidates Emerge for Trump’s Top Environmental Adviser
teaser: A new candidate was needed after the White House withdrew its previous nominee, who had drawn criticism for calling carbon dioxide the “gas of life.”

headline: Trump Says Arming Teachers ‘Could Solve Your Problem’
teaser: At a listening session with grieving parents and school-shooting victims, including students from Stoneman Douglas High School in Florida, President Trump suggested teachers should be allowed to carry firearms.

headline: Questions Swirl as Melania Trump’s Parents Obtain Green Cards

headline: Senior Republican Calls for E.P.A. Chief’s First-Class Travel Files
teaser: Scott Pruitt’s taxpayer-funded travel at the E.P.A. has drawn criticism, resulting in a Republican committee chairman to issue a demand for documents.

headline: An Envoy Who Can Rival ‘North Korea’s Ivanka’
teaser: Administration officials say that Ivanka Trump could smooth some of the tensions that flared during the vice president’s visit, even if they insist that is not the purpose of her trip.

headline: Where the N.R.A. Speaks First and Loudest
teaser: NRATV, the organization’s online video channel, has become a little-noticed but vital forum for the dissemination of some of the most strident pro-gun messaging in politics.

headline: Father of Florida Shooting Victim Confronts Rubio Over Gun Control
teaser: Senator Marco Rubio insisted that other laws would better prevent such episodes and said he would support a bill to increase the minimum age for the purchase of an assault weapon.

headline: Trump’s Pick to Lead Indian Health Service Withdraws Nomination
teaser: The withdrawal of the nominee, Robert Weaver, follows reports that said he had inaccurately represented his qualifications to a Senate committee after his nomination in October.

headline: As China Puts Pressure on Taiwan, Signs of a U.S. Pushback
teaser: Concern about the self-governing island’s fate seems to be building in Washington, even as President Trump seeks China’s help on other issues.

headline: On Washington: Two Polarizing Issues, Gun Control and Immigration, Have Thwarted Compromise
teaser: Despite strong public support and bipartisan congressional backing for action, deep political divisions on the two issues yielded no deal.

headline: Trump Says He Advocates Arming Only Teachers With Special Training
teaser: President Trump took to Twitter to say that he does not want to give all teachers guns to fight mass shootings, but give “concealed guns” to teachers with “military or special training experience.”

headline: U.S. Says Troops Can Stay in Syria Without New Authorization
teaser: Even after ISIS is substantially defeated, the Trump administration will allow troops remain in Syria indefinitely without new congressional authorization.

headline: How the N.R.A. Keeps Federal Gun Regulators in Check
teaser: The A.T.F.’s weakened political position is partly because the N.R.A. has long used its sway to hobble the agency as well as because of a dearth of leadership and resources.

headline: N.R.A. Chief, Facing Gun Control Push, Offers Ardent Defense of 2nd Amendment
teaser: Wayne LaPierre, the N.R.A. chief, delivered remarks to the annual Conservative Political Action Conference.

headline: Margaret Brennan Named Host of ‘Face the Nation’ on CBS
teaser: Ms. Brennan, who succeeds John Dickerson, becomes the only female journalist currently serving as the solo anchor of a major Sunday political show.

headline: Comedian Going to White House Correspondents’ Dinner. What About Trump?
teaser: Michelle Wolf, a stand-up comic and contributor to “The Daily Show with Trevor Noah,” takes on one of the most prominent — and perilous — gigs in comedy.

headline: With Florida Shooting Survivors, N.R.A. Spokeswoman Holds Back. With Conservatives, It’s a Different Story.
teaser: The spokeswoman, Dana Loesch, spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference a day after addressing those affected by the school shooting in Parkland, Fla.

headline: A Supreme Court Showdown Could Shrink Unions’ Power
teaser: Workers in a small Illinois town are worried that a Supreme Court decision curbing union power would hurt their community.

headline: Mueller Files New Fraud Charges Against Paul Manafort
teaser: The charges do not involve President Trump or his campaign, but they compound the legal problems for Mr. Manafort, his former campaign chairman.

headline: As Conservatives Gather, Anger at the News Media Runs Deep
teaser: The first panel of this year’s Conservative Political Action Conference took aim at the press, and the attacks did not let up from there.

headline: Billy Graham to Lie in Honor at the U.S. Capitol
teaser: Mr. Graham, the evangelist and presidential pastor who died this week, will become the fourth private citizen to lie in honor in the Capitol Rotunda.

headline: Former Trump Aide Calls Paris Climate Accord ‘a Good Republican Agreement’
teaser: In an interview, George David Banks, who stepped down recently, said he also believed Mr. Trump might still be willing to remain in the global climate pact.

headline: Right and Left React to the Deepening Divide Over Gun Control
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on the divisive debate on gun restrictions in the wake of the mass shooting in Florida last week.

headline: What Do Jotted Talking Points Say About Trump’s Empathy?
teaser: Consoler in chief has been a role that President Trump has been slow and somewhat reluctant to embrace — especially in contrast to his predecessor.

headline: Justice Dept. to Prioritize Prosecutions for Lying in Gun Background Checks
teaser: The guidance, expected to be announced in the coming days, allows the Trump administration to take action on guns without issuing rules that might inflame gun rights supporters.

headline: Ivanka Trump Arrives in South Korea for Games and Diplomacy
teaser: The president’s daughter will meet with South Korea’s leader and attend the Olympic closing ceremony, where a North Korean delegation will also be present.

headline: Another Shooting, Another Gun Debate. Will the Outcome Be the Same?

headline: Fact Check: Major Shootings Led to Tougher Gun Laws, but to What End?
teaser: Major legislation is often spurred by tragedy. Experts are uncertain about the extent that gun control laws have improved safety and curbed violence.

headline: Another Shooting, Another Gun Debate. Will the Outcome Be the Same?
teaser: Last week’s school massacre in Florida set the well-worn machinery of America’s gun debate in motion. But angry students inject new passion into a stale fight.

headline: Trump Announces Harsh New Sanctions Against North Korea
teaser: The action was a clear signal, near the end of an Olympic Games marked by a rapprochement on the Korean Peninsula, that his pressure campaign would not let up.

headline: Australian Gun Crackdown Cited as Trump Hosts Its Leader
teaser: A survivor of last week’s Florida shooting implored President Trump to look to Australia as a model. As it happens, he is hosting Australia’s prime minister on Friday.

headline: Trump Condemns Florida Officer Who Didn’t Act; Sticks by Plan to Arm Teachers

headline: Rick Gates, Trump Campaign Aide, to Plead Guilty in Mueller Inquiry and Cooperate
teaser: The plea deal could be a sign that Mr. Gates plans to share incriminating information against Paul Manafort, the former campaign chairman, or other members of the Trump campaign.

headline: Trump Administration to Open Embassy in Jerusalem in May
teaser: President Trump said he resisted enormous pressure when he decided to recognize Jerusalem as the Israeli capital because “it’s the right thing to do.”

headline: President Trump: ‘I Try Like Hell to Hide That Bald Spot, Folks’
teaser: It’s not always easy to hide thinning hair, especially when your hair is as famous as the president’s.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Says ‘No President Has Ever Cut So Many Regulations.’ Not Quite.
teaser: Mr. Trump claims to have cut 22 federal regulations for every one that is newly created — more, he says, than any other president. Neither boast is true.

headline: Trump Blames Video Games for Mass Killings. Researchers Do Not.

headline: Top Chinese Official Plans U.S. Trip to Address Trade Friction
teaser: President Xi Jinping of China is sending Liu He, his top economic policy maker and a recent addition to the Politburo, to Washington on Tuesday.

teaser: Mr. Gates’s rapid ascent into President Trump’s orbit as Paul Manafort’s partner, and his sudden ejection from it, underscore how the Russia inquiries have shaken the administration.

headline: Trump Says Kelly Will Decide on Kushner’s Security Clearance
teaser: “He’s going to do what’s right for the country,” President Trump said of his chief of staff. “I have no doubt he will make the right decision.”

headline: As Economy Grows, Federal Reserve Frets Next Downturn
teaser: The Fed’s biannual policy report to Congress made little mention of the stock market’s fluctuations, but it affirmed plans to raise interest rates.

teaser: Conservatives try to look past President Trump’s flaws and see only his policies.

teaser: Gov. Eric Greitens faces an invasion of privacy charge and calls from fellow Republicans to quit. Lawmakers said they could take steps toward impeachment.

teaser: Since Robert S. Mueller III was appointed as special counsel, he has issued more than 100 criminal counts against 19 people and three companies.

teaser: The president mixed facts and falsehoods while talking about immigration, gun policy, trade, climate, taxes and other topics.

headline: Linda McMahon Gets a Ringside Seat for TrumpMania
teaser: Perhaps no other member of the president’s cabinet understands Mr. Trump as Ms. McMahon, a former pro wrestling entrepreneur, does.

headline: Theories Discrediting Victims of Attacks Date to the Civil War Era
teaser: “Crisis actor” conspiracy theories about the Florida school shooting are part of a long history of genuine activism being dismissed as the work of paid agitators.

teaser: Conspiracy theories about the Florida school shooting are part of a long history of genuine activism being dismissed as the work of paid agitators.

teaser: The guilty plea of one of Skadden’s lawyers has cast a spotlight on its work for a Russia-aligned former president of Ukraine, and its advice to other firms.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Shrugs as Russia Investigation Gains Steam

teaser: President Trump, calling the Pennsylvania ruling “very unfair to Republicans and to our country,” said that the decision should be appealed to the Supreme Court.

teaser: The Democratic memo released on Saturday was written to counter Republican claims that law enforcement officials had abused their powers.

teaser: A spokesman for a conservative group said Michael Steele, a former chairman of the Republican National Committee, was selected for the role because of his race.

teaser: President Moon Jae-in scored a potential diplomatic breakthrough when a senior North Korean official told him that the North was willing to open dialogue with the United States.

headline: Michelle Obama’s Memoir to Arrive in November
teaser: Ms. Obama announced on Sunday that the book will be entitled “Becoming.”

teaser: A call between President Enrique Peña Nieto and President Trump descended into a quarrel over the wall, a topic that is fraying relations and blocking progress on vital issues.

teaser: Navarro is in line for a promotion, sources close to the White House say, a sign more aggressive trade measures such as tariffs may be in store

teaser: Lawmakers have no clear consensus on even incremental changes to gun restrictions, let alone more sweeping legislation.

headline: Trump Trade Sanctions Aimed at China Could Ensnare Canada

teaser: As calls for gun bans intensify after the Parkland shooting, some sellers proudly display AR-15 semiautomatic rifles but say they support some limits.

headline: Democrats Did Better Than on Hundreds of Simulated Pennsylvania Maps

teaser: In his brutally honest memoir, “Eat the Apple,” Matt Young grapples with his experiences in the corps.

headline: Rewrite Iran Deal? Europeans Offer a Different Solution: A New Chapter
teaser: The Europeans are creating an add-on agreement that would extend the existing deal with tighter restrictions, hoping that it will satisfy President Trump.

teaser: Xi Jinping’s grab for power without term limits is the biggest move yet in a global shift by Putin, Erdogan and others toward unabashed authoritarianism.

headline: Justices Turn Down Trump’s Appeal in ‘Dreamers’ Case
teaser: In an unusual move, the Trump administration asked the Supreme Court to hear the case before an appeals court had ruled.

headline: A Key Voice is Silent in Supreme Court Case on Unions
teaser: Justice Neil M. Gorsuch, who holds the crucial vote in a case that could threaten public unions, asked no questions.

headline: Ivanka Trump Calls Question About Father’s Sexual Misconduct ‘Inappropriate’
teaser: “I don’t think that’s a question you would ask many other daughters,” Ms. Trump, a presidential adviser, said. “I believe my father.”

headline: Trump Says He Would Have Rushed In Unarmed to Stop School Shooter
teaser: President Trump said the nation needs to consider opening more mental health institutions to avert mass shootings, and he castigated the Florida police response.

headline: Melania Trump Offers Support for Student Protesters After Florida Shooting
teaser: “I have been heartened to see children across this country using their voices,” Mrs. Trump said of the students, many of whom have pushed for gun measures her husband has resisted.

teaser: A proposed $50 million tax break on jet fuel which would primarily benefit Delta is in jeopardy after the airline eliminated a discount for the N.R.A.

headline: Labor Board’s Do-Over Leaves an Obama-Era Rule Intact
teaser: Citing a member’s conflict in an earlier vote, the panel restored a standard making it easier to hold a company to account for franchisees’ practices.

headline: Mississippi Firebrand Appears Set to Challenge Republican Senator From Right
teaser: State Senator Chris McDaniel, who nearly unseated Senator Thad Cochran in 2014, appears to have his sights on Senator Roger Wicker in 2018.

teaser: The Trumps were upset when they learned that an adviser to the first lady had won a $26 million contract to help plan the president’s inauguration.

headline: Stacey Dash, a Star of ‘Clueless,’ Is Running for Congress
teaser: In Federal Election Commission filings on Monday, Ms. Dash, a Republican, declared her House candidacy in a heavily Democratic California district.

headline: Trump Opens Door, Just Slightly, to Talking With North Korea

headline: Trump Losing College-Educated Whites? He Never Won Them in the First Place
teaser: New evidence that exit polls are a very flawed vehicle for doing post-election analysis.

headline: Nonfiction: A Different Perspective on the Border
teaser: In his memoir, “The Line Becomes a River,” Francisco Cantú argues that understanding immigration required him to be a Border Patrol agent.

headline: No Bail Hearings for Detained Immigrants, Justices Rule
teaser: In a rare move, Justice Stephen G. Breyer dissented from the bench, saying the majority was violating fundamental constitutional principles.

headline: Must Tech Firms Provide Data Held Abroad? Justices Struggle to Apply 1986 Law
teaser: The Supreme Court appeared frustrated by the poor fit between the law and technology in a clash between law enforcement demands and firms’ desire to protect customers’ privacy.

teaser: Lawmakers in both parties are recalibrating their positions on gun control in the wake of the massacre at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

teaser: Steven Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, said he had held “high-level” discussions with counterparts about what it would take for the United States to reverse course.

headline: Jared Kushner’s Security Clearance Downgraded
teaser: The president’s adviser and son-in-law lost his top-secret clearance, a White House official and another person familiar with Mr. Kushner’s situation said.

headline: Most Americans Want More Gun Control. Why Doesn’t It Happen?
teaser: Polls show solid support for stricter laws, especially after mass shootings. But there are also deep disagreement, staunch opposition and growing disenchantment with gun control.

headline: White House Has Given No Orders to Counter Russian Meddling, N.S.A. Chief Says
teaser: Admiral Michael S. Rogers’s testimony was the second time this month that a senior American intelligence official had said that the efforts to interfere in U.S. elections didn’t end in 2016.

headline: Justice Dept. Backs High-Stakes Lawsuit Against Opioid Makers
teaser: Attorney General Jeff Sessions said he would use legal actions and task forces to crack down on prescription opioid manufacturers, distributors and prescribers.

headline: Trump’s 2020 Campaign Announcement Had a Very Trumpian Rollout
teaser: The selection of a close ally of Jared Kushner to run the president’s 2020 campaign was seen as a power move by Mr. Trump’s son-in-law. Elsewhere, Mr. Kushner had a rough day.

headline: As Xi Tightens His Grip on China, U.S. Sees Conflict Ahead
teaser: Whether it is saber-rattling in the South China Sea, proselytizing on American campuses or censorship of the web, China has alienated one constituency after another.

headline: 11 Sickened by Hazardous Envelope Opened on Military Base
teaser: Nine Marines were among those being treated after a letter containing a hazardous but unknown substance was opened on the Virginia base near the Pentagon.

headline: Hope Hicks Acknowledges She Sometimes Tells White Lies for Trump
teaser: Ms. Hicks, the White House communications director, told lawmakers investigating Russia’s election interference that she has not lied about matters relevant to their inquiry.

headline: Judge Orders Tarps Removed From Confederate Statues in Charlottesville
teaser: The city placed black shrouds over statues of Gens. Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson after a deadly white nationalist rally last August.

headline: A Big Divergence Is Coming in Health Care Among States
teaser: As the Trump administration chips away at Obamacare, some states are building it back up.

headline: The Interpreter: Episode 2: National Identity Is Made Up
teaser: Episode two of a new video series from The Interpreter columnists.

teaser: Partisans and analysts are compiling data on how companies are spending their tax savings, in order to score political points and bend corporate behavior.

headline: Amid Turkish Assault, Kurdish Forces Are Drawn Away From U.S. Fight With ISIS
teaser: Kurdish fighters in Syria who have been key in the American-led campaign against the Islamic State are peeling off to respond to Turkish attacks.

headline: On Washington: Once Again, Push for Gun Control Collides With Political Reality
teaser: Despite immense pressure to act, members of Congress are badly divided and prospects for consequential agreement seem slim.

headline: Trump Attacks Sessions Over Handling of Surveillance Abuse Allegations
teaser: The president scolded Mr. Sessions after he suggested that the Justice Department’s inspector general would look into accusations of surveillance abuses.

headline: At the Capitol, Tributes to the Rev. Billy Graham

headline: Rev. Billy Graham Lies in Honor at U.S. Capitol for Day of Remembrance
teaser: Politicians and other well-wishers gathered at the Capitol Wednesday to pay tribute to the Rev. Billy Graham, ahead of his funeral in North Carolina on Friday.

headline: N.R.A. Logo? No. #MeToo Shirt? Maybe. Justices Weigh Political Apparel at Polls.
teaser: A challenge to a Minnesota law barring political clothing at polling places left the Supreme Court considering how to balance free speech rights with civility at the voting booth.

headline: Trump Stuns Lawmakers With Seeming Embrace of Gun Control Measures
teaser: In a televised meeting in the Cabinet Room, the president appeared to stun giddy Democrats and stone-faced Republicans by calling for comprehensive gun control.

headline: Hope Hicks to Leave White House Communications Job

headline: Putting Green in the Tea Party, She Crusades for Clean Power

teaser: The unexpected limbo in which Ahmed Muhammed Haza al-Darbi could encourage — or discourage — other detainees from cooperating in exchange for a deal to leave the prison.

headline: Britain Presses U.S. to Avoid Death Penalty for ISIS Suspects
teaser: The British, who have threatened to withhold important evidence about the two men as leverage, also want them prosecuted in a civilian court, rather than being taken to Guantánamo Bay.

teaser: Walmart joined Dick’s Sporting Goods in changing its firearms policy on Wednesday amid a national debate on guns after the school shooting in Parkland, Fla.

headline: Is Bitcoin a Waste of Electricity, or Something Worse?
teaser: America has a productivity problem. One explanation may be the growing use of real resources to make virtual products.

headline: U.S. Banks on Diplomacy With North Korea, but Moves Ahead on Military Plans
teaser: The American military is looking at everything from troop rotations to surveillance to casualty evacuations should it be ordered to take action against North Korea.
