teaser: President Trump has discussed firing one lawyer, and another has considered quitting. A third, who has pushed theories on television that the F.B.I. framed the president, was hired.

headline: Up, Up, Up Goes the Economy. Here’s What Could Knock It Down.
teaser: Some economists say the recovery could continue for years. But many see the seeds of the next crisis being sown in government policy choices.

headline: As DeVos Faces Congress, Officials Say She Hid Plans to Overhaul Department
teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos will defend her agency’s budget before a House panel, including a reorganization plan that staff members say she tried to withhold from Congress.

headline: What Special Elections Can’t Tell Us About a Democratic Wave
teaser: Higher turnout, as well as the power of incumbency, may help save Republicans in the midterms.

headline: Mnuchin Defends Trump Tariffs as World Economic Leaders Worry
teaser: As global finance ministers gather in Argentina, the United States’ protectionist position on trade has consumed the discussions.

headline: A Republican Appointee to the Senate from Mississippi Has G.O.P. Worried
teaser: The Mississippi governor’s choice to fill the seat of retiring Senator Thad Cochran may give an insurgent conservative an opening — and Democrats a chance.

headline: Ben Carson Defends Purchase of $31,000 Dining Set at Congressional Hearing
teaser: “People were stuck by nails, and a chair had collapsed with someone sitting in it,” said Mr. Carson, describing the furniture he replaced.

headline: Supreme Court Warily Eyes California Law Involving Abortion and Free Speech
teaser: The justices heard arguments in a First Amendment challenge to a law requiring “crisis pregnancy centers” to provide information on abortion.

headline: Joe DiGenova, Loud, Partisan and Now, Trump’s Lawyer
teaser: President Trump hired the outspoken lawyer Joseph E. diGenova on Monday. Mr. diGenova is an aggressive voice who attacks the F.B.I. and defends the president.

headline: Saudi Crown Prince Arrives at White House to Meet with Trump
teaser: The president has lavished praise on Mohammed bin Salman, who has rapidly consolidated his position as Saudi Arabia’s heir apparent.

headline: Trump Says He Congratulated Putin on His Re-Election and They May Meet Soon
teaser: “We had a very good call,” Mr. Trump told reporters in the Oval Office. “We will be meeting in the not-too distant future to discuss the arms race, which is getting out of control.”

headline: Ex-Playboy Model Karen McDougal Sues to Break Silence on Trump
teaser: Ms. McDougal is the second woman this month to challenge Trump associates’ efforts to bury stories of extramarital affairs.

headline: Melania Trump Wants to End Online Bullying. Her Husband Doesn’t Always Help.
teaser: Melania Trump has long said she wants to curb online bullying. Her efforts often clash with the president's habit of using Twitter to insult people.

headline: Senators Warn About Russian Election Meddling and Call for Paper Ballots
teaser: The Senate Intelligence Committee offered recommendations for securing elections and implied that the Trump administration needed to take a harder line against foreign meddling.

headline: Children’s Book About Mike Pence’s Gay Bunny Jumps to No. 1
teaser: John Oliver’s parody of the Pence family’s book about their pet bunny has bumped pre-orders of James B. Comey’s memoir from the top spot.

headline: A Man of Few Words, McConnell Tiptoes Around Issue of Mueller
teaser: Mitch McConnell sees little upside to criticizing the president in public, and some critics say that by not issuing a more direct warning, he is undermining Congress’s standing.

headline: N.I.H. to Investigate Outreach to Alcohol Companies
teaser: After a report in The Times, the National Institutes of Health will examine whether health officials violated government policy by soliciting donations to fund a study of moderate drinking.

headline: Senators Reject Effort to Cut U.S. Support for Saudi-led Campaign in Yemen
teaser: Both Democrats and Republicans declined to back a rare legislative attempt to limit the president’s war powers.

headline: Fox News Analyst Quits, Calling Network a ‘Propaganda Machine’
teaser: Ralph Peters, a retired lieutenant colonel, sent an email to his colleagues saying he was ‘ashamed’ of what the channel had become.

headline: Democrats Tell DeVos Her ‘Head Is in the Sand’ on Racial Bias
teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos defended her spending plan before a House panel, saying that “this budget is about students.” Some lawmakers disagreed.

headline: Denounced by G.O.P. as a Nazi, Arthur Jones Wins Illinois Congressional Primary
teaser: Mr. Jones, a Holocaust denier and former member of the American Nazi Party, was the sole Republican candidate in a suburban Chicago congressional district.

headline: Gov. Bruce Rauner and J.B. Pritzker to Face Off in Illinois
teaser: The embattled Republican incumbent survived a primary race against a conservative challenger and now faces a serious threat from Mr. Pritzker.

headline: South Korea’s Leader Floats 3-Way Talks With Trump and Kim Jong-un
teaser: President Moon Jae-in of South Korea said he hoped that after he and President Trump met separately with Mr. Kim, the three leaders could sit down together.

headline: Fed’s Rate Decision: What to Watch For
teaser: Fed policymakers are expected to increase the benchmark interest rate by a quarter-point and signal their view on whether the economy is overheating.

headline: Elections Security Officials Head to Capitol Hill Amid Warnings of Russian Meddling
teaser: The Senate Intelligence Committee has urged state elections officials to take practical steps to secure ballots.

headline: Trump Criticizes Mueller, Again, as a Former C.I.A. Director Suggests Russia ‘May Have Something’ on the President
teaser: John O. Brennan, a former C.I.A. director, speculated that the Russians “may have something on him personally,” referring to Mr. Trump.

headline: U.S. Taking Negotiations ‘One Week at a Time’ on Expiring Iran Deal
teaser: The chief American envoy to the Iran nuclear talks is banking on political savvy and Midwestern earnestness to salvage the deal that President Trump wants to scrap.

headline: White House Job Requirement: Signing a Nondisclosure Agreement
teaser: President Trump insisted on the agreements, but it’s an open secret in the West Wing they can’t be enforced.

headline: Fed Raises Interest Rates for Sixth Time Since Financial Crisis
teaser: The Federal Reserve, buoyed by a strengthening economy, raised rates for a sixth time in three years and indicated another two increases are still expected this year.

headline: Congressional Leaders Near Deal on Over $1 Trillion Spending Bill
teaser: Lawmakers must approve the bill by midnight Friday to avoid a government shutdown this weekend, which would be the third closure this year.

headline: After Trump, an Oratorio About ‘Dreamers’ Changes Key
teaser: Jimmy López and Nilo Cruz were asked to write a choral piece about young undocumented immigrants. Then President Trump was elected.

headline: What Does John Brennan Know?
teaser: John Brennan, the former C.I.A. director, saw signs of Russian election meddling. Are his suggestive public statements signs that he knows information that he can’t divulge?

headline: U.S. in Talks on Tariff Exemptions, Trade Official Says
teaser: The trade representative said steel and aluminum from the European Union and several other exporters might be spared from tariffs about to be imposed.

headline: Trump Met With the Saudis. There Were No Women at the Table.
teaser: Photos from Tuesday’s meeting show that the dynamics at the table remained relatively unchanged — even amid White House staff shake-ups — and male.

headline: AIDS Researcher Robert R. Redfield Named to Lead the C.D.C.
teaser: Dr. Redfield, a Baltimore AIDS researcher and advocate for medication-assisted therapies to treat addiction, will take over the public health agency.

headline: How a Witness for Mueller and a Republican Donor Influenced the White House for Gulf Rulers
teaser: Hundreds of pages of correspondence between the two men reveal an active effort to cultivate President Trump on behalf of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, both American allies.

headline: F.B.I. Investigated Sessions for Possible Perjury Over Russia Denials
teaser: Andrew G. McCabe, whom Mr. Sessions fired last week, authorized the investigation. Mr. Sessions inaccurately testified that he had no contacts with Russians.

headline: Auction of Oil Drilling Tracts in Gulf Draws Tepid Interest
teaser: Companies bid on only 1 percent of the acreage offered, a setback for Trump administration efforts to revive offshore production.

headline: Trump, Defending Call With Putin, Attacks ‘Crazed’ Media and His Predecessors
teaser: The president argued that the conversation in which he congratulated President Vladimir V. Putin could help relations with Russia and, in turn, national security interests.

headline: Trump Plans to Slap Stiff Tariffs and Investment Restrictions on China
teaser: The president, denouncing China’s trade practices, will announce a range of stiff penalties on Chinese imports and investment, sparking concerns of a trade war.

headline: Ex-Chief of C.I.A. Suggests Putin May Have Compromising Information on Trump
teaser: John O. Brennan said Russia may have compromising information on President Trump, setting off furious speculation about whether the former spy chief was basing that assertion on inside information.

headline: House Passes Bill That Would Give Patients Access to Experimental Drugs
teaser: Supporters of the “right to try” bill said it would give dying patients a chance to obtain potentially helpful prescription drugs without waiting for the completion of clinical trials.

headline: Border Wall Not High Priority for Front-Line Agents, Study Finds
teaser: A report released by Democrats on the Senate Homeland Security Committee found that agents more often cited needs for technology and personnel to secure the border with Mexico.

headline: Trump Threatens Biden, Saying He ‘Would Go Down Fast and Hard’ if They Fought
teaser: Mr. Trump said Mr. Biden “would go down fast and hard” if the two men fought. Mr. Biden had said that, if he was in high school, he would “beat the hell” out of Mr. Trump for disrespecting women.

headline: E.U. Said to Be Close to Winning Exemption From U.S. Steel Tariffs
teaser: The bloc’s top trade official expressed optimism after talks in Washington, but said the final decision would be up to President Trump.

headline: John Dowd Resigns as Trump’s Lead Lawyer in Special Counsel Inquiry
teaser: Mr. Dowd’s departure is the latest change among President Trump’s legal team as the president has begun directly attacking the special counsel in public.

headline: Trump Hits China With Trade Measures as White House Exempts Allies From Tariffs
teaser: President Trump said he will impose about $60 billion worth of annual tariffs against Chinese imports.

headline: House Passes $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill; Focus Shifts to Senate as Clock Ticks
teaser: Government funding is set to expire at midnight Friday, and the Senate’s approval is still needed to avert what would be the third government shutdown of the year.

headline: ‘I Take Responsibility,’ Carson Says of $31,000 Furniture Purchase
teaser: Facing withering criticism from a Senate subcommittee, the secretary of housing and urban development followed the advice of his aides, who in recent days have urged him to apologize for the purchase.

headline: House Republicans Say G.O.P. Establishment Opened Way for Russian Influence
teaser: House Republicans, over Democrats’ objections, voted Thursday to release a report concluding there was no collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia.

headline: Unbecoming a Trump
teaser: After a dozen years, Vanessa Haydon Trump says she is leaving the first family.

headline: Tillerson Says Goodbye to ‘a Very Mean-Spirited Town’
teaser: In a farewell speech, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson urged respect and civility in a time and town where he was fired by a presidential Twitter post.

headline: Three Examples of John Bolton’s Longtime Hard-line Views
teaser: Mr. Bolton is known as an uncompromising, often undiplomatic conservative. Some of his views were once out of the mainstream. But not now.

headline: Beyond Gun Control, Student Marchers Aim to Upend Elections
teaser: With hundreds of March for Our Lives demonstrations planned for Saturday, high school students say this is a moment of political awakening for their generation.

headline: Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster to Leave the Trump White House
teaser: Lt. Gen. McMaster is the latest in a series of high-profile exits from President Trump’s administration. He will be replaced as national security adviser by John R. Bolton, a former ambassador to the United Nations.

headline: Spending Plan Moving Through Congress Is a Rebuke to Trump. Here’s Why.
teaser: Even with Republicans in charge, the measure increases funding for many programs the president had sought to cut or kill, and in some cases bars him from pursuing his goals.

headline: State Dept. Approves $670 Million Arms Deal With Saudi Arabia
teaser: The proposed sale, which is bound to be questioned by Congress, came hours after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met with Pentagon leaders to discuss the Saudi-led bombing campaign in Yemen.

headline: His Brother Was Shot in Chicago. He’s Marching With Students From Parkland.
teaser: Ke’Shon Newman’s brother was shot nine times on Chicago’s South Side, where gun violence is a daily threat. Now, Ke’Shon is heading to Washington to march with high school students from Parkland, Fla.

headline: John Bolton, Fresh From Fox News, Joins the Trump Cast
teaser: Mr. Bolton, the next national security adviser, was a longtime commentator. He’s the latest TV personality to go from the small screen to the White House.

headline: News Analysis: With Bolton, Trump Creates a Historically Hard-Line Foreign Policy Team
teaser: There is little in John R. Bolton’s past to indicate he has much time for the diplomatic process, where to get something the United States also gives something.

headline: Mattis Says Guantánamo Lawyers Were Fired Over Temperament, Not Legal Work
teaser: The Pentagon’s abrupt ouster of the top two officials overseeing the Guantánamo military commissions system stemmed from management concerns, the defense secretary said.

headline: How the Left and the Right Reacted to John Bolton as National Security Adviser
teaser: News that Mr. Bolton will become President Trump’s third national security adviser was met with immediate acclaim and criticism. We rounded some of it up for you.

headline: Ex-Playboy Model Karen McDougal Details 10-Month Affair With Donald Trump
teaser: In a lengthy television interview, Ms. McDougal said she was hurt when the president offered her money after sex, but added that they ended up in love.

headline: Man in the News: John Bolton, an Undiplomatic Voice for American Might
teaser: If President Trump wanted a national security adviser who would match his confrontational approach to the world, then Mr. Bolton fits the bill.

headline: Trump Chooses Bolton for 3rd Security Adviser as Shake-Up Continues
teaser: President Trump named John R. Bolton, a hard-line former American ambassador to the United Nations, to replace Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster.

headline: Trump Administration Retreats on Tip-Sharing Plan in Compromise
teaser: A Labor Department proposal would have given employers control over redistribution of tips, but the congressional spending bill would establish strict limits.

headline: Harry Reid Bids Washington Goodbye: ‘Shake My Head Is All I Can Do’
teaser: The former Senate Democratic leader plans to pull up stakes in the capital, saying that his “life’s not the Senate any more.”

headline: Vote Fraud Crusader Kris Kobach Takes His Case to Court, and to Kansas Voters
teaser: Kris Kobach, a leader on President Trump’s now-disbanded vote fraud commission, is defending a Kansas voter restriction in court. He also is running for governor.

headline: Trump Says He May Veto Spending Bill, Risking Government Shutdown
teaser: The president complains the spending bill fails to address immigration issues and the border wall. A presidential veto could shut down the government.

headline: Bolton Was Early Beneficiary of Cambridge Analytica’s Facebook Data
teaser: The political action committee founded by John Bolton hired Cambridge Analytica specifically to develop psychological profiles of voters — and it knew the firm was using Facebook data.

headline: ‘Something About Parkland Has Been Different’: Survivors From 20 Years of Mass Shootings Speak
teaser: We spoke to survivors of mass shootings and others affected by them about the demonstrations planned for Saturday. Their voices are a tiny sampling of the thousands who have been similarly affected.

headline: Responding to Trump’s Tariffs, China Shows ‘Cautious Anger’
teaser: Beijing’s response to tariffs proposed by the United States has been restrained, so far. But China knows it has more weapons in its arsenal.

headline: U.S. Charges 9 Iranians in Huge Theft of Intellectual Property
teaser: The suspects worked at the Mabna Institute, a contractor for the Iranian government, which benefited from the sensitive information obtained in the hacks, officials said.

headline: Zell Miller, Feisty Democrat Who Sided With G.O.P., Dies at 86
teaser: Mr. Miller rose to governor of Georgia, then filled a Senate seat, where he showed his independence with a tart convention speech backing George W. Bush.

headline: Watch Live: President Trump Discusses Spending Bill
teaser: President Trump is speaking about security and the spending bill that recently passed through Congress.

headline: Trump Signs Spending Bill, Then Slams It
teaser: President Trump complained about the $1.3 trillion spending bill, but said he signed it because it increases funding for the military.

headline: After Another Week of Chaos, Trump Heads to Palm Beach. No One Knows What Comes Next.
teaser: President Trump prepared to leave the White House for Florida after a head-spinning series of moves on national security, trade, the budget and with his legal team.

headline: Despite Trump Threat, N.E.A and N.E.H Are Spared in Spending Bill
teaser: For a second time, Congress rebuffed President Trump’s call to eliminate the arts endowments. In fact, the N.E.A. and N.E.H. are seeing slight increases in funding.

headline: Budget Deal in Congress Includes Help for Affordable Housing
teaser: The spending compromise would increase tax credits used to finance housing for the poor. Last year’s tax bill had undermined the program.

headline: Trump’s Tariff Moves: What You Need to Know
teaser: The two-pronged trade offensive aimed at China, and China’s initial response, may be only the start of a complex, escalating economic battle.

headline: A Lot Has Happened This Week, Even by Trump Standards. Let Us Catch You Up.
teaser: Here are six of the biggest stories driving American politics this week.

headline: Justice Dept. Proposes Banning Bump Stocks, Setting Aside Its Own Recommendations
teaser: The moves come amid rising public pressure on the Trump administration to find ways to limit gun violence after a mass shooting in Parkland, Fla.

headline: Why Can’t Dying Patients Get the Drugs They Want?
teaser: A Republican-backed “Right to Try” bill would allow patients to sidestep F.D.A. approval. But the true gatekeepers are the drug companies themselves.

headline: Fact Check: Trump’s Objections Require Some Corrections
teaser: President Trump said that American troops would receive the largest pay raise in a decade and that Democrats fought against a solution for Dreamers. Neither claim is true.

headline: Trump Approves New Limits on Transgender Troops in the Military
teaser: The directive essentially bans service members from identifying as transgender, but it also largely gives the Pentagon the ability to make exceptions.

headline: Justice Dept. Revives Push to Mandate a Way to Unlock Phones
teaser: F.B.I. and Justice Department officials have been quietly meeting with security researchers who have been working on approaches to provide such access to encrypted devices.

headline: Transgender Workers Gain New Protection Under Court Ruling
teaser: Federal judges say that employers cannot legally discriminate against employees transitioning from one sex to the other.

headline: News Analysis: ‘America First’ Bears a New Threat: Military Force
teaser: Not since the immediate aftermath of Sept. 11, 2001, have key national security leaders so publicly raised the threat of armed confrontation if foreign adversaries do not meet America’s demands.

headline: Stormy Daniels, Trump’s Unlikely Foe, Is ‘Not Someone to Be Underestimated’
teaser: To many in the capital, the pornographic actress has become an unexpected force. But those who know her well view the moment differently.

headline: As Ties With Mexico Fray, Kushner Works Quietly to Mend Them
teaser: Allies of Jared Kushner and Mexican officials say he has worked, with some success, to preserve a relationship that has been corroded by President Trump’s clashes with his Mexican counterpart.

headline: Students Lead Huge Rallies for Gun Control Across the U.S.
teaser: The young people, as they seized the nation’s attention, vowed that their grief about school shootings and their frustration with adults’ inaction would power a new generation of activism.

headline: Demonstrators Who Brought Guns and an Opposing Message
teaser: Supporters of the Second Amendment gathered at state capitals and in city centers on Saturday, hoping to counter hundreds of thousands who rallied for stricter gun laws.

headline: Mini-Vows: A Merger for the Rabbi and the Labor Leader
teaser: Randi Weingarten recalled her first date with Sharon Kleinbaum: There was no political-speak. “I didn’t want the night to end,” she said.

headline: Trump Won’t Hire 2 Lawyers Whose Appointments Were Announced Days Ago
teaser: The upheaval on the legal team comes at a critical time for Mr. Trump. The president’s former lead lawyer, John Dowd, quit the team on Thursday, just as Mr. Trump is deciding whether to sit with Mr. Mueller for an interview.

headline: Gun Marches Keep Republicans on Defense in Midterm Races
teaser: The March for Our Lives is another display of energy on the left, but the gun issue could play out differently in House and Senate races.

headline: U.S. Strikes Qaeda Target in Southern Libya, Expanding Shadow War There
teaser: The United States acknowledged its first ever drone strike in southern Libya, hitting a suspected Qaeda safe house and killing two militants.

headline: Opposing Factions Join to Push Confirmation of a Gay Trump Appointee
teaser: Scores of the president’s nominees are held up in the Senate, but few confirmation drives have turned into a causes as the one for his pick for ambassador to Germany has.

headline: At a Crucial Juncture, Trump’s Legal Defense Is Largely a One-Man Operation
teaser: President Trump is struggling to find any top lawyers willing to represent him as he faces a critical decision: whether to give the special counsel an interview.

headline: When Professionals Rise Up, More Than Money Is at Stake
teaser: The teacher uprising that began in West Virginia has exposed a trend among white-collar workers: a feeling that their credentials are being devalued.

headline: Fund-Raiser Held Out Access to Trump as a Prize for Prospective Clients
teaser: The fund-raiser, Elliott Broidy, suggested to prospective clients of his security firm, including some with unsavory records, that he could arrange meetings with the president or his associates.

headline: She Was Shot in Parkland. Can She Turn Trauma Into Change?
teaser: Samantha Fuentes, 18, was hit by gunfire from an AR-15 rifle at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School last month. Onstage, she’s helping to lead a national conversation about gun control. Behind the scenes, she’s reeling from mental and physical trauma.

headline: Trump Orders Expulsion of 60 Russians Over Poison Attack in Britain
teaser: The expulsion order included 12 people identified as Russian intelligence officers stationed at the United Nations. The Russian Consulate in Seattle also must close.

headline: Trump Can’t Stop Tweeting, but Goes Silent on Stormy Daniels
teaser: After sixty-one weeks in the White House, President Trump has found someone he won’t attack on Twitter: Stormy Daniels.

headline: Stormy Daniels Attracts 22 Million Viewers to ‘60 Minutes’
teaser: The CBS show had its best ratings since a 2008 segment with Barack and Michelle Obama — drawing two million more than its 2016 Trump interview.

headline: Trump’s New Judicial Litmus Test: Shrinking ‘the Administrative State’
teaser: The Trump administration has been surprisingly frank in saying it wants to use the courts to curb the power of federal agencies, a longstanding goal of conservatives.

headline: Trump Talks of Bringing Back Rob Porter, Aide Accused of Spousal Abuse
teaser: The president has remained in touch with Mr. Porter, who resigned under pressure as White House staff secretary, according to people familiar with the conversations.

headline: The Post-World War II Order Is Under Assault From the Powers That Built It
teaser: Since the end of World War II, the victorious powers have promoted, trade, democracy and collective security. Now, that order is under assault.

headline: New York Fed Weighs a Wall Street Overseer and Left Spies an Opening
teaser: Progressive groups want a New York Fed chief who is independent of the financial sector, a voice for labor and a reflection of diversity.

headline: After Stormy Daniels, Republicans Face a Referendum on Trump’s Conduct
teaser: As gun control, immigration and taxes energize voters in both parties, the Stormy Daniels allegations have intensified discomfort with the president’s behavior.

headline: Scores of Russians Expelled by U.S. and Its Allies Over U.K. Poisoning
teaser: The mass expulsion of Russian personnel in the United States was the largest ever, yet the president avoided any public condemnation of Russia’s role in an attack in Britain.

headline: Despite Concerns, Census Will Ask Respondents if They Are U.S. Citizens
teaser: Critics fear that the highly charged request by the Trump administration will result in a substantial undercount of the population.

headline: Economic Scene: Trump’s China Policy Has a Flaw: It Makes China the Winner
teaser: Confronting Beijing over trade abuses is not without merit. But rejecting economic alliances opens the way to Chinese initiatives around the region.

headline: Parkland Students Find Themselves Targets of Lies and Personal Attacks
teaser: David Hogg is not an actor. He was indeed at school that day. Emma González did not tear up a copy of the Constitution.

headline: Breitbart, Facing Headwinds, Tries a New Tack: Live Events
teaser: The right-wing website is taking a cue from one of its foes — the mainstream media — and sponsoring a town-hall event in suburban New Orleans next month.

headline: Here’s Why an Accurate Census Count is So Important
teaser: The 2020 census will influence everything from the number of congressional seats to where businesses open to funding for local governments, which is why an accurate count matters.

headline: Trump Ends Temporary Immigration Status for Thousands of Liberians
teaser: President Trump cited improved conditions in Liberia as evidence that the program, which allowed Liberians to live and work legally in the U.S., is no longer needed.

headline: Homeland Security Chief Warns Adversaries Against Election Meddling
teaser: In a closed-door meeting, Kirstjen Nielsen, the homeland security chief, also vowed retaliation against nations that interfere in the midterm elections this year.

headline: At Least Twelve States to Sue Trump Administration Over Census Citizenship Question
teaser: Opponents said the question was certain to depress response to the census from noncitizens and even legal immigrants.

headline: A Low-Profile Trump Travels to Virginia to Meet With Donors
teaser: President Trump left the confines of the White House at night to travel to the home of Giuseppe Cecchi, a real estate developer who hosted a fund-raiser for him in 2016.

headline: Trump, Famous for ‘You’re Fired,’ Offers V.A. Chief Only Awkward Silence
teaser: The peculiar, painful limbo of David Shulkin shows how the president often handles personnel matters: publicly, hoping the employee will leave instead of forcing an ouster.

headline: Trump Secures Trade Deal With South Korea Ahead of Nuclear Talks
teaser: President Trump won his first bilateral trade deal with South Korea this week but whether it is a template for future agreements remains in question.

headline: Sessions and Kushner Square Off, and Prisoners Hang in the Balance
teaser: Tensions over criminal justice policy have pitted the president’s son-in-law against his attorney general, and resulted in a seesawing approach to prisons.

headline: Trump Says Second Amendment ‘Will Never Be Repealed’
teaser: President Trump’s declaration, after days of silence on gun control, came in response to an Op-Ed by the retired Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens.

headline: What a Times Political Reporter Learned From the 2016 Election
teaser: I paid too much attention to rules about candidates’ behavior and credentials, and too little to rules about who gets to vote and whose votes matter the most.

headline: Soul-Searching From Ad Group That Lauded Cambridge Analytica
teaser: The Advertising Research Foundation, which gave an award to the research firm last year for its work with data, now says advertisers need to consider the ethics of how consumer data is collected and used.

headline: Trump Aide Spoke During Campaign to Associate Tied to Russian Intelligence
teaser: The campaign official, Rick Gates, has pleaded guilty in the investigation by the special counsel into Russian election interference.

headline: Supreme Court Again Weighs Voting Maps Warped by Politics
teaser: The new case is a Republican challenge to a Maryland congressional district. A second case, a Democratic challenge from Wisconsin, is pending.

headline: ‘Roseanne’ Revival Wins Huge TV Ratings
teaser: More than 18 million watched ABC’s reboot of a show that has more than nostalgic appeal.

headline: Trump’s Lawyer Raised Prospect of Pardons for Flynn and Manafort as Special Counsel Closed In
teaser: The episode raises questions about whether the president’s lawyer was trying to influence Mr. Trump’s former advisers and their cooperation with the special counsel.

headline: Walmart Pulls Cosmo From Checkout. Plus! Guess Who’s Claiming Victory.
teaser: The National Center on Sexual Exploitation took credit for the decision, linking it to the #MeToo movement, but the retailer would only cite business reasons.

headline: Nancy McFadden, 59, Adviser to Bill Clinton and Jerry Brown, Dies
teaser: A campaign aide to Mr. Clinton in 1992, she joined his administration before becoming Governor Brown’s right hand in Sacramento.

headline: American Drone Strike in Libya Kills Top Qaeda Recruiter
teaser: The recruiter, Musa Abu Dawud, provided logistics, money and weapons that enabled the group to threaten and attack U.S. and Western interests, the military said.

headline: Veterans Affairs Secretary Is Latest to Go as Trump Shakes Up Cabinet
teaser: The move punctuated what has been a sharp fall from favor for David J. Shulkin, who delivered President Trump a string of bipartisan legislative victories.

headline: Critics See Echoes of ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell’ in Military Transgender Ban
teaser: The Pentagon’s recommendations on when transgender people can serve in the military were rife with contradictions, said critics who are ready to challenge them in court.

headline: Trade Deals Take Years. Trump Wants to Remake Them in Months.
teaser: A series of looming deadlines will put pressure on U.S. partners to reach deals, in a high-risk strategy that may not solve deeper and more persistent problems.

headline: Justice Dept. Will Be Investigated Over Surveillance of Trump Campaign Official
teaser: The department’s inspector general announced that he would examine whether law enforcement officials followed the law in seeking permission to surveil a former Trump campaign adviser.

headline: In Arizona Race, Conservatives View Stormy Daniels as a ‘Little Hard to Believe’
teaser: Many voters in Arizona’s Eighth Congressional District seem to take Stormy Daniels’s claim of an affair with Donald Trump with a dose of skepticism.

headline: Trump Rings Up Roseanne Barr After Her Show Is a Ratings Winner
teaser: The president, an obsessive about TV ratings, was said to have been enthralled by the “huge” ratings the show had drawn.

headline: ‘Kiss Up, Kick Down’: Those Recalling Bolton’s U.N. Confirmation Process Say He Hasn’t Changed
teaser: The five months in 2005 that the Senate took to decide whether John Bolton should go to the United Nations is the only extensive examination of his record.

headline: Why John Bolton’s 2005 Nomination Sputtered
teaser: President Trump’s hawkish choice for national security adviser doesn’t need the Senate’s approval. That may be lucky for him. The last time senators reviewed his record, many didn’t like what they saw.

headline: Trump Attacks Amazon, Saying It Does Not Pay Enough Taxes
teaser: The president’s commentary, made in a Twitter post, comes amid reports that Mr. Trump has expressed an interest in reining in the e-commerce business.

headline: Eric Holder Speaks With The Times
teaser: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.

headline: Eric Holder Says He’ll Sue to Block Census Change
teaser: In a wide-ranging TimesTalks conversation, Mr. Holder, the former attorney general, also said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.

headline: Fact Check: The Facts Behind Trump’s Tweet on Amazon, Taxes and the Postal Service
teaser: President Trump criticized Amazon again, causing its stock price to decrease. Here are the facts behind his tweets.

headline: Citing Trump’s ‘Racial Slurs,’ Judge Says Suit to Preserve DACA Can Continue
teaser: A federal judge in Brooklyn said President Trump’s language had created a “plausible inference” that the decision to end DACA violated the Constitution.

headline: Trump Heralds a New Trade Deal, Then Says He Might Delay It
teaser: In a meandering speech, Mr. Trump seemed to undercut his own administration’s initiatives, including on infrastructure and a trade agreement with South Korea.

headline: Sessions Rejects Republican Calls for Second Special Counsel
teaser: Lawmakers had sought an independent inquiry into the surveillance of a former Trump aide, but the attorney general said the matter was already being investigated.

headline: Veterans Affairs Shake-Up Stirs New Fears of Privatized Care
teaser: The issue has been at the center of months of intrigue at the sprawling department charged with caring for the United States’ 20 million veterans.

headline: ‘Roseanne’ Reboot Sprang From ABC’s Heartland Strategy After Trump’s Victory
teaser: The network realized it was leaving some viewers behind — and put into effect a plan that brought back a working-class sitcom.

headline: Hope Hicks is Gone, and It’s Not Clear Who Can Replace Her
teaser: Thursday was the last day at the White House for the 29-year-old from Connecticut, who followed an unlikely career path to become a presidential confidante.

headline: Wooing Saudi Business, Tabloid Mogul Had a Powerful Friend: Trump
teaser: A dinner at the White House helped David J. Pecker, whose company owns The National Enquirer, showcase his connections as he sought to expand into Saudi Arabia.

headline: 5 Times David Pecker and The Enquirer Defended or Championed Trump
teaser: Mr. Trump and Mr. Pecker have long enjoyed a mutually beneficial relationship, and the tabloid mogul has showcased his access to the president.

headline: Silicon Valley Warms to Trump After a Chilly Start
teaser: Even though Mr. Trump still takes potshots at Amazon, the industry’s relationship with the White House is shifting as tech companies find some common ground with the president.

headline: On Washington: Broad Spending Bills Here to Stay as Long as Congressional Dysfunction Reigns
teaser: Without major change, spending bills that are too big to veto will most likely remain the standard in Congress, despite President Trump’s insistence that he’ll never sign one again.

headline: Trump, Lacking Leverage Over North Korea, Takes Aim at South Instead
teaser: By tying a trade deal with South Korea to progress in denuclearizing Pyongyang, President Trump is pressuring an ally hoping it will help him deal with a reclusive foe.

headline: What Happened at the Pulse Nightclub
teaser: In one of the deadliest mass shootings in American history, Omar Mateen killed 49 people at a gay nightclub in Orlando. Here’s how that attack unfolded.

headline: How Will the Midterm Elections Play Out? Watch Pennsylvania
teaser: With a clutch of newly flippable House seats and signs of growing voter restiveness, the state is shaping up as a focal point in the fight for control of Congress, strategists in both parties say.

headline: Let Us Catch You Up on the Biggest Stories in Politics This Week
teaser: From the expulsion of Russian diplomats to a citizenship question on the 2020 census, here are five of the biggest stories driving U.S. politics this week, in a nutshell.

headline: U.S. Says It Can Pay for 100 Miles of Wall on 2,000-Mile Border
teaser: The Trump administration called the money for building new and replacement barriers a first step in the president’s promise for a border wall with Mexico.

headline: ‘It’s Factory North America,’ but Trump Could Hobble It
teaser: What the journey of a Union Pacific locomotive reveals about Trump’s plans for the North American economy.

headline: Video Explainer: Breaking Down the 27 Words of the Second Amendment
teaser: Adam Liptak, who covers the Supreme Court for The New York Times, explains what he calls “the most cryptic part of the United States Constitution.”

headline: Massachusetts, a Health Pioneer, Turns Its Focus to Drug Prices. It’s in for a Fight.
teaser: A state proposal to limit the number of drugs covered by Medicaid, fiercely opposed by patients and drug companies, has drawn national attention as states struggle to pay for costly new medicines.

headline: At the Justice Dept.’s Death Penalty Unit, Accusations of Favoritism, Gender Bias and Unwanted Groping
teaser: For years, employees complained about the behavior of the head of the division, Kevin Carwile, and what they viewed as a toxic culture.

headline: Laura Ingraham Takes a Week Off as Advertisers Drop Her Show
teaser: Fox News said its host was taking a preplanned vacation after she was criticized for saying that the Parkland, Fla., shooting survivor David Hogg was whining about getting rejected from colleges.

headline: Jerry Brown Pardons 5 Ex-Convicts Facing Deportation, Provoking Trump
teaser: In the latest flare-up of tensions between California and Washington, President Trump criticized the governor for granting the pardons.

headline: The Taliban Have Gone High-Tech. That Poses a Dilemma for the U.S.
teaser: American commanders have been forced to consider loosening restrictions on access to night-vision devices for Afghan forces, even though they fear the equipment could be lost or sold underground.

headline: Congressional Memo: Even Republicans Have Used the ‘I’ Word, but Would Firing Mueller Get Trump Impeached?
teaser: A few Republicans have suggested that the dismissal of Robert S. Mueller III as special counsel could lead to President Trump’s impeachment, but it is unclear how.

headline: After Gun Control Marches, ‘It’ll Go Away’ vs. ‘We Are Not Cynical Yet’
teaser: Advocates as well as opponents of gun control, both plotting next steps after the March for Our Lives rally, think their adversaries will eventually tire.

headline: Venting on Immigration, Trump Vows ‘No More DACA Deal’ and Threatens Nafta
teaser: President Trump blamed Democrats and the Mexican government for an increasingly “dangerous” flow of illegal immigrants.

headline: It Oversaw For-Profit Colleges That Imploded. Now It Seeks a Comeback.
teaser: The Accrediting Council for Independent Colleges and Schools, which was stripped of its power by the Obama Education Department, is pursuing a return under a more for-profit-friendly administration.

headline: Hollywood’s Ambassador, Schooled in Diplomacy and the Muppets
teaser: Charles H. Rivkin, an assistant secretary of state during the Obama administration, is now the chairman of the Motion Picture Association of America. He takes over in a time of upheaval.

headline: China Slaps Tariffs on U.S. Products in Warning Shot to Trump
teaser: The Chinese Ministry of Commerce announced tariffs of up to 25 percent on 128 American-made products, retaliating against steel and aluminum tariffs.

headline: Sidebar: ‘A Bit of Divine Justice’: Trump Vowed to Change Libel Law. But Not Like This.
teaser: The president was on the losing side of a libel ruling that could make it easier for victims of sexual misconduct to sue when they are called liars.

headline: Why Sinclair Made Dozens of Local News Anchors Recite the Same Script
teaser: Last month, anchors at local news stations across the country made identical comments about media bias. The script came from their owner, Sinclair Broadcast Group.

headline: Trump Says DACA Is ‘Dead,’ and Calls On Mexico to Enforce Border Security
teaser: Mr. Trump’s tweets were a continuation of his Easter Sunday statements blaming Democrats and the Mexican government for the illegal flow of immigrants.

headline: Supreme Court Rules for Police Officer in Excessive Force Case
teaser: Justice Sotomayor issued an impassioned dissent, saying the majority had told officers that they can “shoot first and think later.”

headline: From Thai Jail, Sex Coaches Say They Want to Trade U.S.-Russia Secrets for Safety
teaser: A Belarusian escort and her “seduction coach” fear deportation from Thailand, saying they know too much about Russian meddling in the 2016 American election.

headline: Trump Suggested Putin Visit the White House, Officials Say
teaser: But the offer, supposedly issued in a March 20 telephone call, may be less than solid, especially as relations have spiraled downward since.

headline: Calling Standards ‘Too High,’ E.P.A. Moves to Relax Car Pollution Rules
teaser: Scott Pruitt, head of the Environmental Protection Agency, announced a plan to weaken Obama-era greenhouse gas and fuel economy measures.

headline: Democrat Elizabeth Esty Won’t Seek Re-election to House Over Abuse Controversy
teaser: The Connecticut congresswoman has been consumed by revelations that she waited three months to fire a former aide who harassed and threatened to kill a co-worker.

headline: A Border Patrol Agent (and Frequent Fox News Guest) Has Trump’s Ear on Immigration
teaser: Brandon Judd, who has reiterated talking points that include pushing for a border wall, has earned President Trump’s praise for his television appearances.

headline: Treasury’s Tax Law Architect, Justin Muzinich, Is Tapped as Deputy Secretary
teaser: The promotion of Mr. Muzinich, who spent most of his career on Wall Street, elevates a moderate voice within the Trump economic team.

headline: In Indiana and Beyond, Bruising G.O.P. Primary Fights Worry Party Leaders
teaser: Republican Senate candidates in states won by President Trump are in primary fights that could leave them weakened in fall contests against vulnerable Democrats.

headline: Weaken Consumer Bureau, Its Chief Requests in First Report to Congress
teaser: Mick Mulvaney, the acting director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, wants to cripple the agency he has long criticized and been tasked to lead.

headline: In Latest Clash With California, Justice Dept. Sues Over Land Use Law
teaser: The Trump administration’s second suit against the state called the statute unconstitutional, and Attorney General Jeff Sessions accused California’s leaders of acting as if they were “above the law.”

headline: Stormy Daniels Case Should Be Resolved Privately, Trump’s Lawyers Say
teaser: President Trump and a company affiliated with him are seeking to force the pornographic film star into arbitration, rather than a public legal process.

headline: China Finds California Wine Pairs Well With a Trade War
teaser: Retaliatory tariffs are a blow to exporters increasingly catering to young, newly wealthy Chinese looking for bottles with cachet.

headline: Young Women Help Lead Campaigns to Success at the Polls
teaser: Hillary Clinton’s stunning defeat in 2016 prompted a record number of women to run for office. A new legion of young women running campaigns has followed.

headline: Trump Begins Third Day of Twitter Attacks on ‘Weak’ Border Laws
teaser: The president also called on Congress to act, following a new push for legislation to enforce immigration laws for those living illegally in the United States.

headline: The Lone Journalist on the Scene When King Was Shot and the Newsroom He Rallied
teaser: Earl Caldwell made history before he wrote it on the night of April 4, 1968, when he reported firsthand on the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. for The New York Times.

headline: Dr. King Said Segregation Harms Us All. Environmental Research Shows He Was Right.
teaser: Both minorities and whites who live in racially divided communities are exposed to higher levels of pollution than those who live in more integrated areas.

headline: Connie Lawn, Independent White House Reporter, Dies at 73
teaser: Ms. Lawn built her nearly 50-year career at the White House without the consistent support of a major media company.

headline: New York Fed Names John Williams President, Bucking Calls for Diversity
teaser: The appointment of the current San Francisco Fed chief brings policymaking experience to a role seen as one of the Fed’s most influential positions.

headline: Economic Scene: Charitable Giving by Corporations Is Also About Getting, a New Study Finds
teaser: An analysis of corporate philanthropy finds that donations to causes affiliated with politicians look a lot like lobbying.

headline: Anna Chennault, Behind-the-Scenes Force in Washington, Dies at 94
teaser: A writer, executive and Republican fund-raiser who dabbled in Cold War foreign intrigue after the death of her husband, a famous general in World War II.

headline: White House Turf Battle Threatens to Delay Tax Law Rollout
teaser: The Office of Management and Budget and the Treasury Department are at odds over the Treasury’s longtime independence in writing tax regulations.

headline: Fact-check: A Twitter Rant That Rails and Misleads on Immigration Policy
teaser: Three days of presidential tweets contained many false and misleading accusations.

headline: Looking for Justice in the Building That Bears Its Name
teaser: A Times reporter who has covered law enforcement under five attorneys general finds that each brings a personal conviction about what fairness and justice mean.

headline: White House Unveils Tariffs on 1,300 Chinese Products
teaser: The Trump administration released a list of Chinese goods that it will subject to tariffs, including electronics, iron and steel plates, engines and optical scanners.

headline: The Final Obamacare Tally Is In. About 400,000 Fewer People Signed Up This Year.
teaser: The drop in enrollment was smaller than many expected, given the Trump administration’s cutbacks in outreach and efforts to undermine the health law.

headline: For Scott Pruitt, a Spotlight Shines on His Ethics, Not His E.P.A. Rollbacks
teaser: As the E.P.A. chief announced his most sweeping regulatory rollback to date, he found himself caught up in a swirl of allegations of impropriety.

headline: White House Memo: On Foreign Policy, President Trump Reverts to Candidate Trump
teaser: Far from learning on the job or modifying his views, Mr. Trump is falling back on the familiar mix of belligerence and isolationism that fueled his campaign.

headline: Amazon Has Lots of Company as Trump Slams ‘Stupid’ Businesses
teaser: Tech firms, military contractors, carmakers, cellphone companies, financial firms, sports leagues and Wall Street giants are all in his Twitter cross hairs.

headline: White House Says U.S. Will Remain in Syria Despite Trump’s Eagerness to Withdraw
teaser: The decision came a day after Mr. Trump made plain his eagerness to pull American troops out of Syria, arguing that the battle against ISIS was essential over.

headline: Government Watchdog Finds Racial Bias in School Discipline
teaser: The Government Accountability Office found that black students continue to bear the brunt of tough school discipline, despite efforts to examine the problem.

headline: Cambridge Analytica and Facebook: The Scandal and the Fallout So Far
teaser: Revelations that digital consultants to the Trump campaign misused the data of millions of Facebook users set off a furor on both sides of the Atlantic. This is how The Times covered it.

headline: John Kasich Is Back in New Hampshire. It’s Not for the Foliage.
teaser: On the itinerary for the Ohio governor and 2016 presidential hopeful: a diner visit, a Q. and A. with students and criticism of President Trump amid speculation about a 2020 run.

headline: Can Paul Ryan Be Defeated? Maybe Not, but His Race Is ‘a Circus’
teaser: The House speaker, Paul D. Ryan, still projects power, but back home in Wisconsin, he is facing political challengers from both the right and the left.

headline: Trump Will Work With Governors to Deploy National Guard to the Border
teaser: “It’s time to act,” said Kirstjen Nielsen, the secretary of homeland security, as she outlined the policy during a White House briefing.

headline: ‘You Hate America!’: How ‘the Caravan’ Story Exploded on the Right
teaser: The coverage tends to play on the fears that hiding among mass groups of immigrants are criminals, vectors of disease and terrorists.

headline: Is Amazon Bad for the Postal Service? Or Its Savior?
teaser: President Trump says Amazon costs the U.S.P.S. billions of dollars. But the available evidence is far less certain, and some of it suggests the opposite.

headline: ‘All It Takes Is One Mistake’: Worries Over Plan to Send National Guard to Border
teaser: Pentagon officials have expressed concern about being seen as picking a fight with an ally at a time when the military has plenty of adversaries to contend with.

headline: How U.S.-China Trade Spat Could Threaten Manufacturing
teaser: If the tariffs stand, along with China’s retaliatory moves, they could damage industries that have relied on a global supply chain for their recovery.

headline: News Analysis: They Have Many Differences, but on Syria, Trump Seems Much Like Obama
teaser: “Both of them are instinctively more concerned about the American economy and things at home,” said Robert S. Ford, the last American ambassador to Syria.

headline: Witness in Mueller Inquiry Who Advises U.A.E. Ruler Also Has Ties to Russia
teaser: The witness, George Nader, has a roster of international connections that helped him arrange several meetings that have drawn the attention of the special counsel.

headline: Feature: How Lisa Murkowski Mastered Trump’s Washington
teaser: The Alaska senator is one of the few Republicans who has gone toe-to-toe with the president — and thrived.

headline: If There’s a U.S.-China Trade War, China May Have Some ‘Unconventional Weapons’
teaser: There are ways to make life harder for American companies in China that need not be formal, or widely publicized.

headline: For Mueller, a Feared Weakness Becomes a Strength
teaser: The special counsel is emphasizing his lack of independence to defend the indictment of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman.

headline: Pentagon Wades Deeper Into Detainee Operations in Syria
teaser: The United States military is spending about $1 million to secure several makeshift detention camps for Islamic State prisoners, broadening its involvement in operations it had sought to avoid.

headline: Trump v. California: The Biggest Legal Clashes
teaser: With 29 suits filed, the federal government and California are engaged in “bloody combat” over issues like immigration, the environment and the census.

headline: Unbuttoned: Buzzed: The Politics of Hair
teaser: Emma González and Rose McGowan, ‘Black Panther’ and ‘Billions’ — shaved heads make a statement, intentional or not.

headline: Sally Yates Says ‘Elections Have Consequences,’ but Trump Goes Too Far
teaser: Ms. Yates, the acting attorney general fired by President Trump for refusing to defend his travel ban, said in a TimesTalks conversation that he is breaking democratic norms.

headline: Why China Is Confident It Can Beat Trump in a Trade War
teaser: Beijing has a strong grip on banks, the news media and politics, and it seems willing to take advantage of vulnerabilities in the American political system.

headline: Woman Who Was Fired for Giving Trump the Middle Finger Sues Former Employer
teaser: Juli Briskman said that Akima L.L.C., a government contractor, dismissed her because it feared her gesture would hurt its business. “Criticism of our leaders should be encouraged,” she said.

headline: Pressure Mounts on Scott Pruitt, E.P.A. Chief, as Top Advisers Eye the Exit
teaser: One senior adviser resigns, and his chief of staff is said to have considered leaving, amid rising pressure over ethics questions.

headline: A Worker Shortage Is Forcing Restaurants to Get Creative
teaser: As Americans increasingly eat out, owners are scrambling to find employees wherever they can.

headline: Chelsea Handler to Discuss the State of Women’s Rights
teaser: The activist, comedian and author will be interviewed by the New York Times reporter Megan Twohey about Ms. Handler’s efforts to promote women’s voices and participation in government.

headline: Under Trump, an Office Meant to Help Refugees Enters the Abortion Wars
teaser: One small government office has become the flash point in the debate over the administration’s embrace of socially conservative policy.

headline: C.F.P.B.’s Chief Gives Big Raises, Even as He Criticizes Spending
teaser: Mick Mulvaney, who is trying to rein in the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, awarded large pay increases to two recent recruits.

headline: Trump Veers From Tax Script to Blast Democrats on Immigration
teaser: In West Virginia, President Trump continued his tirade against the nation’s immigration laws and accused Democrats of embracing dangerous policies to win votes.

headline: E.P.A. Officials Sidelined After Questioning Scott Pruitt
teaser: At least five agency officials were reassigned or demoted, or requested new jobs after raising concerns about the administrator’s security demands and spending.

headline: Trump Denies Knowing of Any Hush Money Paid to Porn Actress
teaser: In his first public remarks, President Trump told reporters on Air Force One that he knew nothing about $130,000 paid to the pornographic film star known as Stormy Daniels.

headline: Sally Yates Speaks to The Times
teaser: Sally Q. Yates, the former acting attorney general, and the New York Times reporter Matt Apuzzo had a wide-ranging conversation at a TimesEvent.

headline: Trump Unleashes Immigration Tirade at Tax Event
teaser: President Trump delivered a lengthy criticism of current immigration policy, accused Democrats of using “chain migration” to get votes and repeated unfounded claims of election fraud.

headline: Quietly, Trump Officials and California Seek a Deal on Car Emissions
teaser: Behind-the-scenes talks could preserve some rules targeted by the Environmental Protection Agency for elimination.

headline: Senegal Eyes Deporting Ex-Detainees as Critics Accuse U.S. of Neglect
teaser: A move by Senegal to deport former Guantánamo detainees spotlights the Trump administration’s closing of a State Department office that monitored resettlements.

headline: White House Tries to Pull Nafta Back From Brink as Deadlines Loom
teaser: After months of stalemate, American negotiators are eager for quick progress on the North American trade deal.

headline: Fact Check: At West Virginia Event, Some of Trump’s Facts Don’t Add Up
teaser: The president raised the issue of rape against immigrants and further confused facts on tax overhaul, the trade deficit with China and voter fraud.

headline: Bernie Sanders Courts Black Voters Anew. But an Obama Reference Stings.
teaser: The Vermont senator, who drew slim support from African-Americans in his 2016 presidential bid, is now trying to fix that vulnerability as he considers another run in 2020.

headline: What Are H-1B Visas, and Do They Hurt American Workers?
teaser: President Trump says foreign workers on H-1B visas take jobs away from Americans. Employers say they fill a labor shortage. Who’s right?

headline: Pacino as Paterno, and Who Is That Producer? Anthony Scaramucci
teaser: Mr. Scaramucci, the voluble former White House communications director, is a co-executive producer of HBO’s “Paterno.” It started with an acquaintance made on an Oliver Stone film.

headline: Trump Cites Aluminum Prices in Defense of Trade Policies
teaser: President Trump launched into a new defense of his pugnacious trade policies on Friday, pointing to the falling price of aluminum to deny harm to consumers.

headline: Trump Will Once Again Skip the White House Correspondents Dinner
teaser: The White House announced on Friday that for the second year in a row, President Trump will skip the White House Correspondents Association Dinner.

headline: Trump Administration Imposes New Sanctions on Putin Cronies
teaser: The Trump administration, carrying out sanctions pressed by Congress for election interference, announced new penalties against Russia’s richest men.

headline: The March Jobs Numbers Show the Economy Is Sound, but Far From Invincible
teaser: The basic story of a strong labor market remains intact, but a disappointing report is a sign that the U.S. is not in some extraordinary boom.

headline: The Saturday Profile: He Says He’s an Innocent Victim. Robert Mueller Says He’s a Spy.
teaser: Konstantin V. Kilimnik, a 47-year-old former Russian military interpreter, is nicknamed “the midget.” But he’s looming large in the special counsel’s inquiry.

headline: Powell Touts Economy’s Strength in First Speech as Fed Chief
teaser: Jerome H. Powell said a potential trade war would have no immediate effect on the Federal Reserve’s strategy of gradually increasing interest rates.

headline: Facebook to Require Verified Identities for Future Political Ads
teaser: As Mark Zuckerberg, the company’s chief executive, prepares to testify before Congress, the company also said it supported the proposed Honest Ads Act.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From criticism of Scott Pruitt to an escalating trade conflict, let us catch you up on five of the biggest stories you may have missed.

headline: Scott Pruitt’s Wish List: Private Jets, Fancy Furniture, 24-Hour Security
teaser: Mr. Pruitt, the Environmental Protection Agency chief, has been criticized for his spending habits — and for appearing to punish those who try to rein him in.

headline: Daniel Akaka, Former Democratic Senator of Hawaii, Dies at 93
teaser: Mr. Akaka, a 36-year veteran of Capitol Hill, fought for the belated recognition of Asian-American servicemen in World War II.

headline: Chief of Staff Advised a Resistant Trump to Fire the E.P.A. Chief
teaser: John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, wants President Trump to fire his Environmental Protection Agency administrator, but the president is resisting.

headline: Texas Congressman Who Settled Harassment Case With Taxpayer Funds Resigns
teaser: Representative Blake Farenthold of Texas, who settled a sexual harassment case with $84,000 in taxpayer funds, abruptly resigned from Congress on Friday.

headline: More Jobs, Faster Growth and Now, the Threat of a Trade War
teaser: In his inaugural speech, the new Fed chairman tried to focus on the strength of the economy even as a spiraling tariff battle with China spooked investors.

headline: For McMaster, Pomp Under Bittersweet Circumstances
teaser: The ousted national security adviser, who departed the White House on Friday, broke with President Trump on Syria and Russia, but sought to hold the line for his commander in chief.

headline: Trump Signs Memo Ordering End to ‘Catch and Release’ Immigration Policy
teaser: The directive does not, on its own, toughen immigration policy, but it is a symbolic move by the president to solve a problem that he has complained Congress will not.

headline: On Washington: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court
teaser: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.

headline: In His Haste to Roll Back Rules, Scott Pruitt, E.P.A. Chief, Risks His Agenda
teaser: Courts have found his orders on lead paint, pesticides and other issues to be poorly crafted, and have struck them down.

headline: U.S. Seizes Backpage.com, a Site Accused of Enabling Prostitution
teaser: The site has been under increasing pressure in recent years, partly because it featured ads that included what child advocates said were code words for underage girls.

headline: U.S. Seizes Backpage.com, a Site Accused of Enabling Prostitution
teaser: The site has been under increasing pressure in recent years, partly because it featured ads that included what child advocates said were code words for underage girls.

headline: Farmers’ Anger at Trump Tariffs Puts Republican Candidates in a Bind
teaser: President Trump is moving to fulfill one of his central campaign promises, but a get-tough stance with China could reverberate badly in the nation’s heartland.

headline: Republicans Seize on Impeachment for Edge in 2018 Midterms
teaser: Invoking the specter of President Trump’s impeachment has become a fund-raising and get-out-the-vote tactic for Republicans. Democratic leaders see the issue as a trap.

headline: South Carolina Congressman Pulls Out Gun at a Meeting With Voters
teaser: The lawmaker, Representative Ralph Norman, put his gun on a table during a meeting with constituents to show that firearms were not dangerous.

headline: Trump Vows ‘Big Price’ for Syria Attack, Raising Prospect of Missile Strike
teaser: The president laid blame for the attack partly on President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, the first time since his election he has criticized the Russian leader by name on Twitter.

headline: Amid Fears of Trade War, Trump Predicts China Will Relent
teaser: President Trump tweeted that he and President Xi Jinping of China will “always be friends, no matter what happens with our dispute on trade.”

headline: ‘I Kept Thinking of Antioch’: Long Before #MeToo, a Times Video Journalist Remembered a Form She Signed in 2004
teaser: Before I could spend the night in my younger sister’s dorm room, I had to report to security...

headline: ‘You Are the Product’: Targeted by Cambridge Analytica on Facebook
teaser: Facebook plans to begin notifying users on Monday who were affected by Cambridge Analytica’s data collection. The Times has already spoken with some people whose data was taken.

headline: In John Bolton, Trump Finds a Fellow Political Blowtorch. Will Foreign Policy Burn?
teaser: Mr. Bolton takes over as the president’s third national security adviser Monday. In a world of carrot-and-stick diplomacy, Mr. Bolton is a stick man: “I don’t do carrots.”

headline: As Trump Seeks Way Out of Syria, New Attack Pulls Him Back In
teaser: A reported chemical attack on a Damascus suburb seems to raise the political and military stakes as President Trump charts the United States’ future in Syria.

headline: North Korea Said to Offer Direct Assurance It Will Discuss Denuclearization
teaser: The gesture appeared to confirm that Kim Jong-un intends to participate in an unheard-of meeting with President Trump about his nuclear program.

headline: Justice Dept., Pressured by Trump, Seeks to Speed Response to Congressional Inquiry
teaser: Attorney General Jeff Sessions appointed a United States attorney to handle document production for an inquiry into the F.B.I.’s handling of the Hillary Clinton email case.

headline: Talk: Cynthia Nixon Wants to Legalize It
teaser: The actress and Democratic candidate for New York governor on marijuana, the black vote and fixing the subway.

headline: Europe Caught in the Middle as Trump Threatens China
teaser: The United States is Europe’s biggest trading partner, but China is closing fast. If a trade war breaks out, neutrality may not be an option.

headline: Feature: The Post-Campaign Campaign of Donald Trump
teaser: He has been president for more than a year — so why is he still holding rallies?

headline: Trump Says He Will Decide Soon Whether to Retaliate for Syria Chemical Attack
teaser: The challenge came on a day when Mr. Trump was already facing a transition in his foreign policy team as his new national security adviser, John R. Bolton, arrived for his first day on the job.

headline: Trump Lauds Potential North Korea Summit as ‘Very Exciting for the World’
teaser: The president now says his planned meeting with Kim Jong-un, the reclusive North Korean leader, could come in May or June.

headline: Zuckerberg to Tell Congress Facebook Made ‘Big Mistake’ on Multiple Fronts
teaser: When he appears before Congress this week, Mr. Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, will issue a broad apology for failing to prevent the mishandling of personal data and other abuses.

headline: Trump Calls Syrian Chemical Attack ‘Atrocious’
teaser: President Trump said at a cabinet meeting on Monday that he would make a decision in the next 24 to 48 hours about whether to retaliate militarily to the chemical weapons attack in Syria.

headline: Federal Budget Deficit Projected to Top $1 Trillion in 2020
teaser: The new analysis from the Congressional Budget Office takes into account the cost of the sweeping tax cuts that Republicans in Congress passed last year.

headline: Trump to Decide Soon Whether to Retaliate for ‘Barbaric Act’ in Syria
teaser: The president said Syria’s patrons in Russia and Iran may also be responsible for enabling last weekend’s chemical attack. “Everybody’s going to pay a price,” he said.

headline: F.B.I. Raids Office of Trump’s Longtime Lawyer Michael Cohen
teaser: Mr. Cohen is at the center of several aspects of the special counsel’s investigation. He also acknowledged paying $130,000 to Stephanie Clifford, who said she had an affair with Mr. Trump.

headline: Tammy Duckworth Becomes First Sitting U.S. Senator to Give Birth
teaser: Ms. Duckworth gave birth to a daughter, Maile, on Monday. She is one of 10 women to give birth while serving in Congress, and the first senator to do so.

headline: What Mark Zuckerberg Will Be Grilled On at the Congressional Hearings
teaser: Appearing for the first time before a congressional committee, the Facebook founder is likely to be asked about privacy, Russian meddling, fake news and more.

headline: Year of the Woman? In Arizona, It’s Women, Plural, and It’s Both Parties
teaser: Women are playing leading roles across the political spectrum in the state, with Democrats hoping to flip the Arizona legislature and Republicans fielding strong female candidates at all levels.

headline: Sanctions Flap Erupts Into Open Conflict Between Haley and White House
