headline: Justice Gorsuch Joins Supreme Court’s Liberals to Strike Down Deportation Law
teaser: By a 5-to-4 vote, the Supreme Court ruled that a law allowing the deportation of some immigrants who commit serious crimes was unconstitutionally vague.

headline: Marco Rubio, Darling of G.O.P. Establishment, Hires a Thorn in Its Side
teaser: The move raises questions about whether Mr. Rubio may be positioning himself for another presidential run and underscores how unsettled the conservative movement is.

headline: What Sean Hannity Has Been Saying About Michael Cohen
teaser: The Fox News host has criticized the raid on President Trump’s lawyer multiple times — but he never disclosed his connection to the lawyer.

headline: Sessions Tries to Put New Pressure on Drug Companies in Opioid Crisis
teaser: A proposal by the attorney general would limit the amount of opioid-based pain medications that pharmaceutical companies can produce.

headline: U.S. Seeks to Send American ISIS Suspect to Another Country’s Custody
teaser: The unidentified American, who has been detained for more than seven months after being captured in Syria, is fighting the plan in court.

headline: Divides Over Trade Scramble Midterm Election Messaging
teaser: A survey shows strong support for President Trump’s tariff moves among his backers, but not so much among those whose votes could be in play.

headline: Barbara Bush, Wife of 41st President and Mother of 43rd, Dies at 92
teaser: Mrs. Bush avoided controversial issues while in the White House and became known for her straight talk, lack of pretension and self-deprecating humor.

headline: Former F.B.I. Agent Admits He Shared Classified Documents
teaser: Lawyers for Terry J. Albury, who pleaded guilty on Tuesday, said his goal had been to show that the bureau “often treated minority communities with suspicion and disrespect.”

headline: Mike Pompeo, C.I.A. Director, Is Said to Meet With Kim Jong-un in North Korea
teaser: The president alluded to the mission on Tuesday when he said that the United States was in direct talks with North Korea at “extremely high levels.”

headline: California Lawmakers Kill Housing Bill After Fierce Debate
teaser: The vote highlighted the state’s housing and homeless problem as a election-year issue that promises to dominate the state’s politics for years.

headline: Trump, in Another Reversal, Says Trans-Pacific Trade Pact Has ‘Too Many Contingencies’
teaser: A tweet by the president seems to end a meandering trade policy. He withdrew from the deal his first week in office before saying he had second thoughts.

headline: Trump Requests Extension to File 2017 Taxes
teaser: President Trump, who has refused to release his tax returns, will file his 2017 tax return by October 2018, according to the White House.

headline: I.R.S. Website Crashes on Tax Day as Millions Tried to File Returns
teaser: A computer failure crippled a crucial part of the agency’s website that allows taxpayers to make their payments directly from their bank accounts on the day taxes were due.

headline: Dignitaries React to the Death of Barbara Bush
teaser: Many lawmakers from both parties publicly remembered Mrs. Bush, including her support for literacy programs.

headline: Mattis Wanted Congressional Approval Before Striking Syria. He Was Overruled.
teaser: The Pentagon chief lost a battle with the White House to get congressional authorization for last week’s allied airstrikes. But he won in pushing for a limited attack.

headline: In Pro-Trump Tennessee, Democrats Count on a Familiar Face to Flip a Senate Seat
teaser: President Trump won Tennessee by a wide margin, but former Gov. Phil Bredesen, a Democrat now running for Senate, has a track record of appealing to Republicans.

headline: Trump Mocks Sketch of Man Who Allegedly Threatened Stormy Daniels
teaser: The president, who has said little about the scandal involving the pornographic film star Stephanie Clifford, said the drawing was of a “nonexistent man.”

headline: Japan’s Prime Minister Pins North Korea and Trade Hopes on Trump’s Whims
teaser: Dogged by scandal at home, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is hoping to score diplomatic and political victories during a meeting this week with President Trump.

headline: In Barbara Bush’s Final Days, Faith, Courage and a Little More Needling
teaser: In his first interview following Barbara Bush’s death, the 43rd president remembered her faith, warmth and biting wit.

headline: Secret Pompeo Mission to North Korea Shows Trump’s Trust in Spies Over Diplomats
teaser: The C.I.A. director, nominated by Mr. Trump to be the next secretary of state, laid the groundwork for a planned meeting between the president and the North Korean leader.

headline: Time Warner C.E.O. Testifies That AT&T Deal Is Needed to Battle Silicon Valley
teaser: Jeffrey Bewkes, Time Warner’s chief executive, said on Wednesday in federal court that Time Warner is an underdog against Amazon, Netflix and others — unless it merges with AT&T.

headline: Ex-Playboy Model, Freed From Contract, Can Discuss Alleged Trump Affair
teaser: A settlement ends a lawsuit against a Trump-allied publisher, and protects the president from being drawn into a legal case involving efforts to buy women’s silence.

headline: Qualcomm May Be Collateral Damage in a U.S.-China Trade War
teaser: One of the brightest stars in the global technology industry now finds its business under fire in two countries.

headline: Senate Votes to Ease Restrictions on Auto Lending Discrimination
teaser: Nullifying the restrictions will weaken the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, which Republicans say has abused its authority. Democrats criticized the move.

headline: Across Midwest, Farmers Warn of G.O.P. Losses Over Trump’s Trade Policy
teaser: China’s proposed tariffs on soybeans would hit hard in Iowa, Kansas, Missouri, North Dakota and other states with highly competitive House and Senate races.

headline: Mike Pompeo Met Kim Jong-un. What’s His North Korea Policy?
teaser: The C.I.A. director’s comments at his hearing to become secretary of state worried so many senators that the Foreign Relations Committee is not recommending confirmation. It was recently revealed that he met secretly with Kim Jong-un over Easter weekend.

headline: Kim Jong-un’s Travel May Be Limited by Aging Aircraft. That Means He and Trump Could Meet in Mongolia.
teaser: Kim Jong-un is not known to have flown outside his country, and the question of his transportation complicates an already delicate and uncertain meeting.

headline: Overlooked No More: Harriott Daley, the Capitol’s First Telephone Operator
teaser: Daley, who became a switchboard operator in 1898, made sure members of Congress were just a phone call away from their constituents.

headline: Unbuttoned: James Comey Still Looks the Part
teaser: The former F.B.I. director has made the rounds this week, offering his take on what “ethical leadership” means. If we’re going by appearances, it’s a lot like the movies.

headline: Cleo Wade Is Everybody’s BFF
teaser: The Instagram poet’s besties include Katy Perry, Reese Witherspoon and Senator Cory Booker. “I consider him family,” Ms. Wade said.

headline: Trump Wants to Close Trade Gap, but Leaves Export Agency in Limbo
teaser: The Export-Import Bank has been effectively crippled, and big business groups are angry that the board of the bank has been left completely vacant.

headline: If the World Economy Is Looking So Great, Why Are Global Policymakers So Gloomy?
teaser: As officials gather for the I.M.F. and World Bank convene in Washington, worries about trade and debt are building

headline: Trump’s NASA Nominee, Jim Bridenstine, Confirmed by Senate on Party-Line Vote
teaser: The Oklahoma congressman’s nomination languished for more than seven months as senators raised objections to his record, and now additional concerns have been raised.

headline: Missile Strikes Are Unlikely to Stop Syria’s Chemical Attacks, Pentagon Says
teaser: A military intelligence report found that the Syrian government is expected to resume its chemical weapons program, despite President Trump saying “mission accomplished.” Here’s how the strike unfolded.

headline: On Washington: Push for Special Counsel Bill Shows G.O.P.’s Rising Fear Mueller Will Be Fired
teaser: Despite Mitch McConnell’s resistance to bringing legislation protecting the special counsel to the floor, its backers are pressing ahead to send President Trump a message.

headline: ‘It’s About Time’: A Baby Comes to the Senate Floor
teaser: Senator Tammy Duckworth’s new baby daughter made history, becoming the first infant to appear on the Senate floor. Even Mitch McConnell smiled.

headline: AT&T Chief Attacks Lawsuit to Block Time Warner Merger
teaser: Randall Stephenson, AT&T’s chief executive, defended his deal to buy Time Warner and said a combined company would be no different than those that already exist in Silicon Valley.

headline: Seeking Foreign Money, G.O.P. Donor Pushed for Trump to Golf With Malaysian Premier
teaser: Documents reveal new details about the efforts of Elliott Broidy to exploit his White House ties. They also raise questions about whether Trump administration officials knew of his attempts.

headline: Pompeo Nears Confirmation but Faces Historic Rebuke From Committee
teaser: With the backing of Senator Heidi Heitkamp, Mike Pompeo looks assured to become secretary of state, but the Foreign Relations Committee may withhold its support.

headline: Justice Department Gives Congress Comey’s Memos on Trump
teaser: The memos, which had been redacted, detail phone calls and encounters between President Trump and James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director.

headline: Trump Administration Seeks to Expand Sales of Armed Drones
teaser: A day after President Trump promised to slash red tape involved in weapons sales, the administration announced new policies, but experts said they would do little to speed exports.

headline: Judge Halts Transfer of American ISIS Suspect to Other Country
teaser: A judge has blocked the U.S. from transferring an American citizen, held in Iraq for seven months as an “enemy combatant,” to the custody of another country.

headline: 6 Takeaways From the Comey Memos
teaser: The memos written by the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey paint a revealing portrait of his interactions with President Trump.

headline: McCabe Report Is Sent to Prosecutors to Weigh Possible Criminal Inquiry
teaser: The Justice Department inspector general concluded in a scathing report that Andrew McCabe, the fired F.B.I. official, lacked candor when answering investigators’ questions.

headline: Giuliani to Join Trump’s Legal Team
teaser: Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former New York City mayor and longtime Trump loyalist, will be part of a legal stable as the president faces the Russia investigation.

headline: Scott Pruitt’s Ethics Inquiries Widen, and G.O.P. Support Shows Cracks
teaser: Powerful conservative lawmakers have begun publicly questioning the E.P.A. chief and insisting on explanations of his travel and security spending.

headline: Sanctions Are Hurting North Korea. Can They Make Kim Give In?
teaser: Despite President Trump’s “maximum pressure,” there is no sign of economic crisis in the North. Does that make its leader, Kim Jong-un, less likely to give up his weapons?

headline: James Comey Opens Up About Ego, Distrust and More
teaser: The former F.B.I. director was interviewed for “The Daily” podcast. Here are five takeaways from the conversation.

headline: The Daily: James Comey Opens Up About Ego, Distrust and More
teaser: The former F.B.I. director was interviewed for “The Daily” podcast. Here are five takeaways from the conversation.

headline: How The C.I.A. Is Waging an Influence Campaign to Get a New Director Confirmed
teaser: The C.I.A. is making an unusually public push to ensure President Trump’s nominee for director, Gina Haspel, is confirmed.

headline: Charges Sought in Eric Garner’s Death, but Justice Officials Have Doubts
teaser: Prosecutors recommended charging a New York police officer, but others question whether the case can be won. Mr. Garner’s gasps of “I can’t breathe” galvanized protesters.

headline: Democratic Party Alleges Trump-Russia Conspiracy in New Lawsuit
teaser: The lawsuit accuses Mr. Trump’s associates of illegally working with Russian intelligence agents to interfere with the outcome of the 2016 election.

headline: Newsbook: Read These 3 Books on Government Corruption
teaser: A look at how Citizens United and a network of plutocrats have shaped the country’s politics.

headline: ‘The Daily’ Transcript: Interview With James Comey
teaser: Days after the release of his book, “A Higher Loyalty,” the former F.B.I. director was interviewed by Michael Barbaro, the host of “The Daily” podcast.

headline: DeVos Education Dept. Begins Dismissing Civil Rights Cases in Name of Efficiency
teaser: The department has begun dismissing civil rights cases brought by “serial” complainants or those that place “an unreasonable burden” on resources.

headline: Trilobites: What a Scientist Learned From Studying the ‘Synchronized Swimming of Sea Monkeys’
teaser: Tiny crustaceans complete a massive daily vertical migration in the world’s oceans. New research suggests their commute may play an important role in the health of the planet.

headline: Global Health: Ethicists Call for More Scrutiny of ‘Human-Challenge’ Trials
teaser: A vaccine study in which subjects are to be deliberately infected with Zika is on pause after ethicists said it had “insufficient value.”

headline: D.E.A. Is Investigating a Former Agent on Misconduct Allegations
teaser: The accusations against the agent, who had been stationed in Colombia, could make it harder for U.S. officials to earn the trust of confidential informants in the shadowy world of drug trafficking.

headline: Michael Cohen Has Said He Would Take a Bullet for Trump. Maybe Not Anymore.
teaser: Roger Stone says Mr. Trump has long treated Mr. Cohen, his lawyer and fixer, “like garbage.” Now he could end up cooperating in a criminal investigation against Mr. Trump.

headline: U.S. Human Rights Report Labels Russia and China Threats to Global Stability
teaser: The State Department report, which this year underwent significant alterations that reflected the change in administrations, also reproached Iran and North Korea.

headline: Pressure to Release Comey Memos May Have Backfired on G.O.P.
teaser: The deputy attorney general’s decision to release the memos did little to help Republicans undermine the credibility of James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director.

headline: Bernie Sanders Says ‘Trump’s Agenda Is Dead’ if Democrats Win Midterms
teaser: Mr. Sanders, the Vermont senator and 2016 presidential candidate, also criticized national Democrats for not doing more to support liberal candidates.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From the release of James Comey’s private memos about his meetings with President Trump to developing talks with North Korea, let us catch you up on six big stories from the week.

headline: Former Lawyer for Stormy Daniels Is Drawn Into Federal Investigation
teaser: Keith Davidson, who reached multiple agreements with Michael Cohen in recent years, has provided certain electronic records to investigators, a spokesman said Friday.

headline: Voting Laws for Felons Can Be Hard to Follow. Here’s an Overview.
teaser: Behind bars for murder in Maine? You can still vote. Convicted of perjury in Mississippi? You might be permanently barred from the ballot box.

headline: Fearing Chaos, National Democrats Plunge Into Midterm Primary Fights
teaser: Democratic leaders are intervening aggressively in California, where the state’s unusual voting system could undercut their chances in crowded congressional races.

headline: Trump Criticizes Times Report About His Longtime Lawyer
teaser: The report described President Trump’s years of poor treatment of the lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, and concerns that Mr. Cohen will cooperate with the federal officials who are investigating him.

headline: Scott Pruitt Before the E.P.A.: Fancy Homes, a Shell Company and Friends With Money
teaser: The E.P.A. chief is under scrutiny for high spending and interactions with lobbyists. Many of the pitfalls he has encountered in Washington have echoes in his past.

headline: Trump Plan Would Cut Back Health Care Protections for Transgender People
teaser: Advocates said the change could jeopardize the significant gains that transgender people have seen in access to care, including treatments for which many insurers denied coverage in the past.

headline: Scott Pruitt Met With Lobbyist Whose Wife Rented Him a $50-a-Night Condo
teaser: The meeting appears to contradict earlier statements that lobbying by J. Steven Hart before the E.P.A. hadn’t occurred.

headline: As Rod Rosenstein Battles for His Job, His Tactics Could Cost the Justice Dept.
teaser: Under siege by the president’s allies in the House, Mr. Rosenstein has acceded to some demands. But his allies worry that may expose the Justice Department to political meddling.

headline: News Analysis: What Does Kim Jong-un Want? U.S. Fears Answer Is ‘Give a Little, Gain a Lot’
teaser: In Washington, most officials and experts believe that the North Korean leader is determined to cement his country’s status as a nuclear state while escaping the chokehold of economic sanctions.

headline: In Message to Trump, Europe and Mexico Announce Trade Pact
teaser: The update of an existing pact will lift trade in dairy, digital goods and other products, and sends a message that some of America’s trading partners are moving on.

headline: After Sylvester Stallone Call, Trump Considers ‘Full Pardon’ of Long-Dead Boxer
teaser: Once the televised funeral for Barbara Bush was over, President Trump notified Americans that he’d been on the phone with Rambo.

headline: Neo-Nazi Rally Draws About Two Dozen People and Upends a Small Georgia City
teaser: The rally, which was held outside of Atlanta, was monitored by more than 700 law enforcement officers from 42 agencies.

headline: Mitt Romney Fails to Bypass Utah Primary for U.S. Senate
teaser: Fair-right delegates at the Republican Party’s state convention narrowly preferred Mike Kennedy, adding him to the ballot. Mr. Romney had already secured his spot by collecting signatures.

headline: The Mass-Shooting Survivor Network
teaser: “Talking to others has helped me realize that I’m not a crazy person.”

headline: A Shadowy War’s Newest Front: A Drone Base Rising From Saharan Dust
teaser: Air Force personnel are working to complete a $110 million airfield that will be used to strike extremists in West and North Africa, a region where most Americans have no idea the country is fighting.

headline: As Another Pence Runs for Congress, His Business Record Faces Scrutiny
teaser: Greg Pence, Vice President Mike Pence’s oldest brother, is mounting something of a stealth campaign, years after leading a convenience store chain that went bankrupt and being sued over personal debts.

headline: Macron Takes a Risk in Courting Trump, but Has Little to Show for It
teaser: The French president leaves on Monday for a state visit to Washington, where he will try, once again, to close the gap with President Trump on climate change, Iran and trade.

headline: Texas Boy Dies After Being Hit by Truck During School Walkout on Guns
teaser: The boy had been trying to cross a busy highway in El Paso. He was not participating in the protest and was part of a group of students headed to a park, officials said.

headline: ‘I Was Trump Before Trump Was Trump’
teaser: Republican candidates all over are parroting the president, spouting his catchphrases and donning his hats as they try to show loyalty.

headline: The Strategy for Some G.O.P. Candidates? Sound Like Trump
teaser: As the midterm elections approach, some Republican candidates are not only embracing President Trump’s policies but also his tone and catchphrases.

headline: China, Feeling Left Out, Has Plenty to Worry About in North Korea-U.S. Talks
teaser: Beijing fears that a grand deal with the North’s longtime enemies could diminish its influence over Pyongyang, experts said.

headline: Trump Rejects Notion He Has Made Too Many Concessions to North Korea
teaser: President Trump, in defending his actions before a planned summit meeting, incorrectly claimed that North Korea had “agreed to denuclearization.”

headline: Amazon’s Critics Get New Life With Trump’s Attacks on the Company
teaser: Many of Amazon’s opponents have struggled for years to be heard. Now they have the country’s most powerful bullhorn — President Trump — on their side.

headline: State and Local Jobs Under Siege as a Middle-Class Gateway
teaser: Even as private employers have rebounded from the recession, the public sector’s ranks have withered, and pay and benefits have lagged.

headline: Hillary Clinton Avoids Direct Reference to Comey Memos in Speech
teaser: Hillary Clinton once again compared President Trump to authoritarians, and glancingly referred to the newly declassified memos by James Comey, the former F.B.I. director.

headline: Setting Tone for Post-Presidency, Obama Will Speak in South Africa on Tolerance
teaser: Barack Obama does not plan to take on President Trump directly, but an adviser said the former president would not shrink from confronting the divisive issues around his successor.

headline: The Healing Edge: ‘Whole Again’: A Vet Maimed by an I.E.D. Receives a Transplanted Penis
teaser: A young soldier whose genitals were destroyed underwent extensive reconstructive surgery that doctors hope to offer to others who were wounded at war.

headline: Emmanuel Macron Heads to White House to Lobby Trump on Iran
teaser: As he arrives for the first state visit of Mr. Trump’s presidency, Mr. Macron hopes to persuade the American leader not to scrap the nuclear agreement with Tehran.

headline: Deported to Libya, Ex-Gitmo Detainees Vanish. Will Others Meet a Similar Fate?
teaser: Senegal deported two former Guantánamo detainees to Libya, raising fears of a broader collapse of Obama-era resettlement deals under President Trump.

headline: After Late Vote Switch, Senate Panel Approves Pompeo for Secretary of State
teaser: Minutes before a committee vote, Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, bowed to pressure and backed the confirmation of Mike Pompeo to be secretary of state.

headline: The Interpreter: An Unpredictable Trump and a Risk-Prone Kim Mean High Stakes and Mismatched Expectations
teaser: The meeting of the two leaders exemplifies a world less constrained by the guardrails of international norms, in which virtually anything can happen.

headline: Rod Rosenstein Makes a Timely Supreme Court Appearance
teaser: After an argument on the independence of executive branch officials, Mr. Rosenstein made his Supreme Court debut in a separate sentencing case.

headline: Cuomo Announces Bill to Ban Plastic Bags in New York State
teaser: The proposal comes a year after Gov. Andrew Cuomo blocked a 5-cent city surcharge on the bags and as he has tacked left since Cynthia Nixon began a primary challenge.

headline: The Fight for Wisconsin Is On as Outside Money Pours Into Senate Race
teaser: National Democrats were shocked in 2016 when a Republican presidential nominee carried Wisconsin for the first time in 34 years. Now both parties see a key Senate race as a crucial test before 2020.

headline: Trump’s First State Dinner: Cherry Blossoms, Clinton China but No Democrats From Congress
teaser: As Melania Trump oversees preparations to welcome President Emmanuel Macron of France, her advice to her staff before the high-profile event is not to worry.

headline: Trump Administration Pushes Abstinence in Teen Pregnancy Programs
teaser: New rules don’t explicitly exclude teaching about contraception and protected sex, but favor “sexual risk avoidance” and don’t require as rigorous evidence of efficacy.

headline: George Bush Is Hospitalized One Day After Wife’s Funeral
teaser: Mr. Bush was “responding to treatments and appears to be recovering,” his spokesman said.

headline: Arizona Special Election: Does the Democrat Have a Chance?
teaser: A special election in Arizona was spurred by a sex scandal, and polls show that this Republican stronghold has a chance at being won by a Democrat.

headline: Fear and Hope in South Korea on Eve of Summit With Kim Jong-un
teaser: South Koreans still don’t know what to make of Kim Jong-un as the North Korean leader prepares to meet with the South’s president, Moon Jae-in.

headline: Trump’s First State Dinner: Details (and Some Guesses)
teaser: Most elements of the state visit, largely planned by the East Wing, are meant to symbolically honor the relationship between the United States and France.

headline: Romney Failed to Win at Utah Convention, but Few Believe He’s Doomed
teaser: The 2012 G.O.P. presidential nominee, running for an open Senate seat, faced conservatives who disliked his ideological swerving, and a fear among hard-right activists that they were losing power.

headline: Trump Voters Driven by Fear of Losing Status, Not Economic Anxiety, Study Finds
teaser: A new study suggests that the white, Christian and male voters who supported Donald J. Trump were driven by concerns over losing their privilege.

headline: Books News: Sales Figures for Comey’s ‘A Higher Loyalty’ Dwarf Recent Political Best Sellers
teaser: Amazon limited reviews of the book to readers who have purchased it on its site.

headline: Ronny Jackson, Trump’s V.A. Nominee, Faces Claims of Overprescription and Hostile Work Environment
teaser: The Senate Veterans Affairs Committee is examining multiple claims against President Trump’s nominee to head the Veterans Affairs Department.

headline: For Trump and Macron, a Warm Embrace and Then Talks on Crucial Disagreements
teaser: President Trump welcomed President Emmanuel Macron of France to the White House on Tuesday for the first state visit since taking office.

headline: American Warplanes Shift Tactics to Target Last ISIS Pockets in Eastern Syria
teaser: The American-led air campaign to defeat the remnants of ISIS in eastern Syria lost its main ground force. Now it is shifting its tactics to kill the last remaining fighters.

headline: E.P.A. to Unveil a New Rule. Its Effect: Less Science in Policymaking.
teaser: The agency plans to publish a new regulation Tuesday that would restrict the kinds of scientific studies the agency can use when it develops policies.

headline: Melania Trump, White Hat
teaser: The first lady’s choice of headgear made quite a statement on the second day of the French state visit.

headline: Shrugging Off Trump Scandals, Evangelicals Look to Rescue G.O.P.
teaser: In what has been described as its largest midterm mobilization ever, the Christian conservative movement is looking past the president’s behavior and toward November.

headline: Supreme Court Bars Human Rights Suits Against Foreign Corporations
teaser: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy said such suits should require explicit congressional authorization, with Justice Sonia Sotomayor countering that the court had created a double standard for corporations.

headline: Ms. Kardashian Goes to Washington
teaser: Kourtney Kardashian will speak at a closed briefing about the need for regulatory reform of the cosmetics industry.

headline: Supreme Court Weighs Claims That Texas Voting Maps Discriminate Against Minorities
teaser: The court heard arguments in a long and winding case about whether congressional and state legislative districts were drawn to discriminate.

headline: Supreme Court Upholds Procedure That’s Said to Combat ‘Patent Trolls’
teaser: The justices ruled that the proceedings, which opponents say usurp the role of the federal courts, were a permissible way for the agency that administers patents to fix its mistakes.

headline: Charles Zwick, Who Balanced Budget Under Johnson, Dies at 91
teaser: As the president’s last budget director, he helped engineer the only federal surplus to be recorded over a span of almost 40 years.

headline: Scott Pruitt’s Political Patron Now Questions the E.P.A. Chief’s Ethics
teaser: Senator James Inhofe, who has long championed Mr. Pruitt, now says he’d like to see an investigation into the ethical allegations against his protégé.

headline: With George H.W. Bush Hospitalized, the World Wonders: Is It a Broken Heart?
teaser: Failing health after sudden grief — especially the loss of a spouse — has been reported by medical researchers. But it seems to be statistically quite rare, experts said.

headline: Le Bromance: Trump and Macron, Together Again
teaser: There was a mutual kiss on the cheek in the East Room, clasped hands and the first state dinner of the Trump era.

headline: Steven Mnuchin Will Head to China as Trade Tensions Mount
teaser: President Trump said he would send his Treasury secretary to Beijing to try to resolve a trade dispute that could have damaging economic repercussions.

headline: Facebook Replaces Lobbying Executive Amid Regulatory Scrutiny
teaser: Facebook shuffled its ranks in Washington as it confronts pressure from lawmakers over data privacy, election interference, misinformation and other issues.

headline: Trump and Macron’s State Dinner: The Guest List
teaser: The list of invitees to Tuesday’s state dinner honoring the president of France included over 120 people.

headline: Pruitt’s Security Chief Moonlighted for Tabloid Publisher That Helped Trump
teaser: Pasquale Perrotta is being investigated by the E.P.A. and Congress for his outside work, which included assignments for American Media Inc., the publisher of The National Enquirer.

headline: Joy Reid Blames Hackers for Anti-Gay Blog Posts, but Questions Mount
teaser: Ms. Reid, a MSNBC host who apologized in December for old anti-gay posts, said newly surfaced writings were an effort by hackers “to taint my character.”

headline: Jeff Sessions Is Serving, and Doing His Best to Ignore, Trump
teaser: Crisscrossing the nation, the embattled attorney general praises the president for supporting law enforcement — most law enforcement, anyway.

headline: A National Security Aide’s Departing Wish: Cooking for the State Dinner
teaser: For his exit from the Trump administration, Michael Anton, a self-described “right-wing Francophile,” asked to work as a line cook helping to prepare dinner for the French president.

headline: Trump Decides American Envoy Headed to Australia Will Go to Seoul Instead
teaser: The decision to nominate Adm. Harry Harris as the ambassador to South Korea is seen as a diplomatic blow to Australia, a close American ally.

headline: Debbie Lesko Wins Arizona Special Election for Congress, Rallying G.O.P.
teaser: The former state senator benefited from more than $1 million in outside spending by Republican groups determined to avoid repeats of losses in Alabama and Pennsylvania.

headline: Scandals and Investigations, but Few Arrests, for Air Marshals Program
teaser: The marshals view their jobs as critical to protecting planes and airports from terrorists. But their complaints of alcohol abuse, sexual harassment and racist behavior describe an agency in chaos.

headline: Don Blankenship, West Virginia Candidate, Lives Near Las Vegas and Mulled Chinese Citizenship
teaser: The former coal mining executive, a strong supporter of President Trump who is running as an “American competitionist,” has refused to disclose his personal finances as required by law.

headline: Trump’s Travel Ban Faces a Supreme Court Test
teaser: The case reached the justices 15 months after the first travel ban caused chaos at the nation’s airports and set a new tone on immigration.

headline: On the Runway: Melania Trump, at the State Dinner in Chanel, Gave Everyone Something to Chew On
teaser: The first lady’s couture selection was an exceptional, if not unexpected, choice by a woman adapting the role to fit herself.

headline: Michelle Wolf’s Next Gig Is Hard Work: Making Washington Laugh
teaser: Ms. Wolf, a comedian from the world of late-night TV, is honing her set for the White House Correspondents’ dinner and preparing a new Netflix series.

headline: Vel Phillips, Housing Rights Champion in the ′60s, Dies at 95
teaser: She broke racial and gender barriers on her way to spearheading open-housing legislation in Milwaukee and was a voice in Democratic national politics.

headline: How Scott Pruitt Plans to Defend Himself on Capitol Hill: Spread the Blame
teaser: A new document shows how Scott Pruitt, the E.P.A. chief, is preparing to answer tough questions about his ethics and spending scandals when he appears before Congress on Thursday.

headline: The Shindigger: James Comey’s Book Party Was Larded With Journalists
teaser: Excluded from the Trumps’ first state dinner, where else were they to go?

headline: White House Digs in as Allegations Swirl Around Ronny Jackson
teaser: White House officials pressed for a confirmation hearing for Dr. Ronny L. Jackson, the nominee to lead the Veterans Affairs Department, even as new accusations of questionable conduct emerged.

headline: Macron Critiques Trump’s Policies in Speech to Congress
teaser: One day after the two presidents showered each other with praise, the speech illustrated that the warm personal rapport contrasts with sharp disagreement on questions of policy.

headline: Trump and Kanye West Share Praise-Filled Tweets. And, Apparently, ‘Dragon Energy.’

teaser: For Democratic women, no endorsement is as powerful as one from the fund-raising juggernaut. But with so many female candidates, the group is forced to pick between them.

headline: How the N.R.A. Fought Gun Control After Parkland
teaser: After the shooting at a high school in Parkland, Fla., that killed 17 people, the N.R.A. used its political clout and a powerful P.R. campaign to fight gun reform efforts.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Exaggerates Mueller Team’s Ties to Obama and Democrats
teaser: President Trump claimed “all these investigators” are Democrats — an overstatement — and incorrectly said that Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, served under President Obama for eight years.

headline: An Ohio Senate Candidate Cloaks Himself Uncomfortably in Trump Garb
teaser: Representative James B. Renacci, a traditional Chamber of Commerce Republican, hopes he can replicate the success the president found in Ohio in the 2016 election.

headline: N.S.A. Triples Collection of Data from U.S. Phone Companies
teaser: The increase could be attributable to how phone companies keep records, an N.S.A. official said, adding that the agency has not changed how it collects data.

headline: Caught in the Theranos Wreckage: Betsy DeVos, Rupert Murdoch and Walmart’s Waltons
teaser: Newly unsealed court documents reveal that some of the world’s richest people invested millions in the discredited blood-testing company Theranos.

headline: Pence’s Doctor Resigns as White House Medical Shake-Up Continues
teaser: The medical unit came under scrutiny after misconduct allegations against Ronny L. Jackson, the president’s primary physician. One source of the accusations was Jennifer Pena, the vice president’s doctor.

headline: Jobless Rate Looks Like Old Times, but the Economy Doesn’t
teaser: With unemployment below 4 percent for the first time since 2000, the recovery’s duration is remarkable, but lagging pay remains a riddle.

headline: 2 F.B.I. Officials, Once Key Advisers to Comey, Leave the Bureau
teaser: The aides, James A. Baker and Lisa Page, advised the former director James. B. Comey on the bureau’s politically charged investigations into Hillary Clinton and the Trump campaign.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: Whether they were reports on the questions the special counsel plans to ask President Trump or more revelations about the payment made to Stormy Daniels, here are six of the biggest stories driving American politics this week.

headline: Trump Is Said to Know of Stormy Daniels Payment Months Before He Denied It
teaser: How much the president knew about the $130,000 payment to a porn actress and who else was aware of it have been at the center of a swirling controversy for the past 48 hours.

headline: Dissecting Mueller’s Most Significant Questions
teaser: What are the most important takeaways from the questions the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, wants to ask President Trump? Times reporters discuss.

headline: Here Are Ohio Newspaper Endorsements for Governor in Tuesday’s Primary
teaser: Ohio’s newspapers backed Mike DeWine for the Republican nomination but were divided over the two Democrats, Richard A. Cordray and Dennis Kucinich.

headline: ‘Knives, Knives, Knives’: Trump Jabs at London Crime
teaser: In a speech at a National Rifle Association conference in Dallas, the president described a British hospital as “like a war zone for horrible stabbing wounds.”

headline: At His Ranch, John McCain Shares Memories and Regrets With Friends
teaser: Mr. McCain urged former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. to “not walk away” from politics, and said he wished he had chosen Joseph I. Lieberman, not Sarah Palin, as his running mate in 2008.

headline: In Speech Ostensibly About Tax Cuts, Trump Keeps China in Cross Hairs
teaser: Despite a detour to topics like trade and immigration, the president largely stuck to the script after a week of speaking off the cuff.

headline: Giuliani Says Trump Would Not Have to Comply With Mueller Subpoena
teaser: The president’s new lawyer appeared on television Sunday morning in an attempt to clarify comments he made last week about payments to Stormy Daniels.

headline: As Trump Prepares Plan to Lower Drug Prices, Big Pharma Girds for a Fight
teaser: President Trump will lay out a plan this month to make good on his promise to lower prescription prices. Drug companies are ready to resist.

headline: ‘Orwellian Nonsense’? China Says That’s the Price of Doing Business
teaser: After the White House accused China of censorship over airline’s references to places like Hong Kong, a Chinese spokesman said the U.S. should “respect the national feelings of the Chinese people.”

headline: N.R.A. Urges Boycott of a Dallas Restaurant Supporting ‘Reasonable’ Gun Laws
teaser: A restaurant that said it would donate proceeds to promote gun regulations drew the ire of the N.R.A., which told its members to “steer clear.”

headline: Can a ‘Policy Nerd’ Economist Win Over Republicans in Ohio?
teaser: Tim Kane would seem to have the right stuff to be a G.O.P. candidate for Congress in any other year. But in 2018, he seems out of step with his party.

headline: Trump Says He Got Rid of Obamacare. The I.R.S. Doesn’t Agree.
teaser: The I.R.S. has started sending penalty notices to businesses that failed to comply with the Affordable Care Act’s employer mandate, angering Republicans and business groups.

headline: News Analysis: Verifying the End of a Nuclear North Korea ‘Could Make Iran Look Easy’
teaser: Inspections to confirm that North Korea had shut down its nuclear program and secure its arms would be far more onerous than those in Iran under a current deal that President Trump wants to end.

headline: George Conway, Spouse of Top Trump Counselor, Takes White House to Task on Twitter.
teaser: George T. Conway III has for months seemed to publicly question decisions made by a chaotic White House in which his wife, Kellyanne Conway, holds a central role.

headline: Trump’s Nominee for C.I.A. Director Offered to Withdraw Amid Concerns Over Past Role in Torture Program
teaser: Gina Haspel offered to withdraw her nomination to run the C.I.A. if her role in the brutal interrogation of an Al Qaeda suspect threatened to tarnish the agency

headline: In Fight Against Violent Crime, Justice Dept. Targets Low-Level Gun Offenders
teaser: Attorney General Jeff Sessions’s aggressive enforcement has set off a debate about whether his approach is the most effective way to fight gun crimes.

headline: Trump Criticizes Investigators, Citing ‘Unrevealed Conflicts of Interest’
teaser: The veiled threat to the special counsel leading the inquiry comes at a time when Mr. Trump’s legal team appears to be struggling to present a consistent message to the American public.

headline: Trump Urges West Virginians Not to Vote for Don Blankenship
teaser: The president tweeted that Mr. Blankenship’s opponents have a better chance of beating the incumbent Democratic senator, Joe Manchin

headline: Homeland Security Warns It Will Prosecute More Undocumented Immigrants
teaser: The crackdown follows a rise in families and children who illegally entered the United States over the last year.

headline: fact check of the day: Trump Wrongly Links Departures of Two F.B.I. Officials to Russia Investigation
teaser: The president suggested that investigators were “getting caught.” But the F.B.I. officials left voluntarily and were not involved with the Russia inquiry when they resigned.

headline: Melania Trump to Roll Out a Children’s Agenda, With a Focus on Social Media
teaser: The president, hoping to protect her from blowback, at one point suggested she choose an easier subject than social media. But she will talk about that and other issues affecting children.

headline: Fact Check: Trump Calls Kerry’s Push for Iran Deal ‘Possibly Illegal.’ Legal Scholars Shrug.
teaser: President Trump suggested that John Kerry, the former secretary of state, violated the Logan Act, a 1799 law that no one has ever been prosecuted under.

headline: How Pruitt’s Aides Work to Shield the Boss: Seven Quotes
teaser: Emails and other documents obtained from the Environmental Protection Agency show how determined Mr. Pruitt has been to keep the news media and the public at a distance.

headline: Trump to Announce Tuesday Whether He Will Withdraw From Iran Nuclear Deal
teaser: World powers have been lobbying the president to remain in the 2015 agreement that the Trump administration has threatened to jettison since taking office.

headline: New Files Detail the Threats Made Against Scott Pruitt at the E.P.A.
teaser: The E.P.A. chief has cited the memos to justify costly round-the-clock security, which has attracted criticism and scrutiny.

headline: The Candidate Who’s Too Trump-Like Even for Trump
teaser: Republicans in Washington, including President Trump, are encouraging West Virginians not to vote for Don Blankenship, a popular Senate candidate with a complicated past.

headline: Gina Haspel Has the Experience to Run the C.I.A., and That May Be Her Biggest Problem
teaser: As she prepares for her confirmation hearing, President Trump’s nominee to lead the spy agency faces questions about her involvement in torture and secret prisons.

headline: Roger Stone Says He Had Little Contact With Manafort Deputy
teaser: Mr. Stone, a veteran political operative, made the comments in an interview in response to a CNBC report that the special counsel was scrutinizing the ties between the men.

headline: Opponents of Iran Deal Hired Investigators to Dig Up Dirt on Obama Aide
teaser: Evidence has surfaced that opponents of the deal engaged in a sophisticated effort to dig up dirt on Benjamin J. Rhodes and his family that continued well after the Obama administration left office.

headline: New York Attorney General’s Comments on Women’s Rights
teaser: Before he resigned Monday after four former romantic partners accused him of physical assault, Eric T. Schneiderman was known as an advocate for women.

headline: Unable to Excite the Base? Moderate Candidates Still Tend to Outdo Extreme Ones
teaser: Research points to a key to political victories in the House: Don’t nominate someone who will motivate the other side to show up.

headline: The U.S. Will Withdraw From Iran Nuclear Deal, Trump Tells Macron
teaser: Mr. Trump’s decision, while long anticipated and widely telegraphed, plunges America’s relations with European allies into deep uncertainty.

headline: Watch: President Trump Withdraws U.S. From Iran Deal
teaser: The president called the nuclear agreement a “horrible one-sided deal that should have never, ever been made.”

headline: House Votes to Dismantle Bias Rule in Auto Lending
teaser: The regulatory rollback by Republicans moved forward as lawmakers also inched closer to a bipartisan agreement to alter portions of the 2010 Dodd-Frank Act.

headline: Watch the Full Video: President Trump Withdraws From Iran Deal
teaser: The president called the nuclear agreement a “horrible one-sided deal that should have never, ever been made.”

headline: Giuliani’s Ever-Changing Hush Money Story
teaser: President Trump and his new lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, have given conflicting accounts of the 2016 payment for $130,000 to the porn star Stormy Daniels. We try to clear things up.

headline: Paul Ryan Swears Father Conroy Back In as House Chaplain
teaser: Catholics had protested in recent weeks after the House speaker asked for his resignation. The two men met for coffee and talked of reconciliation.

headline: As Melania Trump Faces Plagiarism Claims, Her Staff Lashes Out at News Media
teaser: A booklet with the branding of her “Be Best” initiative was first published by the Federal Trade Commission during the Obama era, setting off a storm of accusations.

headline: Eric Schneiderman Set Himself Up as Trump’s Foil. What Happens Now?
teaser: The attorney general had made his name since 2016 as a crusader against Mr. Trump’s agenda and a counterweight to the presidential pardon powers.

headline: Trump Withdraws From the Iran Deal. Here’s How Republicans, Democrats and the World Reacted.
teaser: World leaders and lawmakers from both sides of the aisle were quick to weigh in after President Trump announced his plan to withdraw the United States from the nuclear accord.

headline: Trump Overreaches in Critique of Iran Deal
teaser: President Trump said the pact allowed Iran to enrich uranium and wouldn’t have stopped it from developing a nuclear bomb — claims that lacked context or weren’t entirely accurate.

headline: 9/11 Planner, Tortured by C.I.A., Asks to Tell Senators About Gina Haspel
teaser: It isn’t known whether Ms. Haspel, nominated to lead the C.I.A., was involved in torturing Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, who asked a military judge at Guantánamo Bay for permission to share the information.

headline: News Analysis: Trump’s Termination of Iran Deal Is Risky Bet That U.S. Can ‘Break the Regime’
teaser: President Trump’s decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear deal is premised on the idea that the U.S. and its allies force a better deal with Tehran through isolation and sanctions.

headline: Vice President’s Brother Captures G.O.P. House Primary in Indiana
teaser: On his first run for office, Greg Pence, the vice president’s brother, won the Republican nomination on Tuesday for the House seat his brother once held.

headline: Russia Tried to Undermine Confidence in Voting Systems, Senators Say
teaser: The Senate Intelligence Committee identified around 20 states where Russian hackers surveilled election systems in 2016, but said it found no evidence that vote tallies were changed.

headline: C.D.C. Director’s Salary Is Reduced to $209,700 From $375,000
teaser: The pay cut for Dr. Robert Redfield, the newly appointed agency chief, came about after senators and the public questioned why his salary was much higher than his predecessors’.

headline: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Indicted in Dismantling of U.S. Informant Network in China
teaser: Prosecutors said the officer, Jerry Chun Shing Lee, was approached by Chinese intelligence officers and communicated with them for months.

headline: At a Key Moment, Trump’s Top Diplomat Is Again Thousands of Miles Away
teaser: The absence of Secretary of State Mike Pompeo as President Trump announced a withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal created uncertainty that spanned the Atlantic.

headline: Cordray Defeats Kucinich in Ohio; Blankenship Loses in West Virginia
teaser: The victory by Mr. Cordray, who was endorsed by Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts, came as a relief to many Democrats who saw Mr. Kucinich as unelectable.

headline: Don Blankenship Loses West Virginia Republican Primary for Senate
teaser: The former coal executive faced a concerted campaign by Republicans to stop him, including a last-minute appeal from President Trump. Patrick Morrisey, the state’s attorney general, won the nomination.

headline: Firm Tied to Russian Oligarch Made Payments to Michael Cohen
teaser: The shell company Mr. Cohen used to pay Stormy Daniels later received over $1 million from the firm and several companies with business before the Trump administration.

headline: How Long Would It Take Iran to Build a Nuclear Bomb? It Depends
teaser: It could take at least a year, maybe longer, if Iran decided to make its own fuel. But if it bought its fuel from another nuclear power, the warning time to a bomb could be about three months.

headline: What’s Kim Jong-un’s Last Name? Mike Pompeo Is Learning the Hard Way
teaser: The U.S. secretary of state referred to the North Korean leader as “Chairman Un,” suggesting a lack of experience with Korean names.

headline: Live Briefing: What to Watch for in Gina Haspel’s Confirmation Hearing to Run the C.I.A.
teaser: Ms. Haspel is a career spy who spent her life in the shadows. Now she is facing questions about her role in the C.I.A.’s torture of terrorism suspects.

headline: White House Memo: No Longer Held Back by His Advisers, Trump Puts His Imprint on Foreign Policy
teaser: The president’s decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear agreement opens several weeks in which he will finally put in place the “America First” approach he has long promised.

headline: U.S. Commandos in Africa Are Told to Avoid Combat Missions or ‘Do Not Go’
teaser: The order, issued by Maj. Gen. J. Marcus Hicks, is among several new directives after an Oct. 4 ambush in Niger that killed four American soldiers, including two Green Berets.

headline: 6 Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primary Elections
teaser: Richard Cordray won in Ohio. Don Blankenship lost in West Virginia. What you need to know about last night’s votes.

headline: Europe, Again Humiliated by Trump, Struggles to Defend Its Interests
teaser: With his Iran decision, as on climate and trade, President Trump has split sharply with strong allies. There are signs that their patience is wearing thin.

headline: Eric Schneiderman’s Legacy in Financial Cases May Survive His Downfall
teaser: As New York’s attorney general, Mr. Schneiderman used the same playbook that raised the profiles of his predecessors. Whoever fills the job next will probably do the same thing.

headline: Pompeo Offers Olive Branch to North Korea Amid Mission to Free Americans
teaser: The secretary of state had hoped to smooth any last wrinkles ahead of a planned summit meeting between the North Korean leader and President Trump.

headline: Tech We’re Using: In Washington, a Brighter Spotlight on Technology
teaser: Technology has come under the microscope in Washington. Here are the tools that Cecilia Kang, who covers tech policy for The Times, uses to cover it.

headline: Chinese Tech Giant May Be First Victim of a New U.S. Cold War
teaser: The electronics firm ZTE has found success in the American market like few other Chinese technology brands have. Now it is fighting for its life.

headline: North Carolina Republican Is First Incumbent Ousted in 2018
teaser: Robert Pittenger, seeking his fourth term, lost a primary challenge on Tuesday to Mark Harris, a Baptist minister who opposes same-sex marriage.

headline: Rachel Crooks, Who Accused Trump of Sexual Assault, Wins Legislative Primary
teaser: Ms. Crooks, the Democratic nominee for an Ohio House seat, says Mr. Trump forcibly kissed her at Trump Tower in 2005.

headline: Is This Election Rigged Against Trump?
teaser: With Donald J. Trump's claims that the election is rigged against him, we take a look at past close and contentious elections.

headline: Boeing C.E.O. Downplays Loss of $20 Billion Contract With Iran
teaser: A day after the U.S. decided to pull out of the Iran nuclear deal, Boeing said it would abide by the administration’s decision to cancel its license to sell to Iran.

headline: House Republicans, Defying Leaders, Move to Force Immigration Votes
teaser: More than a dozen House Republicans created a petition to force votes on immigration legislation, hoping to settle the uncertain futures of the so-called Dreamers.

headline: Democrats in Rust Belt: Stay Close to Trump, but Not Too Close
teaser: After primaries in prime Trump territory Tuesday, Republicans were eager to embrace the president while Democrats had a more delicate balancing act.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Haspel Says C.I.A. ‘Historically’ Has Not Interrogated Subjects. History Shows Otherwise.
teaser: Gina Haspel, President Trump’s nominee to lead the Central Intelligence Agency made the claim during her Senate confirmation hearing on Wednesday.

headline: U.S. Pullout From Iran Nuclear Deal May Unsettle Oil Markets
teaser: Saudi Arabia and Russia may offset any reduction in Iranian exports, but if prices rise, one of the beneficiaries could be Iran itself.

headline: Gina Haspel Vows She Won’t Allow Torture if She’s Confirmed to Run the C.I.A.
teaser: Ms. Haspel, the career spy who once oversaw the waterboarding of a terrorism suspect, defended the agency’s past at her confirmation hearing, but she said there would be no torture in its future.

headline: An Ohio Special Election Shapes Up as a Big Test of the ‘Blue Wave’
teaser: The House special election in August in the suburbs of Columbus could indicate how Democrats will perform in November with college-educated, affluent voters.

headline: Inside the N.R.A. Convention
teaser: The annual event in Dallas drew about 75,000 members.

headline: With Schneiderman Out, Environmental Fight Loses a Prominent Voice
teaser: As a leader of the fight against the Trump administration’s rollbacks leaves the stage, what comes next? And what about the Exxon investigation?

headline: To Lower Drug Costs at Home, Trump Wants Higher Prices Abroad
teaser: President Trump, in a speech on Friday, will lay out his plan to reduce prescription drug prices. But one of his ideas may not be so popular with some of the United States’ strongest allies.

headline: Political Memo: Eric Schneiderman Falls. Trump Allies Gloat. Democrats Seethe.
teaser: The White House’s exultation over liberal men who resign over sexual misconduct has grated politicians in both parties, who view President Trump as a poor messenger on women’s rights.

headline: Does Torture Work? Trump: Yes. Haspel: No.
teaser: As a candidate, President Trump was known to tout the effectiveness of torture. But his pick for C.I.A. director, Gina Haspel, told the Senate Intelligence Committee on Wednesday that she sees things much differently.

headline: Appeals Court Bars U.S. From Transferring American ISIS Suspect
teaser: In a major war powers decision, an appeals court has blocked the government from forcibly transferring an American detainee to another country.

headline: DeVos Moves to Loosen Restrictions on Federal Aid to Religious Colleges
teaser: The measure is part of a sweeping deregulatory agenda that includes several rules and regulations for the department to scrap or amend.

headline: Trump Bets Sanctions Will Force Iran to Bargain. There’s No Plan B.
teaser: Even Republicans who were uneasy with the nuclear pact said the White House appeared more interested in scrapping it than dealing with Tehran in a comprehensive way.

headline: How Michael Cohen, Denied Job in White House, Was Seen as Its Gatekeeper
teaser: Through a secretive shell company, the president’s personal lawyer was paid by major corporations and a law firm for help navigating Washington in the Trump era.

headline: President Trump a Nobel Laureate? It’s a Possibility
teaser: The likelihood of Mr. Trump receiving a Nobel Peace Prize for his diplomatic efforts once seemed far-fetched. But as talks with North and South Korea progress, supporters see merit in the idea.

headline: Releasing 3 Americans, North Koreans Signal Openness to Washington
teaser: The release of the three prisoners was North Korea’s most tangible gesture aimed at improving relations with the United States since President Trump took office.

headline: 3 Americans Freed From North Korea Arrive Near Washington
teaser: The return of the prisoners removed a delicate obstacle as President Trump prepares to meet with the North’s leader, Kim Jong-un.

headline: On Washington: John McCain Isn’t Ready to Wave a White Flag Just Yet
teaser: In a new memoir as he confronts brain cancer and his mortality, the senator from Arizona yearns for a return to more civil politics and worldwide U.S. leadership.

headline: Giuliani Resigns From Law Firm Amid Tensions Over Comments About Trump
teaser: Weeks after announcing a leave of absence, Greenberg Traurig said Mr. Giuliani had resigned. Partners had become frustrated by some of his recent interviews.

headline: U.S.-North Korea Summit Set for June 12 in Singapore, Trump says
teaser: Mr. Trump made his announcement in a Twitter post on Thursday morning, just hours after the president met three American hostages recently freed by the North.

headline: Shooting of Agent Shines Light on a Federal Fight Against Chicago Gun Crime
teaser: An A.T.F. task force, which has contributed to significant cases in the city over the past year, is seen as a possible model.

headline: Trump’s Trade Moves Put U.S. Carmakers in a Jam at Home and Abroad
teaser: Outside of agriculture, no industry has more to lose than carmakers as the administration tussles with China and renegotiates the North American Free Trade Agreement.

headline: Homeland Security Secretary Was Close to Resigning After Trump Berated Her
teaser: The president, angry about a rise in illegal immigration, dressed down Kirstjen Nielsen in front of the entire cabinet during a meeting on Wednesday.

headline: McCain May Be the ‘Conscience of the Senate.’ Is Anybody Listening?
teaser: John McCain, tortured as a P.O.W., has long been an influential voice on interrogation. But his opposition to Gina Haspel for C.I.A. director seems to have had little effect.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Pelosi Wrongly Says China and Russia Never Agreed to Sanctions Before Iran Deal
teaser: Representative Nancy Pelosi, the Democratic leader, ignored at least four previous instances when those nations did support international sanctions against Iran.

headline: Gina Haspel’s Testimony About C.I.A. Torture Raises New Questions
teaser: Several statements by Ms. Haspel, President Trump’s nominee to lead the C.I.A., at her confirmation hearing are attracting scrutiny.

headline: Trump on Kim Jong-un: Once a ‘Madman,’ Now a ‘Very Honorable’ Leader
teaser: The head-snapping rhetorical turn has opened the president to criticism that he has been too quick to embrace a brutal leader as a worthy negotiating partner.

headline: In Niger Ambush, Rushing Into the Gunfire to Save the Fallen
teaser: A report and a Pentagon video about the deadly attack show soldiers scrambling to administer aid and find a way to stay alive in a one-sided battle.

headline: Trump to Drop Call for Medicare to Negotiate Lower Drug Prices
teaser: Breaking a campaign promise, President Trump will not push for the plan, which was popular with voters but not other Republican politicians, when he speaks on Friday about soaring prescription costs.

headline: Trump Presses Arab Allies to Do More to Counter Iran
teaser: In a pair of letters to four Middle East nations, President Trump repeated his complaints that the United States has borne too much of the burden in the region.

headline: ‘America Is Respected Again,’ Trump Says in Elkhart, Ind., a City Obama Once Championed
teaser: On Thursday, President Trump swapped his role as grim-faced statesman for one that comes more naturally to him: campaign trail firebrand.

headline: AT&T Chief Says Hiring Michael Cohen as Consultant a ‘Big Mistake’
teaser: In a staffwide memo, Randall L. Stephenson, the C.E.O., also said the company’s head of lobbying would retire.

headline: U.S. Ambassador Will Not Work Full Time in New Jerusalem Embassy
teaser: The ambassador will split time between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, given that most of the embassy staff will be remaining in the Tel Aviv branch of the embassy.

headline: Bond Market Indicates Doubt About Trump’s Economic Targets
teaser: The gap between short- and long-term interest rates has shrunk, and if the trend intensifies, it may be a classic harbinger of recession.

headline: Trump Outlines Plan to Lower Drug Prices
teaser: The president said he would promote more competition, but broke with the promises that he made while campaigning, like calling for Medicare to negotiate lower prices.

headline: Fact-Check of the Day: Trump Misleadingly Says Construction Has Already Begun on His Border Wall
teaser: The Border Patrol has begun replacing old barriers with new barriers — which some call walls and others fencing. But construction on a 1,000-mile border wall has not begun.

headline: The Trump Administration Considers an Old Friend: Ken Kurson
teaser: F.B.I. agents are said to have interviewed people who worked with Mr. Kurson at The Observer, the publication owned by the Kushner family, where he served as editor.

headline: Pruitt’s Dinner With Cardinal Accused of Abuse Was Kept Off Public Schedule
teaser: The E.P.A. chief dined with Cardinal George Pell, who was later charged with assault. But the agency is said to have omitted the cardinal from official schedules.

headline: Trump, Softening His Tone, Calls for More Talks on Car Emissions
teaser: The president has directed his administration to negotiate with California over a proposed rollback of fuel economy and tailpipe emissions standards.

headline: White House Refuses to Apologize for Aide’s Joke About McCain
teaser: Friends and admirers of Senator John McCain condemned an assistant to President Trump who said the senator did not matter because “he’s dying anyway.”

headline: Colleges Hire Consultants to Help Manipulate Student Loan Default Rates
teaser: The congressional watchdog found that the consultants pressured student borrowers to put their loans on ice, which allows borrowers to avoid default and schools to avoid losing federal funding.

headline: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Plans to Try to Lower Drug Prices
teaser: The drug industry won some key victories, even if it did not escape entirely unscathed.

headline: Trump Tirade Is Culmination of Immigration Frustration
teaser: Trump’s fury at his homeland security secretary was part of his belief that the administration is moving too slowly to make good on his 2016 campaign promises.

headline: Here Are the Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From President Trump’s decision to withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal to the release of three Americans from North Korea, here are six of the biggest stories driving American politics this week.

headline: Federal Prisons Roll Back Rules Protecting Transgender People
teaser: The statistics arm of the Justice Department has also proposed that it stop collecting data about sexual orientation and gender identity from participants in a crime survey.

headline: Suspicions, Demands and Threats: Devin Nunes vs. the Justice Dept.
teaser: Mr. Nunes has escalated his confrontation with law enforcement officials, who have expressed concern that he is trying to undermine the special counsel inquiry.

headline: Clashing Views on Iran Reflect a New Balance of Power in the Cabinet
teaser: John R. Bolton, the new national security adviser, is on the rise, and Defense Secretary Jim Mattis appears more isolated. The new secretary of state, Mike Pompeo, may be the man in the middle.

headline: Federal Tax Cuts Leave States in a Bind
teaser: The federal tax law had the unintended effect of giving states a tax windfall. Now, states must weigh whether to spend the money or give it back to residents.

headline: ‘If We Let Everybody Go, There’d Be Nobody in Prison’
teaser: Last year, Ebony Thomas was in jail, unable to afford bail. This year, she’s a spokeswoman for Black Mama’s Bail Out Day.

headline: Education Department Unwinds Unit Investigating Fraud at For-Profits
teaser: A team of lawyers and investigators had looked into advertising at big colleges. Now it mostly process student loan forgiveness applications.

headline: As Idaho Grows, Its Politics Evolve. But Don’t Expect a Democratic Surge.
teaser: These are heady times for Boise, with an influx of newcomers, a spike in home prices and a jolt of jobs. But how will that change Idaho’s politics?

headline: Trying for House Gains, Democrats Bless Moderates and Annoy Liberals
teaser: In right-leaning districts they hope to flip, national Democrats are backing moderates in primaries, a strategy that may yield a fractious House caucus if they win.

headline: Dean Heller, Buffeted on Both Sides, Tries to Save His Nevada Senate Seat
teaser: Mr. Heller has angered Trump supporters and infuriated Democrats. Now, he faces re-election as the Senate’s most vulnerable Republican incumbent.

headline: He Was a Tireless Critic of the Iran Deal. Now He Insists He Wanted to Save It.
teaser: Mark Dubowitz, the chief executive of the Foundation for Defense of Democracies, has drawn outrage as he voices regret over President Trump’s withdrawal from the nuclear pact.

headline: Retro Report: ‘This Is Not a Drill’: The Growing Threat of Nuclear Annihilation
teaser: Veterans of the Cold War say Americans are too complacent about the risk of catastrophe as the number of nuclear hot spots increases.

headline: Europeans Should Have Known Trump Would Abandon Iran Deal, Bolton Says
teaser: The remarks could further exasperate the Europeans, who spent months negotiating to salvage the accord and believed they had nearly satisfied the president’s demands.

headline: To Sway Trump on Trade, Businesses Turn to Cable TV
teaser: The National Retail Federation is planning an advertising blitz on “Fox & Friends” to persuade Mr. Trump to back away from his tariffs plan.

headline: Sidebar: Will the Supreme Court Scrutinize Solitary Confinement? One Justice Offers a Map
teaser: In 1979, an appeals court judge named Anthony Kennedy ruled that prisoners have a right to a little fresh air. Now he and his fellow justices could decide a similar case.

headline: An Evangelical Journalist Finds His Calling at the White House
teaser: David Brody has unusual access to the president. In return, Mr. Trump gets a direct line to the evangelical audience he depends on.

headline: Puerto Rico Nervously Prepares for Hurricane Season: ‘What if Another One Comes?’
teaser: Emergency managers say they have revamped their plans since Hurricane Maria. But work is left to be done, and hurricane season begins June 1.

headline: Supreme Court Ruling Favors Sports Betting
teaser: The case concerned New Jersey, but it has implications for other states eager to allow and tax sports gambling. Americans are estimated to annually place $150 billion in illegal wagers on sports.

headline: China Welcomes Trump’s Help on ZTE as Trade Talks Loom
teaser: The shift by the American president could ease tensions ahead of a visit to Washington by Liu He, a vice premier in the Beijing government.

headline: Pennsylvania’s Primary: Congressional Races to Watch
teaser: The state has a brand-new voting map, which analysts predict may help Democrats eventually gain up to six seats in the House of Representatives this fall.

headline: Times Insider: 3 A1 Headlines, 3 Alerts, 3 Hours: How #MeToo Makes News
teaser: The night was supposed to belong to the Met Gala. Then the Schneiderman story broke.

headline: As D.I.Y. Gene Editing Gains Popularity, ‘Someone Is Going to Get Hurt’
teaser: After researchers created a virus from mail-order DNA, geneticists sound the alarm about the genetic tinkering carried out in garages and living rooms.

headline: Pastor Who Said Jews Are Going to Hell Led Prayer at Jerusalem Embassy Opening
teaser: Robert Jeffress, a Dallas evangelical pastor, played a prominent role in the ceremony, as did the Rev. John C. Hagee, a televangelist with a history of inflammatory remarks.

headline: Dallas Restaurant That Defied N.R.A. Donates to ‘Gun Sense’ Group
teaser: Expressing support for gun ownership with “reasonable” regulations, Ellen’s restaurant gives $15,000 in memory of five police officers killed at a 2016 protest.

headline: Melania Trump Hospitalized for Kidney Medical Procedure
teaser: The first lady is at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center and is likely to remain there for the duration of the week.

headline: Harry Reid Has Surgery for Pancreatic Cancer
teaser: The former Senate Democratic leader had surgery on Monday to remove a tumor from his pancreas. Mr. Reid’s family said the prognosis for his recovery was good.

headline: Supreme Court Rules for Death Row Inmate Betrayed by His Lawyer
teaser: The justices also decided that drivers of rented cars not listed on the rental agreements do not lose their constitutional right to privacy.

headline: Pence Is Trying to Control Republican Politics. Trump Aides Aren’t Happy.
teaser: President Trump has not yet crafted a strategy for his involvement in the midterms. So his supremely disciplined running mate has stepped into the void.

headline: Jerusalem Embassy Is a Victory for Trump, and a Roadblock to Middle East Peace
teaser: The White House said the violence in Gaza, which it dismissed as “unfortunate propaganda,” would not hinder its efforts to push forward a plan for ending the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

headline: Trump Administration Defends Plan to Lower Prescription Drug Prices
teaser: The secretary of health and human services dismissed solutions that have long been supported by Democrats, but that President Trump endorsed during the 2016 campaign.

headline: White House Memo: The Trump White House Will Not Apologize About John McCain (or Much Else, Really)
teaser: Aides who could face wrath from President Trump for admitting a misstep have adopted the president’s theory that apologizing is giving in.

headline: Which Poor People Shouldn’t Have to Work for Aid?
teaser: The lines set by policymakers risk embedding regional and racial biases about who counts as “left behind.”

headline: It’s Primary Day. Here’s Everything You Need to Know
teaser: Voters on Tuesday cast ballots for primaries in four states: Idaho, Nebraska, Oregon and Pennsylvania.

headline: Amid Debate and Violence, Trump Delivers Embassy Victory to Christian Base
teaser: The president’s evangelical supporters are celebrating the new American embassy in Jerusalem as another policy promise he has made good on.

headline: U.S. Imposes New Sanctions on Iran, Designating Head of Central Bank a Terrorist
teaser: The new designation is separate from the nuclear sanctions that were reinstated last week against Iran.

headline: Haspel Likely to be Confirmed After Repudiating C.I.A. Torture
teaser: After refusing at her confirmation hearing to condemn the C.I.A.’s use of torture after 9/11, she wrote in a letter that the agency should not have undertaken that program.

headline: Pompeo Lifts Hiring Freeze in Effort to Return ‘Swagger’ to State Dept.
teaser: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo lifted the department’s hiring freeze in one of many efforts to restore the department’s effectiveness and morale.

headline: Why Alaska Is Crafting a Plan to Fight Climate Change: It’s Impossible to Ignore
teaser: Many solidly Republican states have resisted aggressive climate policies, but Alaska is already seeing the dramatic effects of global warming.

headline: Trump Indonesia Real Estate Project Gets Chinese Government Ally
teaser: President Trump’s partner in Bali, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, has signed a deal with a Chinese state-owned company.

headline: Economic Scene: G.O.P. Insists Making Poor People Work Lifts Them Up. Where’s the Proof?
teaser: President Trump and congressional Republicans are reviving an enduring party view that tying work requirements to antipoverty programs benefits those in need. There’s little evidence that’s so.

headline: Newsbook: 3 Books to Help You Understand Why Moving the U.S. Embassy to Jerusalem Prompted Protests
teaser: The decades-long Israeli-Palestinian conflict has been well-documented in literature.

headline: Suspect Identified in C.I.A. Leak Was Charged, but Not for the Breach
teaser: After the release of C.I.A. hacking tools last year, The Times has learned the suspect’s identity. He’s been charged, but in a separate child pornography case.

headline: Mary Sansone, a Grass-Roots Political Godmother, Dies at 101
teaser: A Brooklyn social worker and civic leader who was colorblind to race, she could deliver votes and was courted by political candidates.

headline: Trump’s Plan for Cheaper Health Insurance Could Have Hidden Costs
teaser: An independent federal study said the proposal could increase government spending by $1.2 billion next year, compared with the $96 million to $168 million a year estimated by the administration.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claimed That Transfers of Military Gear to Police Departments Are ‘At a Record Clip’
teaser: Transfers of surplus equipment have declined — not increased — under President Trump.

headline: Justice Department and F.B.I. Are Investigating Cambridge Analytica
teaser: Federal prosecutors have sought to question former employees of the now-defunct political data firm and banks that handled its business.

headline: Businesses Race to Washington to Sway Trump on China Tariffs
teaser: Some of those testifying about the proposal commended the tariffs, and others criticized them. But all agreed on the potential for the plan to irrevocably alter the course of their businesses.

headline: Talking to Senators, Trump Stays on (His Own) Message
teaser: During a lunch on Tuesday, President Trump avoided controversial topics and instead talked about his own accomplishments and his optimism for the Republican Party in the fall midterm elections.

headline: Women Score Major Victories in House Primary Races in Pennsylvania
teaser: Buoyed by a new congressional map and grass-roots anger at President Trump, Democrats are poised to flip several Republican-held districts in a state Mr. Trump narrowly won in 2016.

headline: Tantalizing Testimony From a Top Trump Aide Sets Off a Search for Proof
teaser: The aide said he remembered getting an email about Russian dirt on Hillary Clinton well before compromising Democratic emails were released. No one can find the message he mentioned.

headline: Scott Pruitt on Capitol Hill: What to Expect in Round Three
teaser: The E.P.A. administrator testifies on Wednesday, the first chance senators will have to question him about first-class travel, his ties to lobbyists and other ethics issues.

headline: 3 Key Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primaries
teaser: In Pennsylvania, the Democrats rallied around women, and the Republicans went for candidates in the Trump mold.

headline: Kim Jong-un Shows True Colors by Threatening to Cancel Trump Meeting
teaser: North Korea’s goal remains unchanged: it will not bargain away its nuclear weapons unless Washington removes military threats.

headline: Novartis’s Top Lawyer is Out After Payments to Michael Cohen
teaser: The Swiss pharmaceutical giant said Felix R. Ehrat would retire, after the company said this month it had made payments to President Trump’s personal lawyer.

headline: Trump to Meet Uzbek President, and Press for Human Rights
teaser: Aides say Wednesday’s meeting is an effort to launch a new era of partnership with Uzbekistan, a country that is making its first fitful turns away from authoritarianism.

headline: Donald Tusk Takes Donald Trump to Task: ‘With Friends Like That’ …
teaser: The leader of the E.U.’s heads of government used 280 characters to blast the U.S. president and reaffirm the bloc’s commitment to its policy agenda.

headline: A Secret Mission, a Code Name and Anxiety: Inside the Early Days of the F.B.I.’s Trump Investigation
teaser: Mr. Trump has described the investigation as a politically motivated effort to undermine his presidency. But time and again, agents took steps that ultimately benefited him.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trade or Enforcement? Trump and Aides Give Conflicting Statements on ZTE
teaser: President Trump on Wednesday characterized his decision to review restrictions on a Chinese telecommunication company as part of “the larger trade deal.” But his commerce secretary and press aides have said differently.

headline: The Key Themes, Dates and Characters in the Russia Investigation
teaser: The special counsel is investigating events that span years and cross international borders.

headline: Trump Discloses Payment to Cohen in Financial Report
teaser: Mr. Trump’s financial disclosure included a payment made to his personal attorney, Michael D. Cohen.

headline: Here’s Your Unclassified Briefing on Secret Government Code Names
teaser: The F.B.I. investigation into Russian election meddling and possible ties to Trump associates was originally called Crossfire Hurricane.

headline: On Trade, the U.S. and China Consider the Unthinkable: Breaking Up
teaser: Complete disengagement is impossible, but both Washington and Beijing envision a day when they don’t need each other as much to power their economies.

headline: Senator Urges Action on Deadly Carbon Monoxide Risk in Keyless Cars
teaser: A top safety official said she would raise awareness about the hazard, but would not commit to mandating a software fix to increase alerts to drivers.

headline: 5 Things the New Trump Tower Meeting Documents Tell Us
teaser: A Senate committee released thousands of documents related to a 2016 meeting with Trump campaign officials and a Russian lawyer. Here are five key findings.

headline: Even Little Lies Are a Big Threat to American Democracy, Tillerson Says
teaser: In an apparent rebuke to President Trump, the former secretary of state says efforts to conceal truth amounts to going “wobbly on America.”

headline: Teacher Walkouts Spread to North Carolina, but the Movement Has Limits
teaser: Centralized education funding helps explain why walkouts have happened in North Carolina and five other states, but not in others.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims a 40% Decrease in Illegal Border Crossings
teaser: Such crossings actually increased in April, compared with March and the previous three Aprils.

headline: Trump Calls Some Unauthorized Immigrants ‘Animals’ in Rant
teaser: The president unspooled a lengthy diatribe before TV cameras, warning that dangerous people were clamoring to breach the United States’ borders and castigating Mexico.

headline: Prospective Democratic Presidential Candidates Put Their Ideas on Audition
teaser: At a Center for American Progress conference, Democrats who are potentially eyeing 2020 focused less on opposing President Trump and more on affirmative policy goals.

headline: Top Republican Senator Says There’s ‘No Doubt’ Russia Favored Trump
teaser: Senator Richard M. Burr of North Carolina, the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said he saw “no reason to dispute” the findings of the United States’ spy agencies.

headline: North Korean Threats Are ‘Splash of Cold Water’ on Expectations for Talks
