teaser: Officials said they believed the meeting between President Trump and Kim Jong-un would still happen, but the threats brought a diplomatic high-wire act temporarily back to earth.

headline: Mueller Won’t Indict Trump if He Finds Wrongdoing, Giuliani Says
teaser: The special counsel’s office has told the president’s lawyers that prosecutors will follow existing guidelines that say that sitting presidents cannot be indicted.

headline: On Washington: Republicans Escalate Bitter Fight Over Judicial Nominations
teaser: The Senate is entering a new phase of judicial battles as Republicans push aside Democrats’ objections.

headline: Watch List Shields T.S.A. Screeners From Threatening, and Unruly, Travelers
teaser: Assaults against airport security screeners are rising, but civil liberties groups worry about expanding government surveillance for minor infractions.

headline: North Korea’s Sudden Shift Puts South’s Leader on the Spot
teaser: For President Moon Jae-in, North Korea’s threat to derail talks has made clear the difficulties of playing matchmaker between Kim Jong-un and President Trump.

headline: Superdelegates Are No. 1 on the Democratic Party To-Do List
teaser: Party officials want to resolve differences over the role and influence of superdelegates, which were a major sticking point in the 2016 primaries.

headline: ‘Bigger Than Watergate!’ Trump Fumes as Russia Inquiry Enters Second Year
teaser: Mr. Trump tweeted that a confidential informant embedded in his presidential campaign would be a scandal bigger than Watergate, inviting comparisons.

headline: China Plans to Offer Major Trade Concessions, but Skepticism Abounds
teaser: A meeting between the top economic adviser to China and administration officials is expected to focus heavily on reducing the gap between what America exports to China and what it imports.

headline: Show Starring Avenatti and Scaramucci Is Being Pitched to Television Executives
teaser: The men are fixtures on cable news — Mr. Avenatti, the lawyer for a pornographic actress suing the president, as Mr. Trump’s antagonist, and Mr. Scaramucci as the president’s supporter.

headline: As Democratic Women Surge, Ranks of Republican Women May Shrink
teaser: Democratic women are running for Congress in record numbers, and Republican women are trying to match the surge. But retirements may leave G.O.P. ranks depleted.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Stretches Facts by Claiming Record Successes During ‘Greatest Witch Hunt’ in U.S. History
teaser: A historian says comparing the Russia investigation to the Salem witch trials is “hot air.” And among the past 10 presidents, Mr. Trump has signed the second-fewest bills to become law at this point in his term.

headline: A State Attorney General Calls Out Betsy DeVos on For-Profit Colleges
teaser: The New Jersey attorney general says federal education officials have stopped cooperating with the state on fraudulent activities at for-profits.

headline: Sanctions on Iran and Venezuela May Empower U.S. Rivals
teaser: Squeezing the two oil producers could increase demand for Russian crude and offer China and Russia a chance to deepen their ties to the Iranians.

headline: Senate Confirms Gina Haspel to Lead C.I.A. Despite Torture Concerns
teaser: Ms. Haspel, a career clandestine officer, will take the helm as the agency’s first female director at a time of shifting alliances and intelligence threats from countries including Russia and Iran.

headline: Responding to Leaks, White House Limits Number of Staff in Daily Meeting
teaser: A joke about Senator John McCain’s illness made at a meeting of White House communications staff last week was leaked, causing an uproar.

headline: Congressional Candidates, Not Mueller, Could Decide Trump’s Future
teaser: The idea of impeachment raises the stakes for control of Congress this November and potentially puts the idea front and center in the midterm elections.

headline: Anti-American Cleric’s Power Grows, Upending Pentagon’s Plans for Iraq
teaser: A political party led by Moktada al-Sadr, whose militia once targeted American troops, will wield considerable power in setting up Iraq’s next government.

headline: White House Memo: ‘Bigger Than Watergate’? Both Sides Say Yes, but for Different Reasons
teaser: Forty-four years after Richard Nixon resigned, critics of President Trump see an even worse scandal. Mr. Trump says the real outrage is the investigation.

headline: Chance of Nafta Deal in 2018 Diminishes as Talks Drag Past Congressional Deadline
teaser: The Trump administration had hoped a revised deal would reach the current Congress, in which Republicans control both chambers. Now, those prospects are diminishing by the day.

headline: Abortion Referrals Would Cause Clinics to Lose Federal Funds Under New Trump Rule
teaser: The change, a top priority of social conservatives, would bar reproductive health organizations from providing or mentioning abortions at any facility that receives federal family planning funds.

headline: Justice Dept. Restricts a Common Tactic of Immigration Judges
teaser: Attorney General Jeff Sessions said that immigration courts could no longer rely on a practice that delays proceedings to remove an immigrant from the country.

headline: Trump and North Korea Rebuff Bolton’s ‘Libya Model’
teaser: John Bolton, the national security adviser, says the dismantling of Libya’s nuclear weapons program provides a playbook for North Korean denuclearization. The idea is provoking a lot of resistance and confusion.

headline: Gunman at Trump Golf Club in Florida Is Shot by the Police
teaser: The gunman, who was identified as Jonathan Oddi, was shot several times and was “yelling and spewing some information about President Trump,” the police said.

headline: U.S. and South Korea to Discuss North’s ‘Bright Future’
teaser: Moon Jae-in, the South Korean leader, is to meet President Trump at the White House next week to discuss possible incentives for Pyongyang to denuclearize.

headline: Trump Pushes Possibility of Campaign Informant as ‘Really Bad Stuff’
teaser: By raising the prospect of a spy in his 2016 campaign, the president weighed into a simmering battle between federal law enforcement officials and his allies on Capitol Hill.

headline: Now Even Japan Is Pushing Back Against Trump’s Tariffs
teaser: Japan is considering filing a complaint with the W.T.O. against the United States for tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, a sign it could be readying for a trade war.

headline: Trump Laments Latest School Shooting and Vows Action — Again
teaser: Mr. Trump had called for gun control measures after the February school shooting in Parkland, Fla., but did not press for action, and Congress has not followed through.

headline: Trump Says He Will Nominate Acting Secretary to Lead V.A.
teaser: President Trump’s previous choice to run the Department of Veterans Affairs, Ronny L. Jackson, withdrew his name from consideration last month.

headline: China Smooths the Way for a Trade Deal as Economic Risks Mount
teaser: China dropped a trade case against American sorghum and prepared to offer Americans an eye-catching package of purchases in an attempt to calm President Trump’s ire on trade.

headline: Director of Bureau of Prisons Steps Down
teaser: It was not immediately clear why Mark Inch resigned from the agency, which has been the subject of congressional scrutiny over allegations of staffing shortages and sexual harassment.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: The Context Behind Trump’s ‘Animals’ Comment
teaser: President Trump said his description of some immigrants as ‘animals’ referred to MS-13 members. But his remarks came during a discussion on how to prosecute immigrants in sanctuary cities, which don’t protect gang members who committed horrific crimes.

headline: Boosting U.S. Exports to China by $200 Billion Is a Tricky Task
teaser: President Trump is trying to broker a deal to bring down the national trade deficit with China. Experts doubt his goal is achievable.

headline: Trump’s New Health and Human Services Secretary Is a Joyful Regulator
teaser: In an administration with a deregulatory bent, Alex Azar relishes his policymaking powers.

headline: White House Keeps Details of Melania Trump’s Health Under Wraps
teaser: Four days into Mrs. Trump’s unusually long recovery period after a kidney procedure, virtually all that has been said is that the first lady is “doing great.”

headline: Lawyers for Michael Cohen and Stormy Daniels Sling More (Legal) Mud
teaser: On Friday, the fighting centered on the question of whether Michael Avenatti, Stormy Daniels’ lawyer, could formally enter the case.

headline: How New Abortion Restrictions Would Affect Women’s Health Care
teaser: The Trump administration’s proposal to bar certain federal funds from abortion providers has raised complicated questions about reproductive health care.

headline: F.B.I. Used Informant to Investigate Russia Ties to Campaign, Not to Spy, as Trump Claims
teaser: The informant made contact in the summer of 2016 with Trump campaign advisers who were already under scrutiny for ties to Russia.

headline: These 7 Women Could Help Democrats Win Congress. (And Here’s How the Republicans Plan to Stop Them.)
teaser: Pennsylvania has had an all-male congressional delegation since 2015. After victories by several women this week, that may change in November.

headline: Requiring Prices in Drug Ads: Would It Do Any Good? Is It Even Legal?
teaser: A proposal that the administration presents as a matter of transparency has raised a torrent of questions from consumers, doctors, drugmakers and advertising professionals.

headline: Melania Trump Returns to White House in ‘High Spirits’ After Kidney Procedure
teaser: The White House has not explained what led the first lady to seek treatment or whether its reference to her “benign kidney condition” meant she had a tumor.

headline: Trump Jr. and Other Aides Met With Gulf Emissary Offering Help to Win Election
teaser: The Trump Tower meeting and follow-ups are the first indication that countries beyond Russia may have offered help to the Trump campaign.

headline: Israel and Evangelicals: New U.S. Embassy Signals a Growing Alliance
teaser: The opening of the U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem marks the increasing importance of conservative Christians to Israel, at the risk of upsetting American Jews.

headline: Trump Administration Announces Trade Agreement With China to Reduce Deficit
teaser: The Trump administration said Saturday that it had reached an agreement with China to increase exports of American goods and services in order to reduce the nations’ trade imbalance.

headline: Black, Female and Running for Governor: Can She Win in the South?
teaser: Stacey Abrams, a Democrat running for governor of Georgia, is trying to win a statewide election in the Deep South without relying on conservative-leaning white voters.

headline: John Lewis and Other Prominent Blacks Spurn Black Challenger in Boston
teaser: Ayanna Pressley is trying to become the first nonwhite member of the House from Massachusetts, but Mr. Lewis and others have endorsed her white opponent.

headline: Young People Keep Marching After Parkland, This Time to Register to Vote
teaser: Younger voters typically do not cast ballots in midterm elections. But after the Parkland, Fla., shooting, registration among younger voters is accelerating.

headline: Out of Prison, Back to Congress? Michael Grimm Is Trying on Staten Island
teaser: After pleading guilty to tax fraud, Mr. Grimm gave up his seat in 2014. Now he’s running to reclaim his Staten Island House seat.

headline: U.S. Suspending New Tariffs While Negotiating Trade With China, Mnuchin Says
teaser: While American officials had signaled last week that China had agreed to increase purchases by $200 billion, Mr. Mnuchin declined to confirm that figure.

headline: Trump Suggests Mueller Is Trying to Hurt Republicans in Midterms
teaser: President Trump raged anew about the special counsel investigation, charging that it had turned up no evidence of collusion with Russia and was now casting a worldwide net.

headline: Mueller Plans to Wrap Up Obstruction Inquiry Into Trump by Sept. 1, Giuliani Says
teaser: Mr. Giuliani sought to make the case that a longer timeline for that aspect of the Russia investigation would hurt Republicans in the midterm elections.

headline: Anti-Gun Backlash From School Shooting? Probably Not in Texas.
teaser: Activism after the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., led to the most successful push for gun control in decades in the state. Few expect the same in Texas.

headline: Trump Grappling With Risks of Proceeding With North Korea Meeting
teaser: President Trump was surprised and angered by a statement issued by the North’s chief nuclear negotiator, who declared that the country would not swap its nuclear weapons capability for economic aid.

headline: Hillary and Bill Clinton Go Separate Ways for 2018 Midterm Elections
teaser: Mrs. Clinton plans to endorse Andrew M. Cuomo for governor of New York this week. But elsewhere on the 2018 campaign trail, she and Mr. Clinton are not always welcome.

headline: Trump Defends Administration’s Trade Strategy With China
teaser: The president praised his approach, and criticized Democrats, in a series of tweets on Monday following a three-day negotiation session that ended with little clarity.

headline: Advising Bolton, a ‘Shadow N.S.C.’ of Cronies
teaser: The new national security adviser has been quietly taking advice from a few longtime associates. Some have business interests that overlap with the N.S.C.

headline: In Photo, a ‘Young’ China Sees an Aging U.S. in Retreat
teaser: Social media users noticed a distinct age gap between the Chinese delegates and the American lawmakers who met them in Washington.

headline: Supreme Court Upholds Workplace Arbitration Contracts
teaser: The vote was 5 to 4, with the court’s more conservative justices in the majority. The court’s decision could affect some 25 million employment contracts.

headline: Trump’s Charm and Threats Aren’t Working on China. Here’s Why.
teaser: President Trump threatened tariffs on $150 billion in goods, then tried conciliation. Beijing’s response either way: Rebuff the offers and avoid specific pledges.

headline: Trump Swears in Gina Haspel as C.I.A. Director, Praising the Agency as ‘Most Elite’ in the World
teaser: The president’s praise of the intelligence agency came amid his assault on what he perceives as the intelligence community’s improper actions as part of investigations into his campaign.

headline: Don Blankenship Announces Third Party Bid for West Virginia Senate Seat
teaser: Don Blankenship, the convicted coal baron who lost his bid for the Republican nomination for the Senate, now wants to launch a third-party bid for the seat.

headline: Coming to Netflix: The Obamas Sign Deal to Produce Shows and Films
teaser: Mr. Obama has told associates that he does not intend to use the new platform to wage a public campaign against his successor in the Oval Office.

headline: In Speech, Pompeo Piles on Against Iran After Nuclear Deal Withdrawal
teaser: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo delivered a remarkably hard-line speech about Iran, offering no concessions to European leaders who want to do business with Tehran.

headline: Bernard Lewis, Influential Scholar of Islam, Is Dead at 101
teaser: Mr. Lewis’s views on the connection between Islam and terrorism inspired controversy but also helped shape American foreign policy under George W. Bush.

headline: Richard N. Goodwin, Adviser to Democratic Presidents, Dies at 86
teaser: A committed liberal, he wrote speeches for John F. Kennedy and Lyndon B. Johnson and later worked as an author, journalist and political consultant.

headline: U.S. Places New Sanctions on Venezuela Day After Election
teaser: The penalties, which bar U.S. companies and citizens from buying debt from the Venezuelan government, were devised to keep President Nicolás Maduro from selling off government debt to enrich himself.

headline: As Trump Adds Sanctions on Venezuela, Its Neighbors Reject Election Result
teaser: A group of mainly Latin American nations said the vote had not “met with the international standards of a democratic, free, just and transparent electoral process.”

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims Russia Investigation Started Because of Steele Dossier
teaser: President Trump has repeatedly pointed to the findings of a House Intelligence Committee report to insist his campaign did not collude with Russia. But that same report concludes that the inquiry began with a diplomat’s tip about a Trump campaign adviser — not the salacious findings of a former British spy.

headline: Trump’s Demands Escalate Pressure on Rosenstein to Preserve Justice Dept.’s Independence
teaser: Rod J. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, responded to the demand for an inquiry into the F.B.I.’s use of an informant by referring the request to the department’s inspector general.

headline: News Analysis: By Demanding an Investigation, Trump Challenged a Constraint on His Power
teaser: The president escalated his campaign to undermine the Justice Department’s traditional independence from White House interference.

headline: Mark Penn, the Former Clinton Aide, Dismisses the Mueller Investigation — and the Clintons Along With It
teaser: His criticism goes beyond just decrying the special counsel to describing the people around his former employers as unprincipled schemers the way the Republicans he once opposed used to do.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Team’s Mueller Strategy: Limit the Investigation and Attack the Investigators
teaser: “They have now decided that they need to be more proactive, more aggressive and more anticipatory,” says Alan Dershowitz, the Harvard Law School professor emeritus.

headline: Republican Leaders Will Be Allowed to See Some Information on Russia Investigation
teaser: Intelligence and law enforcement officials had said the information was highly delicate and that it was not appropriate to turn over unredacted material to Congress.

headline: Trump-Kim Summit Meeting Is a ‘99.9% Done Deal,’ South Korea Says
teaser: South Korea moved to confront growing doubts about whether the meeting between President Trump and Kim Jong-un would actually take place.

headline: Divisions Within Trump Team Undercut Quick Trade Victory With China
teaser: Ceaseless infighting and jockeying for influence on the White House’s trade team helped deprive the president of a quick victory on his most cherished policy issue.

headline: Yes, You Can Go Home Again — If You’re a White House Correspondent From Elkhart, Indiana
teaser: When I heard that President Trump would be speaking in North Side Middle School’s gymnasium, where I used to run laps in gym class, I wasn’t about to miss such a surreal reporting opportunity.

headline: Trump-Kim Meeting Is Yet to Come, but U.S. Has Minted the Coins
teaser: The White House was criticized over commemorative coins to honor the planned meeting between President Trump and Kim Jong-un.

headline: Democrats’ Next Big Thing: Government-Guaranteed Jobs
teaser: It’s a big idea from a bygone era: guaranteed employment. But for Democrats veering to the left, it’s only the latest in an aggressive stance toward governance.

headline: Georgia, Arkansas and Kentucky Primaries: Top Races to Watch
teaser: Georgians are choosing candidates for governor on Tuesday, and there are competitive House seats in all three states. Here’s what you should know.

headline: Trump Welcomes South Korean Leader Amid Uncertainty Over Summit With the North
teaser: Prospects for Mr. Trump’s landmark meeting next month with Kim Jong-un of North Korea have suddenly grown a bit cloudy.

headline: Economic Scene: Whites’ Unease Shadows the Politics of a More Diverse America
teaser: As the country heads for a time when no group makes up a majority, the change may affect white attitudes in far more than racial and economic matters.

headline: Trump Denies Reaching Deal With China on ZTE
teaser: The president said Tuesday that there had been no agreement with China to provide relief to the Chinese telecom firm in return for trade concessions.

headline: Trump on North Korea Summit: ‘We Will See’
teaser: In an appearance with South Korea’s president, Moon Jae-in, President Donald Trump said a planned meeting with North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, remains tentative.

headline: Nicolás Maduro Expels Top U.S. Diplomats from Venezuela
teaser: The newly re-elected president accused the American envoys of conspiring against his government and gave them 48 hours to leave.

headline: Homeland Security Chief Backtracks After Saying Russia Didn’t Try to Help Trump
teaser: The agency’s secretary, Kirstjen Nielsen, appeared to counter conclusions by the intelligence community that Moscow sought to give President Trump an edge in the 2016 election.

headline: Michael Cohen Bonded With Russia-Tied C.E.O., Though Deals Didn’t Pan Out
teaser: Mr. Cohen’s $1 million contract with an oligarch-linked investment firm yielded little in the way of deals. But he and the firm’s chief became closely connected in business and fund-raising.

headline: Congress Approves Bill Giving Patients a ‘Right to Try’ Experimental Drugs
teaser: The House passed a bill that would, in effect, allow patients to bypass the Food and Drug Administration and obtain an “investigational drug.” The Senate approved the same bill in August.

headline: Trump Rule Would Bar Abortion Referrals for Undecided Patients
teaser: The president is expected to promote the proposal, which would impose new abortion restrictions on federal family planning money, at a gala on Tuesday night for a leading anti-abortion organization.

headline: Amy McGrath, Once a Marine Aviator, Wins Democratic Primary for Kentucky’s 6th District
teaser: Ms. McGrath won without the backing of national Democrats. A viral video about her military experience helped generate more than $1 million in donations.

headline: Sinkhole Forms on White House Lawn. Blame the Swamp. Really.
teaser: “Drain the swamp” jabs were abundant on Twitter, but joking aside, the phrase has some geological merit. There is a “legitimate swamp” around the White House, an expert said.

headline: White House Sets Meeting for Republican Lawmakers Over Informant
teaser: The White House said on Thursday that it had organized a meeting for top law enforcement officials and Republican lawmakers. But the details remained fuzzy.

headline: Paul Ryan’s Hold on Speaker’s Job Is Tested by G.O.P. Infighting
teaser: Mr. Ryan’s fractious conference is a management problem for him, but now he is caught between conservatives and moderates on immigration, the special counsel and more.

headline: Stacey Abrams Wins Georgia Democratic Primary for Governor, Making History
teaser: The politically liberal Ms. Abrams will test just how much Georgia’s traditionally conservative politics are shifting and whether a black woman can win the governor’s office in the Deep South.

headline: On Washington: Usually Reliable and Cooperative, Centrist House Republicans Rebel
teaser: With their political survival at stake in the November midterm elections, frustrated moderates are rising up to demand an immigration vote that they say is long overdue.

headline: 5 Key Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primaries
teaser: A viral video star propelled herself to victory. A teacher unseated an establishment candidate. And Stacey Abrams won a commanding victory.

headline: What Mueller’s Investigation Could Mean for the President
teaser: The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, will likely reach one of two conclusions about the president: Either there is evidence that he broke the law, or there is not. Mike Schmidt, a New York Times reporter, explains the possible outcomes.

headline: Trump Repeats Unconfirmed Claims of Spies Inside His Campaign
teaser: Mr. Trump departed from his previous language about the possibility the government deployed a spy inside his campaign. Instead, he stated it as fact.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Incorrectly Quotes James Clapper to Falsely Claim F.B.I. Spied On Campaign
teaser: President Trump tweeted on Wednesday that Mr. Clapper, the former director of national intelligence, said he “should be happy that the F.B.I. was spying on his campaign.” Mr. Clapper did not say that.

headline: Q&A: Stacey Abrams Says She’s ‘Ready to Get to Work’
teaser: Ms. Abrams secured the Democratic nomination for governor of Georgia on Tuesday evening. On Wednesday morning, she spoke to The New York Times about what’s next.

headline: Kentucky Math Teacher, Riding Wave of Public Anger, Defeats State House Majority Leader
teaser: Travis Brenda defeated Jonathan Shell, a powerful state legislator, in a G.O.P. primary, amid anger over changes to the state pension system.

headline: Truth in a Post-Truth Era: Sandy Hook Families Sue Alex Jones, Conspiracy Theorist
teaser: Cases seek a verdict on “post-truth” culture and on Mr. Jones, a Trump ally who reaps millions peddling bogus claims about an American tragedy

headline: The Boundary Between Abuse and B.D.S.M.
teaser: Politicians accused of abusing their sexual partners have put the community’s practices in the news.

headline: How Amy McGrath Went from Marine Fighter Pilot to Political Giant Killer
teaser: Amy McGrath’s journey from Marine combat pilot to the Democratic nominee for a House race combines biography, risk taking and the virtues of the digital age.

headline: I.R.S. Warns States Not to Circumvent State and Local Tax Cap
teaser: The I.R.S. warned states like New York that efforts to circumvent the $10,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction would not pass muster with the federal government.

headline: Jared Kushner Gets Security Clearance, Ending Swirl of Questions Over Delay
teaser: Mr. Kushner’s F.B.I. background check had dragged on, fueling questions about whether the special counsel had found evidence that made him a security risk.

headline: Fed Minutes Suggest Few Worries of Economy Overheating
teaser: The Federal Reserve released minutes from its May meeting on Wednesday. The minutes indicate officials are more worried about inflation falling below 2 percent than overheating.

headline: Massachusetts Gains Foothold in Offshore Wind Power, Long Ignored in U.S.
teaser: The wind farms have increasingly become mainstream sources of power in Northern Europe, but the United States has largely not pursued the technology.

headline: Yulia Skripal Describes ‘Extremely Painful’ Recovery From Poisoning
teaser: The victim of a nerve agent attack gave her first videotaped statement, in an attempt to quell swirling speculation, especially from Russia.

headline: U.S. Disinvites China From Military Exercise Amid Rising Tensions
teaser: The Pentagon said Beijing’s buildup on disputed islands in the South Island Seas is not consistent with the security exercise among allies this summer.

headline: F.B.I. Admits Overstating Locked Phone Problem, and Critics Pounce
teaser: A programming error caused top law enforcement officials to overstate how many locked smartphones it was unable to search, including in congressional testimony.

headline: Lupe Valdez Prepares to Face Greg Abbott in Texas: ‘This Election Is Not Going to Be Bought’
teaser: Ms. Valdez, a former sheriff, has become the first openly gay person and the first Latina to win a major party’s nomination for governor in Texas.

headline: Senate Sends Major Overhaul of Veterans Health Care to Trump
teaser: The Senate gave final passage to legislation that will give veterans more access to private health care on the government’s dime and will examine the V.A.’s scope.

headline: Trump, Visiting Epicenter of MS-13 Killings, Demands Tougher Immigration Laws
teaser: On Long Island, the president again described gang members as “animals,” mocking critics who had rebuked his earlier comments as meanspirited toward all immigrants.

headline: North Korea Issues New Threat on Trump Meeting, Calling Pence Remarks ‘Ignorant and Stupid’
teaser: The country’s vice foreign minister said that Vice President Mike Pence had made “unbridled and impudent remarks that North Korea might end like Libya.”

headline: How a 4-Hour Battle Between Russian Mercenaries and U.S. Commandos Unfolded in Syria
teaser: Interviews and newly obtained documents provide the Pentagon’s first public on-the-ground accounting of one of the bloodiest battles the military has faced in Syria since deploying to fight ISIS.

headline: China May Be Happy at Dimming Prospects for a Trump-Kim Meeting
teaser: President Trump blames China’s leader, Xi Jinping, for Kim Jong-un’s recent harder line on nuclear disarmament. But analysts say he is misreading the situation.

headline: North Korea Says It Shut Nuclear Test Site Ahead of Planned Meeting With Trump
teaser: The event was captured by foreign journalists, but North Korea did not invite any independent nuclear monitors to verify the dismantlement.

headline: Trump Pulls Out of June Summit Meeting With North Korea
teaser: The meeting was scheduled for June 12 in Singapore, but Mr. Trump says it “will not take place.”

headline: Read Trump’s Letter to Kim Jong-un Canceling North Korea Summit
teaser: President Trump on Thursday sent a letter to the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un canceling the highly anticipated summit on June 12 to discuss denuclearization.

headline: Border Patrol Agent Kills Woman Who Crossed Border Illegally in Texas, Authorities Say
teaser: The officer said he fired his gun because he had been assaulted, but a neighbor said there were no signs of an attack.

headline: Lawmakers to Be Briefed on F.B.I.’s Informant in Russia Inquiry
teaser: It was not clear how much will be shared with lawmakers, some of whom have demanded information about the informant for weeks.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Repeats Claim That James Clapper ‘Admitted’ to Campaign Spying. It’s Still Wrong.
teaser: James Clapper, the former director of national intelligence, said and has continued to say the exact opposite.

headline: Hurricane Season’s Around the Corner. Here’s What to Expect.
teaser: The season begins June 1 and experts predict it will be near normal or above normal, but a single storm can cause tremendous damage if it makes landfall.

headline: Trump Calls Canceled Summit a ‘Setback’ for North Korea
teaser: President Trump delivered remarks after his earlier announcement that the United States would not participate in a planned meeting with North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un.

headline: Anatomy of a Breakup: The Turbulent Relationship of Trump and Kim Jong-un
teaser: Here’s a look at what transpired in the whole affair that led us to this point.

headline: News Analysis: Trump’s Gamble Hits Reality Check in North Korea Negotiations
teaser: The president had sought to deal with Kim Jong-un the same way he had handled real estate negotiations — with threats and flattery. It didn’t work.

headline: Pompeo Flashes Temper Over Question on Trump Business Interests
teaser: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo got into another testy exchange Thursday, his second in two days, this time over President Trump’s potential conflicts of interest.

headline: Trump’s Crackdown on Students Who Overstay Visas Rattles Higher Education
teaser: Educators fear that the harsher penalties, which go into effect in August, could hinder university efforts to attract the brightest minds from overseas.

headline: Trump Mulls Options on ZTE as Congress Tries to Force Tough Penalty
teaser: Wilbur Ross, the commerce secretary, said the administration was considering placing an American compliance team inside the Chinese company to ensure that it wasn’t violating sanctions.

headline: Potential Auto Tariffs Prompt Warnings From Industry and Allies
teaser: Economists, lawmakers and industry executives said the threat of tariffs on imported cars threatened to undercut global economic growth and stoke trade tensions even with crucial allies.

headline: Faith Whittlesey, Conservative Voice and Reagan Aide, Dies at 79
teaser: The only woman on the president’s senior staff, she courted the religious right in helping to build a Reagan coalition and alienated feminists.

headline: Concerned by Trump, Some Republicans Quietly Align With Democrats
teaser: Influential liberal donors and operatives are working with Never Trump Republicans to blunt what they view as the president’s threat to democracy.

headline: As Former SEAL Receives Medal of Honor, a Controversy Is Reignited
teaser: Britt Slabinski, a former leader of Navy SEAL Team 6, received the Medal of Honor for valor in a 2002 firefight in Afghanistan. But it has renewed questions over what exactly happened.

headline: Turf War Between Kushner and Sessions Drove Federal Prisons Director to Quit
teaser: Some see Mark S. Inch’s departure as an opening for the Trump administration to endorse sentencing reform — one of the few issues that offer the possibility of a bipartisan deal.

headline: Tax Break, or Kickback? Energy Benefit Becomes a Lightning Rod
teaser: A federal incentive aimed at builders is at the center of a dispute over whether public agencies can use it — and how they can pass it along.

headline: Trump Says Summit With North Korea May Be Back On
teaser: A day after canceling his meeting with Kim Jong-un, President Trump said his administration was back in touch with North Korea and may go ahead with the June 12 get together.

headline: At Trump Tower, Michael Cohen and Oligarch Discussed Russian Relations
teaser: The meeting, which took place 11 days before the inauguration, preceded a $1 million contract Mr. Cohen received from a firm tied to the Russian oligarch.

headline: Single-Payer Health Care in California: Here’s What It Would Take
teaser: Universal state health coverage has rallied Democrats in the governor’s race. But even with the state’s size and wealth, it would be hard to achieve.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Distorts Democrats’ Positions on North Korea and MS-13
teaser: President Trump accused Democrats of “rooting against us in our negotiations with North Korea” and “coming to the defense of MS-13.” Neither claim is true.

headline: Trump Administration Is Said to Tell Congress It Has a Deal to Revive ZTE
teaser: The move would allow stalled trade negotiations with China to move forward, but is also likely to provoke an intense backlash on Capitol Hill.

headline: Trump Tells Naval Academy Graduates That America Is ‘Respected Again’
teaser: Mr. Trump said the new officers should be proud to be joining a military that he said is now recovering from years of decay. He ended his speech with, “Anchors aweigh!”

headline: Fact Check: 3 False Claims From Trump’s Naval Academy Speech
teaser: In a commencement speech on Friday, President Trump told Annapolis graduates that the military had received “no money” before him and that troops had just received their first pay raise in 10 years.

headline: Trump Moves to Ease the Firing of Federal Workers
teaser: The president aims to peel back labor protections and curb the power of government unions, which assailed the actions.

headline: Banks Tried to Curb Gun Sales. Now Republicans Are Out to Stop Them.
teaser: After a few big banks restricted financing to the gun industry, some lawmakers — usually Wall Street’s allies — are looking for ways to squelch what they see as social activism.

headline: Here Are the Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From the cancellation of the U.S.-North Korea summit meeting (for now) to upsets in primary elections, a lot happened this week. Here are the five biggest stories — and some links if you want to read further.

headline: Democrats Go All-Out to Avoid Disaster in California House Races
teaser: The party and allied groups are spending more than $4 million on a handful of chaotic congressional races that are critical to Democrats’ strategy to win the House in November.

headline: On Washington: Why Some Senators Who Want a Criminal Justice Overhaul Oppose a Prisons Bill
teaser: Senior Senate authors of a long-stalled but much more comprehensive package say that a bill passed by the House falls short because it doesn’t address federal sentencing laws.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Versus Law Enforcement: A Confrontation with No Precedent
teaser: The president’s allies say he has every right to manage the executive branch and every reason to be outraged at possible misconduct aimed at his campaign. Critics say he is wreaking untold damage on institutions that form the bulwark of a democratic society.

headline: Woman Fatally Shot by Border Patrol Agent Came to U.S. Seeking Work, Family Says
teaser: “Don’t treat us like animals,” the woman’s aunt said. The woman, Claudia Patricia Gómez González, 19, had studied accounting but could not find work in Guatemala.

headline: Trump Falsely Says Times Made Up Source in Report on Korea Summit Meeting
teaser: The source disputed by President Trump was in fact a senior administration official speaking to a large group of reporters in the White House briefing room.

headline: The Evangelical Fight to Win Back California
teaser: As the primary approaches, Franklin Graham brings Jesus — and a conservative political message — to a state with a vast pool of evangelical voters.

headline: Everyone Loves a Parade. Especially When It’s on a Military Base.
teaser: As Washington grumbles about President Trump’s order to hold a military parade in the capital, the Army’s 82nd maxes out the potential for a show of might.

headline: ‘OMG This Is Wrong!’ Retired English Teacher Corrects a White House Letter and Sends It Back
teaser: A former high school teacher who wrote to Mr. Trump was unhappy with the letter she got in return. “Poor writing is not something I abide,” she said.

headline: U.S. Officials Enter North Korea to Lay Groundwork for Summit Meeting
teaser: The move reflects a more traditional negotiating process that President Trump first short-circuited by abruptly agreeing to meet but later set in motion by canceling the meeting.

headline: Sidebar: Black Defendants Get Longer Sentences From Republican-Appointed Judges, Study Finds
teaser: The study, from two professors at Harvard Law School, also found that women fared better before Republican appointees than Democratic ones.

headline: Flattery of President Trump Turns Fatal in Afghanistan
teaser: An Afghan who made a gold medal to thank Mr. Trump was killed by the Taliban; another fled abroad. One who named his son Donald Trump has gone into hiding.

headline: Ivanka Trump Wins China Trademarks, Then Her Father Vows to Save ZTE
teaser: The timing is likely a coincidence, experts say, but the moves have renewed questions from critics about President Trump’s potential conflict of interest.

headline: Three Younger Veterans Stake a Generational Claim on the Democratic Party
teaser: The men, who served in Iraq and Afghanistan, are traveling the country and building political networks as they find a place in a party top-heavy with leaders in their 60s and 70s.

headline: Trump and Abe to Meet Before North Korea Summit
teaser: The Japanese leader hopes to influence Mr. Trump on issues like North Korean short-range missiles that could hit Japan.

headline: ‘Paying Twice’: A Push for Affordable Prices for Taxpayer-Funded Drugs
teaser: The National Institutes of Health is helping to develop more cutting-edge drugs. But the agency says its mission doesn’t include evaluating prices, even when the drugs use breakthroughs it patented.

headline: White House Memo: Trump Pulls Conspiracy Theories From the Fringes to the Oval Office
teaser: The president’s promotion of the unconfirmed claims he calls “Spygate” continues a long history of presidential trafficking in tales of shadowy cabals and secret plots.

headline: On Memorial Day, Trump Honors ‘Our Heroes’ at Arlington
teaser: President Trump celebrated “the men and women who laid down their lives for our freedom,” singling out several of them and sharing their stories.

headline: Retro Report: Goofy, Elephant, Squid: How Political Gamesmanship Distorts Voters’ Power
teaser: A surprising alliance between Republicans and black politicians decades ago, meant to empower black voters, had unexpected consequences.

headline: North Korea Nuclear Disarmament Could Take 15 Years, Expert Warns
teaser: The report stands in stark contrast with the time frame the United States initially demanded, on what could be a key sticking point in any nuclear summit meeting.

headline: Virginia Republican, Seeking Alcohol Treatment, Won’t Run Again for House Seat
teaser: Tom Garrett’s announcement followed a week of whiplashing rumors and accusations that he and his wife had required personal favors from employees.

headline: Top Kim Jong-un Aide in China, Amid Reports He’s Bound for U.S.
teaser: If he goes on to the United States, Kim Yong-chol would be the highest-ranking North Korean to set foot on American soil since 2000.

headline: Stacey Abrams Didn’t Play It Safe. Neither Are These Female Candidates.
teaser: As women run for Congress and state offices this year, they want to campaign and win on their own terms. Some are coming for their own party. And many are not willing to wait.

headline: Election Guide: California Midterm Elections 2018: What You Need to Know
U.S. Identifies 3 ISIS Militants Who Led Deadly Ambush in Niger
teaser: French and Nigerien security officials say the Islamic State branch has 40 to 60 core members, but it is often joined by sympathetic villagers.

headline: In California’s Farm Country, the Tide of ‘Resistance’ Runs Dry Ahead of the Primary
teaser: Although within California it is common to pit north versus south, the sharp cultural divisions between rural and urban areas are in many ways more significant.

headline: When the President Testified: People in the Room Recall Clinton’s 1998 Interrogation
teaser: The date was Aug. 17, 1998. President Bill Clinton testified before a grand jury. Twenty years later, people in the room and those waiting nearby share their memories.

headline: Supreme Court Won’t Hear Challenge to Restrictive Arkansas Abortion Law
teaser: In turning down an appeal, the court put two of the state’s three abortion clinics at risk of closing.

headline: Roseanne Barr Starts Storm With Racist Twitter Post About Ex-Obama Adviser
teaser: Ms. Barr cited “The Planet of the Apes” in discussing Valerie Jarrett, a black woman and former adviser to President Barack Obama. She then deleted the post, apologized and said she would quit Twitter.

headline: Police Need Warrants for Driveway Searches, Supreme Court Rules
teaser: The case concerned a stolen motorcycle covered in a tarp that an officer had looked under without an invitation or a warrant.

headline: Myanmar Is Intensifying Violence Against Ethnic Minorities, U.S. Says
teaser: A new campaign is targeting the largely Christian minority in Kachin state, and an unknown number of Rohingya are displaced throughout Myanmar, a State Department report on religious freedom says.

headline: Trump Officials, Moving to Break Up Migrant Families, Blame Democrats
teaser: Administration officials argue that court rulings and laws give them little choice, but Democrats have denounced the new policy and rejected attempts to pin it on them.

headline: Economic Scene: The Profound Social Cost of American Exceptionalism
teaser: Rich and technologically advanced, the United States continues to accept a degree of dysfunction that would be intolerable in any other rich society.

headline: Who Is Mike Parson, Missouri’s New Governor?
teaser: Mr. Parson differs little from the departing governor, Eric Greitens, in terms of policy, but greatly in terms of political style and experience.

headline: A Democratic Candidate Criticized Israel. Republicans Shout ‘Anti-Semite.’
teaser: Leslie Cockburn, the Democrat running for an open House seat in Virginia, faces G.O.P. charges of anti-Semitism for her 1991 book highly critical of Israel.

headline: Trump Asked Sessions to Retain Control of Russia Inquiry After His Recusal
teaser: The attorney general is a key witness in the investigation into whether Mr. Trump tried to obstruct the Russia inquiry itself.

headline: Trump’s Summer Campaign Priority: Target Red-State Democratic Senators
teaser: The strategy, meant to take advantage of President Trump’s star power among core Republican supporters, will take him to six states where he can bring a message devised to stoke partisan outrage.

headline: Dick Tuck, Democrats’ Political Prankster in Chief, Dies at 94
teaser: He bedeviled Goldwater, Nixon and other Republican candidates with campaign-trail tomfoolery as a consultant and advance man for the Democratic Party.

headline: At Rally in Nashville, Trump Links Democrats to MS-13
teaser: The president invoked fears of crimes by illegal immigrants, particularly the gang MS-13, to argue for stricter border policies and his long-promised wall, saying Democrats stood in the way.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Exaggerates Record on MS-13
teaser: President Trump claimed that his administration was deporting members of the gang “by the thousands.” Data from Immigration and Customs Enforcement shows this is not possible.

headline: Ivanka Trump Abruptly Leaves Call After Question About China Trademarks
teaser: At the outset, a White House official said that Ms. Trump would take a few questions before departing for a meeting.

headline: Battle to Stamp Out ISIS in Syria Gains New Momentum, but Threats Remain
teaser: The return of top Syrian Kurdish commanders, a surge in French commandos, the arrival of Navy fighter jets and sleuthing by Iraqi spies have revived an effort that had stalled out.

headline: A Worldwide Scramble to Pull Off a Trump and Kim Summit
teaser: Meetings are being held in three locations as the United States and North Korea try to iron out the details of a meeting between the two leaders.

headline: National Democrats Wade, Uninvited, Into New York House Race
teaser: Local Democrats were set on backing one candidate to challenge the Republican incumbent, but party leaders had their eyes on another.

headline: Trump Again Says He Wishes Sessions Was Not Attorney General
teaser: President Trump said on Twitter that he wished he had chosen another good lawyer to be his attorney general.

headline: Meet Jess Phoenix, the Volcanologist Running for Congress in California
teaser: Ms. Phoenix, one of hundreds of scientists seeking public office this year, spoke with The Times about her focus on climate change and her desire to bring evidence-based policymaking to Washington.

headline: Trump Responds to Fury Over Roseanne, but Not Her Racist Remarks
teaser: President Trump acknowledged the furor over a racist Twitter post made by Roseanne Barr, but focused on the apology issued by ABC.

headline: Judge Suggests Review of Cohen Documents Is Moving Too Slowly
teaser: A federal judge for Mr. Cohen were given a June 15 deadline to review the documents seized from his office, apartment and hotel room.

headline: U.S. Struggles to Stop Smuggling of Mail-Order Opioids
teaser: Federal agents are wrestling with how to detect opioids that are shipped into the United States in small but potent and lucrative amounts.

headline: Tennessee Congresswoman Is Criticized for Linking Porn to Gun Violence
teaser: Representative Diane Black, a candidate for Tennessee governor, said that such causes included the “deterioration of family,” violent movies and pornography.

headline: How Trump’s Election Shook Obama: ‘What if We Were Wrong?’
teaser: In a new book, Barack Obama’s longtime adviser, Benjamin J. Rhodes, recounts the former president’s reaction to the election of Donald J. Trump.

headline: Sarah Huckabee Sanders Chokes Up at Student’s Question on Shootings
teaser: A 13-year-old boy asked what the Trump administration was doing to prevent violence in schools.

headline: Sarah Huckabee Sanders Responds to Student’s Question
teaser: A question from Benje Choucroun, 13, about the Trump administration’s response to school shootings appeared to affect the White House press secretary.

headline: For Immigrant Students, a New Worry: A Call to ICE
teaser: Get-tough discipline policies at the Education Department and blurring boundaries at Immigration and Customs Enforcement are making undocumented students vulnerable.

headline: After Years of Trying, Virginia Finally Will Expand Medicaid
teaser: Sweeping Republican losses in the state’s legislative elections last year laid the groundwork for a deal with Democrats on the issue this year.

headline: For Giuliani (Boo!), Yankee Stadium Is No Longer a Safe Space
teaser: For Rudolph Giuliani, getting booed in a place he was once revered was not just a personal slight, but a sign of how much he and the city he once ran have parted ways.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Oversells New ‘Right to Try’ Law
teaser: President Trump claimed that a new law allowing access to experimental drugs would save “hundreds of thousands” of lives. But there is already a federal program in place, and similar state laws have had a minimal effect.

headline: F.B.I. Official Wrote Secret Memo Fearing Trump Got a Cover Story for Comey Firing
teaser: Andrew McCabe documented a meeting that left him concerned that the deputy attorney general may have helped President Trump create a cover story to justify the dismissal.

headline: Trump Meets With Kim. Kim Kardashian West, That Is.
teaser: The subject seemed an unlikely one for Ms. Kardashian West: prison reform and clemency for a 63-year-old woman serving a life sentence on charges related to cocaine possession and money laundering

headline: U.S. Is Poised to Impose Steel and Aluminum Tariffs on European Union
teaser: President Trump must decide whether to go ahead with tariffs on allies like the European Union, Canada and Mexico, whose temporary exemptions to the tariffs expire Friday.

headline: With a $250 Million ‘Institute,’ the U.S. Upgrades Ties to Taiwan
teaser: The opening of a new American institute in Taiwan comes as the U.S. has slowly elevated ties with the island democracy, despite angering China.

headline: How Liberals Got Lost on the Story of Missing Children at the Border
teaser: A lesson in how partisan polarization colors people’s views on a gut emotional level without many even realizing it.

headline: Teachers Find Public Support as Pay Campaign Goes to Voters
teaser: In a survey, nearly three in four American adults said teachers’ salaries were too low. The sentiment crossed party lines, even if raises meant higher taxes.

headline: Never Mind the News Media: Politicians Test Direct-to-Voter Messaging
teaser: Bernie Sanders is holding live-streamed town hall events, while others have started podcasts or even their own local news sites, bypassing traditional media.

headline: Lithuania and Romania Complicit in C.I.A. Renditions, European Court Says
teaser: The findings by the European Court of Justice in Strasbourg, France, offered judicial confirmation the C.I.A.’s response to the attacks of Sept. 11.

headline: Talks Between U.S. and North Korea ‘Are in Good Hands,’ Trump Says
teaser: As Secretary of State Mike Pompeo began formal talks with a top North Korean official, the president voiced cautious optimism about a summit with Kim Jong-un.

headline: White House to Impose Metal Tariffs on Europe, Canada and Mexico, Risking Retaliation
teaser: The steel and aluminum tariffs are meant to make good on President Trump’s long-standing promises to protect American industry, but they’ve prompted a fierce response from allies.

headline: Trump Says He Will Pardon Dinesh D’Souza, Conservative Commentator
teaser: Mr. D’Souza pleaded guilty in 2014 to making illegal campaign contributions, and his pardon will be a victory for the conservative media, a base of support for the president.

headline: Education Secretary Ready to Overhaul Higher Education Law Through Regulation
teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, frustrated by stalled efforts in Congress, is moving ahead with a plan to overhaul the system through her regulatory powers.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Did Trump Fire Comey Over the Russia Inquiry or Not?
teaser: President Trump and his aides have offered a number of reasons — including relief from the investigation into Russian election meddling — for why he fired James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director.

headline: The Economy Can Handle Steel and Aluminum Tariffs. The Real Risk Is Erratic Policy.
teaser: The near-term costs of steel and aluminum tariffs are manageable; the longer-term costs of potential trade wars with the entire world are greater

headline: Thanksgiving Got Shorter After the 2016 Election, Study Says. You Can Guess Why.
teaser: Americans who went to areas of opposite political leanings cut 30 to 50 minutes off family gatherings, an analysis of smartphone data showed.

headline: All About Dinesh D’Souza, Who Is Set for a Trump Pardon
teaser: The conservative commentator’s incendiary attacks on liberals have made him, at times, a hero of the right. Now he’s set to receive a presidential pardon.

headline: Illinois Has Ratified the Equal Rights Amendment. Wait, What?
teaser: It became the 37th state to do so. That leaves one state to go. If you thought the deadline had passed decades ago, you’re right. It’s complicated.

headline: Samantha Bee Apologizes for Slur Against Ivanka Trump
teaser: In the wake of ABC’s cancellation of “Roseanne,” the TBS late-night host hurls a vulgar insult, setting off debate on social media.

headline: How Far Can Trump Go in Issuing Pardons?
teaser: A look at the legal questions raised by President Trump’s unconventional use of his constitutional power to pardon federal crimes.

headline: Disability and Civil Rights Groups Sue DeVos Over Investigation Rollbacks
teaser: The three organizations object to new procedures that allow the Education Department to summarily dismiss complaints it sees as burdensome or a drain on resources.

headline: Lawsuit Says Citizenship Question on Census Targets Minorities for Political Gain
teaser: The lawsuit, filed by several groups representing minorities, was the fourth major effort to block the question from the 2020 census.

headline: U.S. Allies Denounce Trump’s Tariffs Decision
teaser: Leaders and officials from the E.U., Canada and Mexico were united in their disapproval of President Trump’s move to place tariffs on metals, which could provoke retaliation against American businesses.

headline: Stormy Daniels’s Lawyer Sought Help From Democrats in Fight With Trump
teaser: The lawyer, Michael Avenatti, has insisted that the case against the president and his lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, is not political.

headline: Trump Ran as a Renegade. Now He’s Trying to Keep Them at Bay.
teaser: Unexpectedly, President Trump has cut off the oxygen to the opposition, insurgent wing of the Republican Party.

headline: Vulnerable Republicans See Immigration as Political Salvation
teaser: From the Rocky Mountain West to Texas and to California, Republican backers of an immigration petition are making life tough on Speaker Paul D. Ryan.

headline: Jobs Report for May: Here’s What to Watch For
teaser: The report is due at 8:30 a.m., and Wall Street economists estimated that the economy added 190,000 jobs last month, up from 164,000 in April.

headline: Trump Dangles Aid Before North Korea. But Does Kim Jong-un Want It?
teaser: North Korea might not be tempted by promises of economic assistance, fearing dependence on aid from Washington — or anyone else.

headline: Trump Breaks Protocol With Tweet About Jobs Report Before It Is Released
teaser: A tweet “looking forward” to a Labor Department report an hour before its release drew swift condemnation. The report showed strong job growth.

headline: Dinesh D’Souza, Pardoned by Trump, Claims Victory Over Obama Administration
teaser: Mr. D’Souza presented himself as a victim of selective justice, hounded by Mr. Obama’s attorney general among others, because he made a movie sharply critical of Mr. Obama.

headline: How Robert Kennedy’s Assassination Changed American Politics
teaser: Coming on the heels of Martin Luther King Jr.’s death, it fueled a general sense that the normal rules and constants of politics could no longer be counted on.

headline: North Korean Envoy Arrives at White House With Letter for Trump
teaser: The visit by Kim Yong-chol was the first time a North Korean official had set foot in the White House in 18 years. The two sides are trying to reschedule a summit meeting.

headline: For Heitkamp, a Lift From an Unlikely Source: The Koch Brothers
teaser: Senator Heidi Heitkamp, a centrist Democrat in a pitched re-election battle in North Dakota, voted to roll bank banking rules. A Koch-backed group is praising her for it.

headline: Trump Says He’ll Meet Kim Jong-un After All
teaser: The president, who canceled a planned summit meeting a week ago, made the announcement after meeting a top North Korean envoy and receiving a personal letter from Mr. Kim.

headline: This Factory Was Ready to Expand. Then Came the Trump Trade Wars.
teaser: The president’s tariffs, and threats of retaliation, undermine a tax break’s benefits for Plug Power, a maker of fuel cells.

headline: Trump Orders a Lifeline for Struggling Coal and Nuclear Plants
teaser: The president instructed Energy Secretary Rick Perry to “prepare immediate steps” to stop the closure of unprofitable plants around the country.

headline: Trump Had Power to Attack Syria Without Congress, Justice Dept. Memo Says
teaser: The department laid out a broad view of President Trump’s war powers to launch airstrikes against Syria without congressional authorization.

headline: Just in Time for Hurricane Season, a New Leader at the Coast Guard’s Helm
teaser: Adm. Karl L. Schultz said the military service will hold steady in its growing role in homeland security priorities like immigration and disaster relief.

headline: Tech Was Supposed to Get Political. It’s Hanging Back in This Election.
teaser: While voters get ready for California’s primary on June 5, Silicon Valley’s tech community — which had been politically outspoken — has tried to stay largely under the radar.

headline: Lobbyist Whose Wife Rented a Condo to Scott Pruitt Failed to Disclose E.P.A. Lobbying
teaser: The lobbyist, Steve Hart, revised his disclosure reports after his firm found he had not properly detailed his efforts to influence the agency.

headline: U.S. Strikes Killed Nearly 500 Civilians in 2017, Pentagon Says
teaser: In a report released a month late, the Defense Department didn’t list any civilian casualties in Somalia, a finding at odds with the claims of nongovernmental organizations and local officials.

headline: How Trump Is Using the Power to Pardon
teaser: The president has pardoned political allies and prominent figures whom he said were treated unfairly by prosecutors. The Times’s Supreme Court reporter, Adam Liptak, looks at how this compares to the actions of previous presidents.

headline: How Trump Is Using the Power to Pardon
teaser: The president has pardoned political allies and prominent figures whom he said were treated unfairly by prosecutors. The Times’s Supreme Court reporter, Adam Liptak, looks at how this compares to the actions of previous presidents.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s False, Exaggerated and Contradictory Claims on Korea, Mexico and Trade
teaser: President Trump falsely claimed the Korean War was the “longest war” in history. It was one of a host of inaccurate or puzzling statements he made to reporters on Friday.

headline: Here’s What You Missed in American Politics
teaser: Be it President Trump’s decision to reinstate the June 12 meeting with North Korea or more tariffs for American allies, here are six of the biggest stories in politics this week. (And links if you’d like to read further.)

headline: Pardon System Need Fixing, Advocates Say, but They Cringe at Trump’s Approach
teaser: Presidential power has long been viewed as an antidote for the Justice Department’s backlog of clemency applications. But President Trump could be making the system less just, advocates warn.

headline: Mattis Accuses Beijing of ‘Intimidation and Coercion’ in South China Sea
teaser: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said China’s placement of advanced equipment and missiles in the Spratly Island chain was a flagrant show of military power.

headline: Senate Republicans Are Newly Hopeful About the Midterms. For Good Reason.
teaser: The G.O.P.’s preferred candidates are running or winning in several states, and potential problems have been averted. Some Republicans now see Senate gains, not losses, in November.

headline: A Courtside View of Scott Pruitt’s Cozy Ties With a Billionaire Coal Baron
teaser: The E.P.A. chief, who has reversed Obama-era rules on coal mining, enjoyed a superfan experience at a University of Kentucky basketball game — courtesy of an industry executive.

headline: Will a Canadian Donald Trump Become Ontario’s Leader?
teaser: The right-wing populist Doug Ford is running to be premier of Canada’s most powerful province. His brother Rob was famous as Toronto’s crack-smoking mayor.

headline: Gavin Newsom and Antonio Villaraigosa Face the Past in California Race
teaser: The two leading Democratic candidates for governor in Tuesday’s primary must contend with Jerry Brown’s long shadow and voters’ memories of past indiscretions.

headline: Within Trump’s Trade Factions, Nations Look for a Friendly Face
teaser: Divisions and reversals on trade under President Trump have flummoxed U.S. allies and rivals, who are courting whichever advisers they think will listen.

headline: Trump Plan to Lower Drug Prices Could Increase Costs for Some Patients
teaser: Beneficiaries might see higher out-of-pocket costs if drugs are moved from one part of Medicare to another.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Veers to a Korea Plan That Echoes Failures of the Past
teaser: President Trump has vowed not to repeat the errors of his predecessors, but his apparent softening on North Korea resembles approaches taken by Bill Clinton and George W. Bush.

headline: Trump’s Lawyers, in Confidential Memo, Argue to Head Off a Historic Subpoena
teaser: The legal memo takes an expansive view on the president’s authority. Lawyers argued that, as president, Mr. Trump has the power to end investigations.

headline: Roseanne Barr Comments Highlight Racial Tension, California Pastors Say
teaser: In a discussion with The New York Times, three pastors in the heavily evangelical Central Valley talked about race, President Trump and double standards.

headline: About Samantha Bee, Ivanka Trump and That Word
teaser: A conversation about that thing Samantha Bee said about Ivanka Trump. You know. THAT thing.

headline: Trump to Hold Ramadan Dinner After Skipping It Last Year
teaser: The dinner, which is anticipated to be held on Wednesday, will be hosted by a president who has a long history of making inflammatory statements about Muslims.

headline: Jon Tester, a Democrat in Deep-Red Montana, Isn’t Sweating Trump’s Threats
teaser: President Trump may have put a big target on Senator Jon Tester’s back, but the Democrat is confident that Montanans know where he stands.

headline: U.S.-China Trade Talks End in an Impasse
teaser: Chinese officials refused to commit to buying more American goods without a Trump administration agreement not to impose further tariffs on Chinese exports.

headline: When Guns Are Sold Illegally, A.T.F. Is Lenient on Punishment
teaser: Regulators are wary of punishing gun stores that break the law, a review of internal inspection reports and interviews with officials show.

headline: Planning Trump-Kim Meeting: Who Sits Where, What Will They Eat and Who Pays?
teaser: The June 12 summit meeting between President Trump and Kim Jong-un requires figuring out countless details, all of which could be ignored last minute by two leaders known for changing their minds.

headline: How Mnuchin Keeps a Steady Grip in a Tug of War on Trade
teaser: The Treasury secretary, Steven Mnuchin, has managed to stay in President Trump’s good graces while advocating a more free-trade approach, but that balancing act is showing signs of strain.

headline: Facebook Tried to Rein In Fake Ads. It Fell Short in a California Race.
teaser: Measures to prevent election interference remain spotty, as shown in the Fourth Congressional District’s Democratic primary.

headline: Special Operations Forces in Africa Likely to Face Cuts in Major Military Review
teaser: The Pentagon has ordered its Special Operations Command to abandon lower-priority missions and focus more on rising threats from Russia and China.

headline: Trump Says He Has Power to Pardon Himself but Has ‘Done Nothing Wrong’
teaser: The president’s comment raised the prospect that he might take extraordinary action to immunize himself from the ongoing Russia investigation.

headline: Supreme Court Rejects Bid to Discipline A.C.L.U.
teaser: The court vacated an appeals court ruling that had allowed a teenager to obtain an abortion, saying the dispute was moot.

headline: Supreme Court Sides With Baker Who Turned Away Gay Couple
teaser: The court based its decision on religious freedom.

headline: Frank C. Carlucci, Diplomat and Defense Secretary to Reagan, Dies at 87
teaser: In his wide-ranging government career, Mr. Carlucci was an expert budget-whacker and, to presidents and cabinet secretaries, an indispensable No. 2 man.

headline: Promoting Europe’s Conservatives, U.S. Envoy Upsets Germans
teaser: Ambassador Richard Grenell flouted protocol, saying he wanted to “empower” leaders challenging “failed policies of the left.” Berlin asked him to clarify.

headline: California Primary Election: Live Updates
teaser: California voters head to the polls on Tuesday for a primary with huge stakes for the country. Our reporters are talking to voters across the state ahead of the election.

headline: Conservative Koch Groups Plan Pro-Trade Blitz, as the Issue Splits Republicans
teaser: The multimillion-dollar ad campaign comes as Republican lawmakers continue to express dismay over President Trump’s trade moves but insist they are powerless to stop it.

headline: First Draft on Politics: A Special Edition for the California Primaries
teaser: Tomorrow is one of the year’s busiest primary nights, and here’s a special afternoon edition of First Draft to get you up to speed.

headline: How Latino Voting Power Will Count in the California Primary
teaser: In the past, low turnout rates limited Latinos’ impact at the polls despite their large numbers in the state, but there are signs of greater engagement this year.

headline: Californians Go to Polls With High Stakes and Some High Anxiety
teaser: California is key to Democratic hopes for taking back control of the House. But first they must get though the state’s unusual “top-two” voting system.

headline: Schultz 2020? Other C.E.O.s Will Be Watching Closely
teaser: Several prominent chief executives are considering running for president. But “the history of business leaders in the White House has not been good.”

headline: Special Master in Cohen Case Finds Few Seized Materials Are Privileged
teaser: Though she has not yet finished her review, the special master said that most of the records seized from Michael D. Cohen can be turned over to prosecutors.

headline: Associates Denied Trump Was Involved in Statement He Dictated
teaser: Their claims last summer contradict a memo obtained by The Times, in which President Trump’s lawyers admit he dictated a misleading statement from Donald Trump Jr. about a Trump Tower meeting with a Russian lawyer.

headline: Melania Trump Returns to the Public Eye (Sort Of)
teaser: Mrs. Trump’s appearance at an event honoring military families ended the longest break anyone has taken from the role of first lady in modern memory.

headline: With a Chorus of Tweets, Administration Officials Mark Trump’s 500 Days
teaser: The praise recalled a cabinet meeting last year in which the top officials on President Trump’s team took turns offering worshipful statements about him.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Greets Plans for North Korea-Syria Meeting With Deafening Silence
teaser: White House officials said Mr. Trump would directly discuss his views with Kim Jong-un about a summit meeting between the two rogue states.

headline: Mueller Accuses Paul Manafort of Attempted Witness Tampering
teaser: Prosecutors say President Trump’s former campaign chairman tried to contact witnesses in the case against him. They want his bail revoked or revised.

headline: Trump Team Pushed False Story Line About Meeting With Kremlin-Tied Lawyer, Memo Shows
teaser: President Trump’s spokeswoman and lawyer aggressively pushed one story line, while privately acknowledging another. It shows the perils of an interview with Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel.

headline: News Analysis: Trump and His Lawyers Embrace a Vision of Vast Executive Power
teaser: The president and his personal legal advisers have argued to the special counsel that his authority places him above the reach of obstruction statutes.

headline: Fact check of the day: 500 Days In, Trump Boasts of Many Wins
teaser: On Monday, President Trump again took to Twitter to promote what he called his accomplishments in office so far on immigration, the economy and North Korea.

headline: U.S. Army Veteran Is Charged With Attempted Spying for China
teaser: The arrest of the former intelligence agent comes after a former C.I.A. officer was accused of helping China unravel an American spy network there.

headline: U.S. Army Veteran Is Charged With Attempted Spying for China
teaser: The arrest of the former intelligence agent comes after a former C.I.A. officer was accused of helping China unravel an American spy network there.

headline: California Will Have Clues for the Nation: How to Watch the Primary
teaser: The vote shares in top-two congressional primaries like those in California have tended to be similar to general election House results.

headline: Nonfiction: Deep Inside the Obama White House
teaser: Ben Rhodes’s memoir, “The World as It Is,” recounts some of the toughest decisions Obama made during his time as president.

headline: California Primary Election: Voters Head to the Polls
teaser: This is a big Election Day in California, and the country is watching.

headline: Eight States Have Primaries on Tuesday. Here’s What to Watch for.
teaser: Alabama, California, Iowa, Mississippi, Montana, New Jersey, New Mexico and South Dakota are voting on Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know about the main races.

headline: Fiction: Bill Clinton and James Patterson Have Written a Thriller. It’s Good.
teaser: The former president and the best-selling novelist have packed “The President Is Missing” with inside-the-Beltway intrigue and secret White House details.

headline: Win or Lose, Tuesday’s Primaries Are a Big Deal for Women
teaser: There are 122 women on the primary ballots for congressional and statewide executive offices this week.

headline: Photos of the California Primary
teaser: California voters head to the polls on Tuesday. Our photographers have fanned out across the state to capture the scene.

headline: David Koch Steps Down From Business and Conservative Political Group
teaser: The billionaire industrialist was a major benefactor of the arts and with his brother Charles guided the Americans for Prosperity conservative agenda

headline: Portraits of California Voters: ‘You Can’t Have Change Without Voting’
teaser: From San Diego to the Central Valley, Californians are sending a message with their votes in Tuesday’s primary.

headline: White House Unblocks Twitter Users Who Sued Trump, but Appeals Ruling
teaser: The seven Twitter users had been blocked from interacting with the president’s account after criticizing or mocking him, a move that a judge ruled violated their rights.

headline: Medicare and Social Security Finances Worsened Last Year
teaser: A report projected that the Medicare trust fund will be exhausted in 2026, three years before last year’s forecast. Social Security’s old-age benefit finances also deteriorated.

headline: White House Celebration Goes On, Without the Eagles
teaser: In brief remarks during the event, which had originally been meant to honor the Super Bowl champions, the president did not mention the team as he urged Americans to always stand for the anthem.

headline: Nonfiction: Was Jimmy Carter the Most Underrated President in History?
teaser: Stuart Eizenstat thinks so, and he lays out his argument in this admiring but frank appraisal, “President Carter: The White House Years.”

headline: Trump’s School Safety Commission Won’t Look at Guns, Betsy DeVos Says
teaser: Ms. DeVos, the education secretary, said in a hearing that guns were “not part of the commission’s charge,” prompting senators to ask how the panel could avoid the subject.

headline: China Offers to Buy Nearly $70 Billion of American Goods if U.S. Halts Tariffs
teaser: China offered American officials the package in trade talks last weekend, but the deal could quickly fizzle as the White House continues with its plans to impose tariffs on the country.

headline: Scott Pruitt Sought ‘Business Opportunity’ With Chick-fil-A While Leading E.P.A.
teaser: Internal emails show the E.P.A. administrator had an employee pursue a meeting with Chick-fil-A’s chief executive to discuss a “business opportunity” for his wife.

headline: Fact check of the day: Trump vs. the Philadelphia Eagles
teaser: President Trump called off a White House event set for Tuesday that was to honor the winners of the 2018 Super Bowl. But only a few members of the N.F.L. team were planning to attend in the first place.

headline: Trump Stumbles Through ‘God Bless America’
teaser: The president closed his “Celebration of America” event with a rendition of the patriotic tune, but didn’t quite get all the words.

headline: Harriet Tubman on the $20? Trump’s Treasury Dept. Won’t Commit
teaser: An Obama-era plan to put Tubman on the $20 has languished under the Trump administration, which said that “neither the final designs nor all features have been finalized.”

headline: Mexico Hits U.S. With Tariffs, Escalating Global Trade Tensions
teaser: The move came as the administration suggested it wants to split the Nafta talks and negotiate separate agreements with Mexico and Canada.

headline: Senate’s August Recess Cut, Keeping Democrats Off Campaign Trail
teaser: The Senate’s four-week August recess will be shortened to one, a change that could limit home-state appearances by Democrats facing tough re-election fights.

headline: White House Memo: Why Is Trump Mad at Sessions? A Tweet Provides the Answer
teaser: The president acknowledged perhaps as explicitly as ever that he is angry at the attorney general for not stopping the Russia inquiry. To critics, it is all but an admission of obstruction of justice.

headline: Kelly Sadler, Aide Who Mocked McCain, Leaves White House
teaser: Ms. Sadler did not leave because of a macabre joke she made about Senator John McCain, two people familiar with the situation said.

headline: Lewinsky and Trump Shadow Bill Clinton on Book Tour
teaser: At a TimesTalk event, the former president said that his defensiveness in a recent interview “wasn’t my finest hour.”

headline: California Voters Remove Aaron Persky, the Judge Who Gave a 6-Month Sentence for Sexual Assault
teaser: Talk of a recall campaign began almost as soon as Judge Persky handed down the sentence in 2016 to Brock Turner, a student at Stanford. It was criticized as being too lenient.

headline: In New Jersey and 7 Other States, Democrats Fill Ranks of Challengers
teaser: The push to win back the House was paramount for Democrats as nominees emerged in competitive races in New Jersey, Iowa and other states

headline: Gavin Newsom and John Cox to Compete in California Election for Governor
teaser: The candidates, who edged out the former Los Angeles mayor Antonio Villaraigosa, are likely to battle over President Trump this fall. Democrats were in tight races in several Republican-held House districts.

headline: A Growing List of U.S. Diplomats Acting Undiplomatically
teaser: There is nothing new about ambassadors making unfortunate remarks, but an unusual number of top envoys in the Trump administration have provoked controversy among close allies and angered Democrats.

headline: Thousands of Voters Were Left Off Primary Day Rolls in Los Angeles
teaser: A printing error improperly left off about 119,000 names, forcing many voters to cast provisional ballots. No specific reason for the mistake was immediately known.

headline: 5 Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primary Elections
teaser: Trump voters can have long memories. Democratic voters in New Jersey have not fully forgiven Senator Robert Menendez. And other points from the night’s primaries.

headline: California Voters Remove Aaron Persky, the Judge Who Gave a 6-Month Sentence for Sexual Assault
teaser: Talk of a recall campaign began almost as soon as Judge Persky handed down the sentence in 2016 to Brock Turner, a student at Stanford. It was criticized as being too lenient.

headline: San Francisco Voters Uphold Ban on Flavored Vaping Products
teaser: The measure is considered the strictest in the nation. Voters backed it despite an expensive advertising campaign funded by a big tobacco company.

headline: Speaker Ryan Dismisses Trump’s Charges of a Spy in his Campaign
teaser: Speaker Paul D. Ryan backed Representative Trey Gowdy in dismissing President Trump’s assertion that the F.B.I. inserted a “spy” into his campaign.

headline: Europe Asks U.S. for an Exemption From Sanctions on Iran
teaser: A letter to the Trump administration is a tacit acknowledgment that efforts to preserve the nuclear deal will fail without American help.

headline: Trump Should Not Try to Pardon Himself, Ryan Says
teaser: Speaker Paul D. Ryan also said on Wednesday that the F.B.I. did nothing wrong by using a confidential informant to contact members of the Trump campaign as it investigated its ties to Russia.

headline: Trump Defends Melania Trump and Spreads Conspiracies About Her in the Process
teaser: On Twitter, the president spread the sort of rumors about the first lady that might normally attract legal action from the notoriously litigious Trump family.

headline: Trump Offers Clemency to Imprisoned Woman After Being Lobbied by Kim Kardashian West
teaser: The president commuted the sentence of a 63-year-old woman serving life in prison on nonviolent drug charges in response to the urging of Ms. Kardashian West.

headline: Tech We’re Using: An Investigative Arsenal: Power Chargers, Document Analysis Tools and More
teaser: What’s it like to comb through 18,000 pages? Eric Lipton, an investigative reporter for The Times, described the tech he uses to help accomplish that task.

headline: Kim Jong-un’s Image Shift: From Nuclear Madman to Skillful Leader
teaser: Can someone change so quickly? A summit meeting with President Trump will test the North Korean leader’s radical transformation.

headline: California Results Are Consistent With a Competitive House Race
teaser: With ballots still being counted, all indications point to a close, if perhaps Democratic-tilting, race for the U.S. House in November.
