headline: Alexander Nix, Ex-Chief of Cambridge Analytica, Is Defiant in British Hearing
teaser: Mr. Nix’s statements to a Parliament committee contradicted some evidence presented by a former employee, Christopher Wylie.

headline: DeVos Halts Partial Debt Relief Policy After Judge Slams Procedures
teaser: The Education Department halted its new policy of partial debt relief for defrauded students after a judge said the agency had misused private earnings data.

headline: Democrats Find Relief in California House Race Results
teaser: The party spent millions to avoid being locked out of key races under California’s “top two” primary system.

headline: Democrats Strengthen House Takeover Prospects in Primary Voting
teaser: The Democratic Party skirted disaster in California and lined up likely gains in New Jersey, but Republicans saw some bright signs as well.

headline: 5 Takeaways From California’s Primary, for Californians
teaser: Though it had national implications, the California primary also tested state political issues like single-payer health care, Latino turnout and an unpopular gas tax.

headline: Stormy Daniels Sues, Saying Michael Cohen Colluded With Her Former Lawyer
teaser: The suit brought by the pornographic film actress reveals text messages discussing an effort to quash the story of her alleged affair with Mr. Trump.

headline: Elizabeth Warren and a Scholarly Debate Over Medical Bankruptcy That Won’t Go Away
teaser: A 2005 academic paper fueled much discussion and helped her political career, but remains contested.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims ‘We’re Now Exporting Energy for the First Time’
teaser: The United States has been exporting energy for decades, and is not projected to become a net exporter until 2022.

headline: Space Station Could Be Split to Aid Privatization, New NASA Chief Says
teaser: Jim Bridenstine, the agency’s new administrator, said he is considering various ways to allow private companies to assume operation of the space station.

headline: No, Mr. Trump, Canada Did Not Burn Down the White House in the War of 1812
teaser: President Trump reportedly made the claim in a discussion with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada. He was wrong, but the history is a little complicated.

headline: What to Expect as the House Heads Toward an Immigration Showdown
teaser: House Republicans are divided over how to protect so-called Dreamers, and some members are now trying to force leadership’s hand.

headline: After Trump Flare-Up, Eagles Let Football (and Some Signs) Do the Talking
teaser: “If he doesn’t want to stand up for his players, that’s not really my business,” Chris Long said about Roger Goodell.

headline: Who is the ‘Real’ Melania Trump? Who Knows.
teaser: Melania Trump prizes her privacy. But the first lady’s absence from the public eye has led to very different narratives about who she is.

headline: White House’s Nafta Approach Frustrates Businesses, Panicked Emails Show
teaser: Internal documents revealed that corporations and trade groups were often shut out of deliberations, breeding animosity between industry and a supposedly business-friendly administration.

headline: Alex Azar, Health Secretary, Denies Sabotaging Insurance Markets
teaser: Mr. Azar blamed the Affordable Care Act, not Trump administration policies, for costs that many experts expect to surge again next year.

headline: Southwest Border Arrests Rise for Third Month in a Row
teaser: The Department of Homeland Security arrested nearly 52,000 people trying to enter the country last month as illegal immigration shows no sign of abating.

headline: Witnesses Demand Focus on Guns at First School Safety Commission Hearing
teaser: President Trump’s school safety commission convened its first public hearing on Wednesday, and members got an earful from witnesses worried about its direction.

headline: Republican Lawmakers Question Environmental Group’s Praise of China
teaser: The Natural Resources Defense Council is under fire for praising China’s cleanup efforts while challenging the Trump administration’s environmental policies.

headline: China Pledges to Investigate Fears of Sonic Attacks on U.S. Diplomats
teaser: China’s Foreign Ministry said it was prepared to investigate what was causing symptoms similar to brain injury among U.S. diplomats in the city of Guangzhou.

headline: Will Preet Bharara Run for Attorney General? He Just Registered to Vote
teaser: Becoming a registered Democrat is a necessary step if the former United States attorney wants to get in the crowded race.

headline: Former Fox News Analyst Calls Network a ‘Destructive Propaganda Machine’
teaser: Ralph Peters, who quit in March in disgust, said that the network’s attacks on democratic institutions do “a great, grave disservice to our country.”

headline: Paul Ryan Promises House Immigration Vote in Election Season
teaser: Hoping to head off narrow legislation to protect young undocumented immigrants, Speaker Paul D. Ryan said he will draft an immigration bill for a floor vote.

headline: American ISIS Suspect Fights Plan to Release Him in Syria
teaser: The move would avoid a court fight that could jeopardize the underpinnings of the war effort against the Islamic State, but the man’s lawyers say it would amount to a death warrant.

headline: Who Are Dick and Liz Uihlein?
teaser: The billionaire Republican donors have poured money into groups backing right-wing candidates, helping to shape the 2018 midterm elections.

headline: The Most Powerful Conservative Couple You’ve Never Heard Of
teaser: Liz and Dick Uihlein, founders of the shipping-supply giant Uline, have donated some $26 million this year alone advancing conservative causes anywhere they can.

headline: Trump Is About to Meet U.S. Allies in Canada. They’re Angry.
teaser: As he heads to a G-7 meeting amid a tariff dispute, President Trump is the black sheep of the family who has picked a fight with his relatives just before arriving to dinner.

headline: White House Analysis Finds Tariffs Will Hurt Growth, as Officials Insist Otherwise
teaser: The internal analysis, from the Council of Economic Advisers, echoes warnings from Wall Street and academic economists over the president’s trade agenda.

headline: The Chemical Industry Scores a Big Win at the E.P.A.
teaser: The agency has decided that it will not look at air, water or ground contaminants when it determines the health and safety risks of potentially toxic chemicals.

headline: Trump Says Abandoning Iran Deal Has Already Curbed Tehran’s Bad Behavior
teaser: The president, at a news conference with the Japanese prime minister, predicted that his tough tactics would carry over into a successful negotiation with North Korea.

headline: Guiliani’s Freewheeling Trip to Israel
teaser: Rudolph Giuliani — President Trump’s lawyer and a former mayor of New York — spoke on a variety of topics, like the Mueller investigation and Stormy Daniels, while in Israel. He also danced at a restaurant.

headline: Understanding The Times: How The Times Decides When to Publish Leaked News
teaser: Charlie Savage, a Times Washington correspondent, explains the legality and ethics of publishing confidential and/or classified information.

headline: Trump on the North Korea Summit and What’s Next
teaser: President Trump floated the possibility of Kim Jong-un visiting the United States and discussed prospects for their meeting next week.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: With Little Evidence, Trump Claims Iran Has Curbed Activities in Middle East
teaser: President Trump claimed that Iran is “no longer looking” to Syria or Yemen since he withdrew from the Iran nuclear deal. Administration officials have said otherwise.

headline: Giuliani Speaks for Trump. Except When He Doesn’t.
teaser: The first lady and secretary of state pushed back on Rudolph W. Giuliani, making clear that he does not reflect their views on Stormy Daniels or North Korea.

headline: Justice Dept. Seizes Times Reporter’s Email and Phone Records in Leak Investigation
teaser: Federal prosecutors seized the records as part of an investigation into leaks of classified information to the news media by a former Senate aide.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Exaggerates Trade Deficit With European Union by $50 Billion

headline: With Mueller Closing In, Manafort’s Allies Abandon Him
teaser: Allegations that Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, tried to tamper with witnesses originated with two of his former business associates.

headline: Justice Dept. Says Crucial Provisions of Obamacare Are Unconstitutional
teaser: The Trump administration said certain provisions were part of an unconstitutional scheme that required most Americans to carry health insurance.

headline: House Votes to Trim Unused Funding, a Gesture of Fiscal Restraint
teaser: Lawmakers approved a White House plan to cancel funding that had been approved in past years, though it would have a minuscule effect on the deficit.

headline: U.S. Issues Alert to Americans in China in Wake of Sonic Attack Fears
teaser: A strange illness reported by some American diplomats in the southern city of Guangzhou prompted the U.S. to urge its citizens in China to get help for any symptoms.

headline: The G-7 Summit: What to Watch For

headline: Ahead of G-7 Summit Meeting, Trump Rails Against Canadian Tariffs
teaser: In a trio of tweets early Friday, Mr. Trump said Canadian tariffs on American dairy products were “Not fair to our farmers!”

headline: Trump Calls for Russia to Be Readmitted to G-7
teaser: Four years after the world’s leading economies cast Russia out of their club for annexing Crimea, President Trump proposes to let Moscow back in.

headline: Trump Says He’s Considering a Pardon for Muhammad Ali
teaser: It was not clear how the presidential pardon would help the late boxing champion, whose conviction for refusing the military draft was overturned in 1971.

headline: Trump Praises Arrest of Former Senate Committee Aide in Leaks Inquiry
teaser: “I’m a big, big believer in freedom of the press,” Mr. Trump said. “But I’m also a believer in classified information. It has to remain classified.”

headline: Trump Says a ‘Big Operation’ Kept Melania Trump From G-7
teaser: Until President Trump stepped in front of the cameras on Friday, there had been no leaks about the first lady’s closely-guarded condition.

headline: Fact-Check of the Day: Trump Considers Pardoning Muhammad Ali, Whose Conviction Was Already Overturned
teaser: President Trump said he was “doing recommendations on Muhammad Ali.” In 1971, the Supreme Court overturned Ali’s draft evasion conviction, and President Jimmy Carter issued a blanket amnesty in 1977.

headline: Trump, in Apparent Break With Sessions, Says He’s Likely to Back Marijuana Bill
teaser: The legislation, introduced by Senator Cory Gardner, a Republican, and Senator Elizabeth Warren, a Democrat, would leave the decision about whether to legalize marijuana up to the states.

headline: 1 American Soldier Killed, 4 Wounded in Somalia Firefight
teaser: Officials said the U.S. Special Operations forces were working with Somali troops at a small southern outpost when they were targeted by Shabab extremists.

headline: Macron, Trudeau and Merkel At Odds With Trump
teaser: The leaders of France, Canada and Germany pushed back against President Trump’s trade policies ahead of the G-7 summit meeting.

headline: Mueller Adds Obstruction Charge on Manafort and Indicts His Right-Hand Man
teaser: Mr. Manafort’s longtime associate, Konstantin V. Kilimnik, is suspected of having ties to Russian intelligence. Prosecutors say the two men tried to tamper with witnesses.

headline: Orange County Fights Turning Blue. And the Resistance Is Formidable.
teaser: The heart of Reagan Country may not love Trump. But many there think state Democrats have badly overreached and want to check their power.

headline: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Is Convicted of Spying for China
teaser: The former officer, Kevin Mallory, faces life in prison, though his lawyers deny that he betrayed the United States.

headline: Chinese Hackers Steal Unclassified Data From Navy Contractor
teaser: American officials blamed Beijing for the breach, the latest escalation in a cyberwar between the United States and China.

headline: Trump’s New Plan to Dismantle Obamacare Comes With Political Risks
teaser: The Justice Department’s challenge of the constitutionality of major parts of the law imperils popular protections for people with pre-existing medical conditions.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From the tensions among President Trump and the United States’ closest allies to a series of court decisions, it was a busy week in American politics. Here are five of the biggest stories this week (and some links if you want to read further).

headline: What Is the Trade Deficit?
teaser: It’s not a scorecard, and reducing it won’t necessarily be good for jobs.

headline: Feature: First Canada Tried to Charm Trump. Now It’s Fighting Back.
teaser: Inside Justin Trudeau’s campaign against the American trade war.

headline: How Good Is the Trump Economy, Really?
teaser: It depends on whether you look at the level, the direction or the rate of change — three concepts that are often conflated.

headline: No Need to Prepare to Meet Kim Jong-un? Trump Has a Point
teaser: In some ways, President Trump, who came of age during the Cuban Missile Crisis and has long given thought to North Korea, has been preparing for this encounter his entire adult life.

headline: Trump Displays Confidence About North Korea Talks

headline: In the Trump Administration, Science Is Unwelcome. So Is Advice.
teaser: As the president prepares for nuclear talks, he lacks a close adviser with nuclear expertise. It’s one example of a marginalization of science in shaping federal policy.

headline: A Visa Lottery Winner a Decade Ago, a U.S. Soldier Returns Home to Lithuania

headline: White House Memo: ‘Drama, Action, Emotional Power’: As Exhausted Aides Eye the Exits, Trump Is Re-Energized
teaser: With fewer people around to soften his impulses, the president is bending the presidency to his will.

headline: Mitt Romney Wants In Again. There Is One Catch.

headline: Tax Havens Blunt Impact of Corporate Tax Cut, Economists Say

headline: The New New World: Near-Collapse of ZTE May Be China’s Sputnik Moment

headline: Alabama’s Longtime Hostility to Gambling Shows Signs of Fading

headline: ‘I Am Qualified!’ Why Democratic Women Running for Governor Are Saying This

headline: Supreme Court Upholds Ohio’s Purge of Voting Rolls

‘We’re Close,’ but House Progress on Immigration Appears Stalled

But the settlement did not require the government to break up families, and the practice has spurred protests against the Trump administration, a rebuke from the United Nations and a court challenge.

teaser: Hillary Clinton supporters saw the report on James Comey as proof the F.B.I. wronged her in 2016. “It’s disappointing and infuriating,” one ally said.

teaser: The president said such immigrants should be sent back immediately without an appearance before a judge.

headline: Americans Love Families. American Policies Don’t.
teaser: Falling short of other countries, from the left and the right, in meeting real needs.

headline: More Than 500 Migrant Children Reunited With Adults, Government Says
teaser: The federal government said late Saturday that it was working to reunite more children, days after President Trump signed an executive order ending its family separation policy.

headline: White House Memo: Postcards From Another Era: Obama Team Memoirs Flood the Stores
teaser: If it seems as if everyone who worked for former President Barack Obama has a new book out, that’s not far off the mark. And there are more to come.

headline: New Emails Suggest Scott Pruitt Discussed Hiring a Friend of Lobbyist Landlord
teaser: The files, which hadn't previously been disclosed, show a closer relationship between the E.P.A. and J. Steven Hart, the lobbyist husband of Mr. Pruitt's landlord, than earlier acknowledged.

headline: Court to Rule on Mandatory Union Fees, and U.S. May Restrict Chinese Investment
teaser: The Fed will release results of a second round of stress tests on major banks, and Commerce Department numbers will show whether tariffs are having an impact on the cost of consumer goods.

headline: Former Trump Aide Apologizes for ‘Cotton-Picking’ Remark to Black Guest on Fox News
teaser: The remarks by David Bossie prompted a rare on-air repudiation from Fox News, which released a statement calling the outburst “deeply offensive and wholly inappropriate.”

headline: Medicare Allows More Benefits for Chronically Ill, Aiming to Improve Care for Millions
teaser: Medicare health plans will be able to combine medical and social services under a new law that had support from both parties in Congress and the Trump administration.

headline: Trump’s Trade War Could Shut Cheesemakers Out of Foreign Markets
teaser: With other countries raising tariffs to American products and signing trade deals without the United States, the American cheesemaker is increasingly standing alone.

headline: Mexico’s Hardball Politics Get Even Harder as PRI Fights to Hold Onto Power
teaser: Faced with dismal polls, the ruling party is putting the levers of government to its ends. It also considered using the Trump campaign consultant Cambridge Analytica.

headline: Sidebar: He Sold Drugs for $225. Indiana Took His $42,000 Land Rover.
teaser: The Supreme Court has agreed to decide whether the Constitution has anything to say about civil forfeiture laws that let states take property used in crimes.

headline: At a Toast to Trump, the North Korean Anthem Has a Starring Role
teaser: A birthday party in honor of the president included a fashion show salute to his North Korea talks, Trump-themed gowns — oh, and the Senate candidate Corey Stewart.

headline: Jimmy Fallon Says He’ll Donate to Raices in Trump’s Name
teaser: The late-night host had said he regretted playfully running his fingers through Mr. Trump’s hair on his show. The president responded: “Be a man Jimmy!”

headline: Supreme Court Won’t Hear North Carolina Partisan Gerrymandering Case
teaser: The justices passed up an opportunity to take another look at whether the Constitution bars extreme partisan gerrymandering.

headline: Trump Criticizes Restaurant Refusing to Serve His Press Secretary
teaser: It was the latest incident in which a member of President Trump’s inner circle was singled out for public repudiation.

headline: Justices Send Gay Rights and Voting Cases Back to Lower Courts
teaser: The moves followed decisions involving a Colorado baker who refused to create a cake for a same-sex wedding and challenges to partisan gerrymandering.

headline: Newsbook: 3 Books Explain Why the Supreme Court’s Stance on Gerrymandering Matters
teaser: It’s an issue of race, power and politics.

headline: Supreme Court Upholds Texas Voting Maps That Were Called Discriminatory
teaser: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the court reversed decisions finding that an array of voting districts had discriminated against minority voters, but it did rule that one was an impermissible racial gerrymander.

headline: Bulletin board: Lies? False Claims? When Trump’s Statements Aren’t True
teaser: Each time President Trump says something that we know is not accurate, we hear from readers who are upset that we did not call him a liar. Dean Baquet, our executive editor, explains how we think about the word “lie.”

headline: Harley-Davidson Shows Why Corporations Cannot Keep Silent in Trade Wars
teaser: When financial pain threatens to become consequential, public companies are obliged to publicize it. This could affect the debate over Trump’s trade policies.

headline: Meet Colorado’s New Single-Issue Voters: the Cannabis Community
teaser: As marijuana legalization advocates seek to build sustained political power, many are supporting an ally, Jared Polis, in Colorado’s primary for governor Tuesday.

headline: The New Tax Form Is Postcard-Size, but More Complicated Than Ever
teaser: A new version of the 1040 income tax form, set for release this week, omits some popular deductions and requires several work sheets for many taxpayers to complete.

headline: Sean Spicer Is Testing Out a New Job: TV Talk Show Host
teaser: The former White House press secretary plans to film a pilot for a one-on-one talk show next month.

headline: Supreme Court Sides With American Express on Merchant Fees
teaser: In a test of antitrust law, the justices ruled 5 to 4 that the company could use contracts to stop merchants from steering consumers to other cards.

headline: As Activists Confront Trump Officials, Democrats Confront Democrats
teaser: Progressives’ public shaming of Trump administration members in recent days has opened a rift in the party over whether to embrace or discourage such behavior.

headline: Due Process for Undocumented Immigrants, Explained
teaser: President Trump wants authorized immigrants and asylum seekers deported “with no Judges or Court Cases.” What due-process rights do migrants have?

headline: ‘Why Do You Hate Us?’ He Asked. ‘Because You’re Mexicans,’ She Replied.
teaser: In a viral video, a woman unleashed a diatribe against a man and his mother, and, invoking President Trump, called Mexicans rapists, animals and drug dealers.

headline: Border Officials Suspend Handing Over Migrant Families to Prosecutors
teaser: Effectively, the Customs and Border Protection commissioner’s decision revives a “catch and release” approach for most families crossing the Mexican border illegally.

headline: Trump Implores Voters to Back South Carolina Governor on Eve of Runoff
teaser: President Trump told a crowd that a loss by Gov. Henry McMaster, one of his earliest supporters, would be seen as a sign of the president’s own weakness.

headline: Voters Go to the Polls in 7 States on Tuesday. Here’s What to Watch For.
teaser: In New York, establishment candidates face tough challenges. In Utah, Mitt Romney is back. President Trump has weighed in on South Carolina’s runoff for governor.

headline: Nonfiction: Gerald Ford, President Nice Guy
teaser: Donald Rumsfeld’s “When the Center Held” is a sympathetic portrait of the man who pardoned Richard Nixon.

headline: Trump Threatens Harley-Davidson as Company Shifts Production Overseas
teaser: President Trump took aim at one of his favorite American manufacturers, Harley-Davidson, a day after the company said it would shift some production overseas to avoid retaliatory tariffs.

headline: White House Officials Diverge on Immigration Policy
teaser: Attorney General Jeff Sessions and the White House press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, offered slightly different views on the enforcement of the “zero tolerance” policy at the U.S.-Mexico border.

headline: Abortion and Travel Ban Rulings Are Victory for G.O.P. Tactics on Gorsuch
teaser: The refusal by Senate Republicans to act on President Obama’s nomination of Merrick Garland to the Supreme Court, paving the way for Justice Gorsuch, reverberated powerfully after Tuesday’s rulings.

headline: Justices Back Pregnancy Centers That Oppose Abortion, in Free Speech Case
teaser: Operated by opponents of abortion, the centers had argued the law violated their free speech by forcing them to convey messages at odds with their beliefs.

headline: Supreme Court Upholds Trump’s Travel Ban, Delivering Endorsement of Presidential Power
teaser: In a 5-to-4 vote, the Supreme Court ruled that President Trump acted lawfully in imposing limits on travel from several predominantly Muslims nations.

headline: Ivana Trump, In and Out of the Spotlight
teaser: The first of the president’s three wives has said very little about her ex-husband since he took office. “But we speak,” she points out.

headline: As Summit Nears, NATO Allies Have One Main Worry: Trump
teaser: After the fiasco of the Group of 7 meeting, where the president publicly criticized allies, NATO countries dread a similar performance, helping Russia.

headline: ‘Brain Performance’ Firm DeVos Invested in Is Hit for Misleading Claims
teaser: Neurocore, which has received more than $5 million from Education Secretary Betsy DeVos and her husband, has agreed to stop advertising claims a review board found misleading.

headline: As Election Season Ramps Up, What Do You Want to Ask Our Politics Editor?
teaser: Patrick Healy will answer readers’ questions about our coverage of the midterm and 2020 presidential elections.

headline: David Lynch and Donald Trump: A Brief, Surreal History
teaser: “You are causing suffering and division,” the filmmaker wrote to Mr. Trump in an open letter on Facebook, the day after the president mentioned him at a rally.

headline: Reactions to the Supreme Court Travel Ban Decision
teaser: Activists and politicians publicly voiced their responses to the Supreme Court ruling to uphold President Trump’s limits on travel from several predominantly Muslim nations.

headline: Here Is One Way Trump Spreads False Information Online
teaser: The president tweeted something untrue about Representative Maxine Waters. Outrage ensued online, but that only helped spread disinformation.

headline: Roiling Markets, U.S. Insists World Must Stop Buying Iranian Oil
teaser: The United States vowed Tuesday to impose sanctions on any country that buys Iranian oil after Nov. 4, a tough position likely to alienate many.

headline: Trump May Soften Sweeping Plan to Restrict Chinese Investments
teaser: President Trump signaled his support for using an existing committee that reviews risky foreign investments for national security threats.

headline: Senate Odd Couple Tries to Salvage an Immigration Deal
teaser: Five years ago, Ted Cruz and Dianne Feinstein clashed memorably over the Constitution. Now, the senators are searching for comity on immigration.

headline: Sonia Sotomayor Delivers Fiery Dissent in Travel Ban Case
teaser: Justice Sotomayor’s scorching dissent skewered the court’s decision to uphold the ban, which she condemned as “harrowing” and “motivated by hostility and animus toward the Muslim faith.”

headline: Drug Dealers Targeted in Sweep of Illicit Online Marketplaces
teaser: More than 35 people were accused of selling drugs on the “dark web,” the first time prosecutors made the sellers of illegal goods their primary focus rather than marketplace operators.

headline: States Sue to Stop Separations as Government Struggles to Reunite Families
teaser: Seventeen states and the District of Columbia sued President Trump to block family separations as the administration struggled to reunite divided families.

headline: Henry McMaster Wins Governor’s Primary in South Carolina After Boost From Trump
teaser: The 71-year-old governor, forced into a runoff two weeks ago, defeated a first-time candidate a day after appearing at a rally with Mr. Trump.

headline: What the Travel Ban Ruling Means for Presidential Power
teaser: Adam Liptak, the Supreme Court correspondent for The Times, analyzes the 5-to-4 ruling in favor of the Trump administration’s limits on travel from several mostly Muslim countries.

headline: Michael Grimm Falls Back to Earth. In a Ballroom on Staten Island.
teaser: Mr. Grimm, a former congressman who pleaded guilty to tax fraud, tried to make a comeback for his old House seat. It didn’t work. “We make plans,” he said Tuesday night. “God laughs at us.”

headline: Who Is Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez? A Democratic Giant Slayer
teaser: In her first run for political office, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez beat Joseph Crowley, the No. 4 House Democrat. “I always knew it was possible,” she said.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: No, Democrats Don’t Want ‘Open Borders’
teaser: President Trump has made this false claim at least two dozen times since taking office. Democrats support border security measures, though not the border wall he wants to build.

headline: 4 Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primary Elections
teaser: It was a night of rebellious Democrats, who backed progressive insurgents, and loyal Republicans, who helped incumbents backed by President Trump persevere.

headline: In Eastern Europe, Militaries Gird Against Russian Might and Manipulation
teaser: American soldiers and allies, on a military exercise in Poland and Lithuania, are ramping up to thwart Russian cyberattacks and information warfare.

headline: Feature: A Spymaster Steps Out of the Shadows

headline: Trump Backs Softer Restrictions on Chinese Investment

headline: Trump Promotes House Immigration Overhaul, but His Support May Be Too Late

headline: News Analysis: Supreme Court Decision Makes Unions Smaller and Poorer, but Maybe Not Weaker
teaser: The ruling could cost public-sector unions more than a million members. But the ones who stay could make labor more powerful.

headline: E.U. Leader Warns of ‘Worst-Case Scenarios,’ Citing Trump
teaser: Donald Tusk, head of the European Council, warned leaders that there were deep divisions in the trans-Atlantic relationship as a trade war loomed.

headline: Bill Shine Likely as Next White House Communications Director
teaser: The former Fox News executive, who was ousted for his handling of sexual harassment scandals at the network, met with President Trump in recent weeks for the post left open by Hope Hicks.

headline: Supreme Court Delivers a Sharp Blow to Labor Unions
teaser: The court ruled that government workers cannot be required to pay for collective bargaining, which could cost public unions tens of millions of dollars.

headline: Charlottesville Car Attack Suspect Indicted on Federal Hate-Crimes Charges
teaser: The man, James A. Fields Jr., also faces local charges of first-degree murder in the death of a woman protesting a white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va., last summer.

headline: No, Harley-Davidson’s C.E.O. Did Not Punch Back at Trump
teaser: A disparaging quote about President Trump circulating on Twitter and purporting to be from the company’s chief executive is fake.

headline: NASA Again Delays Launch of Troubled Webb Telescope; Cost Estimate Rises to $9.7 Billion
teaser: The successor to the Hubble has had a series of mishaps during testing. An independent review board pushed back the launch for three years.

headline: New York Immigrants Facing Deportation Will Get Video Hearings, Lawyers Say
teaser: The decision came after protests outside a Lower Manhattan court. Immigration lawyers said the policy would affect their ability to identify and represent potential clients.

headline: Trump Administration Cites Difficulties in Meeting Judge’s Timetable for Family Reunification
teaser: Children under the age of 5 must be reunited with their parents within 14 days, the judge said, and other minor children must be reunited within 30 days.

headline: China Won’t Yield ‘Even One Inch’ of South China Sea, Xi Tells Mattis
teaser: Disagreement over the contested sea and Taiwan are major issues as the American defense secretary meets the Chinese leader in Beijing.

headline: Watch: Justice Anthony Kennedy’s Swearing-In Ceremony
teaser: Nominated by President Ronald Reagan, Justice Kennedy in 1988 described the Constitution as the “single moral principle that sets the United States apart from other nations.”

headline: The Front-Runners and Full List of Potential Supreme Court Nominees
teaser: The president has said he intends to choose his next Supreme Court nominee from a list he began compiling during the 2016 campaign.

headline: ‘Leave My Husband Alone’: Elaine Chao Confronts Immigration Protesters
teaser: The transportation secretary defended her husband, Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, when protesters confronted them over the separation of immigrant families.

headline: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez: I’m ‘Unapologetic About What I Believe’
teaser: The Bronx native spoke about her campaign’s mission a day after she shook up the Democratic Party with her defeat of Representative Joseph Crowley.

headline: What Would an Expanded Foreign Investment Committee Do?
teaser: President Trump has backed an expansion of powers for the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to curb Chinese investment in American companies.

headline: As Jobs Go Unfilled, U.S. Employers Vie to Hire Foreign Laborers
teaser: A tight labor market set off a scramble among businesses in a visa lottery for temporary workers, adding a new element to the politics of immigration.

headline: What Does Ocasio-Cortez’s Win Mean for Cynthia Nixon?
teaser: Ms. Nixon, who is challenging Gov. Andrew Cuomo in the Democratic primary, is seeking to draw parallels to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s upset win.

headline: Benghazi Attacker Gets 22 Years, Disappointing Prosecutors Who Sought Life
teaser: A federal judge said the militant, Ahmed Abu Khattala, was essentially convicted of property crimes, which did not warrant a life sentence.

headline: The Major Cases Where Justice Kennedy Left His Mark
teaser: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy served as the decisive vote in several closely watched cases during his tenure. Here are some major decisions where he left his mark.

headline: Ben Jealous ‘Just Climbed K2’ in Maryland Governor’s Race. Next Is Everest.
teaser: Tuesday’s victory by Mr. Jealous, a Bernie Sanders ally, emboldened Democrats seeking to push the party left. Now he’ll face a popular Republican incumbent.

headline: Pompeo Outlines Plans for Global Challenges, Including Venezuela and Palestinian Refugees

headline: Top Democrat’s Defeat Throws Party Leadership Into Turmoil
teaser: The stunning primary defeat of Representative Joe Crowley by a young Latina progressive raised the pressure on the Democrats’ aging leadership to step aside for a new generation.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Gets Chance to Influence American Life for Generations Through Supreme Court Pick

teaser: For decades, Justice Anthony M. Kennedy has been seen as the deciding force on a profoundly polarized Supreme Court who weighed in at key moments to preserve the core of Roe.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Democrats Cite McConnell’s Precedent to Delay Supreme Court Hearings. But Does It Apply?
teaser: Democrats are demanding that the Senate majority leader delay confirmation proceedings during an election year, citing his refusal to consider an Obama nominee in 2016.

headline: Kennedy Retirement Injects an Inflammatory New Issue Into Midterms

headline: Trump, at Rally, Vows to Carry On Anthony Kennedy’s Legacy With Court Pick
teaser: At a rally in North Dakota, the president celebrated an indisputable political trophy as he tries to drum up support for Republicans before the midterm elections.

teaser: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy announced that he would retire, setting the stage for a furious fight over the direction of the Supreme Court.

headline: McConnell Promises Fall Vote to Confirm Next Supreme Court Justice
teaser: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy’s retirement throws the volatile issue of a Supreme Court confirmation to the Senate, and Democrats have little power to stop it.

headline: News Analysis: In Influence if Not in Title, This Has Been the Kennedy Court
teaser: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy occupied a place at the court’s ideological center for his entire tenure, with his vote often the crucial one in closely divided cases.

headline: Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy Will Retire
teaser: The announcement gives President Trump the opportunity to create a solid five-member conservative majority and fundamentally change the direction of the court.

headline: Mattis, in South Korea, Affirms ‘Ironclad’ Alliance Despite Halt to Drills
teaser: The defense secretary reaffirmed the United States’ commitment to its ally as Washington and Seoul plot a path after the Trump-Kim summit meeting.

headline: Trump and Putin Choose Helsinki for First Summit Meeting
teaser: President Trump will meet President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia in Finland on July 16, a politically delicate time with the midterm elections approaching.

headline: Ex-Aide to Roger Stone Is Subpoenaed in Russia Investigation
teaser: The former aide, Andrew Miller, worked for Roger Stone, a longtime informal adviser to President Trump, during the 2016 campaign.

headline: House Passes Resolution Demanding Justice Dept. Turn Over Documents
teaser: As Judiciary Committee Republicans battered the deputy attorney general, Rod J. Rosenstein, a House Republican resolution intensified the war on the Russia investigation.

headline: Political War Over Replacing Justice Kennedy on Supreme Court Underway
teaser: Democrats and liberal advocacy organizations face enormous challenges if they hope to prevent President Trump from installing a conservative justice.

headline: In Human Trafficking Report, State Dept. Warns Against Separating Children From Parents
teaser: Separating families can lead to human trafficking, according to the report, which did not specifically address the effects of President Trump’s zero-tolerance immigration policy.

headline: I.R.S. Nominee Says He Won’t Weaponize Agency
teaser: Charles Rettig is expected to be confirmed to lead a department that has been a political punching bag.

headline: Bulletin board: From New York’s Primary Upset to Polling Data, How The Times Is Covering the Elections
teaser: Our Politics editor, Patrick Healy, answered readers’ questions on The Times’s political coverage and plans for the midterm and 2020 elections.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims to Be First Republican to Win Wisconsin Since Eisenhower
teaser: Following Eisenhower’s two Badger State victories in 1952 and 1956, Wisconsin voted for Republican presidential candidates in 1960, 1968, 1972, 1980 and 1984 before Mr. Trump’s win in 2016.

headline: Fighting Privilege: The Senate Finally Wants to Pay Its Interns
teaser: In a bid to make Washington’s halls of power more diverse, the Senate is seeking to create a $5 million fund to compensate its interns, the first such organized congressional effort in two decades.

headline: Kennedy’s Retirement Could Clear Path for Trump’s Environmental Rollbacks
teaser: On issues like climate change and water pollution, Justice Anthony M. Kennedy was often a decisive vote.

headline: Will a Shocker in New York Have a Ripple Effect in Massachusetts?
teaser: The victory by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in Queens this week brings new confidence to the campaigns of three women challenging male incumbents in Massachusetts

headline: Fact Check of the Day: 4 Misleading or False Claims From Trump’s North Dakota Rally
teaser: In a wide-ranging campaign speech, the president spread inaccuracies on health care, the steel industry, military spending and Representative Maxine Waters.

headline: Agents Seek to Dissolve ICE in Immigration Policy Backlash
teaser: ICE special agents said the Trump administration’s crackdown on illegal migrants has hampered national security investigations and partnering with local officials.

headline: On Washington: Denied a Filibuster, Democrats Eye Other Tactics in Supreme Court Fight
teaser: Coming hearings will be the first time the process has begun with the threat of a filibuster off the table.

headline: White House Memo: In Meeting With Putin, Experts Fear Trump Will Give More Than He Gets
teaser: Foreign policy officials, including some in his own administration, fear a repeat of President Trump’s encounter with Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader.

headline: With Roe in the Balance, Two Republicans Hold High Court in their Hands
teaser: Democrats are practically powerless to stop President Trump’s Supreme Court pick. So all eyes are on Senators Collins and Murkowski to save abortion rights.

headline: For Conservatives, Court Fight Is on Their Turf and in Their D.N.A.
teaser: Few issues are as rooted in the political culture of Republicans as the Supreme Court. They hope for a big boost in the midterms.

headline: In Wisconsin Visit, Trump Cheers One Company and Criticizes Another
teaser: The president celebrates the ground breaking of a high tech campus of a Taiwanese firm while telling Harley Davidson: “Don’t get cute with us.”

headline: With Kennedy Gone, Roberts Will Be the Supreme Court’s Swing Vote
teaser: The question is whether the chief justice — an incrementalist who is passionate about preserving the institutional integrity of the court — will inch further toward the left.

headline: Melania Trump Returns to the Border, This Time Without Subtext
teaser: Mrs. Trump’s trip to Arizona on Thursday was her first public appearance since her visit to Texas was marred by her decision to wear a jacket that said, “I REALLY DON’T CARE. DO U?”

headline: Inside the White House’s Quiet Campaign to Create a Supreme Court Opening
teaser: Its goal was to assure Justice Anthony M. Kennedy that his judicial legacy would be in good hands should he decide to step down at the end of the court’s term.

headline: After 40 Days Apart, a Migrant Family Reunites
teaser: Ludin and her children, ages 9 and 17, were separated immediately after they crossed the border illegally into Texas. Sent to different parts of the country, they were kept apart for 40 days. We were there for their reunion.

headline: Migration Agency Picks a New Leader, and Sends Trump a Message
teaser: The International Organization for Migration will be led by António Vitorino, after Ken Isaacs, the American nominee, withdrew because of a lack of support.

headline: Is This the Year Women Break the Rules and Win?
teaser: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s victory may be more one-off than wave, but her stunning win has raised hopes for other female candidates.

headline: Condemning Deadly Newsroom Shooting, Trump Tempers Hostility Toward Media
teaser: The words of condolences came from a president who has labeled the news media “the enemy of the people” and who whips up chant of “fake news” at his rallies.

headline: How ‘Abolish ICE’ Went From Social Media to Progressive Candidates’ Rallying Cry
teaser: Calls to eliminate the agency charged with enforcing immigration laws, mostly rooted on the political fringe, have gained traction among progressive candidates.

headline: G.M. Says New Wave of Tariffs Could Force U.S. Job Cuts
teaser: In a filing with the Commerce Department, the automaker said the trade barriers “could lead to a smaller G.M.”

headline: ‘Shaken’ Rosenstein Felt Used by White House in Comey Firing
teaser: After the F.B.I. director James B. Comey was fired, the deputy attorney general, Rod J. Rosenstein, privately appeared conflicted about his involvement in the dismissal.

headline: Hundreds Arrested During Women’s Immigration Protest in Washington
teaser: The women were charged and released after staging a sit-in at a Senate office building in Washington, D.C., over the president’s immigration policies.

headline: N.S.A. Purges Hundreds of Millions of Call and Text Records
teaser: The agency said it had discovered “irregularities” in a system it created under a 2015 law, the USA Freedom Act, to collect data from U.S. telecoms.

headline: Trump Says He Will Announce Supreme Court Pick on July 9
teaser: The president said that he has narrowed down his Supreme Court candidates to about five people, including two women, calling them “brilliant” and “talented.”

headline: Here Are the Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From Justice Anthony M. Kennedy’s decision to retire from the Supreme Court to upsets in midterm primaries, it was a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the highlights from the headlines this week.

headline: Prankster Calls the President, and the White House Puts Him Right Through
teaser: A shock jock pretending to be Senator Robert Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey, talked to President Trump, who was on Air Force One at the time, about immigration and more.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Kudlow Falsely Claims Deficit Is ‘Coming Down Rapidly’
teaser: Three sources of government data contradict Friday’s claim by the White House economic adviser, showing instead that the federal budget deficit is actually increasing.

headline: Parents and Children Remain Separated by Miles and Bureaucracy
teaser: More than 2,000 children remain scattered across the country, including 300 in New York, with no clear path to reunification with their parents.

headline: Trump Says Saudia Arabia Will Increase Oil Production
teaser: President Trump tweeted that Saudi Arabia might raise production by up to two million barrels a day. Saudi Arabia did not cite any specific figures in its account of a conversation he had with King Salman.

headline: Weaponizing the First Amendment: How Free Speech Became a Conservative Cudgel
teaser: Borrowing arguments that were once the province of liberals, conservatives have used the First Amendment to justify everything from campaign spending to attacks on the regulation of tobacco and guns.

headline: As Trump Consolidates Power, Democrats Confront a Rebellion in Their Ranks
teaser: The looming battle over the Supreme Court opening highlights the fissure between establishment Democrats and activists pressing a liberal, anti-Trump agenda.

headline: Protests Across U.S. Call for End to Migrant Family Separations
teaser: Thousands turned out Saturday to criticize the separation and detention of migrant families who crossed the border together.

headline: Top Border Patrol Official to Serve as Acting Director of Immigration and Customs Agency
teaser: The appointment of Ronald D. Vitiello as acting director of ICE comes as some activists call for the agency to be abolished.

headline: Has Trump ‘Watched ICE Liberate Towns From the Grasp of MS-13’?
teaser: In a tweet, President Trump defended the work of Immigration and Customs Enforcement, but he did not name any towns that have been freed from MS-13.

headline: Susan Collins, Pivotal Moderate, Says ‘Hostility’ to Roe Would Sway Her Vote
teaser: Ms. Collins, a Republican senator, appeared to edge beyond previous statements, saying a Supreme Court pick who would overturn the abortion rights case “would not be acceptable to me.”

headline: Hard News. Angry Administration. Teenage Journalists Know What It’s Like.
teaser: High school educators across the country have been clamping down on students who publish articles on protests, sexuality and other hot-button issues.

headline: Supreme Court Defeat for Unions Upends a Liberal Money Base
teaser: Progressive groups getting tens of millions of dollars a year find their funding at risk given the expected drop in public-sector unions’ revenue.

headline: Trump, Looking to Midterms, Attacks Democrats on Calls to Abolish ICE
teaser: In a wide-ranging interview, the president also skewered allies on trade and said that he would not sign a new Nafta deal until after the midterms.

headline: As Bolton Says North Korea Could Disarm in a Year, Reality Lags Promises
teaser: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, facing strains inside the administration and potential defiance from the North, heads there this week with a far less aggressive schedule in mind.

headline: The New Health Care: Finally, Some Answers on the Effects of Medicaid Expansion
teaser: Almost a decade into the change in law, research suggests that access to health care has improved and quality has not suffered.

headline: New Tax Law Is Prodding the Rich to Get Divorced, Fast
teaser: Financial professionals from coast to coast are warning wealthy clients that if they’re thinking about filing for divorce, they’d better act soon.

headline: The Real Story Behind a Janitor’s Border Photos of Combs, Toys and Bibles
teaser: Pictures of items that were taken from migrants during the Bush and Obama years have been shared widely as the immigration debate has intensified.

headline: Kallstadt Dispatch: Trump’s Ancestral Village Abounds With His Relatives. Few Will Admit It.
teaser: The German village of Kallstadt doesn’t like to advertise its connection to President Trump. “The topic is too controversial,” a tourism official said.

headline: Mexico’s President-Elect: ‘I Won’t Fail You’
teaser: The leftist Andrés Manuel López Obrador was elected president of Mexico in a landslide victory on Sunday.

headline: ‘God Bless America’: 100 Years of an Immigrant’s Anthem
teaser: Irving Berlin, whose patriotism was fueled by coming to the United States as a refugee when he was a child, wrote the song in the summer of 1918.

headline: Trump Temporarily Reorganizes White House Staff to Push Supreme Court Nomination
teaser: Administration officials will focus on confirming a Supreme Court nominee to fill the seat of Justice Anthony M. Kennedy.

headline: Michael Cohen Hints at Cooperating With Federal Prosecutors
teaser: “To be crystal clear, my wife, my daughter and my son, and this country have my first loyalty,” President Trump’s longtime fixer said in an interview.

headline: U.S. Softens Demand That Countries Stop All Iran Oil Imports
teaser: The Trump administration it would not penalize reduced Iranian oil imports in at least some cases, a move that is likely to soothe market concerns.

headline: In Pointed Letters, Trump Demands More Defense Spending From NATO Allies
teaser: The letters, which went out last month, are the latest sign of acrimony between Mr. Trump and American allies as he heads to a NATO summit meeting next week in Brussels.

headline: ABC Parts Ways With Investigative Reporter Brian Ross
teaser: Mr. Ross and his longtime producer, Rhonda Schwartz, are leaving the network seven months after he erroneously reported a story involving President Trump and the Russia investigation.

headline: Lawyers for Neo-Nazi to Defend Alex Jones in Sandy Hook Case
teaser: Media law experts say defamation cases brought by families of nine shooting victims put Mr. Jones and his online InfoWars empire at risk.

headline: Trump and Mexico’s New Leader, Both Headstrong, Begin With a ‘Good Conversation’
teaser: The election of Andrés Manuel López Obrador, a leader known for being as nationalist-minded as Mr. Trump, could complicate discussions over trade and immigration.

headline: Former E.P.A. Aide Says Pruitt Asked Her to Help Find Work for His Wife
teaser: Samantha Dravis, a former E.P.A. policy chief, told a congressional committee of the request, the latest allegation that he used government staff for personal errands.

headline: White House Twitter Account, in Rare Broadside, Attacks 2 Democratic Senators Over ICE
teaser: The White House misleadingly said Senators Kamala Harris and Elizabeth Warren, both Democrats and potential rivals to Mr. Trump in 2020, supported criminals and gangs.

headline: Schumer Misses Town Hall in Brooklyn, but Still Feels the Heat
teaser: Attendees wanted a chance to confront Senator Chuck Schumer in person about his plans to obstruct President Trump’s pick to fill a Supreme Court vacancy.

headline: Trump Orders Flags to Half-Staff for Capital Gazette Victims, in Apparent Reversal
teaser: The mayor of Annapolis, Md., said the White House initially denied his request for the flag to be lowered but then reversed the decision.

headline: New York Times Reassigns Reporter in Leak Case

headline: Trump Administration Reverses Obama on Affirmative Action
teaser: The justice and education departments will encourage the nation’s schools and universities to adopt race-blind admissions policies, reversing Obama administration guidance.

headline: What Is ICE and Why Do Critics Want to Abolish It?

headline: Facebook Ads Offer Peek at Looming Supreme Court Fight
teaser: Even before President Trump’s new Supreme Court nominee is announced, partisan groups have flooded Facebook and other social networks with political ads over the pick.

headline: Why the Supreme Court Opening Could Affect Gay Marriage as Much as Abortion
teaser: L.G.B.T. groups have made strides in recent years as Justice Kennedy crafted favorable rulings. A more conservative court could spur new challenges.

headline: This Republican Always Shows Up. That May Not Be Enough This Fall.

headline: Trump Voters May Be the Biggest Losers From Trump’s Auto Tariffs
teaser: European auto manufacturers are among the biggest employers in some Republican strongholds.

headline: Obamacare Is Proving Hard to Kill

headline: Imran Awan, Ex-Congressional I.T. Worker, Pleads Guilty to Bank Fraud
teaser: In a plea agreement, prosecutors debunked claims by conservatives that Mr. Awan had engaged in illegal conduct involving House computer systems.

headline: Fact Check: A Fox-Inspired Tweetstorm Touches Many of Trump’s Favorite Themes
teaser: The tweets spanned a range of foreign and domestic issues. They attacked Mr. Trump’s perceived rivals and trumpeted his proudest achievements.

headline: Dershowitz’s Defense of Trump Is Costing Him Friends
teaser: Alan Dershowitz, a professor emeritus at Harvard Law School, has frequented conservative cable news networks to defend President Trump. He says friends on Martha’s Vineyard are “shunning” him for it.

headline: ‘My Whole Heart Is There’

headline: Sexual Abuse Accusations at Ohio State Could Tar Powerful Republican
teaser: Former wrestlers at the university say Representative Jim Jordan of Ohio knew of sexual abuse when he was a wrestling coach — and stayed silent.

headline: Reserved Trump Celebrates Two Passions: Military and Golf

headline: The Times at Gettysburg, July 1863: A Reporter’s Civil War Heartbreak
teaser: Revisiting a rare and tragic dispatch from a war correspondent whose son, a Union officer, was among those killed on the battlefield.

headline: State of the Art: Employee Uprisings Sweep Many Tech Companies. Not Twitter.

headline: How Trump’s Policy Decisions Undermine the Industries He Pledged to Help

headline: News Analysis: How Trump Went From ‘Fire and Fury’ to Dismissing North Korean Nuclear Advances
teaser: As Secretary of State Mike Pompeo heads to Pyongyang this week, he must exceed the terms of the Iran deal — rejected as a “disaster” by his boss — in dismantling North Korea’s nuclear abilities.

headline: Tariffs? Time for a Plan B: ‘Gobble Up Every Bit of Material That I Can’
teaser: With trade disputes growing and new American tariffs on Chinese goods due Friday, some businesses have halted hiring, put off purchases or cut costs.

headline: E.P.A. Drafts Rule on Coal Plants to Replace Clean Power Plan
teaser: The Trump administration is conceding that it has a legal obligation to address greenhouse gases, but it uses a light regulatory touch.

headline: There Isn’t Much the Fed Can Do to Ease the Pain of a Trade War

headline: E.P.A. Chief Scott Pruitt Resigns Under a Cloud of Ethics Scandals
teaser: Mr. Pruitt, a former Oklahoma attorney general, had been hailed by conservatives for his zealous deregulation, but could not overcome the stain of ethics questions.

teaser: Mr. Wheeler, who will run the agency now that Mr. Pruitt is gone, is known for opposing environmental regulations. But unlike Mr. Pruitt, he is known for staying out of the limelight.

headline: Culture of Fear and Ambition Distorted Cuomo’s Economic Projects

headline: Big City: Before Ocasio-Cortez, the Elizabeth Holtzman Effect
teaser: In 1972, in a race with many parallels to today, Ms. Holtzman upset the longtime incumbent Congressman in the Democratic primary.

headline: Trump and Putin Will Meet One-on-One in Finland, Officials Say
teaser: The American ambassador to Moscow said President Trump would use the meeting to “continue to hold Russia accountable for its malign activities,” including election meddling.

headline: Who Is Bill Shine? He Lifted Fox News but Carries Weight of Harassment Scandals
teaser: The former Fox News executive, named to a top White House position on Thursday, was a reliable right-hand man to Roger Ailes, the network’s former chairman.

headline: Michael Cohen Hires Lanny Davis, Lawyer Close to the Clintons
teaser: Mr. Davis said he was persuaded to help after Mr. Cohen said publicly that his loyalty was to his family and the country, as opposed to Mr. Trump.

headline: Can Amy McGrath’s Military Experience Carry Her to Victory in Kentucky?
teaser: As a Marine fighter pilot, Amy McGrath broke many barriers for women in the military. Her experience has already carried her to an upset victory in the Democratic primary for a House seat in Kentucky. Here’s how her campaign hopes to win in November.

headline: How Scott Pruitt Responded to Scandals
teaser: Scott Pruitt, the former head of the Environmental Protection Agency, is the subject of 13 federal investigations into allegations of legal and ethical violations. Here’s what he has said about some of these issues.

headline: On Washington: Political Polarization Takes Hold of the Supreme Court

headline: Ed Schultz, Blunt-Spoken Political Talk-Show Host, Dies at 64
teaser: Mr. Schultz was the host of a conservative radio show before moving to the left and joining MSNBC in 2009. In recent years his politics shifted again.

headline: Arrests at U.S.-Mexico Border Drop for First Time in Months

teaser: Mr. Shine, who was forced out at the network over his handling of sexual harassment scandals, is expected to help revamp a team that has been the target of President Trump’s ire.

teaser: At a minimum, Judge Kavanaugh’s views about when to impeach a president are sure to come up in a confirmation hearing and would allow a light to be shined on Mr. Trump’s handling of the Russia investigation.

headline: ‘Putin’s Fine. He’s Fine. We’re All Fine.’

headline: Pompeo Arrives in North Korea to Try to Curb Its Nuclear Program
teaser: The secretary of state’s trip is his third to Pyongyang, and comes despite widely held doubts about Kim Jong-un’s willingness to denuclearize.

headline: U.S. Hiring Stayed Strong in June Despite Trade Strains

headline: ‘Trump Baby’ Balloon for President’s Trip to U.K.? London Mayor Says Yesssss
teaser: The balloon, which still needs approval from the police and air traffic control before it can be flown, is part of protests planned for the coming visit.

headline: Border Patrol Stops Canadian Fishermen in Disputed Waters Off Maine
teaser: At least 10 fishing boats were stopped in the Bay of Fundy, fishermen say. “There is no illegal immigration going on there,” one said. “It seems silly.”

teaser: Alan Dershowitz‘s latest book, “The Case Against Impeaching Trump,” was written with a sense of urgency. It took two months.

headline: Trump Giving a Fresh Look to Thomas Hardiman for Supreme Court

headline: The House Returns to Deep Uncertainty Over Both Parties’ Leadership

headline: Government Work Done, Tax Policy Writers Decamp to Lobbying Jobs

teaser: For many in his home state, Mr. Pruitt’s rollback of environmental rules and his loyalty to the oil and gas industry count for more than ethical issues they see as liberal exaggerations.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Misleads on NATO Spending

teaser: Mrs. Trump plans to revive “Be Best,” her child-focused platform, as she accompanies her husband on a weeklong trip through Europe.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh, a Conservative Stalwart in Political Fights and on the Bench

headline: Feature: The Fast and Furious Michael Avenatti

teaser: With the country polarized and the Supreme Court’s ideological balance at stake, the battle over Brett M. Kavanaugh will most likely cost tens of millions of dollars.

headline: How Brett Kavanaugh Could Reshape Environmental Law From the Supreme Court

headline: Critic’s Notebook: Trump’s Reality TV Supreme Court Rollout, Slick and Substance-Free

teaser: Before a summit meeting in Brussels, President Trump reiterated complaints about military spending. Donald Tusk, the European Council president, hit back.

headline: Trump: ‘NATO Has Not Treated Us Fairly’

teaser: The pardons of Dwight Hammond and his son, Steven D. Hammond, who had been imprisoned for arson on federal land, suggest that the Trump administration supports ranchers in the battle over such lands.

teaser: In his five terms, Mr. Ray embraced progressive policies. In 1975 invited thousands of Southeast Asian refugees to settle in his state.

headline: Nonfiction: A White House Memoir That’s Equal Parts C-Span and ‘Sex and the City’
teaser: “The Corner of the Oval” is Beck Dorey-Stein’s fresh, funny, utterly unconventional account of working for President Obama.

teaser: President Trump’s new Supreme Court nominee could help Republicans hold or expand control in the Senate, even as it helps Democrats’ chances to take the House.

teaser: Republican senators traveled to Russia over their July 4 recess, preaching conciliation and dialogue. The Russians could not have been more pleased.

teaser: In cases touching on issues as diverse as gun and abortion rights to regulations and national security, Judge Kavanaugh has assembled a conservative record.

teaser: President Trump raised the stakes in the trade war with China, as his advisers announced an additional $200 billion worth of products that would be taxed.

headline: As Migrant Families Are Reunited, Some Children Don’t Recognize Their Mothers
teaser: There were heartbreaking scenes at the court-ordered reunions of migrant families that had been separated for months. The government said hundreds of families wearing monitoring devices will be released into the United States.

headline: Pfizer to Postpone Some Drug Price Increases, After Criticism From Trump
teaser: The company said it would roll back increases that took effect July 1 to give the president a chance to work on his “blueprint” to lower prices and to “provide more access for patients.”

teaser: A great-granddaughter of Herbert Hoover and the new face of “Firing Line” is married to a centrist and CNN anchor. Can their union save the country?

headline: For Midterms, Supreme Court Political Drama Plays to Its Audience
teaser: The clash over Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s nomination will leave Democratic senators on the defensive, but it could energize the left in House races.

headline: Judge Kavanaugh’s Former Clerks: Diverse, and Deployed to Vouch for Him
teaser: Conservative advocates for the Supreme Court nominee coordinated a public relations campaign by his former clerks, more than half of whom are women.

headline: Sarah Palin Says She Was ‘Duped’ by Sacha Baron Cohen
teaser: Ms. Palin has called the British comedian “truly sick” and “evil,” having realized she will apparently appear in his new Showtime series.

headline: Senate Democrats Come Out Swinging in Long-Shot Fight to Block Kavanaugh
teaser: Democrats painted the Supreme Court nominee as an archconservative who would endanger abortion rights and health care and protect President Trump.

headline: Showdown on a Trump Subpoena Could Overshadow Brett Kavanaugh’s Confirmation
teaser: Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh has questioned the wisdom of forcing sitting presidents to answer questions from prosecutors.

headline: Trump Presses NATO on Military Spending, but Signs Its Criticism of Russia
teaser: The contrast reflected a growing disconnect between Mr. Trump and his more traditional foreign-policy advisers when it comes to America’s role on the world stage.

headline: A Soybean Surge Makes Trump’s Trade War Look Deceptively Good
teaser: China rapidly increased purchases of American soybeans and crude oil before tariffs went into effect, temporarily boosting economic growth.

headline: Rivals of Democratic Renegades Pick Up Endorsements and Momentum
teaser: Challengers to ex-members of the Independent Democratic Conference, which worked with Republicans to help rule the New York Senate, are gaining steam.

teaser: Andrew R. Wheeler, the agency’s new boss, appears to be ushering in a change in style, even as he maintains his commitment to his predecessor’s environmental policies.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims It’s ‘Impossible’ for American Farmers to Do Business in Europe
teaser: The United States exported $11.5 billion in agricultural products to the European Union last year.

headline: Democrats Zero In on Kavanaugh’s Defense of Presidential Power
teaser: Democrats thought the weakness of a Supreme Court nominee would be health care and abortion. Then came Brett M. Kavanaugh’s writings on shielding presidents from investigation.

headline: As President Trump Bashes NATO, Republicans Are Largely Silent
