headline: Unshaken by Abuse Scandal, Conservatives Are Sticking With Jim Jordan
teaser: In addition to ex-wrestlers and coaches, the top three House Republicans have backed Mr. Jordan, a powerful House member who denies he ignored sexual abuse allegations.

headline: Justice Dept. Nominee Who Drew Scrutiny for Russian Bank Work Is Confirmed
teaser: Democrats also questioned the experience of Brian Benczkowski, who will lead the department’s Criminal Division. His confirmation broke a logjam of pending nominations for top jobs at the department.

headline: Manafort Is Transferred From Jail Where He Was Treated Like a ‘V.I.P.’
teaser: After complaining of the distance they had to travel to meet with their client, lawyers seeking to delay a trial of the former Trump campaign chairman objected to the judge’s decision.

headline: Live Briefing: Trump’s London Visit: Live Updates
teaser: President Trump left the Brussels NATO summit meeting for a visit to Britain. He was greeted with pomp and protest.

headline: Charges Dropped Against Stormy Daniels in Strip Club Arrest
teaser: Three misdemeanor charges were dropped against the pornographic film actress, who was accused of touching “customers who turned out to be undercover vice officers” while onstage, her lawyer said.

headline: Half of Migrants Under 5 Are Reunited With Parents, U.S. Says
teaser: Forty-six children were found ineligible for immediate reunification, some because of safety concerns or because their parents had already been deported.

headline: Best of Late Night: Stephen Colbert Criticizes Trump for Attacking Germany
teaser: Colbert suggested that Trump was attacking Germany’s ties to Russia in order to distract from his own relationship with the Kremlin.

headline: Trump’s NATO Visit Marked by Stiff Handshakes and Uncomfortable ‘Family Photos’
teaser: That was awkward.

headline: Trump Claims a Big NATO Victory, Over Allies of the U.S.
teaser: The president took “total credit” for persuading U.S. allies to increase military spending beyond current goals — a claim quickly undercut by at least two European leaders.

headline: Trump Says, ‘They Like Me a Lot in the U.K.’ 100,000 Protesters May Disagree.
teaser: Demonstrations are planned for every stage of President Trump’s visit, despite an itinerary that seems designed to keep him out of sight.

headline: North Koreans Are No-Shows at Meeting to Discuss U.S. Soldiers’ Remains
teaser: Talks on returning American troops killed in the Korean War did not take place as planned. But it was unclear whether U.S. officials had been deliberately stood up.

headline: Read Peter Strzok’s Opening Statement
teaser: Peter Strzok, the embattled F.B.I. agent who oversaw the opening of the Russia investigation, appeared on Thursday before the House Judiciary and Oversight committees.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court Confirmation: Get Caught Up
teaser: It’s been a busy week. Here’s a distilled version of what’s happened since President Trump introduced his court nominee to the world on Monday night.

headline: Trade War With China in Aisle 12
teaser: With its latest round of proposed tariffs, the Trump administration is pulling American consumers into its battle with China.

headline: Shouting and Personal Attacks at Strzok Hearing
teaser: Peter Strzok, the F.B.I. deputy assistant director, faced attacks from a Republican lawmaker who brought up Mr. Strzok’s extramarital affair.

headline: American Soldier Is Killed in Afghanistan, the 2nd This Week
teaser: A pre-dawn raid in eastern Afghanistan also killed an Afghan soldier and wounded several others, officials said.

headline: White House Orders Broader Access to Files About F.B.I. Informant
teaser: The full House and Senate Intelligence Committees will be able to read the documents, even though intelligence and law enforcement officials had urged that access be tightly restricted.

headline: In North Korea, a Western Journalist Appears All but Invisible
teaser: The studious lack of attention was the oddest part of an American delegation’s 28 hours in North Korea.

headline: Books News: The Obama-Biden Bromance Continues. This Time in a Mystery Novel.
teaser: In a new crime novel, the 44th president and his vice president team up to solve a suspicious death, and patch up their frayed friendship in the process.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Democrats Overstate Kavanaugh’s Writings on the Affordable Care Act
teaser: As they try to block his nomination to the Supreme Court, Senate Democrats have exaggerated Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s hostility to the Affordable Care Act in his public statements and writings.

headline: Architect of Cuomo’s Buffalo Billion Project Is Convicted in Bid-Rigging Scheme
teaser: Dr. Alain E. Kaloyeros, who was a key player in Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s signature economic development initiative, was convicted Thursday of wire fraud and conspiracy.

headline: Two Senators Call for Investigation of Smart TV Industry
teaser: In a letter to the Federal Trade Commission, Edward J. Markey and Richard Blumenthal expressed concern that Samba TV wasn’t transparent with viewers about data it collected.

headline: British Roll Out Trump’s Political Idol: Winston Churchill
teaser: It’s no accident that Mr. Trump began his visit to England by having dinner at Blenheim Palace, birthplace of Winston Churchill.

headline: Secret Service Issues Guide to Help Prevent School Shootings
teaser: The report backs the formation of “threat assessment teams” made up of mental health, law enforcement and education professionals to identify troubled students.

headline: As Trade War Persists, Mnuchin Says China Talks Have ‘Broken Down’
teaser: Concern is growing among businesses and lawmakers in both parties that President Trump has no clear strategy to resolve the escalating dispute.

headline: Tom Gallagher, Diplomat Who Became a Gay Activist, Dies at 77
teaser: He began his career having to hide the fact that he was gay. He ended it celebrated as a pioneer.

headline: Declaring War on Poverty ‘Largely Over,’ White House Urges Work Requirements for Aid
teaser: A report from the Council of Economic Advisers makes the case for adding new work requirements to social programs such as Medicaid and food stamps.

headline: Trump to Appoint a New Liaison to Congress
teaser: Shahira Knight, who was deputy director at the National Economic Council under its former director, Gary D. Cohn, will take over as director of White House legislative affairs, officials said.

headline: Live Briefing: Trump in the U.K.: President Tells May Ties Are at ‘Highest Level of Special’
teaser: The two leaders held private talks and a news conference, in which they tried to restore a sense of unity after the president’s devastating interview.

headline: Two Words That Could Shape the Politics of the Trade War: Loss Aversion
teaser: The pain of a loss tends to be greater than the enjoyment of a win. That has big implications for trade, and also helps explain the politics of health care and taxes.

headline: Nextdoor Is Betting a Social Network Can Still Be a Platform for Politics
teaser: The neighborhood-based site has found a foothold in the most local of pastimes as it tries to shed past negative publicity.

headline: London’s ‘Trump Baby’ Balloon Flies as Protests Take Off in U.K.
teaser: A pin in its diaper and a smartphone in its hand, the 19-foot inflatable was released above Parliament Square and soared for about two hours.

headline: Trump Visit to U.K. Inspires Yearning for a ‘Love Actually’ Moment
teaser: Twitter users urged Prime Minister Theresa May to confront the president with a stirring speech from the movie after he undercut her in a newspaper interview.

headline: Health Secretary Tom Price Wasted $341,000 on Improper Travel, Inquiry Finds
teaser: The government should try to recoup the money improperly spent on 20 trips including Florida and Switzerland, the inspector general of the Health and Human Services Department said.

headline: Trump, on His Best Behavior, Heaps Praise on May as ‘Tough’ and ‘Capable’
teaser: The president called the U.S.-British relationship the “highest level of special,” and he dismissed an explosive interview he gave to a British tabloid as “fake news.”

headline: Door-Knocking Democrat Tries to Break G.O.P. Grip in Ohio Special Election
teaser: A special election for a House seat in Ohio will test the power of the rural vote against the kind of affluent, rapidly growing suburbs that Democrats need to win.

headline: Pat Swindall, Congressman Undone by Scandal, Is Dead at 67
teaser: A Georgia Republican, he was elected at a time when his state’s political landscape was dominated by Democrats. But a perjury conviction derailed his career.

headline: F.B.I. Agent Defends Actions in Russia Inquiry in Contentious House Testimony
teaser: Peter Strzok, the F.B.I. agent who led the investigations of Russian interference and the Clinton emails, was hauled before the House but came out swinging.

headline: Republicans Had a Plan for Josh Hawley in Missouri. He’s Working on It.
teaser: Handpicked by party leaders and backed by influential donors, Mr. Hawley has gained recognition and influence in a key state. But there have been growing pains.

headline: Justice Dept. Announces Charges in Russian Hacking Case
teaser: Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein announced indictments against 12 Russian military officers who are accused of conspiring to interfere with the 2016 presidential election.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: 10 Falsehoods From Trump’s News Conference With Theresa May
teaser: President Trump made inaccurate or exaggerated statements about the number of American troops abroad, NATO spending and his prediction of the Brexit vote, among other claims.

headline: Wilbur Ross Says He Will Sell Stock After Watchdog Warns of Potential for Criminal Violation
teaser: The Office of Government Ethics warned that the commerce secretary’s failure to make required divestitures could have placed him in a position to violate conflict of interest laws.

headline: G.R.U., Russian Spy Agency Cited by Mueller, Casts a Long Shadow
teaser: From the downing of a civilian airliner over Ukraine to operations in Syria to the 2016 United States election, the G.R.U. has been an arm of the Russian state.

headline: Rod Rosenstein Said 12 Russian Agents Were Charged With Hacking. Read Excerpts From His Announcement.
teaser: “The blame for election interference belongs to the criminals who committed election interference,” Mr. Rosenstein said. Here’s what he had to say about the latest charges in the Russia inquiry.

headline: Democrats Say Trump Should Cancel Putin Meeting After Indictments
teaser: Democrats lined up behind Senator Chuck Schumer, the Democratic leader, in urging Mr. Trump to call off the meeting. Top Republicans were mostly mute.

headline: ‘Warning Lights Are Blinking Red,’ Top Intelligence Officer Says of Russian Attacks
teaser: Days before President Trump’s meeting with Vladimir V. Putin, Dan Coats compared the danger of Russian cyberattacks to the warnings the U.S. had of stepped-up terror threats ahead of Sept. 11, 2001.

headline: Paychecks Lag as Profits Soar, and Prices Erode Wage Gains
teaser: Fears of an overheated economy could prompt the Federal Reserve to cut short a recovery in which incomes have already struggled to gain traction.

headline: Trump Invited the Russians to Hack Clinton. Were They Listening?
teaser: The same day that Donald J. Trump asked Russians for help in hacking Hillary Clinton’s emails, Russia began efforts to target her personal servers.

headline: 12 Russian Agents Indicted in Mueller Investigation
teaser: The intelligence officers are charged with hacking Democrats during the 2016 campaign. The indictment was announced just days before President Trump is to meet with President Vladimir V. Putin.

headline: How Russian Spies Hid Behind Bitcoin in Hacking Campaign
teaser: Operatives used cryptocurrency to obscure their identities and pay for the infrastructure needed to steal emails from Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign.

headline: In Brexit, Trump Finds a British Reflection of His Own Political Rise
teaser: The Brexit campaign’s nationalist appeal and push to restrict immigration was always a close political relative of the Trump movement in the United States.

headline: ‘Fake News’ Goes Global as Trump, in Britain, Rips the Press
teaser: In Britain, President Trump attacked his usual target CNN and, less predictably, The Sun, calling the London tabloid’s interview with him “fake news.”

headline: Gap Between Trump and Justice Dept. Officials Grows More Stark
teaser: Days before the president’s meeting with Vladimir V. Putin, a new indictment gave the most detailed account yet of Russian efforts to sway the 2016 election.

headline: This Week’s Biggest Stories in American Politics
teaser: From President Trump’s mixed diplomatic messages in Europe to more indictments in the special counsel investigation, here are some of the biggest stories of the week. (And some links if you want to read further.)

headline: These Ads Reveal How Women Candidates Are Changing Campaigns
teaser: Candidates like Abby Finkenauer are ditching ads showing them in pantsuits and instead focusing on their personal stories.

headline: Women Rewrite the Political Playbook and Run as … Themselves
teaser: After years of being told to put on a suit and recite their résumé, women running for office are now revealing themselves in more complex ways.

headline: In Trump’s U.K. Visit, Some See ‘Infomercial’ for Money-Losing Golf Resort
teaser: Ethics experts say President Trump’s promotion of Turnberry is part of a broader, problematic effort to use the presidency to gin up business for his property.

headline: Teachers Unions Scramble to Save Themselves After Supreme Court’s Blow
teaser: The Supreme Court said last month that public employees who disagree with their unions no longer have to pay dues.

headline: On Washington: Should Democrats Have Saved Their Filibuster for the New Court Fight?
teaser: By forcing a showdown last year, Democrats gave Republicans an opening to end the filibuster of Supreme Court nominees. Some wish they had it back.

headline: News Analysis: Trump Opens His Arms to Russia. His Administration Closes Its Fist.
teaser: Whether it is Russia’s interference in the election, its annexation of Crimea, or its intervention in Syria, Mr. Trump’s statements either undercut, or flatly contradict, those of his lieutenants.

headline: Influential Judge, Loyal Friend, Conservative Warrior — and D.C. Insider
teaser: The carefully crafted narrative around Brett Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, plays down his legacy as a charter member of elite Washington.

headline: California Democratic Party Snubs Feinstein and Endorses Kevin De León
teaser: Senator Dianne Feinstein is widely expected to preserve her seat in the midterm elections, but the support for Mr. de León reflects the rise of younger liberal activists.

headline: The Democrats Taking on Trump as 2020 Nears
teaser: No major candidacy has been announced yet in the Democratic party, and the 2018 midterms are front and center. But the next presidential election looms large for the party.

headline: Warren is Preparing for 2020. So Are Biden, Booker, Harris and Sanders.
teaser: As many top Democrats eye a run for president in 2020, Elizabeth Warren has all but announced her candidacy, while Joe Biden is planning to campaign up to four days a week this fall for midterm candidates.

headline: News Analysis: Just Sitting Down With Trump, Putin Comes Out Ahead
teaser: By attacking Europe and starting a trade war with America’s closest allies, President Trump has already advanced the agenda of President Vladimir V. Putin, analysts say.

headline: Paul Ryan Says His S.U.V. Was ‘Eaten by Animals.’ Here’s How to Protect Your Vehicle From Wildlife.
teaser: The House speaker said woodchucks chewed the wiring out from his Chevrolet Suburban: “And so my car was eaten by animals, and it’s just dead.”

headline: Theresa May Says Trump Told Her to ‘Sue the E.U.’ in Brexit Talks
teaser: In her comments to the BBC, the British prime minister appeared to be pushing back against President Trump, who had criticized her for ignoring his suggestion.

headline: Trump Says He ‘Hadn’t Thought’ About Asking Putin to Extradite 12 Indicted Russians
teaser: In an interview with CBS, the president said, “I’ll be asking about it,” but he again sought to play down his coming meeting with the Russian president in Finland.

headline: F.B.I. Confidence in Leadership Fell in Year After Comey’s Firing
teaser: Internal data show that F.B.I. morale remains high under the new director, but the figures further undercut one of President Trump’s explanations for firing James B. Comey.

headline: How Israel, in Dark of Night, Torched Its Way to Iran’s Nuclear Secrets
teaser: The Israeli government showed three reporters, including one from The New York Times, documents indicating that the Iranian nuclear weapons program was larger and more sophisticated than once suspected.

headline: U.K. Poisoning Inquiry Turns to Russian Agency in Mueller Indictments
teaser: The military intelligence service suspected of disrupting the 2016 presidential campaign in the U.S. may be behind the poisoning of a former Russian spy and his daughter in England.

headline: Tracing Guccifer 2.0’s Many Tentacles in the 2016 Election
teaser: The indictment of 12 Russian operatives provides never-before-seen detail about the central role of the online avatar Guccifer 2.0 in the dissemination of stolen Democratic documents.

headline: $88 Million and Counting: Trump Amasses Huge Head Start for 2020 Campaign
teaser: The president’s re-election haul reflects a brisk fund-raising effort. Most of his predecessors, by contrast, did not kick off their campaigns until after the midterms.

headline: Obama Visits Kenya, Land of His Father, to Promote Local Charity
teaser: The former U.S. president was in the country to inaugurate a sports and training center founded by his half sister, Auma Obama.

headline: Live Updates: Trump-Putin Meeting in Helsinki
teaser: The leaders’ first summit meeting will be closely analyzed for signs of whether President Trump was friendlier to his Russian counterparts than to the leaders he met in Europe last week.

headline: Trump, at Putin’s Side, Questions U.S. Intelligence on 2016 Election
teaser: At the conclusion of what he called a “deeply productive” summit meeting, the American president offered his Russian counterpoint an extraordinary show of support.

headline: Woman Who Sought ‘Back Channel’ Meeting for Trump and Putin is Charged as Russian Agent
teaser: Mariia Butina was accused of trying to broker secret relationships with American politicians so Russia could influence American policies.

headline: Cognitive Test Trump Took May Have Been Undermined by Publicity, Doctors Warn
teaser: Articles about the test, known as the Montreal Cognitive Assessment, or MoCA, listed some of its questions, potentially influencing future patients.

headline: TV Anchors Agape After the Trump-Putin Appearance
teaser: “Disgraceful,” Anderson Cooper of CNN said at the end of a news conference during which the reporters Jonathan Lemire and Jeff Mason asked tough questions.

headline: Unbuttoned: Melania Trump’s Wardrobe Goes Mute
teaser: After the jacket controversy, the first lady dressed for discretion as she accompanied her husband on his European trip.

headline: Some Republicans Rebuke Trump for Siding With Putin, but Others Remain Silent
teaser: No Republican in Congress, however, pledged any particular action to punish President Trump, such as holding up his nominees, nor did they promise hearings or increased oversight.

headline: news analysis: Trump Sheds All Notions of How a President Should Conduct Himself Abroad
teaser: Rather than defend America against those who would threaten it, he attacked his own citizens and institutions while hailing the leader of a hostile power.

headline: CVS Fires 2 for Calling Police on Black Woman Over Coupon
teaser: The woman said a manager at a Chicago store thought the coupon was fraudulent. She recorded a video of a manager calling the police.

headline: Hospitals Challenge Medicare Payments, With Help From Judge Kavanaugh
teaser: A ruling allowing more hospitals to seek more money was based on evidence that the government had been using faulty data to calculate costs for decades.

headline: News Analysis: For Putin, the ‘Summit He Has Dreamed of for 18 Years’
teaser: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia got what he wanted most from his meeting with President Trump: American affirmation of his status as a global power.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: 8 Suspect Claims From the Trump-Putin News Conference
teaser: President Trump contradicted U.S. intelligence assessments that Russia meddled in the 2016 election, and President Vladimir V. Putin said he didn’t know that Mr. Trump was in Russia in 2013.

headline: U.S. Intel Community Reacts With Fury to Trump’s Rebuke
teaser: The president’s attempt to walk back his comments did little to mollify intelligence officials, especially when it came to Mr. Putin’s offer to aid the Mueller investigation.

headline: News Analysis: Confronted With Evidence of Russian Hacking, Trump Reverts to Conspiracy
teaser: A smoke-and-mirrors effort by Mr. Trump after being briefed extensively on the specific roles by Russian military commanders to tamper with the 2016 presidential election.

headline: Putin Says Democrats Are to Blame for ‘Manipulations’ of Their Party
teaser: In a Fox News interview, the Russian president said the hacked Democratic emails showed the truth — that the party leadership favored Hillary Clinton over Bernie Sanders.

headline: A Congressional Candidate Used to Be a Rapper. Will It Matter?
teaser: Antonio Delgado is trying to unseat John Faso, a Republican incumbent in New York.

headline: ‘I Just Simply Did What He Wanted’: Sexual Abuse Inside Immigrant Detention Facilities
teaser: Immigrant detention is expanding under the Trump administration, increasing the risk of sexual assault in a system where abuse is not uncommon. Two women told us their stories of being sexually abused by guards while under the custody of ICE.

headline: Alabama Primary Runoff: Martha Roby Tries to Fend Off Challenger Bobby Bright
teaser: Ms. Roby, who has held her seat in Congress since 2011, came up short during a June primary. She faces Mr. Bright, a former mayor of Montgomery (and a former Democrat) in a runoff on Tuesday.

headline: American-Russian Relations in Syria? Less Rosy Than Trump and Putin Claim
teaser: After their meeting in Finland, the two presidents lauded the close cooperation between their two militaries in Syria, but the record is actually more mixed.

headline: Right and Left React to the Trump-Putin Meeting
teaser: Writers from across the political spectrum on President Trump’s meeting with his Russian counterpart in Helsinki, Finland, and his remarks afterward.

headline: I.R.S. Will No Longer Force Kochs and Other Groups to Disclose Donors
teaser: The change by the Trump administration applies to many nonprofits that are active in politics, and was praised by conservatives.

headline: Can a Pro-Coal Democrat in West Virginia Carve a Path for His Party?
teaser: Richard Ojeda, a populist Democrat riding a wave of labor activism, is making a deep-red House district look flippable, and may show his party a way to win in Trump country.

headline: News Analysis: Critics of Trump Have a New Word in Their Vocabulary: Treason
teaser: Never in anyone’s lifetime has a president engendered such a wave of discussion about whether his real loyalty was to a foreign power over his own country.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Inaccurately Claims NATO Spending Is Increasing ‘Only Because of Me’
teaser: President Trump said he had single-handedly raised “vast amounts of money” for NATO while at the military alliance’s headquarters last week, a visit he described as “great.”

headline: Obama Warns of ‘Strongman Politics’ After Trump’s Meeting With Putin
teaser: In his highest-profile speech since leaving office, delivered in South Africa, the former president warned of leaders embracing the “politics of fear, resentment and retrenchment.”

headline: Trump Now Says He Accepts U.S. Intelligence Reports on Russian Election Meddling
teaser: Mr. Trump was widely criticized — including by many in his own party — for what had been viewed as his unprecedented deference to the Russian president on Monday.

headline: Democrats Demand Action to Punish Trump, but G.O.P. Is Cautious
teaser: Democratic leaders in Congress pressed for tangible actions to punish President Trump, from new sanctions on Russia to the extradition of Russian agents.

headline: Trump Addresses Criticism of Appearance With Putin: Full Transcript
teaser: The president responded to condemnations of his performance alongside the Russian president during a news conference in Helsinki, Finland.

headline: Republican Reaction to Trump: ‘It’s Just Unacceptable’
teaser: Several members of President Trump’s party criticized the remarks he made suggesting that Russia did not interfere with the 2016 presidential election.

headline: After Putin Meeting, Trump Voters Mostly Dig In. But Cracks Are Showing.
teaser: President Trump has said his admirers will stand by him through anything. Now, a stunning news conference with the Russian president has provided a singular test case.

headline: Read the Transcript of Obama’s Speech Defending Democracy
teaser: The former president offered an impassioned defense of international institutions, seeming to take aim at President Trump.

headline: John Stormer, ‘None Dare Call It Treason’ Author, Dies at 90
teaser: Mr. Stormer’s self-published 1964 book, warning of a Communist conspiracy threatening America, became a grass-roots phenomenon for the right wing.

headline: Would It or Wouldn’t It Be Russia: Trump Goes Double Negative
teaser: President Trump didn’t say in Finland that he doesn’t support American intelligence about Moscow’s interference in the 2016 election. Got that?

headline: Dan Coats, the Intelligence Chief, Finds His Voice. Will It Anger Trump?
teaser: Mr. Coats has emerged to more publicly defend the intelligence agencies — under a president who has long denigrated them.

headline: Mariia Butina: Accused Russian Agent, and Prolific Tweeter
teaser: The United States has accused Ms. Butina of working with Americans to carry out a secret Russian effort to influence U.S. politics. But she is hardly a shadowy figure. Here’s a look at what her online profile reveals.

headline: The Biggest Spender of Political Ads on Facebook? President Trump
teaser: A new study based on Facebook data provides a picture of who is placing political ads on the social network ahead of the midterm elections. President Trump tops the list.

headline: Judge Rejects Settlement Over McDonald’s Labor Practices
teaser: The proposed accord with the federal government would have avoided a decision that could expose parent companies to liability for violations by franchisees.

headline: Martha Roby, Former Trump Critic, Wins Alabama House Runoff
teaser: Ms. Roby, a Republican congresswoman, defeated a primary challenger who assailed her for withdrawing her support for President Trump in 2016.

headline: Nonfiction: Chris Hayes Reviews Michiko Kakutani’s Book About Our Post-Truth Era
teaser: “The Death of Truth” looks at “the age of Trump” — and shudders.

headline: Martha Roby Won. Here’s How Other Pro- and Anti-Trump Republicans Are Faring.
teaser: One question has made and broken Republican campaigns so far this year: To embrace President Trump, or to oppose him?

headline: State of the Art: How to Combat China’s Rise in Tech: Federal Spending, Not Tariffs
teaser: The United States government once invested mightily to build the modern world. Now it has abdicated that role to a foreign rival.

headline: U.S. Opens Inquiry Into Uranium Imports in Sign That Trade War Is Spreading
teaser: The Trump administration cited national security concerns in announcing that it was starting an investigation into imported uranium ore, a key ingredient in America’s nuclear arsenal.

headline: Maria Butina, Suspected Secret Agent, Used Sex in Covert Plan, Prosecutors Say
teaser: Ms. Butina was arrested over the weekend in Washington and was in contact with Russian intelligence, prosecutors said.

headline: As ISIS Fighters Fill Prisons in Syria, Their Home Nations Look Away
teaser: On a rare tour of prisons for Islamic State suspects from nearly 50 countries, a Times reporter watched their jailers try to secure them humanely — but for how long?

headline: Bowing to Trump, Novartis Joins Pfizer in Freezing Drug Prices
teaser: The move comes as drug companies scramble to show they are responding to criticism about their rising prices, including from President Trump.

headline: Consumer Bureau Nominee Could Face ‘Bumpy Ride’ Over Lack of Experience
teaser: Kathleen Kraninger, who has little experience with the consumer finance products and businesses that the watchdog agency was created to police, will be grilled by lawmakers on Thursday.

headline: Russia Is No Longer Targeting U.S., Trump Says. White House Says He Was Answering a Different Question.
teaser: “There’s been no president ever as tough as I have been on Russia,” President Trump said Wednesday.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Kudlow Overstates American, Chinese and European Tariffs
teaser: Larry Kudlow, President Trump’s top economic adviser, cherry-picked and exaggerated statistics about Chinese and European tariffs and claimed that the United States is the world’s “lowest-tariff country.”

headline: Sinclair, Trying to Appease F.C.C., Adjusts Bid for Tribune
teaser: The TV operator said it would sell off two stations through an independent trust. It’s not clear if that will satisfy the Federal Communications Commission chairman’s concerns.

headline: Is Russia Targeting the U.S.? Trump Appears to Say ‘No.’
teaser: Hours later, the White House press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, said that President Trump was answering a different question.

headline: Mark Zuckerberg Tries to Clarify Remarks About Holocaust Deniers After Outcry
teaser: Facebook’s chief executive had said in an interview that false and “deeply offensive” conspiracy theories alone were not enough to get someone barred from the site.

headline: Trump Nominee Is Behind Anti-Union Legal Campaign
teaser: A conservative lawyer chosen to head a federal agency has spent months bringing cases that could bankrupt public-employee unions in several states.

headline: Trump Endorses Brian Kemp Over Casey Cagle in Georgia Governor’s Race
teaser: Either Mr. Kemp, Georgia’s secretary of state, or Mr. Cagle, its lieutenant governor, will face Stacey Abrams in the November election.

headline: Two Lawsuits Against Ohio State Keep Jim Jordan in the Cross Hairs
teaser: The suits say school officials covered up sexual abuse by a team doctor; one mentions Representative Jim Jordan, who has denied claims that he ignored such misconduct.

headline: Reporters, Facing a Hostile White House, Try a New Tactic: Solidarity
teaser: At a West Wing briefing, a reporter from The Hill ceded the floor to an NBC correspondent as Sarah Huckabee Sanders tried to move things along.

headline: From the Start, Trump Has Muddied a Clear Message: Putin Interfered
teaser: Weeks before taking office, Donald J. Trump learned of highly sensitive intelligence about Russian election interference, but he has done all he can to suggest other explanations for the hacks.

headline: Critics of Trump’s Veterans Affairs Dept. Raise Concerns About Departures
teaser: The recent wave of removals, reassignments and retirements happened under an acting secretary who has not been confirmed by the Senate.

headline: Cynthia Nixon Confronts Miranda on the Campaign Trail
teaser: The creators of the fan account Every Outfit on “Sex and the City” are stumping for Cynthia Nixon and helping all of us come to terms with her most influential role (to date).

headline: Before Roe, New York Was America’s ‘Abortion Capital.’ Where Will Women Turn if Access Shrinks?
teaser: In 1970, New York had the most liberal abortion law in the nation, turning it into a magnet for women who wanted to terminate their pregnancies legally.

headline: The Districts Are Mostly White. The Candidates Are Not. Will It Matter?
teaser: There are only a few Democratic candidates of color in majority-white districts. Some activists say the party isn’t trying hard enough.

headline: Trump, in Latest Swipe at E.U., Assails $5.1 Billion Fine Against Google
teaser: President Trump has repeatedly criticized the European Union for what he insists are its unfair trading practices.

headline: Putin Says Trump’s Critics in U.S. Are Trying to Undermine Meeting
teaser: The Russian president warned that unspecified forces in the United States were trying to reverse the results of the talks in Helsinki, Finland.

headline: On Trump’s Car Tariffs, Companies Are United in Dissent
teaser: Auto companies lined up to protest potential tariffs on $351 billion in automobiles and parts at a hearing in Washington on Thursday.

headline: U.S.-Funded Broadcaster Directed Ads to Americans
teaser: Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty is mostly restricted by law from promoting its content in the United States except on request.

headline: In Opening Skirmish, Republicans Shoot Down Anti-Putin Resolutions
teaser: Congressional Republicans blocked a series of moves brought by Democrats — and some Republicans — to rebuke President Trump over his summit meeting with Vladimir V. Putin.

headline: ‘Best Professor.’ ‘Very Evenhanded.’ ‘Great Hair!’: Brett Kavanaugh, as Seen by His Law Students
teaser: Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination to the Supreme Court has been divisive in the nation’s leading law schools, which lean left, but anonymous evaluations from his students at Harvard, Yale and Georgetown paint a portrait of a popular professor.

headline: Pompeo Shifts Russia Focus to Another Issue: Religious Freedom
teaser: In advance of a global summit on religious freedom, the secretary of state said that the Trump administration has been “incredibly strong with respect to pushing back against Russian bad behavior.”

headline: Interior Department Proposes a Vast Reworking of the Endangered Species Act
teaser: The revisions have wide-reaching implications, including for how the federal government would protect species from climate change.

headline: Minnesota Congressman Under Fire Over 2012 Comments About Women
teaser: CNN unearthed recordings of Representative Jason Lewis lamenting that it is no longer acceptable to call a woman a “slut.”

headline: Another White House Reversal, This Time on Turning Over Americans to Russia
teaser: On Monday, President Trump praised a proposal from Vladimir Putin as an “incredible offer.” Two days later, his press secretary said Mr. Trump saw it as an “interesting idea.” Then on Thursday, the White House rejected the notion.

headline: Amid Worker Shortage, Trump Signs Job Training Order

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Claims the U.S. Would Save Money Without Trade. That’s Not What a Trade Deficit Represents.
teaser: The president, in a speech in Illinois, escalated his misguided notion that a trade deficit means “lost” wealth into a claim an expert says “defies the most basic of economics.”

headline: Prosecutors Seek to Question Trump Organization’s Finance Chief
teaser: The request set off alarm bells inside the company, as the executive has handled its finances for decades, has managed President Trump’s trust and has even reviewed the Trump campaign’s books.

headline: From Guantánamo Bay to ISIS Fighter Prisons in Syria: 15 Years of Wartime-Detention Reporting
teaser: Our national security law expert in Washington has been writing about legal and policy problems related to the government’s handling of captured terrorism suspects since 2003.

headline: G.D.P. Grew at 4.1% Rate in U.S. in Latest Quarter. Here’s What That Means.
teaser: The acceleration in gross domestic product was widely anticipated by economists, a result of a confluence of events unlikely to recur.

headline: Remember the Tax Cuts? Republicans Don’t Seem To Despite the Booming Economy
teaser: The new tax law was supposed to mobilize Republican voters and help the party keep the House, but that is not how it is playing out on the campaign trail.

headline: Putin Invites Trump to Moscow, 2 Days After White House Postponed Summit Plans
teaser: The Russian president continued to push for a second meeting, saying he was also ready to meet in Washington.

headline: Trump Claims Credit for an Economy He Calls the ‘Envy of the Entire World’
teaser: President Trump makes the case that the economy, which grew 4.1 percent in the last quarter, will continue its red-hot expansion, though economists are skeptical.

headline: At Prayer Breakfast, Guests Seek Access to a Different Higher Power
teaser: The annual event has become a hub of influence-peddling, as foreign dignitaries, religious leaders and lobbyists jockey for access to top American officials.

headline: Meet the Rebate, the New Villain of High Drug Prices
teaser: A growing chorus, including the Trump administration, is calling for a rethinking of after-the-fact drug discounts that some say contribute to rising prices.

headline: The Stealth Campaign to Kill Off Obamacare
teaser: How the country’s largest lobbyist for the pharmaceutical industry is using “dark money” to support an advocacy group’s efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Trump Endorses Candidates in Three More Races
teaser: President Trump made three congressional endorsements on Friday, backing John James in Michigan, Troy Balderson in Ohio and David Kustoff in Tennessee.

headline: FACT CHECK: Trump’s Numbers on ‘Amazing’ Economy Sometimes Don’t Add Up
teaser: Tying recent growth to his policy moves, the president offered broad pronouncements and a litany of statistics. Some were well founded, others less so.

headline: As Affordable Housing Crisis Grows, HUD Sits on the Sidelines
teaser: Local officials seem resigned to the fact that they will receive little or no help from the Trump administration, whose main policy response has been a plan to increase some rents.

headline: Missed Connection: Donald Trump Jr. and Robert Mueller Cross Paths at Washington Airport
teaser: Donald Trump Jr. and Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, were spotted only feet apart at Reagan National Airport near Washington.

headline: Housing Finance Director, Mel Watt, Investigated for Sexual Harassment
teaser: Mr. Watt, whose term expires in January, is in charge of overseeing mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. He said he did not break any laws.

headline: Trump Says He’ll Stump for Vulnerable Republicans ‘Six or Seven Days a Week’
teaser: President Trump said he would help the most vulnerable Republican congressional candidates, even though many of them are in districts where Mr. Trump is unpopular.

headline: Pruitt’s Successor Wants Rollbacks, Too. And He Wants Them to Stick.
teaser: Andrew Wheeler, the acting head of the E.P.A., is taking a more disciplined approach to dismantling environmental regulations.

headline: Russian Hackers Appear to Shift Focus to U.S. Power Grid
teaser: Intelligence and technology officials report there are surprisingly few attempts to disrupt the campaigns of major American political figures.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From Michael Cohen’s released recording to a pause in the trade war with Europe, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are five of the top stories you might have missed (and some links if you want to read further).

headline: ‘What Does a Trucker Look Like?’ It’s Changing, Amid a Big Shortage
teaser: Pressured by a strong demand for goods, an industry known for older white men is trying to recruit women, teenagers and people of color.

headline: In Georgia Governor’s Race, a Defining Moment for a Southern State
teaser: Democrats and Republicans alike believe that when Georgia chooses between Stacey Abrams and Brian Kemp, they will be signaling what the Deep South powerhouse stands for.

headline: Now Running for Office, Adam Greenberg. You May Remember His First At-Bat.
teaser: Greenberg was hit in the head by a pitch the first time he went to the plate in the major leagues. It upended his life, but 13 years later he is charting a new course.

headline: U.S. Diplomats Held Face-to-Face Talk With Taliban, Insurgents Say
teaser: A senior State Department official was among diplomats who met with representatives from the Taliban in Doha, Qatar, a week ago, the insurgents said.

headline: Newest U.S. Strategy in Afghanistan Mirrors Past Plans for Retreat
teaser: The Trump administration is pushing Afghan commanders to surrender rural and sparsely populated areas of the country and focus on protecting cities.

headline: Still Standing, Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump Step Back in the Spotlight
teaser: They have waited out, and in some cases ground down, their critics, and are ready to make a more visible push for their priorities.

headline: He Was Dow’s ‘Dioxin Lawyer.’ Now He’s Trump’s Choice to Run the Superfund Program.
teaser: Peter Wright helped negotiate a major Dow toxic cleanup. During that time, Dow was accused of submitting disputed data, misrepresenting scientific evidence and delaying the work.

headline: Cynthia Nixon Thinks You’re Underestimating Her. She Thinks You’re Wrong.
teaser: The actress-turned-candidate for governor is trying to convince skeptical New York Democrats to see beyond her political inexperience, like some did with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

headline: Congressional Memo: Obscure Contest? Not When House Democrats Are This Divided
teaser: The fight for the post of House Democratic caucus chairman, now held by the defeated Representative Joseph Crowley, hints at a coming free-for-all.

headline: Paul Manafort’s Trial Starts Tuesday. Here Are the Charges and the Stakes.
teaser: Questions about Russian involvement in President Trump’s 2016 campaign are not on the docket but hang heavily over the proceedings.

headline: New York Times Publisher Rebuts Trump’s Account of Private Meeting
teaser: President Trump said he and the Times publisher, A.G. Sulzberger, discussed how journalists had become “the enemy of the people.” Mr. Sulzberger said he told the president his language was “dangerous.”

headline: G.O.P. Faces Another Midterm Threat as Trumps Plays the Shutdown Card
teaser: In a tweet, the president said he would be willing to shut down the government if Democrats do not give him money for his border wall.

headline: A $100 Billion Train: The Future of California or a Boondoggle?
teaser: In the face of sharp opposition and questions about how to pay for it, construction of California’s high-speed rail line is roaring ahead.

headline: 99 Days to Go, and the 2018 Midterm Battleground Is Not What Was Expected
teaser: The most competitive districts are only somewhat better educated and somewhat more suburban than the country as a whole.

headline: Ron Dellums, Forceful Liberal in Congress for 27 Years, Dies at 82
teaser: Arriving in Washington as an antiwar firebrand, he became a House leader as head of the Armed Services Committee and the Congressional Black Caucus.

headline: Trump Again Threatens to Shut Down the Government Over Border Security
teaser: “We’re the laughingstock of the world,” President Trump said during a 40-minute news conference with Giuseppe Conte, the visiting Italian prime minister.

headline: In Florida, Not All Politics Are Local, as Trump Shapes Governor’s Race
teaser: The president’s endorsement of Ron DeSantis in the Republican primary has tipped the race in his favor and shown how unwavering support of Mr. Trump can be crucial.

headline: Trump Doubles Down on Government Shutdown Over Border Security
teaser: The comments came a day after President Trump had threatened a shutdown on Twitter, to the consternation of some Republicans in Congress.

headline: “I’m Ready to Meet,” Trump Tells Iran
teaser: President Trump signaled his willingness to talk a week after threatening Hassan Rouhani, the president of Iran, on Twitter.

headline: Trump Says He Would Meet With Iranian Leader, but Iran Rules It Out
teaser: “With current America and these policies, there will definitely not be the possibility of dialogue and engagement,” a Foreign Ministry spokesman said.

headline: Ahead of Asia Trip, Business Lobby Gives Pompeo an Earful on Trade War
teaser: As Asian nations move away from the United States and its trade war with China, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce warned of fallout for American firms.

headline: Russia Is Not on the Docket at Manafort’s Trial, but It Will Be in the Air
teaser: The trial of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, concerns his work as a consultant in Ukraine. But the Russia inquiry looms over the proceedings.

headline: ‘Bigfoot Erotica’ Becomes an Issue in Virginia Congressional Campaign
teaser: Monster-themed pornography does exist. But Denver Riggleman, a Republican, said his writing on Bigfoot has not been pornographic.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Repeats, and Inflates, Inaccurate Claims About NATO and Immigration
teaser: At news conference on Monday with Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte of Italy, President Trump exaggerated the number of relatives immigrants can sponsor to reside in the United States through “chain migration.” He also falsely said that NATO was “going out of business” before he pushed the issue of military spending with the alliance.

headline: Trump Spurns Medicaid Proposal After Furious White House Debate
teaser: The administration has been deliberating whether to allow states to partially expand Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act. For now, at least, the answer appears to be no.

headline: Manchin Is First Democrat to Meet With Kavanaugh as Parties Intensify Feud
teaser: The senator is central to his party’s fight to defeat President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, whom Democrats have avoided meeting as they clash with Republicans over access to his emails.

headline: Trump Administration Mulls a Unilateral Tax Cut for the Rich
teaser: A proposal under consideration at the Treasury Department would bypass Congress and use federal regulation to index capital gains for inflation, a $100 billion boost for high earners.

headline: How Trump Allies Shifted Their Defense as Evidence of Contacts With Russians Grew
teaser: The president’s lead lawyer in the special counsel investigation, Rudolph W. Giuliani, presented a defense on Monday: Collusion is not a crime.

headline: Former FEMA Official Accused of Sexual Misconduct That Spanned Years
teaser: Corey Coleman had led the agency’s human resources office until June, when he resigned. Investigators will look into whether his behavior was criminal.

headline: Trump Is Putting Indelible Conservative Stamp on Judiciary
teaser: Beyond the Supreme Court, President Trump has already put a stamp on federal appeals courts, and Senate Republicans have been eager partners in the effort.

headline: Trump Is ‘Looking Into’ 3-D Printed Plastic Guns
teaser: The Trump administration decided to allow a company to post blueprints for 3-D printed plastic guns; multiple states have sued to prevent them from being available online.

headline: Facebook Has Identified Ongoing Political Influence Campaign
teaser: Facebook has identified a coordinated political influence campaign that includes stoking division around white supremacy and the Abolish ICE movement.

headline: At Manafort Trial, Jurors Will Hear Little About Russia
teaser: Jury selection begins in the trial of Paul Manafort, the president’s former campaign chairman, who faces bank and tax fraud charges in a case brought by Robert S. Mueller III.

headline: John Kelly Tells Aides He Will Remain White House Chief of Staff Through 2020
teaser: After months of questions about how long Mr. Kelly would last and who would replace him, officials said he and President Trump have reached a détente.

headline: Alex Jones, Pursued Over Falsehoods, Faces a Legal Crossroads
teaser: The Infowars founder is seeking the dismissal of a bellwether defamation lawsuit this week, as social media platforms take steps to curb him.

headline: Migrant Detention Centers Are ‘Like a Summer Camp,’ Official Says at Hearing
teaser: Senior Trump administration officials said in Senate testimony that they were not aware of the “zero tolerance” policy that resulted in family separations until it was announced.

headline: Trump Promotes Diplomatic Gains, but North Korea Continues Building Missiles
teaser: North Korea is building ICBMs at a facility outside Pyongyang, a sign that the country is continuing its weapons programs despite U.S. diplomacy.

headline: How the Koch-Trump Rift Could Shape the Midterms
teaser: Charles G. Koch, one of the Republicans’ biggest donors, has been critical of President Trump’s protectionist trade policies. Mr. Trump is hitting back, creating tensions that could affect the party in the midterm elections.

headline: Pakistan’s Likely New Leader Could Complicate Afghan Peace Talks
teaser: Imran Khan, the presumptive prime minister, has sought to temper his past anti-American speech. But his election could signal more tensions in an already strained relationship.

headline: Justice Dept. Investigating Claims That Drug Companies Funded Terrorism in Iraq
teaser: In a filing, AstraZeneca said the case was related to a suit that accused five companies of giving the Iraqi health ministry drugs and devices that were then sold to fund attacks.

headline: At Florida Rally, Trump Boasts About the Economy and Takes Aim at Usual Targets
teaser: The president called himself “the most popular person in the history of the Republican Party” — a debunked claim — and took shots at his usual list of piñatas, boogeymen and political targets.

headline: Mueller Passes 3 Cases Focused on Illicit Foreign Lobbying to Prosecutors in New York
teaser: The special counsel has referred investigations into lobbying by Washington insiders to the federal prosecutors in New York handling the case against Michael Cohen, President Trump’s former lawyer.

headline: Charles Koch Takes On Trump. Trump Takes On Charles Koch.
teaser: Mr. Koch has bristled at some of President Trump’s policies, and this week his unease escalated to open threats. Mr. Trump fought back in tweets.

headline: After Years of Quiet, Democratic Candidates Can’t Stop Talking About Health Care
teaser: A potent campaign theme emerges across the nation, with a particular emphasis on pre-existing conditions.

headline: White House Weighs Another Reduction in Refugees Admitted to U.S.
teaser: Under one proposal, no more than 25,000 refugees could be resettled in the United States next year, a cut of more than 40 percent from this year’s limit.

headline: What to Watch as the Fed Meets
teaser: The Federal Reserve is not expected to raise interest rates, but the August meeting still contains intrigue.

headline: Andrew Wheeler, New E.P.A. Chief, Details His Energy Lobbying Past
teaser: Mr. Wheeler, the agency’s acting administrator, has put forth the fullest explanation yet of his energy lobbying activities.

headline: Green Party, Eyeing the 2020 Presidential Race, Prepares for the Midterms
teaser: The Democratic Party loomed large over the annual Green Party conference last month, but all eyes were on November, when Green leaders say they’ll field at least 224 candidates.

headline: ‘Short Term’ Health Insurance? Up to 3 Years Under New Trump Policy
teaser: Consumers may soon have access to less expensive health insurance providing fewer benefits under a Trump administration rule intended to skirt requirements of the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Trump Calls on Sessions to ‘Stop the Rigged Witch Hunt Right Now’
teaser: The attorney general has recused himself from overseeing the special counsel’s inquiry into Russian interference in the 2016 campaign and possible links to Trump associates.

headline: Campaigns Enter Texting Era With a Plea: Will U Vote 4 Me ὤF ?
teaser: Welcome to the age of the political mass-text. Candidates in this year’s midterm elections are adding a new, hard-to-ignore tool to their arsenal.

headline: Chinese Goods May Face 25% Tariffs, Not 10%, as Trump Administration’s Anger Grows
teaser: The administration is considering raising tariffs on a list of $200 billion of Chinese products to 25 percent from 10 percent as China’s currency declines.

headline: U.S. Embassy in London Puts Surplus Goods Up for Auction
teaser: Among the surplus items of little historical value are 1,200 rolls of toilet paper, Dyson vacuum cleaners and plastic chairs.

headline: Trump Tariffs Are Lifting Profits, Steel Giant ArcelorMittal Says
teaser: The company’s chairman and chief executive is a rare business leader who applauds President Trump’s protectionist approach to trade.

headline: What Is QAnon: Explaining the Internet Conspiracy Theory That Showed Up at a Trump Rally
teaser: Do you remember Pizzagate? It’s a little like that: a web of baseless conspiracy theories. And its supporters were highly visible at an event for the president in Florida.

headline: Obama Endorses Dozens of Democrats, Rewarding Diversity and Loyalty
teaser: The former president, who has largely avoided campaign politics, endorsed 81 Democrats in the midterms, including officials who served in his administration.

headline: Illinois Lawmaker Resigns After Ex-Girlfriend Says He Used Her Nude Photos to ‘Catfish’ Men
teaser: State Representative Nick Sauer, a Republican, said he would leave office hours after a report that he used an Instagram account with the photos to “catfish” men online.

headline: U.S. Prepares to Reduce Troops and Shed Missions in Africa
teaser: The plan by the head of Africa Command, which follows an ambush in Niger that killed four Americans, is a response to the Trump administration’s strategy to focus on threats from China and Russia.

headline: Faced With Crippling Sanctions, ZTE Loaded Up on Lobbyists
teaser: A Chinese company waged a furious — and ultimately successful — lobbying campaign to win a reprieve from penalties in Congress.

headline: Trump Finally Picks a Science Adviser. And Scientists? They Seem Relieved.
teaser: Kelvin Droegemeier, a well-regarded meteorologist, has a long research record. But his views on climate change are not well known.

headline: Trump Says You Need an ID to Buy Groceries. Shoppers Say, ‘Huh?’
teaser: Two billionaire friends of President Trump say they cannot recall him ever doing his own grocery shopping, although he can handle a shopping cart.

headline: Prosecution in Paul Manafort Trial Seeks to Detail Tax Avoidance
teaser: The judge in the tax and bank fraud trial restricted prosecutors from displaying pictures of Mr. Manafort’s expensive suits and using the word “oligarch” as President Trump weighed in on Twitter.

headline: Crowds, Stoked by Trump’s Rhetoric, Increase Their Ire Toward the Press
teaser: Menacing the media is a theme of President Trump’s rallies, but news organizations are anticipating an unnerving midterm election season, especially after a hostile crowd in Florida on Tuesday night.

headline: News Analysis: Facebook Grapples With a Maturing Adversary in Election Meddling
teaser: The influence campaign revealed on Tuesday is adapting and evolving to better disguise itself, which limits the social network’s approach to stopping it.

headline: Trump Pushes for Interview With Mueller Against Lawyers’ Advice
teaser: The special counsel has agreed to accept some answers in writing, but the president’s lawyers believe that answering any questions could put him in legal jeopardy.

headline: Lawyers in Sandy Hook Lawsuit Spar Over Meaning of an Online Broadcast
teaser: A lawyer for Infowars is seeking the dismissal of a defamation case, arguing that the Constitution protects “fringe speech.”

headline: Mueller’s Digging Exposes Culture of Foreign Lobbying and Its Big Paydays
teaser: Robert S. Mueller III’s investigations of foreign money flowing into Washington could be as much a part of his legacy as anything he unearths about Russian election interference.

headline: How Fake Influence Campaigns on Facebook Lured Real People
teaser: Activists became entangled with fake accounts and pages on Facebook, leading to significant consequences for them as the company tried to clamp down.

headline: Trump Unveils His Plan to Weaken Car Pollution Rules
teaser: The proposal would freeze rules requiring cleaner, more efficient cars and unravel one of President Obama’s signature policies to fight global warming.

headline: ‘It Can Happen Even to Guys’: Ohio State Wrestlers Detail Abuse, Saying #UsToo
teaser: Former Ohio State University wrestlers — athletes grappling with sexual abuse long buried in their memories — are taking their place in the #MeToo movement.

headline: Tennessee Primaries: What to Watch For
teaser: The key races in the state, which President Trump won by 26 points in 2016, are for the governorship and the Senate seat being vacated by Bob Corker.

headline: Understanding the times: What Does ‘Off the Record’ Really Mean?
teaser: A primer on the kinds of conversations journalists have with sources.

headline: F.D.A. Did Not Intervene to Curb Risky Fentanyl Prescriptions
teaser: Powerful cancer pain drugs were given to patients with other conditions who cannot tolerate them. A program to curb the practice was run by companies that sell the drugs.

headline: Are Journalists the Enemy of the People? Ivanka Trump Stands Alone in the White House by Saying They’re Not.
teaser: But Ivanka Trump’s comments about family separations, while couched in emotion, were closer to White House policy.

headline: Michigan Is About to Elect a Very Different Member of Congress
teaser: In the state primary Tuesday, voters will elect a successor to longtime Representative John Conyers Jr., choosing among one of the most diverse and competitive fields of candidates this year.

headline: European Economy Feels Strain From Trump’s Trade War
teaser: Business managers worry whether a cease-fire between Brussels and the White House will hold. The uncertainty is bad for growth.

headline: Trump Officials on Russian Meddling Threat: Democracy ‘Is in the Crosshairs’
teaser: The heads of the national security agencies said that Russia was attempting to influence the midterm elections. Their remarks were a departure from President Trump’s comments that played down the threat.

headline: Bipartisan Senate Group Pushes ‘Crushing’ Punishments to Thwart Russia
teaser: The legislation is one of the biggest efforts to date by Congress to wrestle back some authority to shape foreign policy, but whether it could actually become law is another question.

headline: Sanders Won’t Say the Media Is Not the ‘Enemy’
teaser: Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the White House press secretary, rebuked members of the news media for what she called “personal attacks” against her.

headline: Judge Dismisses Two Lawsuits Against Fox News Over Retracted Seth Rich Story
teaser: Mr. Rich’s parents did not get the outcome they hoped for. But even in ruling against them, the judge noted that Fox had published a “sensational claim.”

headline: Media Memo: CNN’s Jim Acosta Challenges Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Then Makes a Quick Exit
teaser: The White House briefing room became the latest venue for the fight over the president’s treatment of the news media.

headline: Trump Administration Moves Ahead With Tariffs on Canadian Newsprint
teaser: The tariffs are lower than what the Commerce Department initially imposed, but the decision is still a blow to the American newspaper industry, which is already struggling with declining revenue.

headline: How the U.S. Is Fighting Russian Election Interference
teaser: Russia is trying again to spread disinformation to exploit American division, using social media campaigns as well as more traditional tradecraft, officials said.

headline: Tennessee Republicans Select Newcomer, Spurning Trump Loyalist in Governor’s Race
teaser: Diane Black lost despite showing fealty to the president. Marsha Blackburn and Phil Bredesen won the nominations for the open Senate seat.

headline: Pompeo Warns Turkey on Detained U.S. Pastor: The Clock Has ‘Run Out’
teaser: The imprisonment of Andrew Brunson prompted sanctions from the Trump administration. But the Turkish foreign minister said harsh tactics would not work.

headline: Prosecutors Document Paul Manafort’s Reversal of Fortune After 2014
teaser: In the third day of testimony in Paul Manafort’s tax and bank fraud trial, witnesses described how his finances deteriorated after losing his Ukrainian client.

headline: Top New Hampshire Democrat Arrested on Domestic Violence Charges
teaser: Colleagues on both sides of the aisle have called for Jeff Woodburn, the State Senate minority leader who is up for re-election, to resign.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s Inaccurate Claims About Highways, Immigration and Beyoncé From a Pennsylvania Rally
teaser: President Trump said his campaign rallies drew larger crowds than concerts for Beyoncé, Jay-Z and Bruce Springsteen. That was one of 15 inaccurate claims he made.

headline: Jobs Report for July: Here’s What to Watch For
teaser: Are trade barriers affecting hiring? Is wage growth gaining steam? The monthly Labor Department figures, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern time, may offer answers.

headline: In Potential Kobach Candidacy, Kansas Faces Another Lurch to the Right
teaser: Kris Kobach, a hard-line Trump supporter, could win the Republican nomination for governor, creating intraparty clashes over whether he’s too extreme.

headline: Big City: Zephyr Teachout Is Running for Attorney General. But Her Real Target Is Trump.
teaser: The law professor and activist challenged Gov. Andrew Cuomo in the democratic primary in 2014, and is a godmother to the current moment of upstart women candidates.

headline: Trump Bashes ‘Fake News’: ‘They Can Make Anything Bad’
teaser: For much of a rally on Thursday night in Pennsylvania, President Trump focused on his multiple grievances with the Washington press corps.

headline: Russian Threat ‘Is Real,’ Trump Officials Say, Vowing to Protect U.S. Elections
teaser: The leaders of the national security agencies promised to help state and local governments counter what they called Russia’s efforts to influence the elections.

headline: Trump Calls Media ‘Horrendous People’
teaser: At his latest rally in Pennsylvania, President Trump used inflammatory language to denounce the news media.

headline: John James, Black and Republican, Thinks He Can Crack the ‘Blue Wall’ in Michigan
teaser: Mr. James, 37, is a West Point graduate who spent eight years in the Army. He is the president of his family-run business. And he wants to become a senator.

headline: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Russian Bank in Slap at Moscow and Pyongyang
teaser: The Trump administration issued new sanctions against a Russian bank it accused of doing business with North Korea in a slap to Moscow and Pyongyang.

headline: United States and Mexico Are Nearing Nafta Compromise
teaser: The United States and Mexico made progress toward a Nafta agreement during two days of talks in Washington this week, but Canada still needs to be brought to the table

headline: Paul Manafort Was Deep in Debt. He Saw an Opportunity in Trump.
teaser: Prosecutors in Mr. Manafort’s bank and tax fraud trial say he was desperate for money. Why, then, did he volunteer to work unpaid in a top post in the Trump campaign?

headline: Paul Manafort’s Accountant Testifies She Helped Alter Financial Documents
teaser: The testimony of Cynthia Laporta, a Virginia accountant, brought to life the financial machinations that prosecutors have been sketching out since Mr. Manafort’s trial on bank and tax fraud opened.

headline: There’s Trump’s Foreign Policy and Then There’s His Administration’s
teaser: Nowhere were these differences more jarring than in the response to concerns that the Russian government is plotting to interfere in the midterm elections.

headline: Kavanaugh’s Opponents Protest Ex-Aide’s Role in Screening of Documents
teaser: The lawyer supervising the screening of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s records served as a deputy to Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh when he was staff secretary in the Bush White House.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From Paul Manafort’s trial to multiple presidential rallies, it’s been a busy week. Here’s what you might’ve missed (and some links if you want to read further).

headline: A ‘Rainbow Wave?’ 2018 Has More L.G.B.T. Candidates Than Ever
teaser: A record number of lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender candidates are running for office in November, as the Trump administration and state-level politicians have moved to roll back some legal protections.

headline: The Partisan Battle Brett Kavanaugh Now Regrets
teaser: The Supreme Court nominee, despite his own doubts, left his Washington law firm to rejoin the investigation into President Bill Clinton’s affair with Monica Lewinsky.

headline: Trump Mocks the Intelligence of LeBron James and Don Lemon
teaser: After the N.B.A. star criticized President Trump in a CNN interview, Mr. Trump lashed out at him on Twitter.

headline: Beyond the N.R.A.: Maria Butina’s Peculiar Bid for Russian Influence
teaser: A Rockefeller heir, an Eisenhower, an array of Republican lawmakers — the accused Russian agent sought powerful connections outside the gun-rights group.

headline: Cuomo Moves to Scrap N.R.A. Lawsuit Accusing Him of ‘Blacklisting’
teaser: The gun rights group claims that New York State regulators have cost it millions of dollars by conspiring to keep banks and insurers from working with it.

headline: White Nationalists Love Corey Stewart. He Keeps Them Close.
teaser: The Republican nominee for Senate in Virginia likes to engage the racial fringes of his party, creating a dilemma for mainstream G.O.P. leaders wary of his views.

headline: Can the Ocasio-Cortez Playbook Work in the Heartland? Cori Bush Is Trying
teaser: Running against an esteemed incumbent in a St. Louis district, Ms. Bush is hoping to parlay the energy of the insurgent left into another surprise victory

headline: Accused of Harassment, and Seeking Redemption at the Ballot Box
teaser: Politicians across the country who have been accused of sexual harassment or other misconduct are running for office anyway. Some deny wrongdoing; others ask for a second chance.

headline: Steven Seagal Appointed by Russia as Special Envoy to the U.S.
teaser: Russian officials said the action star’s new role would include promoting cooperation in culture, arts and youth exchanges. The position is unpaid.

headline: President Admits Focus of Trump Tower Meeting Was Getting Dirt on Clinton
teaser: President Trump claimed that the June 2016 meeting was “totally legal,” though it is a key subject of the investigation by the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III.

headline: Steel Giants With Ties to Trump Officials Block Tariff Relief for Hundreds of Firms
teaser: Nucor and United States Steel have exercised veto power, so far without fail, over other companies, forcing them to buy their products instead of steel from abroad.

headline: In Ohio Election, Republicans Test a Midterms Rescue Plan: Polarization
teaser: An Ohio congressional special election has revealed the strategy Republicans will use to keep power in the House — or to ensure Democrats win only a small majority.

headline: Sidebar: Ruth Bader Ginsburg Bemoans a ‘Divisive’ Term, but Vows to Stick Around
teaser: In an annual summary of the Supreme Court’s work, Justice Ginsburg, 85, said she hoped for more consensus and may try to serve until she is 90.

headline: Trump Backs Kris Kobach in Kansas Race, Against Republican Advice
teaser: In providing his support in the governor’s race, the president ignored concerns that Mr. Kobach’s hard-right positions are too polarizing for a general election

headline: U.S. to Restore Sanctions on Iran Following Withdrawal From Nuclear Deal
teaser: Sanctions on Iran had been lifted under the 2015 nuclear accord, which the Trump administration abandoned, and will be reimposed at midnight.

headline: Trump’s Border Wall Could Waste Billions of Dollars, Report Says
teaser: The Department of Homeland Security did not fully consider where barriers were needed or how their cost could vary based on factors like terrain, a Government Accountability Office report says.

headline: Rand Paul Continues His One-Man Détente With Russia, This Time in Moscow
teaser: While American intelligence officials describe Russia as a threat and many lawmakers call for a harder line, Senator Rand Paul has become a leading voice for warmer ties.

headline: Pentagon Cracks Down on GPS Software on Devices in Combat Zones
teaser: The order, which stops short of an outright ban, came after data from the fitness app Strava highlighted the exercise routes of users on American military bases in Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan.

headline: How Kris Kobach Built a National Profile
teaser: Mr. Kobach has advised President Trump and sought the spotlight on issues of immigration and voting fraud. His political career began in 1999 on a suburban City Council.

headline: An Airline Scans Your Face. You Take Off. But Few Rules Govern Where Your Data Goes.
teaser: A government program provides few rules for how companies can use or store the biometric data that verifies passengers’ identity, opening it up to potential abuse.

headline: Iranians and Their Leaders Brace for Impact of New U.S. Sanctions
teaser: New passenger planes landed at Tehran’s airport, Iranians bought gold and other bulwarks against economic distress and the government introduced measures to ease the hardship.

headline: Donald Trump Jr.’s Potential Legal Troubles, Explained
teaser: President Trump’s lawyer, defending the younger Mr. Trump’s meeting with Russians, said nobody has pointed to any law that may have been violated. Here are several.

headline: Trump’s Short-Term Health Insurance Policies Quickly Run Into Headwinds
teaser: Federal officials got a skeptical reaction from state insurance regulators on the value of the plans promoted by the president as a cheap alternative to the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Rick Gates Testifies He Committed Crimes With Paul Manafort
teaser: For decades, Rick Gates was right-hand man to Paul Manafort, the former Trump campaign chairman who is accused of tax and bank fraud.

headline: Why Social Media Platforms Are Booting Alex Jones
teaser: After months of increasing their scrutiny, tech companies have deleted content from the right-wing provocateur Alex Jones.

headline: Margaret Heckler, Health Secretary Ousted From Reagan’s Cabinet, Dies at 87
teaser: She championed women’s rights in Congress and ran the Department of Health and Human Services until she was forced from the post and appointed ambassador to Ireland

headline: 5 States Are Voting on Tuesday. Here’s What to Watch.
teaser: A look at the most important primaries in Kansas, Michigan, Missouri and Washington, and a special election in Ohio.

headline: Can a Criminal Justice Advocate Unseat Ferguson’s Lead Prosecutor? Wesley Bell Will Try.
teaser: On Tuesday, voters in St. Louis County will choose between Robert McCulloch, who was sharply criticized for his handling of the Michael Brown shooting, and Mr. Bell, a reform-minded challenger.

headline: Facebook Is Asked to Change Rules for Journalists and Scholars
teaser: Advocates asked the site to allow research exceptions to its bans on creating fake accounts and the use of digital tools that automatically download large amounts of data for analysis.

headline: Live Briefing: Paul Manafort’s Trial: Rick Gates Testifies Against His Former Boss
teaser: Paul Manafort, the former campaign chairman for President Trump, is being tried on charges of bank and tax fraud in a case stemming from the special counsel’s investigation.

headline: California Strikes Back Against the Trump Administration’s Auto Pollution Rollback
teaser: The state’s rebuttal lays out a road map to California’s legal strategy against the federal government in coming months and years.

headline: West Hollywood Urges Removal of Trump’s Walk of Fame Star (It’s a Long Shot)
teaser: A resolution by the City Council there was largely meaningless because West Hollywood has no authority over the Walk of Fame, which is in Los Angeles.

headline: Paul Laxalt, Senator From Nevada and Reagan Confidant, Dies at 96
teaser: Known for a firm conservatism conveyed courteously, Mr. Laxalt developed a relationship with Ronald Reagan when they were governors of neighboring states.

headline: Alex Jones Demands His Infowars Followers Rise Up and Buy More Merchandise
teaser: As his content is removed from most social media platforms, Alex Jones says the crackdown on Infowars makes it the “most censored program in the world.”

headline: Why the ‘Manhattan Madam’ Is Ensnared in the Mueller Inquiry
teaser: Kristin M. Davis, a former Manhattan procuress, is testifying this week before a grand jury looking at ties between Russia and President Trump’s campaign.

headline: Rosie O’Donnell and Chorus of Broadway Stars Perform Musical Protest at White House
teaser: On the 22nd night of a series of protests, cast members from “Wicked,” “Hamilton” and other shows sang songs meant to evoke a political edge or offer a tinge of hope for the hundreds of demonstrators.

headline: Top Trump Campaign Aides Are Portrayed as Corrupt at Manafort Trial
teaser: The prosecution’s star witness, Rick Gates, detailed a yearslong fraud by Paul Manafort. Defense lawyers assailed Mr. Gates’s credibility, pointing to thefts, lies and an extramarital affair.

headline: Plan to Punish Immigrants for Using Welfare Could Boost G.O.P. Candidates
teaser: Officials could deny legal status to immigrants who accept food stamps or other benefits. Republicans are poised to make it a powerful election year issue.

headline: Whitmer and Schuette Win Michigan Governor’s Nominations
teaser: John James, who received President Trump’s backing, won the Republican nomination for Senate as the president’s looming presence continued to influence the midterms.

headline: Labor Gains Victory as Missouri Voters Reject Anti-Union Law
teaser: After setbacks in other states and in the Supreme Court, workers’ groups overturned right-to-work legislation before it took effect.

headline: In Kansas, Another Close Race, as Kobach and Colyer Remain Deadlocked
teaser: The race, between the sitting governor and a hard-right challenger, served as a test of President Trump’s growing influence over the Republican party.

headline: Republican Holds Slim Lead in Ohio Special Election for House Seat
teaser: Despite millions of dollars in advertising and interventions from President Trump and Vice President Pence, the Republican candidate had a razor-thin lead over a little-known Democrat.

headline: Trump’s Tariffs Are Changing Trade With China. Here Are 2 Emerging Endgames.
teaser: Beneath the acrimony, two potential paths for China seem to be emerging in the trade war with the United States.

headline: 5 Takeaways From Tuesday’s Election Results
teaser: Republicans had a brush with trouble in Ohio, where a result had still not been declared in a special election to fill a House vacancy. Elsewhere, an activist sweep on the left failed to materialize.

headline: ‘End Family Fire’ Campaign Hopes to Combat Accidental Child Gun Deaths
teaser: The nonprofit that helped popularize Smokey Bear and “friends don’t let friends drive drunk” is teaming up with a gun control group to promote safe firearm storage.

headline: Immigration Arrests Drop at Mexican Border for Second Straight Month
teaser: Federal immigration agents apprehended about 2,900 fewer migrants at the border with Mexico in July. The drop follows a springtime spike in arrests.

headline: Wesley Bell, Ferguson Councilman, Unseats St. Louis County Prosecutor
teaser: Mr. Bell defeated Robert P. McCulloch, the county official who oversaw the investigation into the police shooting of Michael Brown in 2014.

headline: A Guide to Covering the Manafort Trial
teaser: Reporters and news assistants in the Washington bureau have developed a series of tactics to manage the trial’s demands.

headline: Rashida Tlaib, With Primary Win, Is Poised to Become First Muslim Woman in Congress
teaser: Ms. Tlaib, a former state legislator who is Palestinian-American, won a Democratic congressional primary in Michigan. She will run unopposed in November.

headline: Kansas and Ohio Races Remain Too Close to Call
teaser: In the Kansas Republican primary race for governor, Kris W. Kobach was ahead of Gov. Jeff Colyer by just 191 votes with all precincts reporting on Wednesday morning.

headline: New York Congressman Chris Collins Is Charged With Insider Trading
teaser: Representative Collins, one of President Trump’s earliest and most vocal supporters, is accused of using inside information about a new drug to avoid losses.

headline: Paul Manafort’s Defense Team Accuses Rick Gates of Multiple Affairs
teaser: After Rick Gates provided hours of damning testimony, Paul Manafort’s lawyers fight back by attacking his credibility and accusing him of lying.

headline: Trump’s Lawyers Counter Mueller’s Interview Offer, Seeking a Narrower Scope
teaser: Negotiations between the president’s lawyers and the special counsel over whether Mr. Trump will voluntarily answer questions have dragged on for months.

headline: Overlooked No More: Julia Sand, Whose Letters Inspired a President
teaser: A housebound New York woman sought to influence the heart of Chester A. Arthur at a time when no one believed in him.

headline: ‘I Will Uplift You’: Rashida Tlaib’s Emotional Victory In Michigan
teaser: The Palestinian-American could be the first Muslim woman elected to Congress after winning the Democratic primary in Michigan’s 13th Congressional District. The former state legislator will run unopposed in November.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Do Trump’s Endorsed Candidates Always Win?
teaser: President Trump claimed that Senate and House candidates he endorses will always win. But four candidates he has backed have lost their races.

headline: Who Gets a New 20% Tax Break? The Treasury Dept. Speaks, and Trump May Save
teaser: Spa owners and authors appear eligible for the new break for professionals, along with some of President Trump’s real estate entities. Doctors, however, are out of luck.

headline: Sharice Davids Could Become First Lesbian Native American Congresswoman
teaser: Ms. Davids, a lawyer and former mixed martial arts fighter who won the Democratic nomination for a House seat in Kansas, campaigned on expanded health care access and gun control.

headline: Kansas Republicans’ Quandary: A Razor-Thin Race and a Possible Conflict of Interest
teaser: As the state counts mail-in ballots to determine a winner in the governor’s race, Republican leaders try to keep Kris Kobach’s hard-right approach from becoming divisive

headline: News Analysis: Trump Claims Election Night Credit. It’s Not That Simple.
