teaser: President Trump and his chaotic, controversy-laden tenure are at least partly responsible for creating a toxic political climate for the Republican candidates he is trying to save.

headline: Judge in Manafort Trial Is a ‘Caesar’ in His Own Rome
teaser: The message Judge T.S. Ellis III gives lawyers in his court is clear: Keep questions on point, move briskly and show some respect.

headline: In Virginia, Women Form an Insurgency to Try to Topple Republican Dave Brat
teaser: Representative Dave Brat’s stunning victory in 2014 showed the power of insurgency. But he is facing an uprising of his own among Democratic women in his Virginia congressional district.

headline: The Marines Didn’t Think Women Belonged in Combat. She’s Proving Them Wrong.
teaser: “I wanted to lead a platoon,” said First Lt. Marina A. Hierl, the first woman in the Marine Corps infantry to do so. It is a milestone in a military community that fiercely resisted the change.

headline: Trump’s Newsprint Tariffs Hasten Local Newspapers’ Demise
teaser: Surging newsprint costs are adding to the woes of struggling local newspapers, forcing them to reduce staff and publication days.

headline: Mind: Psychologists’ Group Maintains Ban on Work at Military Detention Facilities
teaser: Members of the American Psychological Association voted against allowing psychologists to resume work at certain detention centers like the one in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba.

headline: Carla Provost Becomes the First Woman to Lead the Border Patrol
teaser: Ms. Provost had been the acting chief for over a year and is promoted at a moment of transition as the agency looks to add 5,000 agents.

headline: The N.R.A. Has Declared War on Andrew Cuomo. He Couldn’t Be Happier.
teaser: The N.R.A.’s renewed battle with the governor has given him ready-made talking points in his campaign for re-election in New York.

headline: Kavanaugh Had Role in a Bush White House Debate About Terrorism Suspects, Email Shows
teaser: The email, part of a trove of about 5,700 documents involving Brett M. Kavanaugh’s time in the George W. Bush administration, appears likely to be a focus at his Supreme Court confirmation hearing.

headline: Rashida Tlaib Won a Primary on Tuesday. She Also Lost a Primary on Tuesday.
teaser: Here's why there are two races on the same day for the same House seat in Michigan.

headline: Can Chris Collins Be Re-elected While Indicted? Michael Grimm, an Ex-Felon, Has Thoughts
teaser: Mr. Grimm, who won re-election while under indictment, says that much of Washington will look at Mr. Collins “as a pariah.”

headline: Melania Trump’s Parents Become U.S. Citizens as Lawyer Acknowledges ‘Chain Migration’
teaser: Viktor and Amalija Knavs had a private naturalization ceremony in Lower Manhattan, after being sponsored by their daughter in a program President Trump has railed against.

headline: Pence Advances Plan to Create a Space Force
teaser: Vice President Mike Pence gave details about President Trump’s plan to create a military force for space. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis is now onboard with the plan.

headline: U.S. Officials Scrambled Behind the Scenes to Shield NATO Deal From Trump
teaser: John R. Bolton, the national security adviser, pushed NATO ambassadors to finish a critical policy document before the alliance’s summit meeting last month so the president could not reject it.

headline: Kobach’s Lead Cut in Half as Counting Error Narrows Kansas Governor Primary
teaser: Gov. Jeff Colyer, who had been trailing Mr. Kobach by 191 votes, received 100 more votes than he initially received credit for in one rural county.

headline: How a Blacklisted Russian Firm Won (and Lost) a Break From Trump’s Tariffs
teaser: A Russian aluminum giant got a break that had eluded most others. Then it unraveled after Commerce officials realized it had been granted in error.

headline: Court Orders E.P.A. to Ban Chlorpyrifos, Pesticide Tied to Children’s Health Problems
teaser: The ruling by a federal appeals court was a major setback for the pesticide industry, which had successfully lobbied the Trump administration to reject a ban.

headline: F.B.I. Agent Awaits Verdict on Mystery Shots Fired at Oregon Standoff
teaser: An Oregon jury will decide the fate of an F.B.I. agent who is accused of lying about firing his rifle at a roadblock in which a militia leader was killed in 2016.

headline: 3 Years Ago, Uber Beat Back a Cap on Vehicles. What’s Changed? A Lot.
teaser: Political and market forces have changed since Mayor Bill de Blasio lost in his bid to institute a cap on for-hire vehicles three years ago.

headline: Special Counsel Is Granted Request to Keep Inquiry Details Private
teaser: A private conversation during the Paul Manafort trial concerned whether investigators had asked a cooperating witness about the Trump campaign.

headline: Michael Avenatti, Stormy Daniels’s Lawyer, Eyes Another Gig: President
teaser: Mr. Avenatti, President Trump’s tormentor, said he is “strongly considering” running for president in 2020. He is attending a major Democratic dinner in Iowa this week.

headline: Cables Detail C.I.A. Waterboarding at Secret Prison Run by Gina Haspel
teaser: The 2002 cables, written or overseen by Gina Haspel, now the C.I.A. director, detail the torture of Abd al-Rahim al-Nashiri, the main suspect in the bombing of the Navy destroyer Cole.

headline: An Economic Upturn Begun Under Obama Is Now Trump’s to Tout
teaser: Both presidents have had trouble turning better times into higher approval ratings. But this time the challenge is in the hands of a salesman.

headline: E.P.A. Staff Objected to Agency’s New Rules on Asbestos Use, Internal Emails Show
teaser: The clash over the proposal exposes the tensions within the E.P.A. over the Trump administration’s efforts to roll back environmental regulations.

headline: At Carrier, the Factory Trump Saved, Morale Is Through the Floor
teaser: Twenty months after the president-elect reached a deal to keep blue-collar jobs from leaving the country, absenteeism plagues the Indiana plant.

headline: Republican Governors in Blue States Find a Way to Get Along
teaser: Using bipartisanship and avoiding liberal tendencies, conservative governors in states like Maryland and Massachusetts may survive a blue wave in the midterms.

headline: Trump Used Racial Slur During ‘Celebrity Apprentice,’ Former White House Aide Says
teaser: Omarosa Manigault Newman writes in a new memoir that she never heard President Trump use the slur but says there are tapes to prove it.

headline: Trump Hits Turkey When It’s Down, Doubling Tariffs
teaser: The president’s decision, announced in a tweet, raised the possibility of further tariff escalations with China and other countries whose currencies are falling against the dollar.

headline: DeVos Ends Obama-Era Safeguards Aimed at Abuses by For-Profit Colleges
teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, in her most dramatic move to deregulate for-profit colleges, announced she will end a rule to force them to prove the gainful employment of their graduates.

headline: Roger Stone Associate Is Subpoenaed in Russia Investigation
teaser: The associate, the radio host Randy Credico, was identified as the intermediary between Mr. Stone and the WikiLeaks founder, Julian Assange.

headline: NPR Is Criticized After White Nationalist Ranks the Races by Intelligence on Air
teaser: On “Morning Edition,” the host Noel King pushed back against the race-ranking remarks, but critics said the interview allowed a bigot to spread his message.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh Urged Ken Starr Not to Indict Clinton While in Office
teaser: The view of President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee about the separation of powers may please Mr. Trump. But Democrats will want to ask more questions about his views.

headline: Arvonne Fraser, Strong Voice on Women’s Issues, Dies at 92
teaser: Whether in her home state of Minnesota or in Washington, Ms. Fraser urged women to fight for their rights.

headline: Mulvaney Looks to Weaken Oversight of Military Lending
teaser: The head of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will halt “supervisory inspections” of lenders, arguing that the agency lacks legal standing to engage in such examinations.

headline: Once ‘No Longer a Nuclear Threat,’ North Korea Now in Standoff With U.S.
teaser: Pyongyang wants the U.S. to formally declare the end of the Korean War before it begins dismantling its nuclear arsenal. Officials said that was not part of the Singapore deal.

headline: Bulletin board: Using a Public Records Request to Learn More About Brett Kavanaugh
teaser: Readers have asked about the kind of public information requests our journalists make. Two of our investigative reporters explain how this worked with recent requests on President Trump’s Supreme Court nomination.

headline: Outside Influence: The Veterans Agency’s Shadowy Leadership
teaser: Three friends of the president have quietly influenced decisions at the Department of Veterans Affairs, including the firing of the secretary. They seem to be growing bolder.

headline: Inside Twitter’s Struggle Over What Gets Banned
teaser: The social media company provided a rare look inside a policy meeting as it struggled with criticism that it left up posts from the conspiracy site Infowars and its creator, Alex Jones.

headline: Manafort Leaned on Ties to Trump to Win Loans, a Bank Official Testifies
teaser: Months after Paul Manafort left Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign, he still sought to use that connection to bail himself out of financial trouble, a banker’s testimony showed.

headline: Michael Avenatti Urges Democrats to Reject Michelle Obama’s Advice on Trump
teaser: Mrs. Obama said, “When they go low, we go high.” In his first speech as a prospective presidential candidate, Mr. Avenatti told Democrats to “fight fire with fire” instead.

headline: A Half-Million Bikers and a Trade Debate
teaser: This is Sturgis: A massive biker rally in South Dakota. Harley-Davidson has always been a mainstay here, but since the company announced that it’s moving some production overseas, some die-hard fans are questioning their loyalty.

headline: A Judge Blocked a Medicaid Work Requirement. The White House Is Undeterred.
teaser: Trump administration officials say they will still allow states to impose work requirements on Medicaid beneficiaries, despite a federal court ruling that blocked such requirements in Kentucky.

headline: ‘So, So Jaded’: The Campaign to Stop Brett Kavanaugh Struggles for Liftoff
teaser: Activists have mustered seven-figure war chests and troops on the ground, but little energy to stop Judge Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court confirmation has materialized.

headline: Chris Collins, New York Congressman, Suspends Re-election Bid After Insider Trading Charges
teaser: Mr. Collins initially vowed to stay on the ballot but said it was “in the best interests” of his district, the Republican Party and the president’s agenda to suspend his race.

headline: Before White Supremacists’ Rally, Trump Declines to Condemn Them Specifically
teaser: President Trump issued a general call for unity a year after the violence in Charlottesville, Va., saying that he condemns “all types of racism and acts of violence.”

headline: Congressman Collins’s Deep Financial Ties to Biotech Firms Posed Other Conflicts
teaser: Mr. Collins, among the wealthiest members of Congress, has decided not to seek re-election in the wake of insider trading charges stemming from investments he and others had in a biotech firm.

headline: Trump Escalates Attack on Sessions, Calling Him ‘Scared Stiff’
teaser: The broadside included some of President Trump’s harshest language yet against the attorney general, whom he criticized as “Missing in Action.”

headline: Wisconsin Faces a Political Crossroads Tuesday. Which Way Will It Go?
teaser: Democrats hope to swing back in their favor a state that played an unexpectedly pivotal role in President Trump’s victory. But it may be too late.

headline: News Analysis: An Angry Kremlin Faces New Rounds of U.S. Sanctions
teaser: President Vladimir V. Putin has nimbly exploited differences between Washington and its allies, but he has yet to translate that into fewer sanctions against Russia.

headline: At ‘Unite the Right’ Rally, White Nationalists to Gather in Front of White House
teaser: Thousands of counterprotesters are poised to oppose the supremacists’ message a year after the Charlottesville violence, and hundreds of police officers are deployed to keep the peace.

headline: ‘Beautiful’ and ‘Lovely’: Trump Tweets Reflect Fixation on Women’s Appearances
teaser: The president’s comments on Lisa Page and Nellie Ohr made clear his disdain for the two women, who have connections to the Russia inquiry.

headline: For Voters Sick of Money in Politics, a New Pitch: No PAC Money Accepted
teaser: A flurry of Democratic candidates are refusing to take contributions from groups sponsored by corporations, unions or even other politicians, relying instead on individual donors. And voters are responding.

headline: Omarosa Manigault Newman Taped Her Firing by John Kelly
teaser: The recording, played on “Meet the Press,” revealed the White House chief of staff suggesting that she could face damage to her reputation if she did not leave quietly.

headline: Voting Rights Advocates Used to Have an Ally in the Government. That’s Changing.
teaser: The Obama Justice Department fought voter-ID laws, aggressive purges of voter rolls and dilution of minority votes. Under President Trump, the department often does the opposite.

headline: Trump and Comey Had ‘No Conversation About Michael Flynn,’ Giuliani Says
teaser: The statement by Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trump’s lawyer, contradicted a memo by James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, as well as his own previous comments.

headline: Trump’s Tariffs Foster Crisis at the W.T.O.
teaser: The Trump administration has forced the World Trade Organization into the difficult position of ruling on the security interests of its most powerful members.

headline: The Rise and Fall of Paul Manafort: Greed, Deception and Ego
teaser: The former Trump campaign chairman’s trial has ripped away the facade of a man who worked for the campaign at no charge, intimating he was too rich to need the money.

headline: The New Health Care: The Large Hidden Costs of Medicare’s Prescription Drug Program
teaser: Premiums have risen very little in the years since Medicare Part D was introduced. But the same cannot be said of the burden on taxpayers.

headline: ‘Don’t Run This Year.’ The Perils for Republican Women Facing a Flood of Resistance
teaser: The energy in the midterms is working against female Republican candidates who are reluctant or unable to claim any advantage to being a woman among voters.

headline: Peter Strzok, F.B.I. Agent Who Criticized Trump in Texts, Is Fired
teaser: Mr. Strzok was one of the F.B.I.’s top counterintelligence officials. But his disparaging texts about President Trump handed a weapon to conservatives assailing the Russia investigation.

headline: Manafort Trial’s Spectators: ‘Why Go to Cancun’ When You Can See History?
teaser: The trial of Paul Manafort in Alexandria, Va., has drawn an eclectic mix of lawyers, tourists and political junkies determined to witness a little piece of history.

headline: Representative Keith Ellison Denies Abuse Allegations About Ex-Girlfriend
teaser: Mr. Ellison, Democrat of Minnesota, has denied allegations that he had emotionally and physically abused a former girlfriend, Karen Monahan.

headline: Trump Appears to Admit White House Aides Signed Nondisclosure Agreements
teaser: A tweet disparaging Omarosa Manigault Newman, a former aide, appeared to confirm the highly unusual agreements, which officials have declined to acknowledge for months.

headline: Trump Talks for 28 Minutes on Bill Named for John McCain. Not Mentioned: McCain.
teaser: The president avoided reading the name of the military spending bill — which would have meant mentioning the ailing senator and Trump critic — during his speech or the signing ceremony.

headline: Family Feud Breaks Out Between Judiciary Committee Chairman and Son
teaser: In a pair of tweets, Representative Robert W. Goodlatte’s son made it clear he wants change: “I’m deeply embarrassed” by “my father’s grandstanding.”

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Goes for Broke on Claim Military Received No Money Before His Watch. (He’s Still Wrong.)
teaser: While signing the annual funding bill, President Trump inaccurately claimed that the amount was “historic” and the military had “never” previously received funding.

headline: Stephen Miller’s Uncle Calls Him a Hypocrite in an Online Essay
teaser: The article is a notable rebuke by a family member to Mr. Miller, who is one of the most fervent public defenders of President Trump’s immigration policies.

headline: Special Forces Soldier Dies After Roadside Bomb Attack in Afghanistan
teaser: The explosion wounded several Afghans and at least one other American, according to two military officials.

headline: This Former ‘Teacher of the Year’ Wants to Be Connecticut’s First Black Democrat in Congress
teaser: A conversation with Jahana Hayes, whose grass-roots campaign has made her a formidable challenger in Tuesday’s close primary race.

headline: 4 States Are Voting on Tuesday. Here’s What to Watch.
teaser: A look at the most important primaries in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Connecticut and Vermont.

headline: For Rashida Tlaib, Palestinian Heritage Infuses a Detroit Sense of Community
teaser: Ms. Tlaib, who won a Democratic primary in Michigan, may become the first Muslim woman in Congress. She said her upbringing shaped her political vision.

headline: Trump Calls Omarosa Manigault Newman ‘That Dog’
teaser: In Twitter posts, the president attacked the former aide who has written a book about her time in the White House, calling her a “crazed, crying lowlife.”

headline: Trump’s Trade War Is Rattling China’s Leaders
teaser: While President Xi Jinping remains firmly in charge, friction with the Trump administration and troubles at home have dented his political dominance.

headline: Kavanaugh Could Unlock Funding for Religious Education, School Voucher Advocates Say
teaser: Brett M. Kavanaugh’s confirmation to the Supreme Court could advance efforts to make publicly funded vouchers available to students attending religious schools.

headline: Manafort Lawyers Rest Without Calling Witnesses in Fraud Trial
teaser: Defense lawyers did not present any witnesses in Paul Manafort’s trial, while prosecutors called roughly two dozen.

headline: Trump Claims Power to Bypass Limits Set by Congress in Defense Bill
teaser: In the latest example of his broad vision of executive power, President Trump used a signing statement to challenge dozens of provisions, including limits on Russia and North Korea.

headline: Trump Campaign Says It Has Filed Case Against Omarosa Manigault Newman
teaser: The arbitration case is a major escalation in the president’s fight with his former aide, whose tell-all book and audio recordings are roiling the White House.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: White House Falsely Claims Trump Has Created More Jobs for Black Americans Than Obama Did
teaser: Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the White House press secretary, said the economy added only 195,000 jobs for African-Americans under President Barack Obama. In fact, it added about three million.

headline: The New York Times Joins Effort to Combat Trump’s Anti-Press Rhetoric
teaser: An initiative started by The Boston Globe has enlisted more than 200 newspapers nationwide to publish editorials on Thursday in favor of the news media.

headline: U.S.-Turkey Tensions Could Stall Progress Against ISIS, Officials Say
teaser: Joint operations between American and Turkish troops are still being planned. But officials worry about Turkey’s reliability as a battlefield partner.

headline: Pentagon Spokeswoman Is Under Investigation Over Staff Complaints of Retaliation
teaser: The inquiry centers on Dana White’s decision to transfer aides after they filed complaints about her. She also used her staff to fetch dry cleaning and run other errands, according to a news report.

headline: Colyer Concedes in Kansas, Handing Governor’s Nomination to Kobach
teaser: Mr. Kobach, a lightning rod for his views on voting rights and immigration, had raised concerns among Republicans that he would alienate moderate voters.

headline: Groundbreaking Night for Women and Diversity, While a Trump Critic Falls
teaser: Tim Pawlenty, who had called the president ‘unsound,’ lost a Republican governor’s race in Minnesota, while a Muslim woman and a transgender candidate prevailed elsewhere

headline: In Connecticut, Ned Lamont Scores a Decisive Win, and Jahana Hayes Moves Closer to History
teaser: Mr. Lamont won the Democratic primary for governor, while Ms. Hayes’s win moved her closer to being the state’s first black Democrat in Congress.

headline: Christine Hallquist, a Transgender Woman, Wins Vermont Governor’s Primary
teaser: Ms. Hallquist, a Democrat, became the first transgender candidate to be nominated for a governorship by a major party.

headline: Frozen Out by Obama, Hungary’s Far-Right Leader Finds a Friend in Trump
teaser: Prime Minister Viktor Orban joins a growing roster of right-wing or euroskeptic leaders in Europe to have secured President Trump’s backing.

headline: 4 Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primaries
teaser: On another night of primaries leading up to November’s midterm elections, Democrats embraced diversity (with some notable exceptions) and Republicans rewarded loyalty to President Trump.

headline: Democrats Discard Washington Platform in Bid for House Control
teaser: Unlike 1994 and its “Contract With America” or 2006 and its “Six for ’06,” this midterm campaign will not feature a centralized message from the party seeking control of the House.

headline: 3 Days on the Road With the Parkland Activists
teaser: They’re registering voters. They’re spotlighting the work of local organizers. They’re talking about all forms of gun violence.

headline: Hallquist on Primary Win: ‘We Already Made History’
teaser: Christine Hallquist, a Democrat from Vermont, is the first transgender candidate to be nominated for a governorship by a major party.

headline: Sanders Can’t ‘Guarantee’ That Trump Hasn’t Used N-Word
teaser: The White House Press Secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, said that President Trump had denied using the racial slur and that he had never used it in her presence.

headline: Turkey Rejects 2nd Appeal to Release U.S. Pastor Andrew Brunson
teaser: Ankara also sharply raised tariffs on American-made alcohol, cars and tobacco, ramping up the trade dispute between the countries.

headline: Trump Administration Sanctions Companies Helping North Korea
teaser: The sanctions were ordered against three organizations and an individual accused of facilitating illicit shipments to North Korea.

headline: Primary Wins Bring a Night of ‘Firsts’
teaser: Diverse candidates in Connecticut, Minnesota and Vermont advanced to the general election, potentially setting them up for historic wins in November.

headline: Is Trump a Regular Guy? Yes, an Ex-Aide Says, Sometimes He Drives His Rolls-Royce
teaser: Corey Lewandowski, the president’s former campaign manager, told stories about a Rolls-Royce and a platinum American Express card in explaining how the president understands regular people.

headline: Evidence Against Manafort Is ‘Overwhelming,’ Prosecutors Say
teaser: In closing arguments, the special counsel’s office described Paul Manafort, the former Trump campaign chairman, as well versed in financial matters and motivated to commit fraud.

headline: Trump Revokes Ex-C.I.A. Director John Brennan’s Security Clearance
teaser: The White House cited “erratic” behavior by Mr. Brennan, who has frequently been a fierce critic of the president.

headline: Christine Hallquist on Her Primary Victory: ‘It Gives the Transgender Community Hope’
teaser: Ms. Hallquist, a Vermont Democrat, made history Tuesday night by becoming the first transgender nominee for governor from either major party. She spoke to The Times the next morning.

headline: Cuomo Says ‘America Was Never That Great’ in Jab at Trump Slogan
teaser: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s remark drew immediate criticism from his Republican opponent, Marcus Molinaro, who said the governor owed the nation an apology.

headline: Anomaly or Omen? A House Republican Tells Voters He ‘Stood Up’ to Trump
teaser: With many Republicans courting the president and others afraid to criticize him, an Ohio congressman has gingerly created a small crack in the wall, risking Trumpian wrath.

headline: Big City: Ignore, Condescend, Dismiss: Debate Playbook for Men Facing Women
teaser: An offer to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez highlights how male candidates often use debates to diminish female opponents, perhaps increasingly at their peril.

headline: Jahana Hayes Was Told She ‘Had No Chance.’ She, and Voters, Beg to Differ.
teaser: Overcoming a life of early poverty and homelessness, Ms. Hayes is now poised to become the first black Democrat to represent Connecticut in Congress.

headline: Fact Check: Was the U.S. Actually ‘Built on Tariffs,’ as Trump Says?
teaser: We took a look at the evidence for President Trump’s claim, which appeared to refer to a period starting in the late 19th century.

headline: Bannon’s New Group Issues a Midterm Plea: Save Trump
teaser: The group is Stephen K. Bannon’s new vehicle since he was pushed out of the White House last year. Trump advisers say Mr. Bannon is just promoting himself.

headline: Little-Known Justice Dept. Official Makes Trump’s Security Clearance List
teaser: Critics said the inclusion of Bruce Ohr on the list of those whose clearances were revoked or under review was an abuse of presidential power and an intrusion on the independence of law enforcement.

headline: In a Proxy Fight for the Party’s Future, a New Face Presses Her Democratic Opponent
teaser: In their final debate in a Massachusetts congressional race, Ayanna Pressley challenges Michael Capuano over abortion funding, Trump’s wall and gun control.

headline: In Kentucky House Race, a Battle of Ideology vs. Résumé
teaser: A year ago, Representative Andy Barr was thought to hold a safe House Republican seat in Kentucky. Then came the candidacy of the Democrat Amy McGrath.

headline: The Questions the Jurors in the Manafort Trial Will Be Asking
teaser: In weighing whether to find Paul Manafort guilty or not of financial fraud charges, jurors will have to take into account evidence, witness credibility and other factors.

headline: Pelosi Talks of ‘Bridge’ to New Leader as Democrats Test Her Strength
teaser: Nancy Pelosi, the House Democratic leader, is confronting threats from different corners of her party, posing the most serious test of her 15-year grip on the caucus

headline: Melania Trump’s Parents Ignite Debate Over ‘Chain Migration’
teaser: Readers debate who deserves to get a family visa to immigrate to the U.S., citing as examples their own families’ stories and the stories of families they know.

headline: Trump Says Newspapers Are ‘in Collusion’ on Championing a Free Press
teaser: The president lashed out after more than 200 newspapers, including The New York Times, published editorials about the dangers of the Trump administration’s repeated attacks on the news media.

headline: Ex-C.I.A. Director John Brennan Strikes Back After Trump Revokes His Security Clearance
teaser: The White House cited “erratic” behavior by Mr. Brennan, who has frequently been a fierce critic of the president.

headline: A New U.S. Post to Pressure Iran, and a Stark Challenge Ahead
teaser: The job of special envoy will be filled by Brian Hook, who said withdrawing from the 2015 nuclear accord has opened new avenues of diplomacy despite strained relations with Europe.

headline: U.S. and China to Rekindle Trade Talks as More Tariffs Loom
teaser: The meeting, to be held in Washington this month between midlevel officials, comes as the Trump administration is preparing more tariffs on Chinese goods.

headline: Gender Letter: When the Resistance Meets the Polls: A Historic Week for Women Politicians
teaser: In an election year already dominated by a surge of women, and L.G.B.T. candidates, this week’s Democratic primary signaled that zeal is translating into votes.

headline: Cuomo vs. Nixon? He’d Rather Campaign Against Trump
teaser: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s motivation behind his recent attacks on the president has more to do with his re-election this year than any ambitions in 2020.

headline: Trump’s Military Parade Could Be Postponed Until 2019, Official Says
teaser: The decision came as Defense Department officials said that the event could cost more than $90 million.

headline: Omarosa Manigault Newman Releases Tape of Lara Trump’s $15,000-a-Month Job Offer
teaser: The audio is the latest in the trickle of recordings that Ms. Manigault Newman has made public to bolster the credibility of her book, “Unhinged.”

headline: Education Department Opens Civil Rights Inquiry Into Abuse at Ohio State
teaser: The inquiry keeps a harsh spotlight on the university, drawing additional scrutiny to how officials handled claims of sexual misconduct by a team doctor.

headline: For News Media, a Day of Solidarity in a Summer of Unease
teaser: Job losses, insults from Mr. Trump and threats have made this a difficult time for many journalists. On Thursday, more than 300 publications responded.

headline: Democrats Question Kavanaugh’s Testimony About Bush Nominee
teaser: Democrats say that files from the Bush White House show that President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee played a significant role in a nomination he distanced himself from.

headline: Manafort Jurors Ask for Definition of Reasonable Doubt
teaser: The jury deciding the fate of President Trump’s ex-campaign chairman ended its first day of deliberations with four written questions to the judge. The answers might have been less than satisfying.

headline: White House Memo: Once Dry Discussions, Cabinet Meetings Are Now Part of the Trump Show
teaser: The president alternates between gentle and pointed quizzing of his cabinet secretaries in a ritual with a story line that has become almost comically consistent.

headline: North Korea Presses Demand for End of War Amid Talk of Pompeo Visit
teaser: South Korea’s leader indicated that Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was preparing for his fourth visit to the North.

headline: In a Divided Era, One Thing Seems to Unite: Political Anger
teaser: Disputes over politics have divided Americans’ homes, strained marriages, ruined friendships and invaded the workplace.

headline: Giving Others a Voice in Congress, One Hand-Delivered Letter at a Time
teaser: Since President Trump’s inauguration, a group of Washington-based volunteers have spent their lunch breaks and after-work hours delivering over 12,000 letters to Capitol Hill.

headline: A New Film Compares Democrats to Nazis and Trump to Lincoln. At This Screening, It Was a Hit.
teaser: Attendees at a viewing party in Ohio said the film, from the conservative provocateur Dinesh D’Souza, was a confirmation of a worldview they feel is often ridiculed.

headline: Some States Sitting on Piles of Cash, and Cities Want a Cut
teaser: States like Ohio are placing their surpluses in rainy-day funds, but cities that have suffered because of cuts since the recession say it is time to loosen up.

headline: Melania Trump, a Mysterious First Lady, Weathers a Chaotic White House
teaser: On many matters, Mrs. Trump has directed her East Wing to operate independently of the West Wing, and she is still keeping Washington at a distance.

headline: Trump Asks S.E.C. to Study Quarterly Earnings Requirements for Public Firms
teaser: The president said that he wants the Securities and Exchange Commission to weigh letting companies report results just twice a year.

headline: Revoking Clearance, Trump Aims Presidential Power at Russia Inquiry
teaser: The move to revoke John Brennan’s security clearance may be the latest sign that the president is determined to punish anyone connected to the Russia investigation.

headline: Meet the Special Counsel Team: So Careful They Won’t Even Disclose Their Shake Shack Orders
teaser: The trial of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, has provided the public with its first extended glimpse of Robert S. Mueller III’s investigators.

headline: Trump Cancels Military Parade, Blaming Washington Officials for Inflating Costs
teaser: The president said local politicians “wanted a number so ridiculously high” that he canceled a planned parade that the Pentagon had already postponed.

headline: Want to Be President? Just Ask Iowans
teaser: One year before the 2020 candidates descend on the Iowa State Fair, attendees had some ideas on how the would-be presidents might win their votes.

headline: She’s Trying to Pull an Ocasio-Cortez. Her Target: Pete King.
teaser: Liuba Grechen Shirley, a Democratic newcomer campaigning as a working mother, is trying to take down New York’s most visible Republican congressman.

headline: Embracing Conspiracy Theory, Trump Escalates Attack on Bruce Ohr
teaser: President Trump threatened to revoke “very soon” the security clearance of the little-known Justice Department official, who has been accused of having helped start the Russia investigation.

headline: Trade War Worries Iowa Republicans in a Close House Race
teaser: In a region where farm troubles can ripple through the economy, even backers of President Trump are wary of the damage a tariff battle could cause.

headline: Trump Calls Manafort Trial ‘Sad,’ but Is Quiet on a Possible Pardon
teaser: The jury in the financial fraud trial of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, deliberated for a second day without reaching a verdict.

headline: Booming Economy May Be Little Felt as Voters Decide
teaser: Republicans say the economy will help them in November. Democrats say it won’t. New data says the full story is more complicated.

headline: Alex Jones of Infowars Destroyed Evidence Related to Sandy Hook Suits, Motion Says
teaser: A motion filed on behalf of a Sandy Hook victim’s father accused Mr. Jones, who is being sued for spreading false claims about the 2012 school shooting, of deleting videos and social media posts.

headline: U.S. Will Not Spend $230 Million Allocated to Repair Devastated Syrian Cities
teaser: The decision is the United States’ latest step back from a seven-year war that has been largely won by a brutal government and its Russian and Iranian backers.

headline: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Myanmar Military Over Rohingya Atrocities
teaser: The penalties, for what the Treasury Department called ethnic cleansing and other human rights abuses, target four Burmese military and border guard commanders and two military units.

headline: Canada on the Sidelines as U.S. and Mexico Near an Agreement on Nafta
teaser: The United States and Mexico are making progress, but the trade talks still exclude America’s closer political and economic partner.

headline: Justice Dept. Backs Suit Accusing Facebook of Violating Fair Housing Act
teaser: The department suggested Facebook could be held liable if housing providers used the site’s targeting tools to discriminate against prospective renters and buyers in advertising their properties.

headline: Trump’s Plan for Coal Emissions: Let Coal States Regulate Them
teaser: President Trump is planning an overhaul of climate regulations that lets states set their own rules, according to people who have seen the proposal. Environmentalists say emissions could rise.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From revoked security clearances to the Manafort trial, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are five of the biggest stories (and some links if you want to read further).

headline: Judge Bars Statements Made by Guantánamo Detainees During F.B.I. Interrogations
teaser: The decision could be a major setback for the effort to prosecute the five detainees who are accused of aiding the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

headline: Accusing Trump Adviser of Repeatedly Lying to Investigators, Mueller Asks for Jail Time
teaser: In a memo filed Friday evening, Robert Mueller said that George Papadopoulos’s attempts to mislead the F.B.I. had a significant effect on the investigation into Russian election interference.

headline: Trump Has Attacked the Russia Inquiry Over 250 Times. Here Is What’s True.
teaser: We assessed President Trump’s claims about Russia’s interference in the 2016 election and the ensuing federal investigation of his campaign.

headline: States Rush to Rein In Prescription Costs, and Drug Companies Fight Back
teaser: Without waiting for Congress or the Trump administration, states have passed many laws to hold down drug prices, over the objections of manufacturers.

headline: Trump Accuses Social Media Firms of Discrimination Against Conservatives
teaser: After a string of crackdowns on the platforms, President Trump vowed to prevent voices aligned with his administration from being removed.

headline: Tax Cuts Are a Hit With One Pivotal G.O.P. Group: Rich Donors
teaser: Republicans may be struggling to sell their $1.5 trillion tax cut to voters, but the law has helped unleash tens of millions from donors who benefited handsomely from it.

headline: White House Counsel Has Cooperated Extensively With Mueller’s Obstruction Inquiry
teaser: The White House counsel, Donald F. McGahn II, was a witness to key episodes being scrutinized in the case. His cooperation with investigators is unusual.

headline: Trump Won Pennsylvania. Democrats Want the State (and His Voters) Back.
teaser: With its redrawn congressional map and working class union towns, the state has found itself at the center of Democrats’ plans to win control of the House of Representatives.

headline: On Washington: How the Senate Got Its Groove Back With the Power of the Purse
teaser: While the Senate may be at odds over the Supreme Court vacancy, it is trying, for the first time in years, to advance funding bills the old-fashioned way.

headline: Trump Attacks New York Times Report on Don McGahn’s Cooperation With Mueller
teaser: President Trump said that The Times had falsely implied that the White House counsel “turned” on him. The newspaper said it stood by its report.

headline: As Trump Dismantles Clean Air Rules, an Industry Lawyer Delivers for Ex-Clients
teaser: The top air pollution official in the Trump administration had been a lawyer for polluting industries. They are now benefiting from his new role.

headline: There Is More to Stacey Abrams Than Meets Partisan Eyes
teaser: As minority leader in Georgia State House, Ms. Abrams, the Democratic nominee for governor, showed both a penchant for standing on liberal principle and a willingness to negotiate with Republicans.

headline: Trump Lawyers’ Sudden Realization: They Don’t Know What Don McGahn Told Mueller’s Team
teaser: The lapse has contributed to a growing recognition that an early strategy of full cooperation with the inquiry was a potentially damaging mistake.

headline: Giuliani Says ‘Truth Isn’t Truth’ in Defense of Trump’s Legal Strategy
teaser: President Trump’s personal lawyer, Rudolph Giuliani, made the comment on “Meet the Press” on Sunday in response to a question about a potential interview by the special counsel.

headline: Cohen, Trump’s Ex-Lawyer, Investigated for Bank Fraud in Excess of $20 Million
teaser: The inquiry, which could deal a significant blow to President Trump, is entering the final stages, and charges against Michael D. Cohen could come by the end of August.

headline: How Sexism Follows Women From the Cradle to the Workplace
teaser: New economic research suggests that the attitudes toward a woman when she is born have a lasting impact on how much she works, and earns, as an adult.

headline: Sidebar: Two U.S. Agents Fired Into Mexico, Killing Teenagers. Only One Faces a Lawsuit.
teaser: The Supreme Court has been asked to decide whether American officials may be sued for cross-border shootings after lower courts reached opposite conclusions.

headline: A Corrupt Lobbyist’s Influence in the Cuomo Administration Is Revealed in Newly Disclosed Emails
teaser: New York spent more than $200,000 in legal fees to try to keep nearly 350 pages of the emails secret.

headline: Melania Trump Called for Good Behavior on Social Media. The President Unleashed More Attacks on Twitter.
teaser: Another day of dissonant messaging unfolded from the Trump White House.

headline: Minnesota Democrats Targeted in Ads Citing Allegations Against Keith Ellison
teaser: An ad campaign launched on Monday by a conservative super PAC used abuse allegations against Rep. Keith Ellison to attack the credibility of four Minnesota Democrats.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh Urged Graphic Questions in Clinton Probe
teaser: A newly released memo shows that Brett M. Kavanaugh took a relentlessly tough stance as a young lawyer investigating President Clinton’s affair with an intern.

headline: Pentagon Says an American is Killed in Helicopter Crash in Iraq
teaser: Several other troops were injured in the crash that followed a joint counterterrorism operation in Iraq.

headline: ‘Abolish ICE’ Movement ‘Catering to the Extreme Elements,’ Trump Says
teaser: Writing to state and local leaders, the president denounced Democrats who have called for the elimination of Immigration and Customs Enforcement as enablers of lawlessness and anarchy.

headline: Trump Attacks Justice Dept. Official, and Sessions for Not Firing Him
teaser: President Trump issued a subtle challenge to the attorney general to fire Bruce Ohr, a civil servant who is on a list of people the president was considering stripping of their security clearances.

headline: Trump Complains to Donors About Fed Chairman’s Raising of Interest Rates
teaser: At a fund-raiser in the Hamptons, President Trump said that he had expected Jerome H. Powell to adhere to an easy-money monetary policy, by keeping interest rates low, when he nominated him.

headline: U.S. Criticism of ‘Suspected’ Nuclear Sites May Derail Talks, North Korean Media Warns
teaser: North Korean officials urged President Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to push aside hard-liners and move ahead with diplomacy.

headline: Why Did Gabby Giffords Endorse 2 Republicans in New Jersey?
teaser: The former Democratic congresswoman is supporting Representatives Leonard Lance and Chris Smith based on their gun control records in Washington.

headline: Trump Praises Border Patrol Agent for Speaking ‘Perfect English’
teaser: President Trump made the remark during a White House event honoring employees of Immigration and Customs Enforcement and Customs and Border Protection.

headline: Leonard Boswell, Veterans’ Champion in the House, Dies at 84
teaser: A former career Army officer who saw combat in Vietnam, he sponsored a veterans suicide-prevention act. As a farmer, he focused on agricultural issues.

headline: ‘Truth Isn’t Truth’ and ‘Alternative Facts’: A White House Defense Strategy
teaser: The Trump administration has used some unusual phrases to defend its positions in the news media. Here is a closer look at a few of these remarks.

headline: Remember John W. Dean, a Watergate Informant? He’s Back in the Limelight
teaser: President Trump referenced Mr. Dean, who served as President Richard Nixon’s White House counsel, in a tweet defending his current White House counsel, Donald F. McGahn II.

headline: Companies Warn More China Tariffs Will Cripple Them and Hurt Consumers
teaser: The Trump administration, which will hold trade talks with the Chinese this week, began six days of hearings on its proposal to tax another $200 billion worth of Chinese goods.

headline: New E.P.A. Rollback of Coal Pollution Regulations Takes a Major Step Forward
teaser: The E.P.A.’s acting chief has signed a proposal that would all but erase former President Barack Obama’s efforts to impose controls on greenhouse gasses from coal plants.

headline: New Russian Hacking Targeted Republican Groups, Microsoft Says
teaser: Microsoft was surprised not that recent “spear phishing” attempts had occurred, but that they targeted traditional conservative think tanks. Those groups have been critical of Russia.

headline: The Bipartisan Cry of ‘Not in My Backyard’
teaser: The housing secretary wants to encourage mixed-income, multifamily development as a way of making housing more affordable. But it’s a notion homeowners of all political leanings tend to oppose.

headline: Levi Sanders Is Not His Father. He Keeps Telling That to Voters.
teaser: Bernie Sanders’s son is running for a House seat in New Hampshire. The name is familiar, and so are the mannerisms. But, he is quick to remind voters, “I am my own person.”

headline: Alaska and Wyoming Are Voting Today. Here’s What to Watch.
teaser: Gov. Bill Walker is running for re-election in Alaska, as are Senator John Barrasso and Representative Liz Cheney in Wyoming.

headline: Alaska and Wyoming Are Voting Today. Here’s What to Watch.
teaser: Gov. Bill Walker is running for re-election in Alaska, as are Senator John Barrasso and Representative Liz Cheney in Wyoming.

headline: In Wyoming Governor’s Race, a Wealthy Conservative Donor Tries on a New Hat: Candidate
teaser: A conversation with Foster Friess, who was an early supporter of President Trump. He’s now one of six Republicans competing in a primary on Tuesday.

headline: E.P.A.’s Rollback of Coal Pollution Rules Will Lead to More Deaths, Its Numbers Show
teaser: The Trump administration unveiled its rewrite of pollution rules for coal-fired power plants, and its analysis shows an increase of up to 1,400 premature deaths annually.

headline: New U.S. Sanctions Target Russia for Defying Rules on North Korea
teaser: The administration’s targets include ships that were transferring oil to North Korean vessels, which imported the oil despite international sanctions.

headline: Jury in Paul Manafort Trial Suggests It Is Divided on One of 18 Counts
teaser: Jurors sent the judge a note asking how to fill out the verdict sheet if they cannot come to agreement on one of the fraud charges against Mr. Manafort.

headline: Facing New Russian Hacking, Senators Signal They Are Ready to Act
teaser: After Microsoft revealed a new Russian attack on American democratic institutions, senators in competing hearings signaled they are ready to punish the Kremlin.

headline: ‘Silent Sam’ Confederate Statue Pulled Down in North Carolina
teaser: The monument has been a divisive symbol on the campus of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Its toppling was cheered by protesters who called it a tribute to white supremacy.

headline: Kavanaugh Agrees Roe v. Wade Is ‘Settled Law,’ Susan Collins Says
teaser: The vote of Ms. Collins, a Maine Republican who back abortion rights, is critical to the confirmation of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court pick.

headline: White House Pledges Aggressive Midterm Campaign Plan for Trump
teaser: Officials said the president would participate in at least eight rallies over the next six weeks, several in places that are home to vulnerable Democratic senators, and as many as 16 fund-raisers.

headline: Paul Manafort Convicted in Fraud Trial
teaser: The verdict was a victory for the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, whose inquiry has drawn withering criticism from President Trump.

headline: Thomas Hofeller, Republican Master of Political Maps, Dies at 75
teaser: He had a crucial role in the Republican Party’s resurgence in Congress and state legislatures. In the South, he helped upend decades of Democratic rule.

headline: Michael Cohen Leaves Court After Guilty Plea
teaser: The former personal lawyer to President Trump pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations, as well as multiple counts of tax evasion and bank fraud.

headline: Trump Responds to Manafort Conviction
teaser: President Trump told reporters in West Virginia that Paul Manafort was a “good man” and that his conviction “has nothing to do with Russian collusion.”

headline: Red Flags for Immigrant Recruits: Calling Parents, Not Laughing at Jokes
teaser: Records detail the reasons, some seemingly trivial or erroneous, that the Army has been labeling immigrant recruits security risks.

headline: ‘We Have Some Breaking News’: A Wild Day Makes Networks Scramble
teaser: Over the course of a whipsawing hour of television, journalists struggled to keep up with developments involving Paul Manafort and Michael Cohen.

headline: Representative Duncan Hunter Is Indicted, Accused of Misusing Campaign Funds
teaser: Mr. Hunter, accused of spending tens of thousands of dollars on personal expenses like family trips and tuition, became the second Republican congressman indicted this month.

headline: Cohen Implicates President Trump. What Do Prosecutors Do Now?
teaser: The Justice Department has long said that sitting presidents can’t be indicted. But impeachment remains an option.

headline: Cohen, Manafort and Trump: What’s Next?
teaser: Mr. Cohen pleaded guilty to breaking campaign finance laws. Mr. Manafort, was convicted in his financial fraud trial. Can Mr. Trump pardon them? And how does this affect him?

headline: A One-Two Punch Puts Trump Back on His Heels
teaser: The conviction of Paul Manafort and guilty plea by Michael D. Cohen could open fissures among Republicans on Capitol Hill and expose President Trump to the possibility of impeachment.

headline: Michael Cohen Says He Arranged Payments to Women at Trump’s Direction
teaser: Mr. Cohen made the admission as he pleaded guilty to tax evasion, bank fraud and campaign finance violations in federal court in Manhattan.

headline: Takeaways From the Conviction of Paul Manafort
teaser: A jury found Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, guilty on eight counts of financial and tax fraud. Here are the biggest takeaways.

headline: Wyoming Republicans Renominate Senator John Barrasso
teaser: Voters in Alaska and Wyoming were also casting ballots on Tuesday in primaries for governor.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s False Claims About Coal, the Environment and West Virginia
teaser: President Trump claimed that coal was “indestructible,” that West Virginia had one of the strongest state economies and that the U.S. was the “cleanest country in the planet.” None of that was true.

headline: Trump’s New Pollution Rules Still Won’t Save the Coal Industry
teaser: At best, the Environmental Protection Agency’s new proposal could help a few coal plants stave off retirement for a short while longer.

headline: News Analysis: Cohen and Manafort Are in Deeper Legal Trouble. Mueller Could Benefit.
teaser: The conviction of Paul Manafort and the guilty plea of Michael D. Cohen, while unrelated to the central questions of the Mueller inquiry, could lead to cooperation with the special counsel.

headline: With Cohen Implicating Trump, a Presidency’s Fate Rests With Congress
teaser: For now, the G.O.P. continues to stand by Mr. Trump. But with only weeks until the midterms, the question will soon be put before voters, who will decide whether to hand Congress to the Democrats.

headline: Feature: When the Supreme Court Lurches Right
teaser: What happens when the Supreme Court becomes significantly more conservative than the public?

headline: Feature: How the Trump Administration Is Remaking the Courts
teaser: Thanks to ruthless discipline — and a plan long in the making — the G.O.P is carrying out a sweeping transformation of the federal judiciary.

headline: Chinese State TV Mocks Trump in Sarcastic Video
teaser: A video takes direct aim at President Trump, portraying him as a bumbling leader who is indirectly advancing China’s interests.

headline: Overwhelmed by the Cohen and Manafort News? We’ll Catch You Up
teaser: The dust had barely settled from one revelation about a Trump associate when another landed almost immediately on Tuesday. Here’s a guide to our coverage.

headline: Trump Praises Manafort for Refusing to ‘Break,’ Unlike Cohen, His Former Fixer
teaser: The president wrote that he had “such respect for a brave man,” Paul Manafort, who was convicted of tax and financial fraud.

headline: Robert H. Ferrell, Authority on Truman, Is Dead at 97
teaser: The consummate Truman scholar wrote or edited a dozen books about the 33rd president, including collections of his diaries and letters.

headline: Democratic Party Says It Has Thwarted Attempted Hack of Voter Database
teaser: The D.N.C. this week contacted the F.B.I. about the attempted hack, which was not successful.

headline: The Indictment of Duncan Hunter, Explained
teaser: Prosecutors claim Representative Duncan Hunter and his wife spent over $250,000 of campaign funds on personal items. Here is an explanation of the indictment filed on Tuesday.

headline: Blame Trump’s Tariffs and the Weather. New York’s Farmers Do.
teaser: Farmers say a drought, flooding, a trade war and a tightening immigration policy have led to economic woes that are forcing many to question their future.

headline: Long-Secret Report on Leaks From Starr Inquiry May Be Released
teaser: The 1999 report is said to have criticized disclosures to news outlets by Ken Starr’s team, which included Brett Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee.

headline: State of the Art: Can Facebook, or Anybody, Solve the Internet’s Misinformation Problem?
teaser: Facebook showed it was proactive against online threats when it revealed new global influence campaigns this week. But being proactive is far from finding a solution.

headline: Snaring Doctors and Drug Dealers, Justice Dept. Intensifies Opioid Fight
teaser: After the president asked for a crackdown on suppliers, Attorney General Jeff Sessions announced cases that spanned from Ohio to China to the “dark web.”

headline: Trump’s Tariffs Are Paying Off for Century Aluminum
teaser: The company is expanding and growing under the president’s tariffs after lobbying the government for years for help to combat foreign metals.

headline: On Washington: As Bad News Piles Up, Republicans Hardly Flinch
teaser: Party leaders found several reasons to look past the legal actions against Trump insiders, even as the president himself was implicated.

headline: ‘How Did We End Up Here?’ Trump Wonders as the White House Soldiers On
teaser: President Trump, a man who has in the past relished the idea of leading his troops into political battle, seemed subdued as he grappled with two legal setbacks.

headline: When Is an Offense Impeachable? Look to the Framers for the Answer
teaser: The constitutional convention in 1787 focused on corrupt conduct used to gain the presidency in drafting the impeachment clause.

headline: The Developments With Manafort and Cohen Explained
teaser: Our investigative reporter who spent 16 days covering the Paul Manafort trial, Sharon LaFraniere, answers our readers’ questions on Manafort’s conviction and Cohen’s guilty plea.

headline: Anatomy of a Crime: Sex, Hush Money and a Trump Fixer’s Guilty Plea
teaser: Coordinating with Michael Cohen, a tabloid giant turned its tip line into a trip wire for negative stories that could hurt the Trump campaign, prosecutors said.

headline: Betsy DeVos Is Said to Weigh Letting School Districts Use Federal Funds to Buy Guns
teaser: The Education Department may let school districts use money meant for academic enrichment to buy guns, officials with knowledge of the plan say.

headline: Trump Wants Pompeo to Study ‘Killing of Farmers’ in South Africa
teaser: President Trump commented on South African plans to seize some land without compensation, coming to the defense of “white farmers” and claiming without evidence that there had been “large scale killings.”

headline: Trump, Familiar With ‘Flipping’ Under Legal Pressure, Says It ‘Almost Ought to Be Illegal’
teaser: President Trump’s comment on “flippers” illustrates why his views diverge on former associates in legal trouble: Michael Cohen and Paul Manafort.

headline: Attempted Hacking of Voter Database Was a False Alarm, Democratic Party Says
teaser: The Democratic National Committee says suspicious activity was merely a test.

headline: Cynthia Nixon Says She Can Win. But Who Are Her Voters?
teaser: Polls show Ms. Nixon trailing far behind Gov. Andrew Cuomo. But her campaign insists she’s reaching a new electorate not captured by the old metrics.

headline: Holdout in Manafort Jury Blocked Guilty Verdicts on 10 of 18 Charges, Juror Says
teaser: “We laid it out in front of her again and again,” a juror, Paula Duncan, told Fox News. “She still said she had reasonable doubt.”

headline: Betsy DeVos Eyes Federal Education Grants to Put Guns in Schools
teaser: The Education Department is considering allowing states to tap a fund for educational reform and improvement to buy guns for educators, a use not approved by Congress.

headline: Corporate Chiefs Say Trump’s Immigration Policies Are Hurting U.S. Economy
teaser: Timothy D Cook of Apple, Ginni Rometty of IBM and dozens of other C.E.O.s said new guidelines and practices were hindering skilled foreign workers.

headline: Pompeo Will Return to North Korea Next Week With Reinforcement
teaser: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced Thursday that he would travel to North Korea next week and bring with him a new special envoy to Pyongyang.

headline: Alice Dunnigan, First Black Woman to Cover White House, Will Get Statue at Newseum
teaser: The daughter of a Kentucky sharecropper, Ms. Dunnigan endured poverty, segregation and sexism as she fought to fulfill her dream of becoming a journalist.

headline: Trump Put a Low Cost on Carbon Emissions. Here’s Why It Matters.
teaser: How much economic damage will global warming cause? It’s a tough calculation, and the answer, to a big extent, determines how easily the government can roll back environmental rules.

headline: David Pecker, American Media Chief, Is Said to Have Immunity in Trump Inquiry
teaser: Mr. Pecker is close to President Trump and Michael D. Cohen, his former lawyer, and had been integral to a campaign effort to help protect Mr. Trump from embarrassing stories about women.

headline: Army Recommends Silver Star for Captain Criticized in Deadly Niger Ambush
teaser: The appeal to recognize Capt. Michael Perozeni’s acts of valor in the Oct. 4 firefight contrasts with earlier findings that he filed misleading plans for the mission.

headline: Treasury Issues Crackdown on State and Local Tax Workarounds
teaser: Proposed regulations could hit taxpayers who receive state credits for donations to private schools.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s Inaccurate Claims About Cohen, Obama and Campaign Finance
teaser: On Fox on Thursday, the president claimed that Michael D. Cohen pleaded guilty to counts that “aren’t a crime” and misleadingly compared the violations to infractions by Barack Obama’s 2008 campaign.

headline: ‘Can The President Be Impeached?’: We Answer Your Questions
teaser: Since the news broke of Michael Cohen’s guilty plea, we received lots of questions from our readers. Adam Liptak, the Times’s Supreme Court Reporter answers them.

headline: Trump’s Lawyers Urged Him to Postpone Even Considering Pardons in Russia Inquiry
teaser: The president’s high-profile pardons and commutations this year prompted his lawyers to caution him against weighing clemency for associates in the special counsel investigation.

headline: Chill Remains Between China and United States in Latest Trade Talks
teaser: There was little sign of progress between the world’s two largest economies as the Trump administration tried to ramp up pressure on China with more tariffs and investment restrictions.

headline: Montgomery Memo: A Rebirth for Alabama Democrats? Not So Fast.
teaser: Democrats were euphoric after Doug Jones’s Senate victory, but even he says “you’re not going to see a giant blue wave” in one of America’s reddest states.

headline: Senator Says He Has Trump’s Backing for Prison Bill Vote Late This Year
teaser: Senator Charles E. Grassley and Jared Kushner ended a phone call with President Trump — and said the president will back a bipartisan criminal justice bill after the midterm elections.

headline: Secret Report on Starr Inquiry Leaks Is Released, but Doesn’t Name Kavanaugh
teaser: Democrats had hoped the report would shed light on the actions of Brett Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee.

headline: A Rural Georgia County Considered Closing Polling Places. It Struck a Nerve.
teaser: In a state where voting issues have flared up repeatedly, voters suspected the worst about a rural county’s consolidation plan.

headline: How Politics Took Over the Killing of Mollie Tibbetts
teaser: The death of Ms. Tibbetts in Iowa sharpened the focus of Republicans, who had already been campaigning on dire workings about violence and insecure borders.

headline: White House Memo: With a Vocabulary From ‘Goodfellas,’ Trump Evokes His Native New York
teaser: As he faces mushrooming legal troubles, the president evokes a place replete with shady businessmen and mob-linked politicians, raffish types with unscrupulous methods and uncertain loyalties.

headline: In Tweet, Trump Seems to Endorse Racist Narrative of South African Dispute
teaser: The post appeared to be the culmination of a lobbying effort by a right-wing South African group that falsely claims that white farmers are being systematically forced off their land and killed in large numbers.

headline: ‘Where’s Your Husband?’ What Female Candidates Hear on the Trail
teaser: The number of women running for office is surging. But for many, harassment and discrimination is a persistent reality. We spoke with six female candidates about how they have persevered.

headline: For Female Candidates, Harassment and Threats Come Every Day
teaser: The abuse already common in many women’s everyday lives can be amplified in political campaigns, especially if the candidate is also a member of a minority group.

headline: Gender Letter: The Persistence of Stormy Daniels
teaser: “How ya like me now?!” Stormy Daniels said in a tweet on Tuesday, a bombshell of a day for President Trump, his inner circle and the rest of us.

headline: John McCain Will No Longer Be Treated for Brain Cancer, Family Says
teaser: Mr. McCain, a towering figure in American politics, had been undergoing treatment since July 2017, and has been absent from Washington since December.

headline: Trump, Undeterred by Sessions’s Rebuke, Urges Him to Examine Corruption on the ‘Other Side’
teaser: President Trump said “everyone” wants the Justice Department to resist political considerations as he resumed attacks on his attorney general.

headline: The Untold Story of Trump and Cuomo, Who Didn’t Always Hate Each Other
teaser: Gov. Andrew Cuomo has made his opposition to President Trump a cornerstone of his campaign. In the transactional worlds of politics and real estate, their lives have often intersected.

headline: Kremlin Sources Go Quiet, Leaving C.I.A. in the Dark About Putin’s Plans for Midterms
teaser: The spy agency does not believe its Russia informants have been killed, but sources have gone largely dormant amid heightened scrutiny and rising threats.

headline: Balderson Wins Special Election for Ohio House Seat
teaser: Weeks after voting ended, State Senator Troy Balderson, a Republican, edged out a victory in a traditionally red district. He will face his opponent again in November.

headline: Trump Asks Pompeo to Cancel North Korea Trip, Acknowledging Diplomacy Has Stalled
teaser: President Trump said he did not think the country was making sufficient progress on denuclearization.

headline: Violence, Crime, Drugs: These G.O.P. Messages Go Grim
teaser: A collection of images from Republican ads and campaign messages portrays the left as angry, menacing and weak on crime.

headline: Maria Butina Did Not Use Sex in Covert Russian Plan, Her Lawyers Say
teaser: Prosecutors miscast years-old, joking text messages as evidence that she was involved in a “duplicitous” relationship and offering sex for a possible job, her lawyers said.

headline: A Lot Happened This Week. Here’s What You Need to Know in American Politics. : A Lot Happened This Week in American Politics. Here’s What You Need to Know.
teaser: From the news about Michael Cohen and Paul Manafort to developments in Congress, a lot happened this week in American politics. Here’s what you might have missed (and some links if you want to read further).

headline: Democratic Split on Impeachment Talk: Officials Avoid It, but Voters Are Eager for It
teaser: Party leaders are cautioning candidates in the midterm elections not to campaign on impeachment, for fear of inciting conservatives to vote in defense of President Trump.

headline: Trump Administration Cuts More Than $200 Million in Aid for Palestinians
teaser: The State Department said the money, meant for the West Bank and Gaza, would be redirected to other projects.

headline: Allen Weisselberg, Top Trump Organization Official, Was Granted Immunity for Testimony
teaser: The deal for testimony in the case against President Trump’s former personal lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, did not extend a blanket immunity beyond the information shared, a person briefed on the arrangement said.

headline: 19 Noncitizens Voted Illegally in 2016 in North Carolina, U.S. Charges
teaser: The foreign nationals, from countries as varied as Nigeria and Japan, face prison and large fines if convicted. Many are legal permanent residents, one since 1976.

headline: Trump’s Cancellation of Pompeo Trip Dashes Hopes in South Korea
teaser: Many had hoped that the American secretary of state’s planned visit to North Korea would help the South’s leader, Moon Jae-in, to advance his inter-Korean agenda.

headline: What Will Mueller Do? The Answer Might Lie in a By-the-Book Past
teaser: The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, has approached law enforcement consistently for decades: leading aggressive investigations marked by adherence to precedent and higher office.

headline: News Analysis: Is China Undermining Efforts to Disarm North Korea? Not Yet, Analysts Say
teaser: China is mostly abiding by the sanctions meant to pressure the North, one expert said. But he added, “It depends on how the United States trade war goes.”

headline: Democrats Overhaul Controversial Superdelegate System
teaser: Under a new plan, superdelegates would only be able to vote in extraordinary cases such as contested conventions.

headline: News Analysis: Trump’s War on the Justice System Threatens to Erode Trust in the Law
teaser: President Trump’s remarks about law enforcement revolve mostly around how its actions affect him personally — a vision that would recast an independent justice system as a guardian of the president.

headline: John McCain, War Hero, Senator, Presidential Contender, Dies at 81
teaser: A naval aviator who endured torture in Vietnam, Mr. McCain rose to the heights of power in Washington until cancer felled him.

headline: Recalling the John McCain We Knew
teaser: Reporters and editors at The New York Times had a backstage view of Mr. McCain’s decades in public life. Here are their reflections.

headline: On Washington: John McCain, a Last Lion of the Senate
teaser: The Senate becomes a lesser place without the sometimes angry, often funny, always larger-than-life presence of the Republican from Arizona.

headline: John McCain to Lie in State at Capitols in Washington and Arizona
teaser: The Republican senator will also receive a full dress funeral service at the Washington National Cathedral before his burial in Annapolis, Md.

headline: Trump Offers Condolences to Family of John McCain, Senator Who Defied Him
teaser: President Trump, who once said Mr. McCain was “not a war hero” because he was captured in Vietnam, offered his “deepest sympathies and regret” to Mr. McCain’s family after his death.

headline: $1.7 Billion Federal Job Training Program Is ‘Failing the Students’
teaser: Job Corps has had more than two million graduates since it was started in 1965, and it boasts its share of inspiring success stories, but study after study has questioned its effectiveness.

headline: Veteran, Maverick, Candidate: Key Moments of John McCain’s Public Life
teaser: Mr. McCain became known as an independently minded conservative, opposing President Trump after two failed presidential campaigns of his own.

headline: High Profits and Misery Meet at Door of Smugglers’ Stash Houses
teaser: Smugglers are making millions of dollars by extorting migrants after sneaking them into the United States and shuttling them from house to house.

headline: Politicians and World Leaders Remember John McCain
teaser: Leaders recalled Mr. McCain, the senator and former Republican presidential nominee who died on Saturday, for his bipartisanship, courage and patriotism.

headline: White House Memo: Gather Round, Everyone. It’s Time to Play ‘Find the Collusion’!
teaser: As President Trump makes a game of his mantra of “no collusion,” he mocks what is in fact a serious allegation, and muddies the waters of what is a clear-cut question for investigators.

headline: Arizona Governor Faces a Tough Choice: A Senator Cut From McCain’s Mold or Trump’s
teaser: The vacant Senate seat of the late John McCain has exposed the rift between his followers and the party’s Trumpian base.

headline: As a Nation Mourns McCain, Trump Is Conspicuously Absent
teaser: Senator John McCain’s death seemed to be a metaphor for the demise of civility and unity in the Trump era.

headline: McCain ‘Suffered Fools Poorly,’ and Arizonans Admired Him For It
teaser: Mourners gathered along the roadways in Phoenix to pay respects to a man who had become an institution in Arizona.

headline: Trump’s $130,000 in Hush Money to Stormy Daniels: Here’s Everything We Now Know
teaser: The guilty plea by Michael Cohen, President Trump’s ex-lawyer, brought to light new revelations about the payoff — and the efforts to conceal it.

headline: U.S. and Mexico Agree to Preliminary Nafta Deal
teaser: The preliminary agreement is a major step for President Trump, who has threatened to scrap the pact altogether. But Canada is still on the sidelines, and many issues are unresolved.

headline: White House Flag Briefly Marks John McCain’s Death
teaser: The White House flew the American flag at half-staff on Sunday after the death of Senator John McCain, but it returned to its full height Monday. It remained at half-staff at the Capitol.

headline: ‘I Tried to Think Like a Corrupt Party Hack’
teaser: The Queens Democratic Party machine seemed to be nominating candidates without their consent. I needed to find them. But how?

headline: Bruce Ohr Fought Russian Organized Crime. Now He’s a Target of Trump.
teaser: Mr. Ohr, a longtime Justice Department official, was targeted in attacks by the president and his allies for links to the Russia investigation. He could lose his security clearance.

headline: A Trump Endorsement Can Decide a Race. Here’s How to Get One.
teaser: The president’s grip on G.O.P. primary voters is as strong as it has been since he seized the party’s nomination a little over two years ago.

headline: China Has Withheld Samples of a Dangerous Flu Virus
teaser: Despite an international agreement, U.S. health authorities still have not received H7N9 avian flu specimens from their Chinese counterparts.

headline: Donna Shalala Isn’t Done Yet
teaser: Impeachment. Guaranteed income. A conversation with the former Clinton administration official, who hopes to win a seat in Congress.

headline: Read Senator John McCain’s Farewell Statement
teaser: His former campaign manager, Rick Davis, read a farewell statement on behalf of Mr. McCain, who passed away at the age of 81.

headline: Meet Josh Shapiro, the Man Behind the Bombshell Investigation of Clergy Sexual Abuse
teaser: As attorney general of Pennsylvania, Mr. Shapiro rooted out sexual abuse in the Catholic Church, prompting international calls for reform. Now, he talks about the anti-Semitism he faced, how the report shaped his own spirituality, and the possibility of a federal investigation.

headline: North Korean State Media Denounce U.S. as Diplomacy Stalls
teaser: Belligerent articles alleged “extremely provocative and dangerous” American military moves after the United States canceled a trip by Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

headline: In Defending Trump, Is Giuliani a Shrewd Tactician or ‘Untethered’?
teaser: Rudolph Giuliani, President Trump’s lawyer, offered the first detailed look at his strategy for representing the president, in blunt and divisively political terms.

headline: The Trump Tax Cuts Were Supposed to Depress Housing Prices. They Haven’t.
teaser: So far, economists see only faint effects of the new tax law in housing prices. The predicted carnage hasn’t materialized.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Calls Preliminary Pact Between U.S. and Mexico ‘Maybe the Largest Trade Deal Ever’
teaser: “I cannot imagine any metric in which an agreement between the U.S. and Mexico can be the largest,” a trade expert said.

headline: Federal Court Throws Out North Carolina’s Congressional Districts, Again
teaser: What happens next is unclear, but the case will likely be appealed to the Supreme Court, which has never ruled a partisan gerrymander to be unconstitutional.

headline: Arizona and Florida Have Primaries Today. Here’s What to Watch.
teaser: Republicans are facing off for a shot at replacing an anti-Trump senator in Arizona, while Democrats clash to get on the ticket in the Florida governor’s race.

headline: Remembrances Across the Nation: The Schedule of Tributes to John McCain
teaser: The former senator’s life will be celebrated for five days in Arizona, Maryland and Washington. Here’s how to pay respects.

headline: ‘The Whole World Is Watching’: The 1968 Democratic Convention, 50 Years Later
teaser: On Aug. 28, 1968, violent clashes in Chicago between demonstrators and police produced one of the most polarizing showdowns of the 1960s. People are still debating what it all meant.

headline: Trump Accuses Google of Burying Conservative News in Search Results
teaser: President Trump hinted that he would take action against the search giant in his latest attack on a technology company.

headline: Russia Hated John McCain, and Will Miss Him Dearly
teaser: The death of the Arizona senator has deprived Moscow of its favorite punching bag, the supposed leader of a global conspiracy of “Russophobes.”

headline: Pentagon Has No Plans to Again Cancel Large Military Exercises on Korean Peninsula
teaser: The statement by Defense Secretary Jim Mattis was yet another sign that the diplomatic thaw between Washington and Pyongyang is coming to an end.

headline: Replace Richard Russell’s Name With McCain’s? Senate Debates a Segregationist’s Legacy
teaser: The Senate is weighing whether to rechristen the Russell Senate Building, named after a senator who promoted racial segregation, to honor John McCain.

headline: Trump Accuses Google of Burying Conservative News in Search Results
teaser: The president hinted that he would take action against the search giant in his latest attack on a technology company.

headline: ‘As a Democrat in Arizona, I Voted for McCain’
teaser: Readers who reached across party lines to vote for Senator John McCain during his Senate and presidential runs pay tribute to him.

headline: Trump Privately Urges Pastors to Help Him From the Pulpit in Midterms
teaser: An audio recording reveals the president pushing evangelical leaders to use what he described as their newfound freedom of speech to campaign on behalf of Republicans.

headline: C.I.A. Officer-Turned-Candidate Says PAC Obtained Her Security Application
teaser: A former C.I.A. officer running for Congress demanded the Congressional Leadership Fund destroy the highly sensitive security clearance application that she says it obtained.

headline: White Collar Watch: How a Ruling on Insider Trading Could Affect the Chris Collins Case
teaser: A recent revision to an opinion in an insider trading case could make prosecutors’ jobs easier in the case against the congressman from upstate New York.

headline: Dozens at Facebook Unite to Challenge Its ‘Intolerant’ Liberal Culture
teaser: In a rare sign of internal dissent, more than 100 employees have formed a group to agitate for better representation of conservative views.

headline: Judges’ Ruling on Election Map Plunges North Carolina Politics Into Disarray
teaser: Monday’s ruling declaring that the state’s congressional district map is unconstitutional has left candidates struggling to understand what comes next.

headline: Trump Ally Ron DeSantis Wins Florida Governor’s Primary
teaser: Mr. DeSantis, a once-little known conservative congressman, vaulted to victory in the Florida governor’s primary on the strength of President Trump’s endorsement.

headline: Andrew Gillum Upends Expectations in Florida Primary Victory
teaser: Showcasing a compelling life story, Mayor Gillum of Tallahassee staged an improbable come-from-behind victory over four Democratic challengers.

headline: The New Health Care: A Little-Known Windfall for Some Hospitals, Now Facing Big Cuts
teaser: A program meant to help the poor has grown beyond its original intent.

headline: 4 Takeaways from Tuesday’s Primaries
teaser: Races for governor have often yielded centrist candidates. Voters in Florida, Oklahoma and Arizona chose a different route. And women, once again, made a strong showing in House races.

headline: Andrew Gillum Wins Florida Primary
teaser: Mayor Andrew Gillum of Tallahassee won Florida’s Democratic primary for governor on Tuesday. If he wins in November, Mr. Gillum would be the state’s first black governor.

headline: Trump Administration Picks Career Justice Dept. Official to Defend Its Policies
teaser: Joseph H. Hunt will lead the department’s civil division, which defends the administration in legal challenges over issues such as census questions and lawsuits against the president.

headline: White House Counsel Donald McGahn Will Leave This Fall, Trump Announces on Twitter
teaser: The departing counsel, Donald F. McGahn II, is a key witness to the question of whether the president obstructed the inquiry into election interference by Russia.

headline: Rudolph Giuliani Criticizes an Anticorruption Crackdown in Romania
teaser: President Trump’s personal lawyer said his letter to the Romanian president was part of his private practice and had “nothing to do with the U.S. government.”

headline: Ron DeSantis Wins Florida Republican Primary for Governor
teaser: Representative Ron DeSantis beat his challenger, Adam Putnam, to secure the Republican nomination in Florida.

headline: DeSantis Warns Florida Not to ‘Monkey This Up,’ and Many Hear a Racist Dog Whistle
teaser: The Republican nominee for governor in Florida drew condemnation from Democrats for a comment about his opponent, Andrew Gillum.

headline: Get to Know Ron DeSantis, Republican Nominee for Florida Governor
teaser: Mr. DeSantis, who represents Florida’s Sixth District in Congress, is a loyal Trump supporter, a regular on Fox News and a Navy veteran.

headline: New U.S. Sexual Misconduct Rules Bolster Rights of Accused and Protect Colleges
