teaser: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos is preparing to propose new sexual misconduct rules that cement the rights of the accused and lessen liability for institutions.

headline: McCain Family Mourns at Arizona State Capitol
teaser: Senator John McCain’s wife Cindy and his daughter Meghan paid their respects in a ceremony in Phoenix.

headline: Bloomberg Moves New Forum for Elites From China Amid Fallout of Trade War
teaser: Organizers are moving the event to Singapore after a Chinese partner for the conference, planned by Michael R. Bloomberg, requested that it be postponed.

headline: E.P.A. to Reconsider Obama-Era Curbs on Mercury Emissions by Power Plants
teaser: It is the latest effort by the Trump administration to revisit or weaken environmental rules. Mercury has been tied to brain damage and other ailments.

headline: Democratic Embrace of Diverse Candidates Collides With Barbed Politics of Trump Era
teaser: Andrew Gillum’s victory in the Democratic gubernatorial primary in Florida comes at a time when racial and ethnic issues are becoming more volatile and explicit in politics.

headline: Trump Accuses China of Undermining Diplomacy With North Korea
teaser: The president appeared in part to be trying to dial back remarks made by Defense Secretary Jim Mattis, who had opened the door to resuming joint military exercises with the South.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Claims ‘We Did a Fantastic Job in Puerto Rico’
teaser: President Trump asserted that Puerto Rico’s power utility was “dead” and that electricity was “gone” even before Hurricane Maria hit the island in September 2017. The utility was in disrepair but still operational, and the island was not in the dark.

headline: Andrew Gillum Pulled Off the Upset of a Lifetime. Now Comes the Hard Part.
teaser: After the surprise victory of Mr. Gillum, a progressive, 39-year-old black man, in the Democratic primary for Florida governor, he must now find a way to raise enough money for a grueling general election.

headline: ‘Can You Stop Interrupting?’ ‘Can You Stop Lying?’ Cuomo and Nixon Spar in Debate.
teaser: The candidates for governor in New York fought over standing up to President Trump, marijuana, health care policy and corruption in Albany.

headline: Who Stretched the Truth? A Cuomo-Nixon Fact Check
teaser: Nixon and Cuomo make accusations about Trump, the M.T.A. and corruption

headline: Planning His Funeral, McCain Got the Last Word Against Trump
teaser: For years, the president had used Twitter and his bully pulpit to mock and condemn the senator from Arizona. In death, John McCain found a way to have the last word.

headline: Cuomo, Citing God and Death, Rules Out 2020 Presidential Run
teaser: Gov. Andrew Cuomo vowed to finish a full third term if re-elected in November, saying that the only caveat was if “God strikes me dead.”

headline: Australia Denies Chelsea Manning an Entry Visa, Citing ‘Criminal Record’
teaser: The Australian government said Ms. Manning, who was convicted of sharing classified American military documents, failed a character test.

headline: John McCain Memorial to Feature Tributes From Biden and Other Friends
teaser: Thousands of Arizonans are expected to gather to say goodbye to the senator before his body is moved to Washington.

headline: Review: ‘Active Measures’ Looks at Links Between Trump and Russia
teaser: Directed by Jack Bryan, this documentary digs through reams of documents and interviews more than two dozen people, including Hillary Clinton and John McCain.

headline: E.U. Says It’s Ready to Abolish Car Tariffs, Shifting Position
teaser: The apparent change may help in talks between Brussels and the White House, but any deal between the two could violate global trade rules.

headline: National Enquirer Had Decades of Trump Dirt. He Wanted to Buy It All.
teaser: Donald Trump and his lawyer, Michael Cohen, devised a plan to buy all the stories on Mr. Trump that the National Enquirer and its parent company had collected, according to Mr. Trump’s associates.

headline: Asian-American Students Suing Harvard Over Admissions Win Justice Dept. Support
teaser: The agency has filed a so-called statement of interest in their case, saying that Harvard “has failed to show that it does not unlawfully discriminate.”

headline: Pause in Military Drills, Ordered by Trump, Leaves South Koreans Uneasy
teaser: President Trump’s complaints about the cost of the exercises, and of the American military presence itself, have some Koreans fearing for their security.

headline: Insults Fly at Cuomo-Nixon Debate
teaser: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Cynthia Nixon faced off in their only scheduled debate before the Democratic Primary for governor in New York.

headline: F.B.I. Arrests California Man After Threats to Kill Boston Globe Employees
teaser: According to the F.B.I., the California man made a series of menacing phone calls to The Boston Globe, calling the newspaper an “enemy of the people.”

headline: Postal Service Improperly Divulged Spanberger’s Sensitive National Security File, and Asks for It Back
teaser: The Postal Service blamed “human error” for the release of a Democratic House candidate’s security clearance application, requesting that a Republican super PAC return it.

headline: What It Means to Be Lying in State
teaser: On Friday, John McCain will be one of a few senators in history to “lie in state” at the United States Capitol.

headline: Supreme Court Stays Out of Case on Gay Rights and Foster Care
teaser: The justices refused to intercede in a dispute between Philadelphia and a Catholic foster care agency that does not work with same-sex couples.

headline: Trump Seeks to Block Pay Raises for Federal Workers
teaser: The president, who has moved to curb government unions, said the pay increase wasn’t affordable. But Congress can still pass legislation granting the raises.

headline: Judge Rules Against Alex Jones and Infowars in Sandy Hook Lawsuit
teaser: Mr. Jones sought to have the defamation case dismissed on free speech grounds.

headline: State of the Art: Here’s the Conversation We Really Need to Have About Bias at Google
teaser: President Trump’s charges that Google shows anti-conservative search bias is wrong. But Google may well be biased against minorities and others who lack real-world power.

headline: President Trump Had a Lot to Say at His Rally and on Twitter. But Not About John McCain.
teaser: Conspicuously absent from the president’s active media day was any acknowledgment that a nation was remembering Senator John McCain.

headline: U.S. to End Funding to U.N. Agency That Helps Palestinian Refugees
teaser: President Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo made the decision to cut all aid for Palestinian refugees at a meeting in early August.

headline: China’s State Media: Trump Tweets Come From an ‘Alternative Universe’
teaser: In recent days, China’s English-language state media outlets have grown more strident in their mockery of the president and his policies.

headline: How Modern Medicine Has Changed the Supreme Court
teaser: Longer lives, longer terms and tougher nomination fights, as well as a premium on youth.

headline: Trump Approach on Nafta Relieves Automakers’ Worst Fears
teaser: Car and parts makers should be able to adapt to changes negotiated with Mexico without undue expense or disruption, analysts say.

headline: Beto O’Rourke Dreams of One Texas. Ted Cruz Sees Another Clearly.
teaser: For years, a blue Texas has seemed both impossible and inevitable. Have the political winds there finally shifted enough for an unapologetic liberal to win a Senate seat?

headline: Washington Prepares to Honor John McCain: The Senator Is to Lie in State in U.S. Capitol
teaser: Here’s what to expect as a series of tributes to the senator begin to unfold in Washington.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: One Last Time, McCain Counterprograms Trump
teaser: The senator’s memorials laid out his vision of civic life, and said a lot, indirectly, about someone who was conspicuous by his absence.

headline: Lobbyist Linked to Manafort Charged With Failing to Register as a Foreign Agent
teaser: The lobbyist, Sam Patten, worked for a pro-Russia Ukrainian political party, the same one that employed Paul Manafort, as recently as this year, prosecutors say.

headline: John McCain Is Honored at U.S. Capitol
teaser: Senator John McCain was brought to the Rotunda to lie in state. Leaders from both parties paid tribute to the celebrated lawmaker.

headline: Strategies: What if the Economy and Markets Are Even Better Than They Look?
teaser: The strength of the economy and the stock market might seem too good to be true. But you may want to hedge your bets.

headline: John McCain Lies in State in the Capitol: ‘We Lost a Good One’
teaser: Senator John McCain lay in state in the Capitol’s Rotunda, hailed as a principled war hero as citizens wondered whether an era of comity died with him.

headline: On Washington: A Rare Moment of Unity, in Celebration of John McCain
teaser: At Mr. McCain’s last visit to the Capitol, colleagues embraced the spirit of public service.

headline: Texas Judge Delivers Unexpected Victory for DACA Program
teaser: The decision regarding the Obama-era program was a temporary win for activists who are waging a legal fight against the Trump Administration to save it.

headline: Once Bipartisan, an Election Security Bill Collapses in Rancor
teaser: Lawmakers were once on track to approve a bipartisan election security bill. Its ugly collapse sends a message: “There isn’t a sense of urgency or priority.”

headline: Trump to Skip Meetings in Asia as He Keeps a Distance With Allies
teaser: In his decision not to attend summit meetings in Asia this fall, the president will miss an opportunity to calm frazzled relationships in the region. And China could step in, analysts said.

headline: Ayanna Pressley Seeks Her Political Moment in a Changing Boston
teaser: Massachusetts is well known for deeply entrenched politics that favor incumbents. But the Boston City Council member is campaigning for Congress in a moment that has favored women and underdogs.

headline: Spooky Theory on Ills of U.S. Diplomats in Cuba
teaser: Doctors and scientists say microwave strikes may have caused sonic delusions and very real brain damage among embassy staff and family members.

headline: Giant Balloon Depicting London Mayor in Bikini Is Flown Near Parliament
teaser: A Briton who says Mayor Sadiq Khan is not doing enough to fight crime came up with the idea, in response to the “Baby Trump” balloon flown in July.

headline: Live Briefing: John McCain Farewell to Be Led by Two Presidents — but Not That One
teaser: Here are some things to watch for as the senator is memorialized at the Washington National Cathedral on Saturday.

headline: On Washington: Why a Predictable Supreme Court Fight Is a Sign of a Broken Process
teaser: The elimination of the filibuster against judicial nominees has major implications for the integrity not only of the Senate, but also of the federal courts.

headline: Live Video: John McCain’s Memorial Service
teaser: Former Presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush are among the dignitaries who will deliver tributes to Senator McCain at the Washington National Cathedral.

headline: Meghan McCain Delivers Pointed Rebuke of Trump at Her Father’s Funeral
teaser: John McCain’s daughter reproached President Trump at the senator’s funeral as the president left the White House wearing golf gear and a “Make America Great Again” hat.

headline: Read George W. Bush’s Eulogy for John McCain
teaser: Former President George W. Bush delivered a eulogy on behalf of Senator John McCain at a ceremony attended by many of Washington’s top current and former lawmakers.

headline: Two Presidents Offer a Tribute to McCain, and a Contrast to Trump
teaser: Barack Obama and George W. Bush were among the political figures from both parties who came to mourn not just a giant of the Senate, but also an ideal that he represented.

headline: Read Barack Obama’s Eulogy for John McCain
teaser: Former President Barack Obama delivered a eulogy on behalf of Senator John McCain at a ceremony attended by many of Washington’s top current and former lawmakers.

headline: A Failed U.S. Mission: Secretly Flipping a Russian Oligarch for Dirt on Trump Campaign
teaser: American officials hoped they could persuade some of Russia’s wealthiest men to help with investigations into organized crime and interference in the 2016 election. It didn’t work.

headline: Washington Mourned John McCain. President Trump Went Golfing.
teaser: For many, it was a historic opportunity to memorialize the life of a Senate titan. For President Trump, it was Saturday.

headline: Remembering John McCain at the Washington National Cathedral
teaser: The senator’s daughter Meghan McCain and former presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush were among those who made eulogies to John McCain at a memorial service on Saturday.

headline: White House Cites Executive Privilege to Withhold 100,000 Pages of Kavanaugh Records
teaser: Senator Chuck Schumer denounced the Trump administration’s decision to cite executive privilege in refusing to release records relating to Judge Kavanaugh’s time as a lawyer in the Bush White House.

headline: Trump’s Rougher Edge Complicates Trip by Pompeo and Mattis to India
teaser: Trade tensions, threats of sanctions and even President Trump’s reported mocking of the Indian leader have contributed to a suddenly long list of diplomatic challenges.

headline: After Deadly Raid, Pentagon Weighs Withdrawing Almost All Commandos From Niger
teaser: The plans, if approved by Defense Secretary Jim Mattis, would also close military outposts in Tunisia, Cameroon, Libya and Kenya.

headline: Accused Russian Agent Spent Months in Futile Pursuit of Jet Fuel Payday
teaser: Maria Butina surrounded herself with prominent American conservatives and dubious characters bent on making a fast buck. It was not always easy to tell one from the other.

headline: Mollie Tibbetts’s Father Asks That Her Death Not Be Exploited to Promote Racism
teaser: The call by Rob Tibbetts to not politicize his daughter’s murder came a day after the president’s eldest son blamed Democrats for her death.

headline: After a Primary on the Fringe, Georgia Republican Tacks Toward the Center
teaser: Brian Kemp won the Republican nomination for governor as a “politically incorrect conservative.” Ahead of a competitive general election, though, he has moderated that message.

headline: How Brett Kavanaugh Would Transform the Supreme Court

headline: Political Year of the Woman? Been There, Done That, Oregon Says
teaser: Women already control the governor’s office in Oregon and more top state legislative posts than in any other state, and now have track records to defend at the ballot box.

headline: Federal Workers Brace for New Push on Trump Bid to Curb Unions
teaser: President Trump met a legal setback in moving to curb civil servants’ unions, but agencies may be able to achieve the same goals on their own.

headline: Meghan McCain, Forged in Her Father’s Image
teaser: Ms. McCain’s emotional call to arms at her father’s funeral was proof that she is her father’s daughter, a paradoxical figure willing to pay the price of being direct.

headline: Companies Say Trump Is Hurting Business by Limiting Legal Immigration
teaser: The government is making it harder to hire foreigners by denying visas, asking for more information and delaying approvals, corporate leaders say.

headline: A Coveted Lawyer’s Juggling Act May Be Good, and Bad, for Trump
teaser: William Burck is deciding which documents about Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh can be released, as he also represents current and former White House officials in the special counsel inquiry.

headline: Tech Giants Now Share Details on Political Ads. What Does That Mean For You?

headline: Mike Capuano Is in the Political Fight of His Life

headline: Books of The Times: John Kerry Recounts a Life Full of Incident (and a Few Regrets) in ‘Every Day Is Extra’
teaser: The five-term senator’s memoir covers his privileged upbringing, his service in Vietnam and his long life in politics.

headline: Trump’s Justice Department Redefines Whose Civil Rights to Protect
teaser: A decision to back a lawsuit seeking to curb race-based college admissions follows a pattern by the Justice Department to reshape civil rights enforcement.

headline: Second Insider Attack Kills Service Member in Afghanistan
teaser: The attack is the second in past two months, bringing the number of American service members killed this year in Afghanistan to six.

headline: Fringe Figures Find Refuge in Facebook’s Private Groups
teaser: Many private groups reviewed by The Times contained content and behavior that appeared to violate Facebook rules, like those against hate speech.

headline: Democrats, Eyeing a Majority, Prepare an Investigative Onslaught
teaser: With their confidence growing, House Democrats are preparing an onslaught of investigations that would put President Trump on defense and slow talk of impeachment.

headline: An Advocate for Women or a Threat? As Hearings Begin, Differing Views of Kavanaugh Emerge
teaser: Two different pictures of Brett Kavanaugh are expected to emerge at his confirmation hearings, with Democrats casting him as a threat to abortion rights and Republicans portraying him as an advocate for women.

headline: Trump Blasts Sessions for Charging G.O.P. Members Before Midterms

headline: New Yorker Festival Pulls Steve Bannon as Headliner Following High-Profile Dropouts

headline: Alex Jones Said Bans Would Strengthen Him. He Was Wrong.

headline: Mueller’s Office Will Grill Him About Roger Stone. He Will Respond With Comedy.

headline: Pruitt’s Spending on Security More Than Doubled in 11 Months, E.P.A. Investigator Says
teaser: The agency’s inspector general also found that the E.P.A. lacked methods for assessing safety needs. The spending helped lead to Mr. Pruitt’s resignation.

headline: How Supreme Court Confirmations Became Partisan Spectacles

headline: ‘You’re Out of Order’: Kavanaugh Hearing Opens With Protests

headline: Jon Kyl, Former Senator, Will Replace John McCain in Arizona
teaser: Gov. Doug Ducey, who made the selection, was facing a difficult balancing act in trying to please Trump supporters while not alienating McCain’s family and loyalists.

teaser: The defense secretary and other administration officials are described as resorting to extraordinary measures to thwart the president’s decisions in a White House depicted as “crazytown.”

headline: Facebook and Twitter Have a Message for Lawmakers: We’re Trying

headline: A New Lawsuit Threatens Obamacare. Here’s What’s at Stake and What to Expect in Oral Arguments
teaser: A federal judge in Texas will consider whether to suspend or kill the law. The Trump Administration has chosen not to defend it and its coverage of pre-existing conditions.

headline: Mueller Will Accept Some Written Answers From Trump
teaser: The tone of a letter from the special counsel’s office led some Trump allies to conclude that if the president is interviewed, the subject matter will be more limited than they had feared.

headline: ‘Five Eyes’ Nations Quietly Demand Government Access to Encrypted Data

teaser: Mr. Capuano, a 10-term incumbent, conceded to Ms. Pressley after a primary campaign in which she insisted that “change can’t wait.’’

headline: Democrats Open Contentious Hearings With Attack on ‘Partisan’ Kavanaugh

teaser: Woodward’s latest look inside a White House offers details of an administration in chaos.

teaser: Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook and Jack Dorsey of Twitter will testify about their companies response to foreign meddling in elections and the moderation of online content.

headline: Books News: Children’s Books Authors Are Selling More Than Books. They’re Taking a Stand.
teaser: They hold signs at protest marches, but they are also volunteering to strategize for a State Assembly race, and even running for office.

teaser: Mr. Corsi, a conservative commentator and conspiracy theorist, expects to answer questions about his connections to the former Trump adviser Roger J. Stone Jr.

headline: Another Case Is Threatening Obamacare. Democrats Hope It Will Help Them.

teaser: President Trump’s nominee to the Supreme Court, Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, faces his third day of confirmation hearings on Thursday.

teaser: In a first, the Upshot and Siena College will publish polling results in real time.

teaser: The president plans to focus on Iran and its malign activity around the Middle East, and people inside and outside the administration worry he will bring reality-TV antics to the world stage.

teaser: The president said Sayfullo Saipov, who is charged with killing eight people in Manhattan, should be executed. Can his attorney general make a fair call on seeking the death penalty?

teaser: Senators on the Judiciary Committee pressed Judge Brett Kavanaugh about the constitutional right to abortion and his views on the special counsel.

teaser: Tom Carper, Delaware’s longtime senator, fended off a challenge by another insurgent calling for resistance and change

teaser: President Trump tried to recapture his administration’s narrative, warning that if his supporters did not vote, he would be subjected to impeachment.

headline: Trump Warns Supporters of Impeachment if They Don’t Vote
teaser: President Trump suggested at a rally in Billings, Mont., that if he is impeached, the United States would turn into a “third-world country” where every president would face impeachment from the opposing party.

headline: Newsbook: Are You Watching Bret Kavanaugh’s Confirmation Hearings?
teaser: Here are three books that explore Supreme Court dynamics and the power of the nine justices.

headline: Gender Letter: Behind the Scenes With Christine Marinoni, Cynthia Nixon’s Wife
teaser: Plus: The triumph of Ayanna Pressley and a long-overdue obituary for Melitta Bentz, inventor of the coffee filter.

headline: ‘I Don’t Talk’ That Way, Trump Says. Except When He Does.
teaser: President Trump said he has never used terms like “mentally retarded” or “dumb Southerner,” as he is quoted in Bob Woodward’s new book. But the record shows he has.

headline: Cuomo Often Takes Taxpayer-Funded Planes and Helicopters, Far More Than Other Big State Governors
teaser: Gov. Andrew Cuomo took 195 trips on taxpayer-funded state aircraft last year, far more than governors in California, Texas and other large states.

headline: Trump Wants Attorney General to Investigate Source of Anonymous Times Op-Ed
teaser: Speaking to reporters on Air Force One, Mr. Trump said, “I would say Jeff should be investigating who the author of that piece was because I really believe it’s national security.”

headline: Science Does Not Support Claims That Contraceptives Are ‘Abortion-Inducing’
teaser: Judge Kavanaugh’s use of the term in his confirmation hearing resurrected a controversial phrase.

headline: The U.S. Ambassador Who Crossed Trump on Immigration
teaser: A plan to deport Vietnamese refugees led the veteran Asia hand Ted Osius to quit. He says every diplomat faces the question: “What ethical lines won’t you cross?”

headline: George Papadopoulos, Trump Campaign Adviser, Is Sentenced to 14 Days in Jail
teaser: In an interview, the former campaign adviser said he lied to the F.B.I. to distance himself and the Trump team from “what was probably an illegal action.”

headline: Excerpts From the New York Times Interview With George Papadopoulos
teaser: Mr. Papadopoulos said he lied to federal investigators because he wanted to protect himself and the Trump campaign from “what was probably an illegal action or dangerous information.”

headline: Florida Must Provide Election Materials in Spanish, Judge Says
teaser: In an acerbic order, a federal judge said 32 counties with Puerto Rican populations were obligated to provide Spanish-language sample ballots.

headline: Inside Alex Jones’s ‘Tangy Tangerine’-Fueled Empire
teaser: Fans of Infowars don’t just buy in to the conspiracy theories peddled by Alex Jones, they actually buy. Mr. Jones has amassed a fortune by pitching health products and weapons components as antidotes to the frightening worldview he broadcasts.

headline: Conspiracy Theories Made Alex Jones Very Rich. They May Bring Him Down.
teaser: The Infowars founder and Trump backer is as much marketer as ideological warrior, selling products to assuage the fears he is so expert at stoking.

headline: Obama Takes on Trump in Debut Speech of 2018 Campaign Role
teaser: The former president offered a stinging indictment of his successor, sometimes by name, accusing him and his Republican supporters of practicing a “politics of fear and resentment.”

headline: A ‘Faustian Bargain’: Republicans May Wince, but the Payoffs From Trump Have Been Rich
teaser: This week has illustrated why Republicans put up with the chaos: As President Trump raged, his party moved toward an ideological shift in the Supreme Court that will last for decades.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims He’s Saving Medicare and Social Security, Which He Says Democrats Are ‘Killing’
teaser: President Trump has accused Democrats of trying to “raid,” “rob” or “hurt” Medicare and Social Security, while suggesting he has made both programs “stronger.” Neither claim is true.

headline: Italy’s Most Powerful Politician Joins Steve Bannon’s ‘Movement’
teaser: Steve Bannon, President Trump’s former chief strategist, has formed a new group to help populists gain influence in Europe. Now Italy’s interior minister is part of it.

headline: On Washington: Democrats Sow Disorder in the Senate Over Kavanaugh and the Court
teaser: With few tools to block a Supreme Court nominee, Democrats decided to test Senate rules and decorum at the hearings to confirm Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

headline: As Hearings End, Democrats Accuse Supreme Court Nominee of Dissembling
teaser: Four days of Supreme Court confirmation hearings ended Friday the way they began: With fierce partisan divisions over Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

headline: To Secure Better Housing, Top Diplomat Pulls Rank on the Military
teaser: Mike Pompeo went from living in a mansion in Kansas to a rental apartment in Virginia. Now he is getting a home upgrade, courtesy of the military.

headline: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
teaser: From the hearings on Capitol Hill for Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh and social media executives to stunning revelations about the Trump administration, here are five of the biggest stories in American politics this week. (And some links if you want to read further.)

headline: Trump Administration Discussed Coup Plans With Rebel Venezuelan Officers
teaser: Venezuelan military officers seeking to overthrow President Nicolás Maduro sought help from the Trump administration, which met with them several times.

headline: Democrats Embrace Liberal Insurgents, Demanding New Face for Party
teaser: Progressive women and racial minorities have toppled Democratic incumbents and eroded party machines in key states, with implications for the next Congress and the 2020 presidential race.

headline: ‘No One Could Believe It’: When Ford Pardoned Nixon Four Decades Ago
teaser: In 1974, President Gerald Ford pardoned Richard Nixon for his role in Watergate. It remains the pardon others have been measured against, as a debate over pardon power is revived.

headline: Michael Cohen Offers to Rip Up Hush-Money Deal With Stormy Daniels
teaser: The motives behind the abrupt move remain unclear, but one effect could be to spare President Trump from being deposed in a lawsuit related to the case.

headline: Washington Memo: Brett Kavanaugh’s Expert Evasions, Learned From Past Masters

headline: Manchin Counts on Health Care to Stave Off Republican Tide in West Virginia
teaser: In a heavily pro-Trump state, the Democratic senator has built a lead in polls based, in part, on his support for the Affordable Care Act.

headline: U.S. Recalls Top Diplomats From Latin America as Worries Rise Over China’s Influence
teaser: The State Department said the diplomats were returning to Washington to discuss moves by three Latin American nations to recognize China.

headline: Top Trump Adviser Says Ted Cruz Could Lose Texas Senate Race
teaser: Still, Mick Mulvaney, the Office of Management and Budget chief, said Republicans would be able to surmount a Democratic “movement of hate” in November.

headline: Prosecutors Admit They Wrongly Accused Russian of Offering Sex for Republican Access
teaser: But they said that the mistake did not mean that the woman, Maria Butina, should be released from pretrial custody in her espionage case.

headline: Affairs, Pheasant Feathers and White House Stays: A List of Money-in-Politics Scandals
teaser: Experts say most campaign finance law violations are clerical. Here’s a look at some recent, high-profile political scandals that have had a campaign finance twist.

headline: North Korea Stages Huge Military Parade — Without Its ICBMs
teaser: The absence of long-range ballistic missiles at an event celebrating the nation’s founding is an encouraging signal for Washington’s diplomatic efforts.

headline: How ‘Plaid Shirt Guy’ Got Prime Seating at a Trump Rally
teaser: Images of Tyler Linfesty behind President Trump at a rally looking incredulous during his speech gained widespread attention. But how did he end up in such a prominent seat?

headline: Medicaid Expansion Finds Grass-Roots Support in Conservative Utah
teaser: Utah is one of three conservative states where advocates are trying to outflank Republican lawmakers and get ballot measures approved on Nov. 6.

headline: Players and Fans See Double Standard in Serena Williams’s U.S. Open Loss
teaser: Reactions on social media largely focused on the chair umpire, Carlos Ramos, who penalized Williams for behavior that would ordinarily result in a warning.

headline: California Tries New Tack on Gun Violence: Bullet Controls
teaser: The state already has some of the strictest gun control legislation. Now it's pushing to limit the unfettered sale of ammunition.

headline: C.I.A. Drone Mission, Curtailed by Obama, Is Expanded in Africa Under Trump
teaser: The Obama administration had handed off much of the C.I.A.’s deadly drone program to the military. President Trump has eased those limits on secret airstrikes by the agency.

headline: Three Hours Up Close With Alex Jones of Infowars
teaser: His Infowars business under legal threat after he spent years spreading lies about the Sandy Hook shooting, Mr. Jones says he’s the victim of a media conspiracy.

headline: Abortion Opposition Once Defined Marsha Blackburn. But Not in Senate Race.

headline: White House Memo: Trump Claims Credit for the Economy. Not So Fast, Says Obama.

teaser: The attorney general race is too close to predict, but Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has widened his lead over his primary opponent, Cynthia Nixon, according to a Siena College poll.

headline: Trump Administration Threatens International Criminal Court and the P.L.O.
teaser: The United States will shut down the Palestine Liberation Organization office in Washington and threaten the court if it investigates American troops in Afghanistan.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump Falsely Claims G.D.P. Growth Is Higher Than Unemployment ‘for the First Time in 100 Years’
teaser: It has happened at least 185 times in the past century.

teaser: John Bolton, President Trump’s national security adviser, warned the International Criminal Court against pursuing an investigation of American troops in Afghanistan.

teaser: Calling climate change the defining issue of our time, António Guterres said “the time has come for our leaders to show they care about the people whose fate they hold in their hands.”

teaser: The Environmental Protection Agency plans to make public a proposal to weaken an Obama-era requirement that companies monitor and repair methane leaks.

headline: Primary Season Was Full of Surprises. Here’s Why the Polls Missed Some of Them.

headline: Best of Late Night: Stephen Colbert Gives Les Moonves (His Boss) a Shove Out the Door

headline: South Korean Leader Urges ‘Bold Decisions’ on North’s Denuclearization

headline: In an Increasingly Diverse House, Aides Remain Remarkably White

teaser: Jeffrey D. Klein, who helped Republicans in Albany, is blanketing his primary race with money in an attempt to fend off his challenger, Alessandra Biaggi.

headline: Education Dept. Reopens Rutgers Case Charging Discrimination Against Jewish Students

teaser: The new order is aimed broadly at any potential outside interference, but is meant to give the government an additional tool to punish, and deter, Russian entities.

headline: Rhode Island Has a Primary Election Today. Here’s What to Know About It.

teaser: The Department of Homeland Security denies that the money came from disaster relief accounts and says it is prepared for a hurricane that will hit this week.

headline: Median U.S. Household Income Increased in 2017

headline: One of the First Women in the Infantry Will Be Discharged From the Marines

headline: Trump’s Tweets Pivot, Loudly, to Video
teaser: The president experiments with a new subgenre, in which his hands must do the work of the Caps Lock key.

headline: More Migrant Families, and Guatemalans, Are Trying to Enter the U.S.

teaser: More from NYT Climate

headline: Molly Kelly Has a Message for Republicans: ‘Do Not Underestimate Me’

teaser: Companies and business groups led by the National Retail Federation are highlighting the current and anticipated pain that the tariffs are bringing.

teaser: The chief executive published a roughly 3,300-word post cataloging the steps the social network has taken to prevent manipulation.

headline: Trump Rejects Death Toll in Puerto Rico Reported by His Own Government
teaser: The president accused Democrats of inflating the death toll from Hurricane Maria, saying only six to 18 people died “after” the storm hit the island; the official toll is 3,000.

headline: House Polls Show Very Close Races but Also Hints of Democratic Strength

teaser: Corey Brettschneider’s “The Oath and the Office” offers advice to presidents on their constitutional duties.

teaser: A purchase of custom, mechanized curtains for an official residence on the East Side of Manhattan was approved ahead of the department’s budget cuts.

headline: Evelyn Rodriguez, Mother of Girl Killed by MS-13, Remembered for Her Guts and Courage
teaser: After a shrine for her daughter was removed, Evelyn Rodriguez confronted a nearby driver, a friend said. They argued. The driver sped off and ran her over.

teaser: While Hillary Clinton lost the state to Donald Trump, female Democratic candidates in Michigan are trying to create a new playbook, one union voter at a time.

teaser: Kim Jong-un has shifted away from an in-your-face nuclear approach, tailoring it to his reading of President Trump.

teaser: Mr. Trump claimed, in a pair of posts on Twitter, that tariffs on steel imports have given “new life” to the domestic steel industry, without raising prices

teaser: Representative Trey Gowdy, chairman of the House Oversight Committee, said Monday he will investigate the potential misuse of government vehicles by FEMA’s chief.

headline: Independents Approve of the Economy, but Will It Help Republicans in the Midterms?

headline: Republicans Opposing Trump on Trade Face Election Quandary

headline: The Kavanaugh Allegations, and 5 (Misguided) Reasons People Doubt Victims

headline: Trump Accuses Democrats of Using Sex Assault Allegation to Delay Kavanaugh’s Confirmation
teaser: “We want to get to the bottom of everything,” President Trump said, adding that a delay of the judge’s confirmation was “certainly acceptable.”

headline: Kavanaugh’s Accuser Has Yet to Confirm Appearance at Monday Hearings
teaser: Christine Blasey Ford, who has accused Supreme Court nominee Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual assault, has yet to confirm that she will appear at hearings on Monday.

headline: Why Marco Rubio Attacked Salt Bae Over His Dinner With Maduro
teaser: The celebrity chef drew Mr. Rubio’s ire for serving a lavish meal to the authoritarian president of Venezuela, known for his extravagant lifestyle amid crushing poverty.

headline: Trump Officials Urge End of Time Limits on Detaining Migrant Children
teaser: Administration officials told senators that a court ruling that limits detention of children has encouraged migrants to bring their offspring when they illegally enter the country.

headline: noted: Let It Flow! #PantsuitNation is Now Caftan Country
teaser: Hillary Clinton, Beyoncé and Chrissy Teigen are among those choosing this sisterly, forgiving style.

headline: Climate Fwd:: Trump Administration Formally Rolls Back Rule Aimed at Limiting Methane Pollution
teaser: The Interior Department move, which benefits drilling companies, effectively reverses a major Obama-era effort to fight climate change.

headline: Cuomo and de Blasio: Making Nice, for Now

headline: What Trump Has Said About Men Accused of Abuse

headline: Books News: ‘Full Disclosure’ by Stormy Daniels Has Few Bombshells, but Is Likely to Rattle the White House
teaser: Mr. Trump’s presidency has proved to be an unexpected boon for the publishing industry, which has unleashed a barrage of juicy insider accounts.

headline: Political Memo: On Kavanaugh, a Changed America Debates an Explosive Charge
teaser: The accusations against the Supreme Court nominee are being assessed under different social and cultural conventions than when the episode allegedly occurred

headline: Supreme Court Won’t Disturb Ruling Unmasking Dark Money Donors

headline: U.S. Loses Track of Another 1,500 Migrant Children, Investigators Find

headline: On Politics: Kavanaugh’s Accuser Wants an Investigation
teaser: Christine Blasey Ford, who has accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual assault, said an investigation should be a “first step” before she agrees to testify.

headline: U.S. Oil Sanctions Bite Iran Without a Price Spike

headline: North Korea’s New Promises on Weapons Stop Short of Denuclearization
teaser: Kim Jong-un agreed to “permanently dismantle” key facilities in a bid to ease tensions with South Korea, but his offers did not meet U.S. demands.

teaser: In an interview with the Hill newspaper, President Trump said his disappointment with Attorney General Jeff Sessions was not limited to his recusal from the Russia investigation.

headline: News Analysis: For Red-State Democrats, Accusation Against Kavanaugh Scrambles Midterm Calculus
teaser: Three moderates had been weighing a yes vote to confirm Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, while other Democrats hoped there would be few consequences for a no vote. The sexual assault allegation has changed calculations.

headline: ‘I Don’t Have an Attorney General,’ Trump Says in a New Attack on Sessions
teaser: President Trump said his disappointment with Attorney General Jeff Sessions was not limited to his recusal from the Russia investigation.

headline: Trump Says Kavanaugh Accusations Are ‘Very Unfair’
teaser: The president said he wanted to hear from Christine Blasey Ford, the accuser: “If she shows up and makes a credible showing, that’ll be very interesting.”

headline: Poland, Making a Play for a U.S. Military Base, Offers to Call It Fort Trump
teaser: President Andrzej Duda offered to host the structure as a bulwark against Russia. President Trump said Warsaw would have to pay billions to use his name.

headline: Trump Says Kavanaugh Accusations Are ‘Very Unfair’
teaser: The president said he wanted to hear from Christine Blasey Ford, the accuser: “If she shows up and makes a credible showing, that’ll be very interesting.”

headline: Trump Arrives in North Carolina to See Hurricane Florence’s Devastation
teaser: Sixteen rivers in the state are in major flood stage, and critical highways remain impassable.

headline: Understanding the times: How to Tell Us a Secret
teaser: A Times project that offers readers simple, confidential ways to securely submit tips via their phone or email has paid dividends in news gathering since Day 1.

headline: Utah Group Files Complaint Against Mia Love Over Fund-Raising
teaser: The progressive group cites funds Ms. Love raised in the absence of a primary challenge. Her campaign called it a “political ploy.”

headline: Fewer Attacks, but a More Complex Terrorist Threat in 2017, U.S. Says
teaser: Terrorist attacks and deaths declined in 2017 after a concerted push against the Islamic State, but Al Qaeda and militant groups linked to Iran remain deadly.

teaser: Taking stock of the rise of women in politics, and some context around the Kavanaugh confirmation hearings.

headline: New Attention Given to Kavanaugh’s Remarks About Drinking
teaser: Following an accusation of sexual assault, Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s past comments about drinking in his youth are resurfacing.

teaser: Christine Blasey Ford, a researcher and statistician, was reluctant to come forward with her allegation that Brett Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, sexually assaulted her.

headline: Once ‘99 Percent Against Trump,’ Dean Heller Calls Him ‘Great Leader’
teaser: The Nevada senator, the most endangered Senate Republican up for re-election in November, was unusually effusive in praising the president ahead of Mr. Trump’s rally in Las Vegas.

headline: Trump Picks Expert on Regulation for Federal Reserve Board
teaser: Nellie Liang, nominated on Wednesday to the Fed’s board of governors, is an economist who previously led the Fed’s division focused on monitoring financial stability.

headline: Americans Are Increasingly Doubtful That Voters Are Ready to Elect Women
teaser: A majority say there should be more female leaders in politics and business but are skeptical that women will get the chance, a survey shows.

headline: On Politics: Stalemate Over Kavanaugh Inquiry
teaser: The woman who accused Judge Brett Kavanaugh of sexual assault rejected the idea of a Senate hearing, saying it would not be a “good faith investigation.”

headline: Why Polling Can Be So Hard

headline: Evangelical Leaders Are Frustrated at G.O.P. Caution on Kavanaugh Allegation

headline: U.S. Retreats on Publicizing Body Count of Militants Killed in Afghanistan

teaser: Christine Blasey Ford, who accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting her as a teenager, has reopened discussions that could lead to testifying next week.

headline: With More Than 200 L.G.B.T. Candidates, Advocates Hope for a ‘Rainbow Wave’ in the Midterms
teaser: The number of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender candidates running for office this year is higher than ever. But there is a partisan split among the nominees.

headline: Biosafety Reforms Still Lagging at Military Labs

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Her Story? Or Theirs?

headline: Michael Cohen Has Spoken Repeatedly With Mueller’s Prosecutors
teaser: The interviews with the special counsel are a new sign of the special counsel’s progress in getting firsthand accounts from key players.

headline: White House Memo: Trump Sees a ‘Red Wave’ Where His Party Sees a Red Alert
teaser: The many “distractions” generated by the president, Mitch McConnell said, were preventing Republicans from having a coherent message focused on the economy.

headline: Ron DeSantis Faces Questions About Supporter’s Racist Slur

headline: 2 Supreme Court Nominees. 2 Delays.

headline: Senator Orrin Hatch Reads ‘The Exorcist’ at Thomas Hearing
teaser: At the 1991 hearing, the Republican senator suggested Anita Hill’s story was inspired by the book.

headline: Anita Hill’s Testimony and Other Key Moments From the Clarence Thomas Hearings
teaser: In three days of televised hearings that riveted the nation, Anita F. Hill detailed allegations of workplace sexual harassment by Judge Clarence Thomas.

headline: Anita Hill Hearings: A Master Class in Mansplaining

headline: On Politics: Kavanaugh Hearing Negotiations Continue
teaser: Christine Blasey Ford, who has accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual assault, has reopened negotiations with lawmakers over a hearing next week.

teaser: Danish soldiers, scientists and two very sturdy dogs are the only residents of Station Nord in Greenland. Like any remote outpost, there are quirky rules and rituals.

teaser: President Trump said in a Twitter post that if the alleged attack “was as bad as she says,” charges would have been filed.

headline: Many Voters Tend to Believe Christine Blasey Ford, Even if They Question Her Motive

headline: Gender Letter: Christine Blasey Ford Pushes Back: Here’s What Might Happen Next

teaser: In the turbulent days after the firing of James B. Comey, the deputy attorney general appeared conflicted about his role and wanted to expose administration dysfunction, people around him said.

headline: Conservative Pundit Points Finger at Another Man to Deflect from Kavanaugh

headline: Black Candidate Wants to Know Who Called 911 as She Talked to Voters
teaser: Shelia Stubbs is headed for the Wisconsin legislature. The caller thought her car was part of a drug deal. Her mother, 71, and child, 8, were inside.

headline: Congressman Is Criticized for Joking That Justice Ginsburg Was ‘Groped’ by Lincoln
teaser: Ralph Norman, Republican of South Carolina, was making a reference to the recent allegations against Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

headline: Marilyn Lloyd, 89, Tennessee Trailblazer in Congress, Dies

headline: Billionaire Backer of Maria Butina Had Russian Security Ties
teaser: Konstantin Nikolaev, the oligarch who helped finance Ms. Butina, has been an investor in projects linked to the Russian government.

teaser: In an opinion piece defending Christine Blasey Ford, the former first daughter wrote: “Your memory snaps photos of the details that will haunt you forever.”

teaser: White House aides warned that such a move could look like an attempt to influence former campaign aides facing charges in the special counsel inquiry.

teaser: The event resembled a boisterous re-election pep rally for President Trump rather than an effort to lift Josh Hawley, the Republican attorney general running for Senate.

teaser: The casino magnate and his wife, initially skeptical of President Trump, are thrilled with some of his policies and have donated $55 million to Republican campaigns.

teaser: The siblings say their brother’s extremist views on immigration and his comments about a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va., prompted them to take action.

headline: Six Siblings of a Republican Congressman Have Endorsed His Opponent in Campaign Ads
teaser: The siblings say their brother’s extremist views on immigration and his comments about a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va., prompted them to take action.

headline: Trump Galvanized a Movement of Women. Kavanaugh Is Testing It.

teaser: Swastikas, racial epithets and profanity were scrawled across a campaign banner for Representative Josh Gottheimer and the home of a supporter who had put the sign on his lawn.

teaser: A rule proposed by the Trump administration could force immigrants seeking permanent resident status to prove they will never become reliant on government assistance.

teaser: A new hashtag has survivors of sexual abuse answering the question: Why didn’t you say something sooner?

headline: An Undiplomatic Trump? At This U.N. Meeting, His Aides Fear the Opposite
teaser: The president’s advisers worry that he will be overly enthusiastic about engagement with adversaries, given his conviction that he can outmaneuver any leader or strike any deal.

headline: Kavanaugh to Give Senate Calendars From 1982 to Back Up Denial
teaser: Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh has calendars from the summer of 1982 that do not show a party consistent with the allegation against him. But his team acknowledges they do not disprove the accusation.

teaser: Can seven insurgent State Senate candidates, fresh off Democratic primary victories, be enough of a catalyst for progressive change?

teaser: Edward Whelan, the president of the Ethics and Public Policy Center, offered to resign, but the organization’s board put him on leave instead.

headline: News Analysis: Constrained From Fighting, Trump Is Left a Spectator With Kavanaugh in Peril
teaser: A confirmation effort that was once seen as an island of functionality in a chaotic White House has become the latest messy episode in a presidency full of them.

teaser: A second accusation of misconduct surfaced against Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh on Sunday, the same day Christine Blasey Ford committed to testifying against him.

teaser: The race for Senator Robert Menendez’s seat has proved competitive in deeply blue New Jersey. His Republican opponent, Bob Hugin, built his career in the pharmaceutical industry.

headline: One Big Problem With Medicaid Work Requirement: People Are Unaware It Exists
teaser: Arkansas is the first state to test it, and thousands have been kicked off the program.

headline: Trump Stands by ‘Fantastic’ Kavanaugh as He Seeks G.O.P. Votes
teaser: In a radio interview with Geraldo Rivera to be broadcast Monday, the president cast doubt on the sexual assault allegation against Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

headline: Rod Rosenstein, Deputy Attorney General, Is Considering Resigning
teaser: It was not immediately clear whether he expected to be fired by President Trump or whether he planned to resign.

headline: Gina Haspel Is Skeptical of North Korea’s Willingness to Give Up Nuclear Arms
teaser: The C.I.A. director is supportive of the Trump administration’s diplomatic efforts, but reflects a widespread view that North Korea is reluctant to denuclearize.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh, Facing New Allegations, Vows He Will Not Withdraw
teaser: Senior Republicans, tamping down speculation that support might be cracking, will come out strongly in favor of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s confirmation to the Supreme Court.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Congress Has a Bad Reputation. Kavanaugh Isn’t Helping.
teaser: The Judiciary Committee decides whether to perform its core duty, a look at what’s ahead for Rosenstein, and a dispatch from Alaska.

headline: Trump Signs Revised Korean Trade Deal
teaser: The pact, which will allow more American automobile exports to South Korea, lacks a promised side deal to prevent currency manipulation.

headline: McConnell Accuses Democrats of ‘Trying to Destroy’ Kavanaugh
teaser: In a speech on the Senate floor, Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, defended Judge Brett Kavanaugh against the sexual misconduct allegations against the Supreme Court nominee and said Democrats were helping conduct a “smear campaign.”

headline: Drug Industry Tries to Slip $4 Billion Windfall Into Opioid Bill
teaser: Drug companies are eyeing a popular opioid bill to roll back discounts for Medicare beneficiaries, but opposition has quickly mobilized.

headline: The Evolution of Kyrsten Sinema, from Homeless Child to Senate Candidate
teaser: Ms. Sinema, the Democratic nominee in Arizona, has made her story of childhood homelessness a central part of her political identity. But documents and contradictory statements raise questions about it.

headline: Florida Democrat Running for Congress Dies Unexpectedly
teaser: April Freeman had been set to face off against a Republican state senator, Greg Steube, in the November election.

headline: How Rosenstein Protects Mueller From Trump
teaser: Deputy Attorney General Rod J. Rosenstein has discussed ways to remove President Trump from office. He’s also fiercely defended the special counsel for the Russia investigation, Robert S. Mueller III — one of the president’s most frequent targets.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s Inaccurate Claim That U.S. Is ‘the Fastest-Growing Economy in the World’
teaser: The United States’ G.D.P. growth is nowhere near the highest in the world, though its rate is currently one of the highest among developed economies.

headline: Protesters Rally Against Kavanaugh, and Back His Accusers: ‘The Wave of Women Is Here’
teaser: Demonstrations and walkouts took place in solidarity with Christine Blasey Ford and Deborah Ramirez, who have accused the Supreme Court nominee of sexual misconduct.

headline: ‘We Believe Women’: Protesters Rally Against Kavanaugh
teaser: Demonstrations across the country took place against the Supreme Court nominee Judge Brett Kavanaugh, who is accused of sexual assault.

headline: White House Memo: At the U.N., Trump Can’t Escape His Political Problems Back in Washington
teaser: With the drama surrounding Rod J. Rosenstein and Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, it is hard to recall a General Assembly that opened against a backdrop of such political turmoil, on so many fronts.

headline: Supreme Court Fight Goes Prime Time With Kavanaugh’s Fox News Interview
teaser: Brett M. Kavanaugh submitted to questions about allegations of sexual misconduct, the first time in memory that a Supreme Court nominee was interviewed on TV before a confirmation vote.

headline: Iran’s Terms to Reopen Nuclear Talks? Trump Has to Back Down
teaser: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran said Monday he would consider new talks with Washington only if President Trump reversed himself and honored the 2015 nuclear accord.

headline: On Politics: Kavanaugh Says He Won’t Be ‘Intimidated’
teaser: Judge Brett Kavanaugh, facing mounting allegations of sexual impropriety, vowed to fight the “smears,” saying he will not withdraw his Supreme Court nomination.

headline: Voters in Battleground Districts Are Divided on Kavanaugh
teaser: Polling suggests that support for his Supreme Court nomination has eroded in the last week.

headline: On Washington: Kavanaugh’s ‘Golden Résumé’ Turns Into a Lead Weight
teaser: His pluses have become minuses as his time at elite schools has given rise to sexual misconduct claims and his long record in Washington has fueled Democratic distrust.

headline: News Analysis: The Democratic Dream: Defeat Kavanaugh, Win the Senate and Stop Trump Supreme Court Picks
teaser: That scenario helps explain why President Trump and Senator Mitch McConnell are so determined to push through Brett Kavanaugh rather than replace him with a less damaged candidate.

headline: United Nations General Assembly: Live Updates
teaser: Leaders from around the world have gathered in New York to deal with a host of nettlesome issues, ranging from Iran’s nuclear program to North Korea to wars in the Middle East.

headline: Watch Live: Leaders Speak to the United Nations General Assembly
teaser: President Trump will give a speech on Tuesday before the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

headline: ‘We Believe Survivors’: Protesters Surround Cruz at Restaurant
teaser: Demonstrators confronted Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas, at a restaurant to protest the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, who has been accused of sexual assault.

headline: Anti-Kavanaugh Protesters Confront Ted Cruz at Dinner
teaser: “We believe survivors,” the activists chanted, as they surrounded Mr. Cruz and his wife, Heidi, at an upscale Italian restaurant in Washington.

headline: Trump, at U.N., Scorns ‘Unaccountable Global Bureaucracy’
teaser: The president, speaking at the General Assembly, doubled down on his “America First” foreign policy. He did have a few kind words for North Korea.

headline: Lisa Murkowski Delivers Message: Take Kavanaugh Accusations Seriously
teaser: Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, said she is troubled by Christine Blasey Ford’s story. “It is about whether or not a woman who has been a victim at some point in her life is to be believed.”

headline: Trump Accuses Democrats of Running ‘Con Game’ Against Kavanaugh
teaser: Speaking in New York, the president disparaged a woman who accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of exposing himself to her, saying she was “messed up” and “drunk” at the time.

headline: Alabama Revisits Ten Commandments, Hoping for Help from Kavanaugh
teaser: The state’s voters this fall will decide on a constitutional amendment that would allow the commandments to be displayed in schools and other public property

headline: Trump Trade Negotiator Warns That Canada Is Running Out of Time
teaser: Robert Lighthizer, the United States trade representative, said the administration will move forward with a bilateral trade pact with Mexico if an agreement cannot be reached with Canada.

headline: Trump Accuses Democrats of Playing ‘Con Game’
teaser: President Trump unleashed his latest criticism of Democrats, calling them “con artists” for their handling of the sexual misconduct accusations against Judge Brett Kavanaugh.

headline: Mormon Women’s Group Calls for Probe of Allegations Against Kavanaugh
teaser: The Mormon Women for Ethical Government called for a suspension of Judge Kavanaugh’s confirmation proceedings, pending a thorough investigation.

headline: Hatch: ‘Everything Is an Excuse for Delay’ in Kavanaugh Hearing

headline: One Reason for Slow Wage Growth? More Benefits
teaser: The rise of nonwage compensation like paid time off is helping persuade the Fed to push up interest rates.

headline: China Rejects U.S. Warship’s Visit to Hong Kong as Tensions Rise
teaser: The cancellation, along with recalling a senior admiral who was in the United States for a conference, came in response to sanctions imposed by the Trump administration.

headline: Hunt of Yellowstone Grizzly Bears Canceled as a Result of Judge’s Ruling
teaser: A federal court decision found that the United States Fish and Wildlife Service erred in stripping the grizzlies’ status as a threatened species.

headline: They Say Sexual Assault, Kavanaugh Says It Never Happened: Sifting Truth From Memory
teaser: How trauma and time alter the way we recollect significant events.

headline: As Debt Rises, the Government Will Soon Spend More on Interest Than on the Military
teaser: Tax cuts, spending increases and higher interest rates could make it harder to respond to future recessions and deal with other needs.

headline: Tom Steyer to Spend Millions Backing Andrew Gillum in Florida
teaser: Tom Steyer, the liberal billionaire who has crusaded for impeaching President Trump, is pouring money into electing Andrew Gillum governor of Florida.

headline: Law Enforcement Officials Confront Tech Companies’ Power

headline: ‘I Believe Her’: Mazie Hirono Takes an Aggressive Stance in Kavanaugh Hearings
teaser: The Hawaii Senator has gained newfound prominence as a leading Democratic voice calling for Judge Kavanaugh’s accusers to be heard and respected.

headline: He Took Home Documents to Catch Up on Work at the N.S.A. He Got 5½ Years in Prison.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: Fact-Checking Trump’s Speech to the United Nations
teaser: Addressing the world body’s annual General Assembly meeting on Tuesday, President Trump made inaccurate claims about his own record, the Islamic State, the war in Yemen, reactions to the Iran nuclear deal and the trade deficit.

headline: Congress Bets Trump Will Sign Bill to Fund Military, Even Without His Wall
teaser: Neither Republicans nor Democrats want the government to close before the midterm elections, but the president has repeatedly raised the specter of a shutdown, most recently last week.

headline: McConnell’s Fix for Judiciary Panel’s Gender Gap: ‘Female Assistant’

headline: U.S. Army Reservist Is Accused of Spying for China
teaser: The suspect, Ji Chaoqun, gave information to a Chinese intelligence officer to recruit employees at American defense contractors as informants, court papers said.

headline: In Yale’s Culture of Privilege and Alcohol, Her World Converged With Kavanaugh’s

headline: Kavanaugh’s Assertions About His Past Face Scrutiny

headline: On Politics: Trump Accuses Democrats of a ‘Con Game’

headline: E.P.A. Places the Head of Its Office of Children’s Health on Leave
teaser: The unusual move affects an office tasked with making sure that environmental regulations adequately protect children and fetuses from exposure.

headline: Who Is Rachel Mitchell, the Prosecutor Set to Question Christine Blasey Ford?
teaser: Ms. Mitchell, the chief of the Special Victims Division of the Maricopa County attorney’s office in Arizona, is well regarded her peers and officials say.

headline: What to Watch From the Fed: A Rate Increase and the Path Forward
teaser: Markets have priced in a fourth consecutive quarterly rate increase. All that’s left on Wednesday is the Fed’s official announcement.

headline: Our Investigative Reporters Explain the Trump-Russia Story

headline: Trump Vows to Release Mideast Peace Plan Within 4 Months

headline: Trump Accuses China of Interfering in Midterm Elections
teaser: Mr. Trump offered no evidence of Chinese meddling in the November vote, but he has previously accused China of aiming tariffs at American states that support him.

headline: Kavanaugh’s Calendar Portrays Party-Filled Summer for Supreme Court Nominee

headline: Kavanaugh Is Accused by a Third Woman of Sexual Misconduct

headline: Are You a Young Evangelical? We Want to Hear From You Ahead of the Midterm Elections
teaser: We’re interested in hearing from young evangelicals about the relationship between your faith and politics today.

headline: Fed Raises Rates for Third Time in 2018
teaser: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the third time this year and signaled it was on track to raise them again in December.

headline: Female Candidates Calibrate Politics with Support for Kavanaugh Accusers

teaser: Senator John Kennedy of Louisiana, a member of the Judiciary Committee, urges his fellow Republicans to avoid turning Thursday’s hearing into a spectacle.

headline: Black Female Lawmaker in Vermont Resigns After Racial Harassment

headline: At the Center of the Kavanaugh Accusations: Heavy Drinking

headline: In Rare Bipartisan Accord, House and Senate Reach Compromise on Opioid Bill
teaser: The legislation contains a mix of law enforcement and public health measures. Addiction experts say it will help — but not enough.

headline: Angry Colleague Tells Congressman What to Do With ‘Racist Ad’

headline: ‘Nothing Has Changed’: Angela Wright Reflects on the Anita Hill-Clarence Thomas Hearings

headline: Ellison, Trying to Clear Name, Calls for Investigation Into Abuse Claims

headline: Trump Calls Accusations Against Kavanaugh ‘All False’

headline: Read Brett Kavanaugh’s Complete Opening Statement

teaser: A week after internet rumors started circulating about Christine Blasey Ford, misinformation is still spreading about her and two other women.

teaser: President Trump remarked that the deputy attorney general, Rod Rosenstein, denied allegations that he planned to invoke the 25th amendment to remove President Trump from office.

teaser: The Trump administration is prepared to release text of its trade agreement with Mexico, throwing the future of the trilateral Nafta pact into uncertainty.

headline: Read Christine Blasey Ford’s Prepared Statement
teaser: In her prepared remarks about Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, Dr. Blasey said that his “assault on me drastically altered my life.”

teaser: President Trump complained that Canada’s tariffs were too high and said that “we don’t like their representative very much.”

headline: Trump Calls Kavanaugh Accusations ‘All False,’ but Says He Can Be Convinced by Testimony

headline: On Politics: Trump Calls Kavanaugh Accusations ‘All False’
teaser: President Trump said that his own opinion about Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s case was affected by the many allegations of sexual misconduct that had been leveled against him.

headline: Live Briefing: Kavanaugh Hearing: What to Watch as Christine Blasey Ford Heads to Capitol Hill

headline: Best of Late Night: Samantha Bee Slams Kavanaugh’s Defenders

teaser: The meeting could be rescheduled, as the president will be monitoring testimony from Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh and the woman who accused the Supreme Court nominee of sexual assault.

headline: Pompeo Hails Talks With North Korea but Says Sanctions Must Continue

headline: Washington Rolls Back Safety Rules Inspired by Deepwater Horizon Disaster

teaser: The political and gender divide in America played out on TV not just in what Christine Blasey and Brett Kavanaugh said, but how they said it.

headline: As Senator Collins Weighs Vote, Maine Women Size Up Blasey and Kavanaugh

teaser: Surrounded by her lawyers, publicists and a sisterhood of friends who had convened to support her and zealously protect her privacy, Dr. Blasey said her piece.

headline: On Politics: An Emotional Hearing, With the Supreme Court at Stake
teaser: A woman’s tremulous account of sexual assault and a man’s angry, outraged denial played out for hours before a riveted nation and a riven Senate.

headline: American Bar Association Urges F.B.I. Inquiry Into Kavanaugh
teaser: The group, which had endorsed the judge’s Supreme Court nomination, said Thursday that it should not move ahead until sexual assault allegations are carefully examined.

headline: With a Key Vote Secured, Senators Will Advance Kavanaugh’s Nomination

teaser: Senator Jeff Flake spoke with two women who described their own sexual trauma.

teaser: Despite Democratic claims that Republicans are needlessly rushing the nomination, Republicans see opportunity for a conservative court.

headline: Smile! Don’t Get Angry. The ‘Tight Rope’ of Testifying While Female.

teaser: Both countries are expected to release text of the agreement reached last month, setting up a potential showdown with Canada and Congress.

teaser: What often seems an afterthought is that for millions of women, and men, who have endured sexual violence, the toll is life-altering. It’s trauma that doesn’t have a term limit.

teaser: A spokeswoman for Andrew Gillum, the Democrat, called the messages “abusive.” His opponent, Ron DeSantis, did not deny being behind them.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: How the Kavanaugh Hearing Resonated
teaser: A deluge of responses from readers on the hearing, plus a recap of a busy day and the best opinion writing on the topic.

headline: How the F.B.I. Will Investigate the Kavanaugh Accusations
teaser: The bureau, in a relatively limited inquiry, will rely on witnesses to voluntarily answer questions or hand over documents.

teaser: The Republican senator, confronted by angry women and frustrated Democrats, got a one-week delay for the F.B.I. to investigate sexual misconduct accusations.

teaser: The New York Times fact-checked his testimony, and what emerges is the image of a skilled lawyer who dissembled when pressed on certain accusations.

teaser: A case brought by Democrats in Congress could give them access to a wide array of financial documents from the president and the Trump Organization.

headline: On Politics: This Week’s Biggest Stories
teaser: The Kavanaugh hearings weren’t the only news in a busy week for American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories this week (and some links, if you want to read further).

headline: Do Migrant Teenagers Have Abortion Rights? Two Volatile Issues Collide in Court
teaser: The Trump administration says it has broad authority to block abortions for young undocumented immigrants in federal custody, because they can return to their home countries at any time.

headline: News Analysis: Kavanaugh Could Help G.O.P. in Senate Midterms. But Not in House Races.
teaser: Republicans believe Judge Kavanaugh’s confirmation would cause a backlash among women and independent voters, hurting G.O.P. chances in House races.

headline: U.S. Weighed Penalizing El Salvador Over Support for China, Then Backed Off
teaser: The White House wanted to cut aid to El Salvador after it severed diplomatic ties with Taiwan in favor of China. But that could have jeopardized efforts to curb illegal immigration.

headline: Kavanaugh Borrows From Trump’s Playbook on White Male Anger
teaser: For many conservatives, especially white men, angry responses Thursday by Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh and Senator Lindsey Graham represented a welcome rebuke to a hostile liberal order.

headline: Next Women’s March Is Set for January, With Main Protest in Washington
teaser: March organizers hope to capitalize on opposition to Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s nomination to the Supreme Court and to influence the 2020 presidential race.

headline: Washington Braces for Battle as F.B.I. Contacts Potential Witnesses to Kavanaugh Claims
teaser: The F.B.I. has reached out to a Yale classmate of Judge Kavanaugh, Deborah Ramirez, who has accused him of exposing his genitals to her at a college party.

headline: Kavanaugh Battle Shows the Power, and the Limits, of #MeToo Movement
teaser: Christine Blasey Ford’s emergence shows how pivotal the movement has become, and how its dynamics have threaded their way into American life.

headline: Warren Says She Will Take ‘A Hard Look’ at Running for President in 2020
teaser: Senator Warren, a liberal Democrat from Massachusetts, has been one of her party’s most aggressive critics of President Trump.

headline: Iranian Official Says Oil Deal With Europeans Is Close Despite Threat of U.S. Sanctions
teaser: The arrangement would constitute the most open break between President Trump and European allies that objected vociferously to his decision to pull out of the 2015 nuclear deal.

headline: A Quiet Docket May Be Just the Right Medicine for the Supreme Court
teaser: A lack of blockbuster cases offers the justices a chance to bridge ideological divides that have flared in the confirmation process of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

teaser: Chad Ludington, who in a statement said he frequently socialized with Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, said he often saw him “staggering from alcohol consumption.”

headline: Kellyanne Conway Says She Was a Victim of Sexual Assault
teaser: Ms. Conway said she was a victim of sexual assault as she defended Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court nominee, who has been accused of sexual assault decades ago.

headline: U.S. and Canada Move Closer to Nafta Deal as Deadline Looms
teaser: With a midnight deadline approaching, differences between the two countries were still preventing a three-nation deal.

headline: Trump Administration Prepares a Major Weakening of Mercury Emissions Rules
teaser: The proposal is designed to provide legal justification for weakening not only the rules on mercury emissions from coal-burning power plants, but also other pollution controls as well.

headline: U.S. Marine’s Son Wins Okinawa Election on Promise to Oppose Military Base
teaser: Denny Tamaki’s victory is a setback to plans to transfer a busy Marine air base to a less-populated coastal area on the island.

headline: On Washington: How Jeff Flake May Have Saved Republicans From Themselves
teaser: The extended F.B.I. investigation wasn’t what Republicans wanted, but it could end up easing the way for Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court confirmation.

teaser: The decision to withdraw from an important annual meeting shows how tensions over an escalating trade war are spreading to other arenas.

headline: Chad Ludington’s Statement on Kavanaugh’s Drinking and Senate Testimony
teaser: Mr. Ludington, a Yale classmate of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s, issued a statement on Sunday saying the Supreme Court nominee misled a Senate panel last week.

headline: On Politics: Democrats Denounce Limits on Kavanaugh Inquiry
teaser: The apparent constraints on the F.B.I. investigation of sexual misconduct allegations against Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court nominee, could make it a “farce,” Democrats said.

headline: Hobbled by Budget Cuts, the I.R.S. Brings Fewer Tax Fraud Cases

headline: Biden is Preparing for 2020. Can He Overcome the Hill-Thomas Hearings?
teaser: As he explores a possible 2020 presidential run, the former vice president finds that his role in Clarence Thomas’s confirmation hearings 27 years ago is complicating his plans.

headline: Justice Department Sues to Stop California Net Neutrality Law

headline: Watch Live: Trump Announces New North American Trade Deal

headline: After Watching Kavanaugh Hearing, Woman Decides to Name State Senator She Says Raped Her
