headline: Trump Hails Revised Nafta Deal as a Trade Promise Kept
teaser: The president, who has renamed the trilateral trade agreement, said it will help United States companies and workers.

headline: Venezuela’s Crisis Imperils Citgo, Its American ‘Cash Cow’
teaser: The government oil company, crippled by sanctions and domestic turmoil, is so deep in debt that a United States subsidiary may be lost as collateral.

headline: Trump Just Ripped Up Nafta. Here’s What’s in the New Deal
teaser: Changes for automakers, dairy farmers, labor unions and large corporations headline the renegotiated U.S.M.C.A., which is poised to replace Nafta.

headline: White House Tells F.B.I. to Interview Anyone Necessary for Kavanaugh Inquiry
teaser: The White House authorized the new directive after a Democratic outcry. But the bureau must finish its investigation by Friday.

headline: Supreme Court, in Harsh Spotlight, Returns to the Bench
teaser: As the nation remained riveted by the embattled nomination of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, the eight justices opened the new term by hearing a case about an endangered frog.

headline: The G.O.P. Keeps Calling Him a ‘Big-City Rapper.’ He’s Also a Rhodes Scholar.
teaser: Antonio Delgado, a Democrat making his first run for office, is challenging Representative John Faso in a key battleground race in New York.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Jeff Flake’s #Me Moment
teaser: A senator whose political stances are more about style than substance; the politics of immigration; and checking in on Democrats and 2020.

headline: Foreigners’ Views of America Dim Under Trump, Poll Shows
teaser: The drop has been particularly steep in parts of Europe and Latin America, according to a Pew Research Center survey. In only three countries have attitudes toward the U.S. improved since 2016.

headline: Jemele Hill Is Joining The Atlantic and Ready to Talk Politics
teaser: After 12 years at ESPN, and a controversial 2017, Ms. Hill will be a staff writer at The Atlantic.

headline: Retro Report: For Private Prisons, Detaining Immigrants Is Big Business
teaser: A surging inmate population in the 1980s led to a boom in for-profit prisons. Today, privately run prisons have become the government’s default detention centers for undocumented migrants.

headline: Kavanaugh Was Questioned by Police After Bar Fight in 1985
teaser: As an undergraduate student at Yale, Brett M. Kavanaugh was involved in an altercation at a local bar during which he was accused of throwing ice on another patron, according to a police report.

headline: Trump, Defending Kavanaugh, Accuses Senate Democrats of Hypocrisy and Dishonesty
teaser: With his Supreme Court nominee’s confirmation under fire, the president lashed out, making various accusations toward Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee.

headline: Trump Attacks Democrats on Senate Judiciary Committee
teaser: President Trump assailed three Democrats who serve on the Senate Judiciary Committee, criticizing their remarks during a hearing into sexual assault accusations against his Supreme Court nominee, Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh.

headline: A New Front in the Kavanaugh Wars: Temperament and Honesty
teaser: As the F.B.I. pursues Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s past, Democrats seeking to derail his nomination are using his performance before the Senate Judiciary Committee last week as a new avenue of attack.

headline: At a Rally Looking Toward November, Trump Sets His Sights Two Years Beyond
teaser: The president, in Tennessee to rally for Republican candidates in the midterms, took aim at three Democrats who could challenge him in 2020.

headline: On Politics: ‘Comprehensive’ Kavanaugh Inquiry Must End by Friday
teaser: The White House said the F.B.I. should interview anyone necessary in its investigation of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court nominee, but that it should be wrapped up quickly.

headline: Floods. Wildfires. Yet Few Candidates Are Running on Climate Change.
teaser: Democrats, campaigning to win back control of the House and fend off Republican Senate candidates in states President Trump won, have been relatively muted on environmental issues this year.

headline: Here Are the 5 Senators Who Will Decide Kavanaugh’s Fate
teaser: One has already made a sudden reversal. One has set up her own test. None blindly follow their party. Here is what each must weigh.

headline: A Political conversation: In Ohio Governor’s Debate, Wonky Candidates in a Divided State
teaser: On Monday night, the two major candidates for governor in Ohio, a critical swing state, met to debate. Two New York Times political reporters attended, and afterward assessed the proceedings.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh and the F.B.I. Investigation: Catch Up
teaser: Here’s an overview of the intense fight over the confirmation of the Supreme Court nominee, who has been accused of sexual misconduct by several women.

headline: F.B.I. Completes Interview of Mark Judge, Kavanaugh Friend
teaser: Mr. Judge has said that he has no recollection of any attempted rape by Judge Kavanaugh. One of the judge’s accusers has said Mr. Judge witnessed the episode.

headline: Abroad in America: ‘What the (Insert Extreme Word of Choice) Is Going On Over There?’
teaser: Sarah Lyall attempts to help foreign readers (and maybe some American ones, and maybe herself) understand what is going on as the United States approaches the midterms.

headline: Ricin Suspected in Mail Sent to Trump and Pentagon Officials
teaser: The Secret Service said the suspicious letter to the president was not delivered to the White House, and the Pentagon quarantined all of its mail.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: What a Book Critic Finds in Mark Judge’s ‘Wasted’ 21 Years Later
teaser: Mark Judge’s 1997 memoir, “Wasted,” captures both the milieu in which the author and Brett Kavanaugh were raised, and prevailing ideas of masculinity in the 1980s.

headline: 11 Takeaways From The Times’s Investigation Into Trump’s Wealth
teaser: Based on a trove of confidential financial records, the Times report offers the first comprehensive look at the inherited fortune and tax dodges that guaranteed Donald Trump a gilded life.

headline: Homeland Security Agency’s Computers Couldn’t Track Separated Families, Report Finds
teaser: The agency struggled to track children separated from their parents and gave inconsistent information to migrant parents arriving at the border, an inspector general’s report said.

headline: Trump Taunts Christine Blasey Ford at Rally
teaser: At a campaign event in Mississippi, the president went further than ever before in directly assailing Dr. Blasey, who has accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual assault.

headline: Four California Men Accused of Inciting Riots in Charlottesville Violence
teaser: Federal prosecutors described the men as “serial rioters” and said they repeatedly attacked people protesting last summer’s white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va.

headline: ‘It’s a Very Scary Time for Young Men,’ Trump Says
teaser: President Trump made the remark about young men in the U.S. amid the unfolding investigation into sexual assault accusations against his Supreme Court nominee, Judge Brett Kavanaugh.

headline: U.S. Bans Diplomatic Visas for Foreign Same-Sex Domestic Partners
teaser: Foreign diplomats and employees of the United Nations, World Bank, NATO and other international organizations must be married for their partners to get a visa.

headline: New Arrests in Connection to Deadly Charlottesville Violence
teaser: Four men with ties to a white supremacist group were arrested on charges of inciting a riot at last year’s rally and counterprotests in Virginia, the authorities said.

headline: Justices Weigh Case of Condemned Inmate Who Cannot Recall His Crime
teaser: The Supreme Court, which is short-handed as it awaits word of the fate of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s nomination, seemed to be looking for a way to rule for the inmate without making a broad statement.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: War of the Sexes
teaser: How the Kavanaugh hearings reflect our new political reality; questions about the midterms; and the latest on the F.B.I. investigation.

headline: Anti-Kavanaugh Protesters Arrested at Joe Manchin’s Office
teaser: Nine women were arrested during a sit-in at the office of the West Virginia Democrat, who has not said if he will vote to confirm Judge Kavanaugh.

headline: What’s in a Name Change? For Those Saying U.S.M.C.A., a Mouthful
teaser: Reviews are still out on the substance of the new trade deal to succeed Nafta, but its abbreviation is getting a resounding thumbs down.

headline: Kavanaugh Proceedings Drive a Senate Once Governed by Decorum Into Rancor
teaser: Rules dating back to Jefferson are supposed to keep the Senate a decorous place where prerogative rises above partisanship. The Kavanaugh proceedings are breaking it.

headline: Bar Association Questioned Kavanaugh’s Temperament and Honesty in 2006
teaser: The bar association on three occasions gave Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh its highest rating. In 2006, though, after scores of interviews, it had doubts.

headline: White House Has a Message for Republican Candidates: Stay Close to Trump
teaser: In a memo, Bill Stepien, the White House political director, described a plan for the president to campaign in seven states for House candidates who support his agenda.

headline: ‘Take Out’ Russian Missiles? U.S. Envoy’s Remark Spurs Anger, and Pullback
teaser: The American ambassador to NATO used vague language that sounded like an American threat to strike Russian missiles preemptively. She later clarified her meaning.

headline: On Politics: Trump Empire Was Built On Suspect Tax Schemes
teaser: A Times investigation reveals that President Trump participated in dubious tax schemes during the 1990s that greatly increased the fortune he received from his parents.

headline: Missing in the G.O.P.: Black and Hispanic Nominees for Governor
teaser: There are 36 governors races this year. In about 30 of them, the Republican nominees are white men.

headline: International Court Orders U.S. to Ease Some Iran Sanctions
teaser: The International Court of Justice said in a nonbinding ruling that Washington should lessen restrictions that affect humanitarian aid and civilian aviation safety.

headline: In Tennessee Senate Race, Financial Missteps Linger in the Background
teaser: Marsha Blackburn, a firebrand Trump supporter, squares off against Phil Bredesen, a moderate former governor, in a race that’s a microcosm for others around the country

headline: Christine Blasey Ford’s Credibility Under New Attack by Senate Republicans
teaser: In a sworn statement to the Senate, a man who said he dated Dr. Blasey for six years contradicted her testimony about her experience with polygraph tests.

headline: Swing Republican Senators Condemn Trump’s Mockery of Kavanaugh Accuser
teaser: President Trump’s mockery of Christine Blasey Ford, who has accused Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual assault, has injected new uncertainty into his Supreme Court confirmation.

headline: How Fred Trump’s Empire Made Donald Trump Millions
teaser: In Donald Trump’s version of how he got rich, he was the master dealmaker who parlayed a $1 million loan from his father into a $10 billion empire. But a New York Times investigation shows that in every era of Mr. Trump’s life, his finances were deeply intertwined with, and dependent on, his father’s wealth.

headline: How Donald Trump’s Dad Made Him a Landlord at Age 3
teaser: As a toddler, Donald Trump was earning $200,000 a year in today’s dollars from his father’s empire. He was a millionaire by age 8. Here’s how Fred Trump’s financial maneuvering created a steady stream of income for Donald Trump and his siblings.

headline: How Fred Trump’s Children Became His Bankers
teaser: In the 1980s, Fred Trump made an important structural change to his empire that produced a large new source of revenue for Donald Trump and his siblings. By using family mortgages, Fred Trump turned his children into his bankers.

headline: How the Trumps Held on to Generational Wealth
teaser: By the end of 1997, Donald Trump and his siblings owned nearly all of Fred Trump’s empire, free and clear of estate taxes. How did they do it? A special type of trust with a clunky acronym: GRAT, short for grantor-retained annuity trust. It is one of the tax code’s great gifts to the ultrawealthy.

headline: For Canada and U.S., ‘That Relationship Is Gone’ After Bitter Nafta Talks
teaser: The negotiations over the trade deal shocked Canadians, who now feel that the close relationship with their biggest trading partner is destroyed.

headline: Trump Attacks ‘Failing New York Times’ Over Tax Scheme Reporting
teaser: Responding to an article published online Tuesday, President Trump did not offer an outright denial of the facts it reported.

headline: U.S. Withdraws From 1955 Treaty Normalizing Relations With Iran
teaser: The largely symbolic move comes after the International Court of Justice ordered the United States to ease some sanctions on Iran.

headline: Trump’s Mockery of Blasey Draws Ire of Swing G.O.P. Votes
teaser: Senators Jeff Flake, Susan Collins and Lisa Murkowski criticized President Trump’s derisive comments about Christine Blasey Ford, who has accused his Supreme Court pick, Judge Brett Kavanaugh, of sexual assault.

headline: ‘He Was Stating Facts’: Sanders Defends Trump’s Blasey Remarks
teaser: Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the White House press secretary, deflected criticism of President Trump for mocking Christine Blasey Ford’s testimony, in which she accused Judge Brett Kavanaugh of sexual assault.

headline: Melania Trump, in Africa (and Far From Washington), Seems at Ease
teaser: With an ocean between her and the turmoil of the White House, the first lady showed a side of herself the public rarely sees: the happy one.

headline: Are Bar Fights Normal? A Debate Fit for 2018
teaser: After news that Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh had been in a bar fight in 1985, debate erupted about whether that was a red flag — or an American rite of passage.

headline: Bernie Sanders to Discuss the Midterms and What’s at Stake for Students
teaser: Mr. Sanders will be interviewed by Alexander Burns, a national political correspondent for The New York Times, at the University of Maryland on Wednesday night.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Midterm Conspiracies
teaser: The most out-there theories of 2018; texting about our new texting project; and a rundown of of today’s White House briefing.

headline: Federal Anti-Discrimination Official Under Fire for Racial Comments
teaser: A top Consumer Financial Protection Bureau official apologized to agency staff members after a racially charged blog post he wrote in 2004 as a University of Virginia law student became public.

headline: Sanders Dismisses The Times’s Trump-Tax Story as ‘Very Boring’
teaser: But Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the White House press secretary, had some praise for The New York Times investigation into the Trump family’s tax schemes.

headline: With a Transformed Judiciary in Sight, McConnell ‘Will Not Be Intimidated’
teaser: But Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky, knows he may take the blame from President Trump and conservatives if the Senate does not confirm Judge Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court.

headline: Protesters Ask McConnell: ‘Do You Always Turn Your Back on Women Like This?’
teaser: Senator Mitch McConnell was followed and questioned by a group of women about sexual assault victims at Reagan Washington National Airport on Monday.

headline: News Analysis: In Risky Shift, Trump and G.O.P. Directly Assail Kavanaugh’s Accuser
teaser: After weeks of not directly attacking Christine Blasey Ford, the president and his Republican allies have embarked on a more aggressive effort to challenge her credibility.

headline: Pence Speech to String Together a Narrative of Chinese Aggression
teaser: Vice President Mike Pence, in a speech on Thursday, is expected to say that “China wants a different American president,” according to excerpts from the speech released Wednesday night.

headline: On Politics: Republicans Condemn Trump’s Mockery of Kavanaugh Accuser
teaser: Three senators who could decide Judge Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court confirmation denounced President Trump’s taunts against a woman who accused the judge of sexual assault.

headline: Estranged in America: Why Both Sides Feel Lost and Left Out
teaser: Nearly half of Democrats say they feel this way, slightly more than Republicans.

headline: Driven by South’s Past, Black Women Seek Votes and a New Future
teaser: Mobilized by the nation’s divisions on race and Donald Trump’s presidency, black women are using networks forged in segregation to turn out voters this fall.

headline: Russia Accused in Cyberattacks on Investigators Pursuing Doping and Poisoning Cases
teaser: American and European officials said that Russian military intelligence officers were responsible for a string of attacks and attempted hackings.

headline: On Kavanaugh’s Confirmation, Republicans Are Increasingly Confident
teaser: As senators read F.B.I. interview transcripts, the White House is confident that the new background check on Brett M. Kavanaugh has improved his claim to the Supreme Court.

headline: Hillary Clinton Is Coming to Broadway. As a Character in a Play.
teaser: Lucas Hnath’s “Hillary and Clinton” will be the first play with Mrs. Clinton as a protagonist to reach Broadway.

headline: Lindsey Graham Welcomed Trump’s China Tariffs, Then Helped Companies Avoid Them
teaser: The South Carolina senator urged the administration to exclude imports used by companies from his state from a list of products subject to tariffs.

headline: Brett Kavanaugh and ‘Boys Club’ Code
teaser: From Las Vegas to Georgetown Prep, variations of “what happens here stays here” are common. But where does this phrase come from and what does it really mean?

headline: U.S. Sanctions Turkish Company for Trade With North Korea
teaser: The sanctions on a Turkish company intend to be a tough signal to Pyongyang ahead of Secretary of State Mike Pompeo’s visit to North Korea this weekend.

headline: Viruses Spread by Insects to Crops Sound Scary. The Military Calls It Food Security.
teaser: Critics warn that a Defense Department-funded food security project that is still in the lab could set off a “biological arms race.”

headline: As Afghanistan Frays, Blackwater Founder Erik Prince Is Everywhere
teaser: Some Afghan officials say Mr. Prince is trying to influence presidential elections to pave the way for his plan to privatize the war for President Trump.

headline: The Kavanaugh Report: Reactions From Senators on the Right and Left
teaser: Lawmakers reviewed the F.B.I.’s findings from an inquiry into Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s background. Here’s what senators from each side of the aisle had to say about it.

headline: Terrorist Threat ‘More Fluid and Complex Than Ever,’ White House Says
teaser: The Trump administration’s first public counterterrorism strategy cleaves to many of the same principles and plans adopted by Presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush.

headline: 5 Senate Races and 10 Women Add Up to One Big Moment
teaser: The proliferation of female candidates for New York State Senate, several of whom are running for the first time, has excited observers who lament the gender gap in politics.

headline: Critic’s Notebook: In ’80s Comedies, Boys Had It Made. Girls Were the Joke.
teaser: Teen movies like “Porky’s” reveled in the dynamic of Dr. Christine Blasey Ford’s worst memory: “The uproarious laughter between the two, and their having fun at my expense.”

headline: Senators React to F.B.I. Report on Kavanaugh
teaser: Republicans and Democrats have drastically different reactions after reviewing an F.B.I. report into allegations against Judge Brett Kavanaugh.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Reality Check
teaser: A warning against putting too much faith into polls right now; updates on Flake and Heitkamp; and the latest from the Opinion pages.

headline: Ron DeSantis Reboots in Close Florida Governor’s Race, After Early Stumble
teaser: Mr. DeSantis had strong support from President Trump, but initial missteps left him trailing his Democratic opponent. Now he is on the attack, seeking momentum.

headline: G.O.P. Hopes Anger Over Treatment of Kavanaugh Propels Voters to the Polls
teaser: Conservatives hope to use the liberal opposition to Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination as a graphic example of the threat posed by a Democratic takeover, but they worry that passions will dissipate.

headline: Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Plastics Are Predicted to Rise
teaser: A predicted rise in emissions from the petrochemical industry, led by plastics producers, threatens to erode climate benefits from reductions in other sectors, according to a report.

headline: New York Regulators Examine the Trump Family’s Tax Schemes
teaser: State and city officials announced they were looking into the maneuvers after an investigative report in The New York Times.

headline: Protesters Pack the Senate Building
teaser: Protesters confronted Senator Orrin Hatch, Republican of Utah, in the elevator, while others filled the balconies of the atrium of the Hart Senate Office Building.

headline: Former Justice John Paul Stevens Says Kavanaugh Is Not Fit for Supreme Court
teaser: Justice Stevens, 98, suggested that Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s performance at his confirmation hearing “demonstrated a potential bias” that should disqualify him.

headline: Trump Mocks Al Franken for Quick Resignation Over Claims of Sex Misconduct
teaser: It was an extraordinary statement as the president’s Supreme Court nominee nears a vote in a confirmation process rocked by such accusations.

headline: On Politics: 2 Key Republicans Signal Satisfaction With Kavanaugh Inquiry
teaser: Senator Jeff Flake of Arizona and Senator Susan Collins of Maine indicated they were satisfied with the F.B.I. report on Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court nominee.

headline: Singing, Chanting and Rage on Capitol Hill as Kavanaugh Vote Nears
teaser: On a steamy day in the capital, several thousand protesters, most of them female, made a late stand against the nomination of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court.

headline: Kavanaugh Has Regrets About Testimony: ‘I Said a Few Things I Should Not Have Said’
teaser: In an op-ed published Thursday night, Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh admitted that he “said a few things I should not have said” at his hearing last week.

headline: September Jobs Report: Here’s What to Watch For
teaser: The Labor Department data will provide the latest snapshot of the American economy.

headline: Take a Tour of Manafort’s Multimillion-Dollar Homes, Going Up for Sale
teaser: As part of a plea deal with federal prosecutors, Paul Manafort, President Trump’s disgraced campaign chairman, forfeited his New York homes worth about $22 million to the government.

headline: Jacky Rosen Wants to Flip Nevada for Democrats. But First, Kavanaugh.
teaser: Ms. Rosen, a first-term congresswoman, is running against Senator Dean Heller, one of the most endangered Republican incumbents in November. The Kavanaugh nomination is a wild card in the race.

headline: Take a Tour of Manafort’s Multimillion-Dollar Homes, Going Up for Sale
teaser: As part of a plea deal with federal prosecutors, Paul Manafort, President Trump’s disgraced campaign chairman, forfeited his New York homes worth about $22 million to the government.

headline: Retired Supreme Court Justice: Kavanaugh Is Not Qualified
teaser: Justice John Paul Stevens, a former member of the Supreme Court, said Judge Brett Kavanaugh “demonstrated a potential bias” during the second round of his Supreme Court confirmation hearings last week.

headline: One Year After #MeToo, Examining a Collective Awakening
teaser: Exactly one year ago, reporting on Harvey Weinstein unleashed a movement. That movement’s adaptability and capacity continues to be tested at a whirlwind pace.

headline: Kavanaugh Clears Key Procedural Vote on Way to Supreme Court
teaser: The Senate narrowly voted to cut off debate on the confirmation of Brett M. Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court, setting up a final vote as early as Saturday.

headline: Trump Derides Kavanaugh Protesters and Claims They Were Paid
teaser: The president called some of the women protesting his embattled Supreme Court nominee “very rude elevator screamers.”

headline: Abroad in America: It All Comes Down to the Senate
teaser: Sarah Lyall is helping international readers (and maybe some American ones, and maybe herself) understand what is going on as the U.S. approaches the November elections.

headline: Senator Murkowski Voted Against Kavanaugh. Read Her Remarks Declaring Why.
teaser: The Alaskan senator said Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh was “not the right man for the court at this time.”

headline: The Kavanaugh Vote: Murkowski, Manchin, Collins and Flake in the Spotlight
teaser: Here are the key senators as the Senate moves toward a final vote Saturday afternoon on Judge Brett Kavanaugh.

headline: Melania Trump Raises Eyebrows in Africa With Another White Hat
teaser: The first lady drew criticism after she appeared on a safari grassland wearing a pith helmet — a common symbol of European colonial rule.

headline: House Democrat Promises Kavanaugh Investigation if Party Wins Control
teaser: Representative Jerrold Nadler, who is in line to be the chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, said he was prepared to look into accusations of sexual misconduct and perjury.

headline: As Kavanaugh Moves to Final Vote, Still No Resolution on Hill Harassment Legislation
teaser: Lawmakers have yet to finalize their own overhaul rules to handle discrimination and harassment on Capitol Hill.

headline: A Daughter’s Wedding Adds to the Drama Around the Senate’s Kavanaugh Vote
teaser: Senator Steve Daines, Republican of Montana, probably won’t be needed to confirm Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, but he’s ready to leave his daughter’s Big Sky wedding if necessary.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Inside Murkowski’s Vote on Kavanaugh
teaser: Why a senator from Alaska broke from her party; photos from a crazy day on Capitol Hill; and Hillary’s Broadway debut.

headline: Read Susan Collins’s Speech Declaring Support for Brett Kavanaugh
teaser: Senator Susan Collins of Maine, a key Republican vote, said that “my fervent hope is that Brett Kavanaugh will work to lessen the divisions in the Supreme Court.”

headline: Cuomo Accepts the Working Families Ballot Line, Ending Feud. For Now.
teaser: A bet by the Working Families Party on Cynthia Nixon didn’t work out. Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo won big. The party then had to ask him to take its line, grudgingly.

headline: Bitter Tenor of Senate Reflects a Nation at Odds With Itself
teaser: The battle over the confirmation of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh has exposed a climate of partisan distrust rivaled by few other moments in the recent past.

headline: F.B.I. Review of Kavanaugh Was Limited From the Start
teaser: President Trump, reacting to critics, said the F.B.I. should have a free hand to investigate. But the White House counsel told him that was a bad idea.

headline: On Politics: This Week’s Biggest Stories
teaser: From Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh’s all-but-assured confirmation to revelations about President Trump’s wealth, here are some of this week’s biggest stories in American politics.

headline: Susan Collins, Standing Alone, Makes Her Case for Kavanaugh
teaser: The Republican senator from Maine delivered a 45-minute, point-by-point civic lesson of a speech to explain her support for President Trump’s nominee.

headline: News Analysis: After Lots of Bluster, Trump Has a Week to Brag About
teaser: But in Mr. Trump’s scorched-earth presidency, the victories — whether the success of Judge Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination or the trade deal with Canada and Mexico — are divisive and come at a cost.

headline: The Trump Trade Strategy Is Coming Into Focus. That Doesn’t Necessarily Mean It Will Work.
teaser: Taking an aggressive stance with traditional allies now seems to be just a warm-up for the main event: isolating China.

headline: Fact-Checking the President: Has He Saved or Sabotaged Obamacare?
teaser: President Trump boasts that he has “mostly obliterated Obamacare.” His health secretary is taking credit for making the law work better than ever. Who’s right?

headline: Confirming Kavanaugh: A Triumph for Conservatives, but a Blow to the Court’s Image
teaser: The Supreme Court will move further to the right than it has been in many decades, with two distinct blocs that reflect the deep polarization of the American public and political system.

headline: What They’re Saying About Kavanaugh on the Senate Floor
teaser: A series of Democrats and a couple of Republicans made remarks through Friday night and into Saturday morning.

headline: Senate Poised to Confirm Kavanaugh, Ending a Clash With Lasting Fallout
teaser: As the senators entered their final hours of debate, hundreds of protesters were massed on the steps of the Supreme Court and later the Capitol.

headline: Watch Live: Senate Delivers Final Vote on Kavanaugh
teaser: After a highly contentious nomination process, senators deliver the final vote on the confirmation of Judge Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court.

headline: Women, What Is Your Reaction to Kavanaugh’s Confirmation?
teaser: We are eager to understand how women are viewing this moment.

headline: How to Register to Vote: Deadlines for Each State
teaser: Election Day is Nov. 6, but voter registration deadlines in many states are well before that.

headline: Show How You Feel, Kavanaugh Was Told, and a Nomination Was Saved
teaser: Judge Kavanaugh’s angry Senate testimony, urged by the White House counsel, Don McGahn, turned the tables and emboldened demoralized Republicans.

headline: A Day of Broad Smiles and Raised Thumbs for Trump
teaser: “There’s nobody with a squeaky clean past like Brett Kavanaugh,” Mr. Trump told reporters, dismissing allegations of sexual assault and misconduct against the judge.

headline: Cory Booker Criticizes Trump in Iowa, Where Presidential Hopefuls Flock
teaser: Mr. Booker, of New Jersey, is one of several potential Democratic presidential candidates who is crisscrossing the country to be seen by voters.

headline: Battle for the House Has a Wide Range of Possible Outcomes
teaser: The size of the Democratic advantage is unclear, polling shows, and the Kavanaugh controversy introduces an element of volatility.

headline: Was the Kavanaugh Hearing the Worst Supreme Court Fight? You Be the Judge
teaser: While some have bemoaned recent cutthroat politics in the Senate, history shows many failed or hard-fought nominations back to the 1700s.

headline: Pompeo Cites ‘Good Trip’ to North Korea and Progress on a Deal
teaser: The secretary of state’s trip to Pyongyang was his fourth, part of an effort to reach a breakthrough on denuclearization.

headline: Wall Street Is Booming Under Trump. But Many of Its Donors Are Embracing Democrats.
teaser: The financial community is on pace to give more money to Democratic congressional candidates and incumbents than their Republican counterparts.

headline: Liberals Eye Far-Reaching Goal: Delegitimizing Supreme Court’s Conservative Majority
teaser: After the fight over the confirmation of Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh, liberals are discussing ways to undo the conservative bloc’s power.

headline: On Washington: The Senate’s Deep Wounds From an Ugly Kavanaugh Fight
teaser: Accusations, threats, attacks: The confirmation process of Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh entered new territory from the beginning, and senators from both parties fear lasting institutional damage.

headline: With Battle Over, a New Justice Quickly Gets to Work and Sets a Record
teaser: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh is the first member of the Supreme Court to hire an all-female class of law clerks.

headline: A New Wave of Democrats Tests the Party’s Blanket Support for Israel
teaser: A cluster of activist Democrats largely cruising toward House seats has dared to breach what has been an almost inviolable orthodoxy on both sides of the aisle.

headline: Court Battle Shifts the Political Terrain for Senators in the Heartland
teaser: In North Dakota and other farm states, the heated debate over the Supreme Court has nationalized the fight for the Senate, elating Republicans and worrying Democrats

headline: Major Climate Report Describes a Strong Risk of Crisis as Early as 2040
teaser: A landmark United Nations report paints a far more dire picture of the immediate consequences of climate change than previously thought and says that avoiding damage requires quickly transforming the world economy.

headline: On Politics: Kavanaugh Takes His Seat
teaser: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh was in his new chambers on Sunday, preparing for the arguments the Supreme Court will hear this week.

headline: As Storms Keep Coming, FEMA Spends Billions in ‘Cycle’ of Damage and Repair
teaser: FEMA has paid out billions for disaster recovery efforts. But many projects seem to be undertaken in defiance of climate change, leaving structures nearly as vulnerable as before.

headline: Books News: How Feminist Dystopian Fiction Is Channeling Women’s Anger and Anxiety
teaser: A growing canon of female-centered science fiction looks at questions of gender inequality, misogyny and institutionalized sexism.

headline: Nonfiction: John Kerry Describes Politics as It Used to Be
teaser: “Every Day Is Extra” is the memoir of an eyewitness to some of the most dramatic changes in American political history.

headline: Mike Pompeo and His Chinese Counterpart Trade Harsh Words
teaser: A sharp exchange between Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and Foreign Minister Wang Yi stripped away the usual diplomatic veneer.

headline: How The Times Avoids Conflicts of Interest in Book Reviews
teaser: Pamela Paul and two other editors of The New York Times Book Review explain how they use the section’s long tradition as a “political Switzerland” to try to bring conversations to the center.

headline: #MeToo Is a ‘Movement Toward Victimization,’ G.O.P. Senate Candidate Says
teaser: The remarks by Representative Kevin Cramer of North Dakota drew a rebuke from his rival, Senator Heidi Heitkamp, who described how her mother had been sexually assaulted as a teenager.

headline: On the Runway: Melania Trump: Out of Africa, Still in Costume
teaser: During her first solo trip abroad, the first lady said people should focus on what she does, not what she wears. But she still seems dedicated to dressing a part.

headline: In a Mississippi Restaurant, Two Americas Coexist Side by Side
teaser: Amid fried catfish and sweet tea, two friends in Mississippi, who agree on next to nothing about politics, navigate their differences as part of their daily shifts.

headline: Trump Calls Kavanaugh Accusations a ‘Hoax’
teaser: Without offering evidence, President Trump said Democrats set up Justice Brett Kavanaugh and, in reference to the multiple sexual assault accusations leveled against the newest member of the Supreme Court, said that he “did nothing wrong.”

headline: Why the G.O.P.’s Gender Gap Is More Than Just an Optics Problem
teaser: The Republicans on the Senate Judiciary Committee are all men. Their remarks during the heated Supreme Court confirmation fight over Justice Brett Kavanaugh renewed attention to the party’s fraught relationship with women.

headline: Joe Manchin’s Yes on Kavanaugh Finds Sympathy in West Virginia
teaser: Senator Joe Manchin III was the only Democrat to vote for Brett M. Kavanaugh’s confirmation to the Supreme Court. That’s O.K. with his home state of West Virginia.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: ‘A Revitalization of Democracy’
teaser: Talking to Kirsten Gillibrand and Gretchen Whitmer about women in politics; the Senate race in Texas has an identity crisis; and watching a live poll.

headline: He’s Atop the Ballot, Yet Virtually Broke. And G.O.P. Donors Are Not Coming to the Rescue.
teaser: Republican contributors have shifted focus to New York Senate races, and away from their candidate for governor, Marcus Molinaro, who has $210,000 cash in hand.

headline: Fact Check of the Day: McConnell’s Position Has Shifted on Considering Supreme Court Nominees in Election Years
teaser: The Senate majority leader misleadingly suggested on Sunday that his rationale in 2016 for refusing to fill a Supreme Court vacancy in a presidential election year was related to a divided government.

headline: New U.N. Climate Report Says Put a High Price on Carbon
teaser: Most nations don't tax carbon. Those that do tax emissions have not set carbon prices high enough to bring deep reductions in carbon pollution.

headline: Kavanaugh Sworn In: ‘I’ll Be an Independent and Impartial Justice’
teaser: Brett M. Kavanaugh was sworn in as a justice to the United States Supreme Court on Monday. President Trump started the ceremony with a declaration of the new justice’s innocence.

headline: Trump Will Loosen Ethanol Rules, Aiding Anxious Farmers Ahead of Midterm Elections
teaser: The new rules will allow ethanol-blend gasoline to be sold during the summer months, ending a ban designed to limit smog, and angering the oil industry and lawmakers from oil states.

headline: Dire Climate Warning Lands With a Thud on Trump’s Desk
teaser: A day after the U.N. issued a call to arms for the world to confront climate change, President Trump, who has mocked the science around it, did not broach the topic, even in vulnerable Florida.

headline: Kanye West Expected to Visit Trump at the White House
teaser: The musician wants to discuss job opportunities for former convicts and how to increase manufacturing jobs in the Chicago area, according to a person briefed on the meeting.

headline: On Politics: Trump Campaign Aide Sought to Create Fake Online Profiles
teaser: The aide requested proposals in 2016 from an Israeli firm to create fake online identities and to gather intelligence on opponents.

headline: Kavanaugh Uproar in Senate Fuels G.O.P. Races for Governor and House
teaser: Republicans are working to harness outrage over the confirmation hearings among their voters in races where a surge of energy from the left is a threat.

headline: Iran Widens an Already Huge Rift Between Europe and U.S.
teaser: Since President Trump announced that he would pull out of the Iran nuclear deal, European leaders are actively working to help Tehran get around new sanctions.

headline: Rick Gates Sought Online Manipulation Plans From Israeli Intelligence Firm for Trump Campaign
teaser: The company pitched plans for fake avatars that would try to persuade Republican delegates to back the Trump campaign over that of Senator Ted Cruz and to gather intelligence on Hillary Clinton.

headline: Trump Bets Kavanaugh ‘Hoax’ Can Turn Into Midterm Gains
teaser: Democrats remain confident that they will benefit from outrage over the confirmation of Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh despite sexual misconduct allegations against him.

headline: Justice Kavanaugh Takes the Bench on the Supreme Court
teaser: On Tuesday, Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh heard his first Supreme Court arguments, all concerning enhanced sentences for gun crimes.

headline: Nikki Haley Resigns as U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations
teaser: A representative of the Republican mainstream, Ms. Haley had criticized Mr. Trump’s demeanor. But her appointment was seen as an olive branch.
